reviews.review: Gorgeous!. This mosque maybe a little harder to access than the Blue Mosque, but it's definitely more beautiful. Next to it is the tomb of Mimar Sinan, the great architect that designed it aming many other famous mosques in Turkey. Lovely views from the top too. A must visit if you have the time
Sinan and his touch on third hill. Get inside, look at the doom. Walk arround take a breath and raise your head again. Then go out and look at the view. What a mark Sinan left on this hill.
Great live mosque . Not as pompous as some of the other mosques but a great sanctuary to feel the real Istanbul. Beware of the prayer hours. As then it's closed.
Amazing!. This Mosque was not far from our hotel and was a definite must see. It is larger and has more manicured grounds surrounding it than the Blue Mosque.

Wonderful! . This is one of the most superb pieces of architecture and the decoration inside is amazing!
Less of a tourist destination than the blue mosque, it makes it better in my opinion. Less people, fewer queues, more serenity and calm.
The view from the gardens outside is amazing. Well worth a visit!

That's a mosque . Sulaymaniyah mosque is the most beautiful of all the mosques I visited in Istanbul.From the inside it is so spacious and tranquility u can sense in the air,the light is adding a respectful atmosphere to the mosque plus the architecture from the inside.Outside the mosque there's the tomb of sultan Sulayman and the garden next to the tomb is where u can see a very good view to the Bosporus and the Galata tower.
Amazing. Absolutely beautiful place. well maintained, a credit to the turkish people. The call to prayer is beautiful

Hike to get up but its worth it!. A little bit of a hike to get up here but its worth every tiring step! Love the courtyards, the tombs and the vast interior of the mosque. You could easily spend an hour or two here. The views down to the river are beautiful. The mosque is the masterpiece of the great architect Sinan, whose work is spread across Turkey and especially in Istanbul. His tomb is next to the mosque. You can walk down from the mosque directly to the riverside and Galata Bridge.
Great architectural treasure . We had a wonderful tour Istanbul Guided Private Tours. A fantastic outing explaining all the wonders and of this architectural masterpiece.

Beautiful buildinga and setting. The area this mosque is in seems a bit shabby. The mosque itself is surrounded by high walls so there is a pleasant surprise waiting once inside the walls. The buildings and grounds inside the walls are very beautiful and well woth a visit.
Great views. Another magnificent mosque with great architecture. The views from the top courtyard are fantastic. The walk down through shops and markets can take up an afternoon.

You should go there!. One of my Turkish colleagues took me there; and my visit turned to be an amazing experience!The beauty of this mosque is beyond imagination; and on top of that its proximity to great cafes and restaurants!Make sure to visit this place in the evening followed by visit to one of the cafes around it to see the majestic view of the mosque as well as the whole city of the Istanbul!Go there!

Excellent work by Sinan. Excellent work of art by Sinan. Beautifully laid out Sinan's complex speaks for brilliance of mind of a great architect. Tomb of Sultan Sulman Quanuni is located at the mosque along with graves of other royal family members.
Great viwe. If you want visit only one mosque in Istanbul, you should see this place. It has a great view of see and bosphorus. If you tired of walking you can relax here. I highly recommend.

Great mosuqe to include in the visit. If I had to do only one mosque in Istanbul it would be this one. It is a bit on the side of the old town and therefore it is quieter but more real. The building is magnificent by its simplicity. It has a calming effect and if you are tired from the buzz and the heat, you can stay there and relax. Inside the decoration is nice and fresh. You are welcomed by young assistants from the university close by who volunteer to answer any questions about the building, the religion, the rites, etc.. well worth the visit.

Spectacular . Not other way to describe this place. We went there in the evening, lights on, simply amazing. Huge place, close to the Grand Bazaar and Istanbul University. Worth a visit. Highly recommended.

The real architectural mosque masterpiece. . Senan, the master architect behind most of what remains as celebrated buildings in Turkey, built this mosque. It served as a blue print for thr blue mosque that followed it. Majestic, with a dome that was unconventionally supported and one that offers fantastic acoustics, a must see.

Smell old İstanbul, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia,Topkapı Castle and much more... Across of the Süleymaniye mosque, you should try dry bean, and, trileçe. Also,you can try grill fish at Eminönü. Take a walk from Sirkeci to Samatya, and stop here a while to try Turkish Kebap, and then visit Ermenian- Rome churchies. You make the final in Samatya Fish market, This place you can eat , also have fun.

Must visit if in Istanbul. Again on the mosques to visit if you are in Istanbul. As for any mosque woman's must cover their hair (will be provide for free when entering the mosque). Be advise it close at 10 PM and sometimes at 11 PM. There are a lot of coffee shops near that area so plan ahead

great after walking up several hills. this Mosque is beautiful but the route to get to it ! phew make sure you have your walking shoes on as the lack of signage and proper directions is annoying to say the least. there are several uphill roads to take.

Great mosque. Located on the Third Hill of Istanbul, Turkey. It is the largest mosque in the city, and one of the best-known sights of Istanbul.It is a huge complex with really beautiful interior and architecture. Women: don't worry if you didn't bring a scarf or so, you can borrow one there. Attending the azan and have a prayer there it was one of my favorite thing to do while visiting this mosque

Beautiful huge mosque. This is one of the must visits when you go to Istanbul.It is a huge complex with really beautiful interior and architecture.Women: don't worry if you didn't bring a scarf or so, you can borrow one there.Downside of it's popularity is that it can get very crowded.I personally preferred the copy in Ankara over this, because it's more quiet and I like the interior better.
Good to see. It's good to see if you have enough time, but it's not considered to be as high priority of a visit.
Made to impress. Grandiosity , to resume this building. This is the Muslim religion at its best. The pictures that you may take it does not make it justice inside or out.
Another gem of Istanbul's Crown. A grand mosque with a grand garden and a very serene and environment. This mosque tells you the story of Islam's arrival in west and the grandeur of Ottoman empire.

Good but not when you need a car parking. Too beautiful historical and good place to pray Friday prayers with calm and good voice of Imam, but if you come with your car there is no way to find parking, so stop your car a little bit far and come by taxi or train.

Nice place to visit . It is nice place to visit and see how the architecture of this masjid..it is in nice area and you could easily find shopping and food around..as all heritages locations in Istanbul..I advice you to visit it @

My favorite place in Istanbul . This is the place I was looking for all the time! Very peaceful, very silent, very soulful. Seemed like I could have stayed here forever. Really. Amazing green grass around the Mosque, where you can just lay, watch the clouds on the sky and dream;) breathtaking view at the city. For me personally this Mosque is a soul of Istanbul.

beautiful mosque with great views of the city below.. I visited 4-5 mosques in Istanbul, and this was my favorite. It was less crowded than the Blue Mosque, and just as picturesque. Also, it has a separate mausoleum that houses the tombs of some of the sheiks and their families. This is the biggest mosque in Istanbul, and is perched on a hill overlooking the city.

Magnificent . The architecture is astoundingly intricate and breathtakingly beautiful. It is a quick stop when the crowds are thin (as it was with us). It took us 30 minutes to look at the architecture,Light fixtures, ceilings, murals and to take photos. It was 30 minutes of sensory overload though. This is well worth the visit.
Very interesting and beautiful. So much history here and lots to see. Great views of the city from the roof top. Beautiful mosque and grounds.

Islamic architecture at its best . If you're a fan of Islamic architecture, or architecture in general, you will really enjoy a visit to this place. The whole place around the mosque is nice as well, with good coffee shops and places to relax and enjoy the Bosphorus view.
Must visit. Spirtual and very calming from the moment you walk in. Stunning views across Bosphorous, and very nice to be in shade for a bit.
Wonderful only. Surrounded by many minarets abd it was amazing inside,hearing the voice of imam durung the pray was very heavy moment

Unmissable. This is another wonderful example of the work of the great Ottoman architect Mimir Sinan and in my extremely humble opinion is second only to his utterly magnificent Selimiye Mosque in Edirne (well worth the 2.5 hour bus trip). Suleymaniye is beautiful and light inside and outside offers some of the best views of Istanbul. There are also good restaurants in the surrounding outer buildings.

Very Serine and peaceful place. We went to offer our Juma Namaz ( friday prayers ) on 29th July 2016. We were four and when the local Turkish Masjid administrative people came to knew that we are visitors they took us upstairs in Moazzin Area...where Bilal Hubshy was broadly inscribed....After prayers Imam Saheb shaked hands with queued men ..but hugged us and became very happy and exchanged good wishes and best prayers for us and for Pakistan.....we loved that gesture....recitation was very heart touching......a lot of historical things around walking distance from this LARGEST MASJID OF ISTANBUL..

The views from here are spectacular. Day 1 in Istanbul and we walked and walked and walked and came across the Suleymaniye Mosque. How awesome the views over the Bosphorous from this Mosque, we walked around and took in what we could see.
A Hidden Treasure. An absolutely stunning working mosque. I highly recommend this mosque for the amazing art work inside. Also the views of the city from the outside are exceptional.
Masterpiece. Located in a hill of Istanbul, it is a marvelous piece of art from Sinan the architect. Great monument.
Beautiful Mosque. A must see. Volunteers are very helpful in explaining the design, construction, and meaning behind all the mosque has to offer.

Serenity . Every time I visit Sulaymaniyah I feel the same serenity and peace. Especially in summer, sitting on the green grass and watching the architecture and people is divine. But be careful about the ants. They bite quite badly.
Interesting place. It was very interesting to visit the Suleymaniya Mosque and know the story of that historical period of time. The view of the city is wonderful as well.

Magnificent, peaceful. Out of all the beautiful places in Istanbul, this was my favorite. The openness of the architecture, so simple but absolutely beautiful. Words simply cannot describe the beauty. I recommend watching the Khan Academy before the visit to learn about the architect Sinan.

As good as blue masjid. Masjid suleymaniye is huge. Looks very similar to the sultanhamet cammii and sits at the top of the hill surrounded by undeveloped streets and locals. But it is massive and takes some walking around. Inside looks similar to the blue masjid and ottoman features, worthwhile if you are in that direction.
Unbelievable arcitecture. If you dont see this unbelievable mosque you loose very big chance in your life.Arcitecture was very very good.
Family vacation. A must see! You feel so good inside! Silence! Park! Really nice! Don't leave istanbul without a visit! U will love it! U need a scarf! If u don't have, they provide @ entrance!

Can't miss this site. Make sure to visit the impressive mosque but don't forget the tombs of the sultans. Also the view from the main courtyard is amazing, can see the bridges and the Galata tower as well as the entire city

Sinan the architects second greatest mosque. Sinan the architect, The best-known and loved master builder of the Ottoman period considered this magnificent mosque to be his second-greatest masterpiece (the first being the truly outstanding Selimiye Camii, which is to be found in Edirne). Although the Sultan Ahmet mosque is better known and more frequently visited, the Suleymaniye easily competes with it for aesthetic beauty and peace. A wonderful place to visit and worship, or just spend a few hours in peaceful meditation, it provides a wonderful sanctuary away from the bustle of the city. Also not to be missed, perhaps as a special treat after cuma prayers if you are a Muslim, are the delicious kuru fasulye (baked beans) served just outside the gates by a series of shops that all specialise in the same simple but delicious dishes. Nothing tops off a visit to this inspiring mosque better than a filling meal of rice and beans accompanied by pickles and ayran.

Really Good work. Thıs emazıng pleace from Ottoman tıme buıld ıt whıch ıs very importend mousōe for Ottoman very Nıce deceretıon bıggest one very ımportand one Thıs realy emazıng pleace to be hıgly recommended to every one
beautiful , peaceful. This active mosque is stunning and close to many other worthwhile sites. All are worth visiting but not with all the unrest.

Beautiful masjid. This is the largest masjid in Istanbul, named after Sultan Suleyman I ('The Magnificent'). The architecture & the calligraphy are true masterpieces. Adjoining masjid are the tomb of sultan suleyman & hurem; one great feature of this suleyman's tomb is a piece of 'Hijre Aswad' about 1x1 inches implanted on the top of entrance (outside).

Amazing views and others.... Firstly I came to there with friends in Ramadan
Ramadan is holy mounth for Muslims i hope you know it
Anyway; The mosque had consructed by the Sinan
Unfortunately now dont remember the date of the construction
But I give a secret, have a amazing views and atmosphere

Beautiful mosque. This is an older mosque in comparison to the blue mosque but it is definitely worth visiting. Reading the history in regards to this mosque is enlightening. From outside the mosque, you can get the view of the entire area which you can see most of the main sites. Definitely worth a view!

One of the great Ottoman mosques in Turkey - a must see. It is the largest mosque in Istanbul and built in honour of Sultan Suleyman I ('The Magnificent'). The architecture of the mosque is stunning and is a true masterpiece show-casing the skills of grand architect 'Sinan'. The mosque is one of the distinctive features when sailing down the Golden Horn.

Absolute lovely!. We went to pray Friday prayer here, and it was very spiritual. It is a well-kept mosque and the locals are friendly.
Outside the Suleymaniye Mosque, there is a good view of the sea and the city.
Beside the Mosque there is a graveyard and you can visit the tomb of Sinan, the great Ottoman architect.

The Mosque of Sultan Suleyman The Magnificent. The biggest mosque of Istanbul (well actually not anymore, the camlica mosque on the asian side is bigger). One of the the best architect of the world Sinan's work. Stands on the 3rd hill of Istanbul (istanbul built on seven hills), mainly construction style and architectural style has been copied from Hagia Sophia. Diameter of the dome is 27 meters where it is 31.5 meters at hagia sophia. Sinans masterpiece is Selimiye Mosque which is in Edirne and the diameter of the dome there is 29 meters. So what ? Sinan, after 1000 years couldnt built bigger dome ? I am sure he could do it. But Sinan had a respect to masters so didnt even try built bigger....

Beautiful mosque. My favorite mosque in Istanbul. The interior is great with the beautiful drawings and stained glass windows. There were also volunteers available to speak to you more about Islam, a misunderstood religion nowadays. The view around is equally great!

Architecture and beauty which rivals the Blue Mosque!. If you have time, this is also a must see! It's a 5 minute tram journey or a 20 minute walk from the Sultanahmet square, but the architecture is out of this world!!
simply beautiful!. By far this was our favorite. It's beauty is beyond description and the sense of peacefulness you feel is calming for the spirit. You just want to sit inside and soak it all in.
Amazing . The amazing thing in this mosque it is not only historical place it is romance place and amazing view to golden horn there are some nice coffees near mosque on roofs

Amazing symmetry and peace. For those who love cordial public spaces and architectural aesthetics in practice, this is a must-see. The cascading domes, the symmetry of the courtyard, and the pleasant parklike grounds invite you to relax and enjoy the views. It sits on top of a hill, so people who have trouble walking up and down might want to rent a taxi or plan their ascent/descent accordingly. On the other hand, the views of Istanbul are breathtaking!

Most tranquil beautiful mosque. Sulimaniye Mosque is reputedly the largest mosque in Istanbul, designed by the master architect Minar Siman is the 1560s. The mosque is actually part of a complex that includes madrasses, a caravanserai, soup kitchens, the tombs of sultan Mehmet and his wife Roxelana and Minar Siman. Although some of the outer buildings are being restored the mosque is a fascinating place to visit. The construction is classic and impressive. The interior is much more understated than the SultanAhmet Mosque, with pastel colours and limited use of tilework. I think the contributes to the tranquil atmosphere. The fabulous views across the Golden Horn are a bonus and on the street outside there is a row of eating houses selling traditional fesulye (haricot beans) and rice to sustain you before setting off to the next stop on your tour.

Suleymania mosque. Beautiful inside and out, biggest mosque in Istanbul.U can walk it from the grand bazaar, about 15mins walk up a steep hill from the bazaar.Lovley view of the river outside the mosque

peaceful experience. Myself and my family visited this mosque in Aug 2016. I found it a more pleasant experience than visiting the Blue Mosque as it was quieter and had fewer aggressive tour guides lurking around outside. Some excellent restaurants nearby as well.

One of the most impressive mosques. This mosque is really impressive, even if you have already seen several mosques such as the Blue Mosque or the New Mosque.It's also interesting to learn more about the life of Suleyman.A must see.

Quiet and beautiful place. This place is worth visiting - the mosque is beautiful and without the hustle and bustle of the Blue Mosque, the people inside very helpful and the garden quite a delight.You can get some covers for yourself outside and then enjoy the mosque. The inner decorations are gorgeous, you can look at the people simply praying, sleeping or charging their phones inside and just enjoy the atmosphere. The people inside spotted we were foreigners and immediately came to tell us how to get to the bus station and so on. Really nice place in the middle of a noisy metropolis.

Well worth the walk up the hill. We ventured on foot from our hilton hotel passed the metro stop, and boy was it worth it. Sinans masterpiece, so appropriate the great architect is buried here. Makes me feel proud to be a Muslim to witness such structures built over 500 years ago...unlike the poor portrayal of our peaceful religion by so called Muslims in today's times.

Beautifully kept grounds and mosque.. The grounds surrounding this mosque are very well cared for and are a beautiful way to sit and have tea and think about what really matters to you. The mosque is very large and ornate and is lovely and cool and peaceful on a hot day. Be prepared to cover your head and shoulders and be respectful while you visit.

Most beautiful mosque in the city. This one is no museum.But it is still to me the most beautiful mosque in Istanbul.Impressive by its size and architechture. You also have a nice view on Bosphorus from there.No entrance fee.

I think it is a very good rival to the blue mosque. The grounds are beautiful with never ending views back to the bay and "new Istanbul". The interior is every bit as magnificent as the blue mosque in my opinion. The coloration is different of course, but the immense size, the grandeur of the various nooks and crannies of the building are truly magnificent.

Beautiful Mosque and Grounds. Suleyman's magnificent, beautiful Ottoman Imperial Mosque is situated on Istanbul's Third Hill, presiding over land and sea. Dating from 1557, this is the largest mosque in Istanbul, with an airy, restrained interior. Less traveled than Hagia Sophia or the Blue Mosque, and within walking distance, this is a definite must see while in Istanbul. Ladies, be certain to bring a scarf for proper head coverage while touring within. Take time to explore the lovely grounds and exterior tombs as well.

Allahuakbar what beauty!! . Privileged to have seen this great masjid which I feel has more character and Britt than the sultan Ahmed masjid. So quiet and peaceful with a great view over the Bosporus.The call to prayer was amazing. Free for all to walk in and see. Free for Muslims all day long. My highlight of Istanbul was this masjid. Must see.

Very expressive. Absolutely amazing.. Maybe even if not so famous as Sultan Ahmet Camii is, probably the biggest mosque in Istanbul. Inside is an absolute silence, the architecture is impressive. Must-see and the two crypts (Suleiman and Sinan), located on the outside of the mosque.There is no entry fee
Highlight of Istanbul. Has a different personality compared to the Sultanahmet Mosque, but still stunning - the details are beautiful and the views of the Bosphorous are just breathtaking.

Simply the most beautiful mosque in Istanbul . Though its not as famous as the blue mosque (Sultan Ahmet) among tourists, but for me this Masjid (mosque) is more beautiful and more spacious with a breathtaking view to the Bosphore. It also contains on its yard the graves of some Ottoman's Sultans including Sultan Süleyman who ordered to build this masterpiece. Every visitor to Istanbul got to pay this place a visit.

Don't miss the subtle beauty of this Mosque. This was our last Mosque (after Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia) and by far my favorite. Much of that has to do with the visual beauty of it which is subjective, but the size is very digestible and the history very interesting.
Neil Williamson . Very spiritual experience worth a visit to see the inside of the mosque. Take time to reflect on what and where you are.

Amazing Mosque. Loved the architecture. Stopped at Eminonu square where mosque is there. Nice place for washing in the centre. Pick a plastic bag, put your shoes and go in. Enjoyed the wonderful painting and decoration of the mosque. Outside many tourists were taking pictures. Remember to be well dressed before going inside.

Suleymaniye Mosque. The Süleymaniye Mosque, built on the order of Sultan Süleyman (Süleyman the Magnificent), "was fortunate to be able to draw on the talents of the architectural genius of Mimar Sinan" (481 Traditions and Encounters: Brief Global History). The construction work began in 1550 and the mosque was finished in 1557.This "vast religious complex called the Süleymaniye...blended Islamic and Byzantine architectural elements. It combines tall, slender minarets with large domed buildings supported by half domes in the style of the Byzantine church Hagia Sophia (which the Ottomans converted into the mosque of Aya Sofya)" (481 Traditions and Encounters: Brief Global History).The design of the Süleymaniye also plays on Suleyman's self-conscious representation of himself as a 'second Solomon.' It references the Dome of the Rock, which was built on the site of the Temple of Solomon, as well as Justinian's boast upon the completion of the Hagia Sophia: "Solomon, I have surpassed thee!"[1] The Süleymaniye, similar in magnificence to the preceding structures, asserts Suleyman's historical importance. The structure is nevertheless smaller in size than its older archetype,

Wonder of the World. This is one of the most beatiful mosque in Turkey. Recently it has been renovated. The atmosphere is amazing, so relaxing, quite. I recommned to visit during weekdays and before noon for experiencing such environment.
A must see in Istanbul. A beautiful place to visit. A must see when you are in Istanbul. The architecture is simply amazing.

Out of this world. One of the great works of Sinan the Architect, stands overlooking breathtaking bosphorus. Visit it during the morning (at dawn) or evening (at sunset) prayer ceremonies, when you can listen to the beautiful voices echoed in the stunning mosque. Sinan, so the legend goes, was smoking water-pipe during the construction, then the Sultan suddenly entered and demanded to know if he was wasting money and time. He assured the Sultan that he was merely checking the acoustics. Why not test it yourself to see if he was successful?
nice view. well worth a visit very interesting lots to see in and around this building the grounds are kept very well

Don't miss it - great views.. Go and see the Suleymaniye Mosque - everyone goes to the Blue Mosque, but the Suleymaniye is up on a plateau, has fantastic views of the city and also has two great mausoleums you can go in - including that of Suleyman the Magnificent himself.
Suleymaniye mosque. Great place to visit very historical and amazing architecture for those who love it right next to grand bazaar

Perfection. The garden, surroundings, location, view... It's more then a touristic spot. You can feel the empire's all power reflected to this mosque. 999 windows can explain everything. If you visit here I recommend the café s down the street.

Lots to see including a view, near the Grand Bazaar and University. There is a lovely view of the water from outside the large campus. In addition to the mosque, there are some very elegant tombs you can go inside of.
Wow. Simply stunning. The place just has an awe once you see it. Absolutely beautiful. Words cannot describe the beauty of this place

The Best Mosque in Istanbul. This mosque is an architectural masterpiece! While not a particular fan of visiting mosques, churches, etc. this place is awesome. It is uncrowded and reasonably easy to find. The walk there from the tram is through/around the main campus of Istanbul University and itself quite enjoyable. The views from the site are excellent.While nothing beats the amazing engineering of the Blue Mosque or the incredible stone in the interior of the Aya Sofia, Suleymaniye is, nonetheless, a better example of an Ottoman mosque.
Beautiful. Another Mosque I just happened to wander into. Nice and clean. Not crowded and good location. Got to love the details inside

Best of all mosques. For us the best of all the mosques in Istanbul. Big, tranquil with amazing views. A must as its not as busy as the Blue Mosque. The only issue for us was we had a wheelchair and this mosque is up a hill. The walk up was our workout for the day. But the peacefulness was amazing.

One of my fav mosque. I really like this mosque too. It's very amazing how after all this time, this mosque is in perfect condition. I also love to have the chance to go to suleiman and hurrem tomb. it was a great experience since I love ottoman history.
Wow wow wow. What a view. Definitely better than the well known hagia sophia and blue mosque. Wonderful construction and guess what it's not crowded. Beautiful place

Beautiful masjid. A must visit masjid even though it was quite a difficult walk up the hill as we had been touring Topkapi palace throughout the morning - but lovely views at the top of the hill outside the masjid - very impressed with the volunteers inside the masjid giving information and dawaah to the non Muslim tourists
an old mosguw. its big and old mosque.I think its best old mosque after blue mosque in istanbul.Also when you go there,u will see some restaurants their menu rice and bean.Its very tastyy

Ramadan treasure. We were in Istanbul during Ramadan and went to the Suleymaniye Mosque just before sunset. When we arrived many people were coming out of the Mosque after evening prayers. We were able to visit this magnificent creation of Sinan while it was quiet and mostly empty. We then joined those who had filled the park-like grounds with a festival feeling. Kids were playing and families were having picnics on blankets. Fireworks were in the air. A most beautiful and moving experience under a full moon.

Beautiful Mosque, Beautiful Views and FREE. We came here after visiting the Grand Bazaar tour. We walked here from the Grand Bazaar which was about a 15 minute walk. This is a beautiful mosque and I recommend coming here to watch the sunset. The Mosque is on top of a very tall hill and has beautiful views of the Bhosporus and Istanbul. The mosque is also beautiful inside and has a architecture similar to other historic mosques in the area. I could come here again and sit outside to enjoy the view of the city. Simply Amazing!
Beautiful Mosque. amazing Mosque to visit which is set high on a hill and has a different atmosphere to the blue mosque. Some great views at the top!A long walk up the hill1

The greatest mosque in Istanbul. This is the glorious highpoint of the architect Sinan's achievement in the city. It is far more peaceful and, in my opinion, more beautiful than the Blue Mosque. There is a fascinating graveyard at the side although this closes quite early in the afternoon. We sat for ages and enjoyed the sense of "place". A very helpful lady offered spiritual information but wasn't at all pushy. Be warned, it's up quite a steep hill!

Skip the Blue Mosque. This mosque is by far more beautiful than the Blue Mosque. Well worth the trip, even if you've been to a few mosques already. In my opinion, if you only go to one, go to this one.
Suleymaniye. It's the mosque that built by mimar sinan doe sultan sulaiman snd sulaiman body buried there and his wife with mimar sinan as well

Nice Mosque. This is a beautiful space. The tile work is pretty as is the stone work. The wood work is excellent. And it's in great shape. There are also some spectacular views of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque from the grounds. And the grounds are also lovely. The other nice thing is that since it is no longer operating as a place of worship, you can go anytime.
Great Place to visit. I like this harm and peaceful place in Istanbul among several others. Its a wonderful architecture and gorgeous place and well located near to the main city and shopping places.

Must see!. Istanbul is the city of mosques and when you are there you HAVE to visit this one too, because like the others it's gorgeous (if i can say that about a mosque), it has a lot of ornament everywhere and it's interesting because it has so many colours, not just one dominant color. Also there is a very nice view from the outside of the mosque. I can't give enough good words to it, you just have to see it. It's of course for free.

Go up on the hill. If you wish to get away from the crowds of tourists in Sultanahmet then go onto the hills. On the third hill (this is the name of the hill, in Istanbul all of them are numbered) you will find one of the most glorious mosques in the whole Turkey. I like visiting this place during a hot day. Inside it is quiet and much cooler. Decorations on the ceiling and walls are glorious. But I like the most this beautiful geometric pattern on the main entry door. There are not many like this one in the whole world.

Best for views. I prefer Suleymaniye Mosque, since it doesn't have all the crowds you'll have to face at the Blue Mosque. It's also beautiful inside and the outside area very pleasant, with a large green area. There you'll have amazing views over Istanbul's rooftops and the Golden Horn, with Galata Tower on the background. I'm really into pictures, so the external part of the mosque was perfect to get some nice shots.
Super!. Place is on the top of the hill. You can see beautiful design of the mosque. Also there are good local food places near it.

Short visit. We stopped by the mosque for a quick look. It was about to close. Be aware that women are required to cover their heads. All are required to cover knees and shoulders. The grounds around the mosque are beautiful.

Beautiful Place. This place amazing, as i have been in Ramadan month beautiful people of istanbul gathered for Iftar and it was so amazing to see the moment so many people started their food at the same time.Place was so superb and the birds flying above the mosque, sea view from the mosque. Garden of the Mosque and the small vintage monuments attached to them are amazing to see.

Amazing . This is simply amazing - located on the top of the hill , facing the Bosphorus Sulaymaniye mosque gives you amazing emotions. The architecture is simply beautiful , so strong and so light at the same time, the floral ceiling paintings are beyond courageous!
Wow.... just wow. This is an amazing place to visit, the architecture inside and out is just stunning, well worth a visit.

Amazing Mosque. Sulaymaniyah Mosque is located in the heart of Istanbul, most beautiful ancient arctured designed and center of tourist attraction with its beauty, the most interesting is local market surrounded by this mosque, specialized in selling spices dry fruited, nuts and all kind of cheese and olives Very cheap comparatively to any other place, people in this zone are very freindly in thier approach and gives you sincere advise Highly recommended to buy all kind of stuff from this place and to dine

This mosque is so special! . It's in a very high place and the location is very good! The Mosque itself is build by the same architect as the blue mosque and has unique features I would recommend everybody.

The Sublime SULEYMANIYE CAMII ! Unforgettable !!!!!. One of the most beautiful and exquisite creations of the great Turk architect , Mimar Sinan , this mosque was built in the sixteenth century to honour the personality of the great Suleyman the Magnificent ! And it is really magnificent in all its aspects ; position ( on the banks of the Bosphorus ), the dome of the mosque , the surrounding parks , alleys and gardens , the red roses , the cemetery , hamam etc , the interior court , make it an ” ensemble ” not to forget and to remember for a lifetime ! Blessed those who have been there ! The most beautiful !!!! Not so crowded as many other attractions in Istanbul !

Looks like something out of the set of Game of thrones. This looks like something straight out of the set of a game of thrones episode. The gardens are very quaint and peacefully decorative. A window into elite Ottoman life -- and death. One of the most interesting features of the complex focused on the Sȕleyman the Magnificent Mosque is the small historic graveyard in which the tombstones wear hats – turbans, fezes and other headgear apparently indicating the ranks of the decedents. Inside, the mosque dome soared with calligraphy and floral decoration. Something about the shade of blue in the Iznik tiles seems spiritual without being dainty. Sȕleyman’s tomb was also grand, although the sarcophagi of his wife and other relatives made the space seem a bit jammed. The separate tomb for his mother was more serene.

Excellent place to contemplate and learn about Islam. Süleymaniye Mosque is one of the most stunning examples of Islamic architecture built by the famous Ottoman architect Sinan in the 16th century. While you are inside -if you are lucky- you can learn more about this magnificent complex by asking questions to the mosque volunteers. They provide you with the necessary information on the Turkish and Islamic culture as well as. Just like mosque visit, getting information from the volunteers is free of charge.

43 Cars. In the yard of this mosque in the late evening I met 43 cats gathered on one place. I counted them! Also the building of the mosque is quite impressive. The area around it is also interesting - it represents more the native local live of the citizens of Istanbul.

Sulemaniye Mosque -truly magnificient.. The Sulemaniye camii (mosque) is the second largest imperial mosque in Istanbul, the largest being the Sultan Ahmet (Blue) mosque. It has four minarets with 10 serifes or balconies with stalactite corbels compared with the Blue mosque’s six minarets with 16 serifes. Suleyman the Magnificient (b.1494-d.1566), also known as the “Kanuni” or the lawgiver, was the longest reigning Ottoman sultan for 46 years (1520-1566). He was the fourth sultan to rule Istanbul and the tenth in the imperial line of Osman (Othman) giving the empire the Westernized name “Ottoman.” The empire was at its pinnacle during his reign extending from eastern Europe, Middle East and north Africa with over 20 million people under his dominion. The Suleymaniye was constructed in 1558 by the master architect Minmar Sinan who built 131 mosques including the mosques for Suleyman’s first son Shezad, his favorite daughter Mihrimah and his son-in-law and grand vizier (chief minister) Rustem Pasha who was married to Mihrimah. Behind the mosque are the mausoleums (turbes) of Sultan Suleyman, his wife Hurrem (Roxelana) and daughter Mihrimah and a four other sultans. Outside the mosque walls is the tomb of the architect, Sinan.The Blue mosque was built over a half century later in 1616 by master Sinan’s apprentice Mehmed Aga.This is truly a very huge and beautiful mosque with large courtyards and terraces and being built on a hilltop it has some gorgeous views of the Goldern Horn and the Bosphorus strait. For this reason, it is also the most prominently visible mosque from the Golden Horn. It is very much less crowded than the Blue mosque and the experience is so much the better and more relaxed to soak in the atmosphere of this magnificent structure. For these two main reasons I personally preferred this one.
Spectacular building high above the city. Beautiful building, such a wow factor when you walk in and gaze up at the amazing ceilings. Well worth a visit.
Amazing architecture.... Amazing architecture, if you have not been visited yet, time to go and see. It is located on the third hill of Istanbul. It is the largest mosque in Istanbul.

Huge and great. Built by Sultan Suleman the Magnificent between 1550 and 1557, this mosque is the largest in Istanbul and occupies a position atop one of the seven hills of Istanbul. The architect was master designer Mimar Sinan and this wonderful mosque represents the Ottoman period at its greatest. The glorious dimensions of the mosque means that this huge building dominates the Golden Horn and wherever you are in Istanbul, you can see the building. The clever design incorporates foundations which include juniper piles and beams giving the building the elasticity required to absorb the shock waves of earthquakes without damage. It also has a ventilation system which prevents any accumulation of dirt and 255 pots built into the dome to enhance the acoustics. All in the sixteenth century...fantastic!

Spring Break in Istanbul 2016. The Mosque is beautiful, but it's a little hard to reach if your walking. It's a great sight but you have to walk thru a fairly sketchy neighborhood to get there. We actually checked out the "New Mosque" and passed the spice bazaar to reach the Sulemaniye Mosque. It's a worth while beautiful place to visit with great sights and picture opportunities. RedRiverLawyer. If a building could be an ambassador to a previously unfamiliar culture, this is it. Compared with the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, this mosque is both crisper architecturally (its near-white stone exudes lightness) and brighter in its feel. Many families were sitting around on the grass on the grounds enjoying the sunny afternoon and children romped at ease with their families in the courtyard. It was eye-opening to us as American Protestants to be able to feel so welcomed in this beautiful mosque. It had a more open door to visitors, obviously expecting in return the respect to religious customs that everyone showed, than some of the large cathedrals in Europe we have visited.
Unbelievable Mosque. Unbelievable,The decor and design of this place will take you back hundreds of years back to Sultan Süleyman the magnificent & his legacy.

A quiet gem in Istanbul. We had the pleasure of visiting Süleymaniye Mosque on the recommendation of our hotel receptionist as well as a fellow guest. In reality there is no comparison between the two because they are so different with the exception of both being mosques.I felt very much at peace inside this mosque with its individual places designated by the carpet and the quiet simplicity of the decor. It was a highlight for me to visit.

No Lines At All Now!. I sit here in Istanbul, searching for a superlative that has not been used. Anyway,search ended, here is mine. This magical mosque is a must see! At present you can easily stroll in without waiting.

Fitting tribute to the greatest Sultan of Ottoman dynasty. Designed by the great Sinan on one of the 7 hills of Istanbul, Suleymaniye Camii is an architectural wonder. The massive and beautiful impressive building is a fitting tribute to its patron Suleyman the magnificent. It is difficult to decide which of the 2 mosques is better between this and Blue mosque. Suleymaniye is definitely more peaceful owing to lack to tourists. We just reached there before sunset and then went inside to offer maghrib (after sunset) prayers. Immense calm, soaring space and serene atmosphere welcomes you when you are inside. Regretfully we couldn’t spend much day time in the Suleymaniye masjid and didn’t see its massive outer complex and other areas. Will definitely go again if I am back in Istanbul.
Very huge Mosque. The mosque and its neighborhood are lovely. The size of Suleymaniye mosque is pretty big and the history behind this edifice is awesome

a gem of ottoman archtiecture. Built by the most famous architect of the ottoman empire (Sinan) by order of the great sultan Suleyman the magnificent, you cannot overlook this huge structure which stands on one of the highest hills in the old city. It is a working mosque but you can also visit it outside of prayer hours if you are not muslim. Just follow the usual rules: modest clothing, no shoes, women should cover their hair.It is in fact much more than a mosque. Originally it was also a kind of social center, with a kitchen feeding the poor, a hostpital and a library.Outside of the mosque you can also visit the tombs of sultan Suleyman and his (in)famous wife Roxelane. The tomb of Sinan is just outside of the mosque.

Most beautiful (large) mosque in Istanbul. Glorious, beautiful and peaceful large mosque with a stunning location that has gorgeous views across Istanbul. Make sure you check out the whole complex and area and see the tombs and admire the utterly exquisite architecture. The tomb of the architect is very nearby and worth a look.

well worth the climb. We arrived here by mistake - old Istanbul is not the easiest to find your way round - but we were so pleased we did. An oasis of calm with splendid views over the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus, plus the chance to visit the burial place of the Sultan, surrounded by beautiful tiles.

Our favorite mosque. Of course the Blue Mosque is impressive and as a more significant history and touristic interest. Nevertheless, Suleymaniye is just as impressive in terms of its architecture and mosaics.It's less touristic and hence more peaceful. It has a garden in front of the mosque with impressive views to the city, the golden horn and the Bosphorus.Highly recommend it

Visitor Friendly. This beautiful mosque is light and bright. While it looks smaller than some nearby mosques, it is quite large. The staff were very friendly and offered resources when they saw we were interested in more than just the small brochure. Great experience!
Great History. Must visit for all those wanting to know more about the Ottoman history.also one of the best views of Istanbull

Beautiful mosque. Visited this mosque to offer Friday prayers. There's a very steep climb to reach the mosque, but the view from there is stunning and well worth it. Inside, the mosque is impressive and beautifully decorated. This is definitely one of the finest mosques to visit in Istanbul.

good. i prefer topkapi palace , but this one is good also if you wanna fill your day , there are graves of first & second soltan soleyman , and the grave of mehrima (the dauster of soltan soleymani personally prefer topkapi palace

great experience. A little bit out of the way but totally worth it. Beautiful mosque but even more impressed with the stunning views of Istanbul, Asia and European from here and the Fantastic local food available outside. Really was a treat.

A beautiful piece of art. Sulemaniye mosque is around 20 mins walk from grand bazar. Personally I liked it more than the blue mosque as it's more peaceful and less crowded as well. Views from back lawn onto bosphorus are a treat. You can sit in lawns for hours to relax and admire the surroundings. Definitely a must go if you're visiting istanbul.
much better than the Blue Mosque!. make the effort of getting to Suleymniye, it is worth it. away from the crowd, our guide from Walks In Istanbul gave a true speech about it,too

Absolutely Beautiful!. This is one of the most beautiful mosques in Turkey. A visit to this Mosque is an absolute must. The architecture of this Mosque is breathtaking. This is an absolutely brilliant piece of architecture. The interior is gorgeous with beautiful stainglass windows in the front and marble arches in different shades. It's not overly gaudy but still stunning. It's amazing what could be achieved in the 16th century without the resources and equipment which we have today.

Marvelous. Of all the mosques I have visited in Istanbul this one stands out above the rest. Ofcourse it has its grandeur, but that every mosque has that in Istanbul in its own way. No this one stands out because of its atmosphere which is quiet en peaceful. Another feature is the spectacular view that you have over the Bosporus. Acces is free of charge.

Oasis of peace and tranquility. Beautiful mosque with four minarets. It is a masterpiece of ottoman architect Mimar Sinan. Near the mosque is mausoleum of sultan Suleyman and his wife Hurem. From the yard of the mosque is stunning view on Istanbul. Beautiful

Great mosque. Stunning view at Istanbul from it's garden. Mosque is peaceful place, wonder of architecture of ottoman archittect Mimar Sinan. Near the mosque is mausoleum of sultan Suleyman, as well as his wife Hurem. Worth seeing

Check out the roof top view. Great mosque to visit while you're in Istanbul in addition to the blue mosque and the new mosque. If I'm not mistaken this is one of the largest mosques in the city! Check out the view from the roof top, its unrivalled!

Panoramic views alone make it worth a visit. The mosque is the largest in Istanbul and sits high on a hill so offers panoramic views that are definitely worth seeing. The grounds are simple and well kept. There are tombs that you can visit as well. I spent quite some time enjoying the peacefulness of the courtyard area of the mosque, but not sure how peaceful it is during peak season. I had forgotten my scarf so did not go in, but a look through the door reveals more magnificence.

Domes. I liked this mosque the best among all mosques in Istanbul. If you love architecture, you must not miss this place. It is situated in middle of residential areas and markets, so it's a nice walk to check out those areas as well ( it is not fancy, but livingly and truthful to what Istanbul people's life is). The Mosque, at least when I visited, didn't feel like a tourist place. It seems to be more tolerant on the dress code, and only trying to be very inviting for people to come in to experience the praying. I sat there for an hour, just to enjoy the beautify voices by the prayers which I do not understand. You have to see the domes! from outside the yard, you could see the top of the domes of an additional structures, and there is the city afar. You will take great pictures there. Near by, there are some coffee , restaurants on roof tops. I have been told that I could take coffee and enjoy the view of the mosque. Although I had no such time, I could see those roof tops close by.

Shahane asar. Unbelievable structures that has instructed around haunderd years ago,shows the art and miniature beauties of ottoman empires era.magic and tremendous buildings like mosque and other historical monuments.

Quite impressive, worth seeing. We were quite impressed by the mosque and the sultan's grave (which is surrounded by a cemetery). The neighborhood of the mosque is very nondescript and therefore not worth seeing, but the mosque itself and the view of the Bosphorus it offers were worth our time.
Great area to shop. There are many shops near by the mosque. The mosque itself is very similar to the Blue Mosque. There is also a very panoramic view of Galata Tower and Bosphorus over there.

Worth your time . This was very beautiful mosque and not only that but it had a really beautiful view. There are cats and dogs that live at this mosque and walk around the gardens and a dog that hangs out on the roof across the street. Just don't forget money to pay for the bathrooms.

Not a must go. If you are interested in architect or history then you may visit this place otherwise there is not much to see over there. Tomb of mimar sinan (Architect of most mosque in ottomans time) is near to mosque.
Outlook is quite similar to other mosque like Blue mosque or yeni camii.
cool masjid. a nice cool historical masjid, the view and architectural design is good, u can visit it if u have time

magnificent mosque and views. Don´t miss a small climb to this mosque, the views are breathtaking and the architecture is beautiful. We had the chance to meet a volunteer inside who explained us many aspects from the Islam which we didn´t know and were very interesting, specially about women in Islam. She spoke perfect english and was very patient, look for volunteeers as it enriches your visit. Take a 360 degrees walk outside, its magnificent from every angle.

Do not miss the fabulous Bosphorus view!. The mosque is located in the heart of old Istanbul, it is very beautiful and well architected by Mimar Sinan. The tomb of Sultan Sulaiman and his family are inside the park of the mosque. The back yard has a very good view on Istanbul. you can spend the whole day just enjoying the view there!

Suleymaniye Mosque. Suleymaniya Mosque, situated on the third hill, near Eminonu Tram Stop. Is one of the largest and grandest mosques of Istanbul. It was constructed on the orders of Sultan Suleman the Magnificiant. It is a masterpiece of Mimar Sinan. The construction began in 1550 and completed in 1558. It is a blend of Islamic and Byzentine archetercture. It was ravaged by fire in 1660 and was restored by Sultan Mehmed 1V. During the earthquake of 1766 a part of the Dome collaples. During World War 1 the courtyard was used as a weapons depot, due to a fire in the ammunition damage was again done to the mosque.After three years of extensive restoration and at an expense of TL 21 Million, the mosque was re-opened in 2010. Entry is free except at the time of prayers when it is restricted only for Muslims.

A more sober, elegant approach to the Mosque. After the Hagia Sophia and the "Blue" mosque, this Mosque is refreshing in its sober elegance pristine cleanliness, and brings the visitor to a perhaps less-visited part of the city (go there by foot therefore), if not for this monument.

Nice historical mosque and tombs. The mosque is one of its kind and the best mosque I've visited in Istanbul.This is a complex with many things to visit and since i am a little familiar with turkish history, after the mosque itself i loved the tombs.Just don't miss this if you're in Istanbul.
Think a diffferent place in earth!. Look ! Sit on a higher ground, you will see the awesome view. Walk from the grand bazaar, taste some delicious meatball. Now you are in Istanbul!
A mosque. The mosque is very similar to Blue Mosque . It is situated near the famous Spice Bazaar of Istanbul.

The most beautiful Masjid in Istanbul. In my opinion this Masjid is even more beautiful than the blue mosque. The architecture is breathtaking and the views are amazing.
This is also not a tourist trap and you can really enjoy your time and reflect on the accomplishments of the Ottomans

Impressive. I enjoyed visiting this mosque more so than the Blue Mosque, maybe because the other one's so crowded. This was not deserted, but there was a more reverential feel, no kids running around screaming and rolling on the floor. I would recommend visiting this location, it's only a couple blocks from the Grand Bazaar.

Great view. Sit on a higher ground, the view is awesome.
We walked from the grand bazaar over, but worth the hike.
Beautiful place. As someone mention before, underrated place, not so many tourist around, weather didn't cooperate either, but masjid is really beautiful.

Mosque of the Magnificent Suleyman. Its architect is Sinan and this mosque is one of the most beautiful mosques..in addition to architecture perfection, its localization is also impressive..you should also visit back garden and look at the magnificent Istanbul scene..

Underrated. Amazing view of the city & a fine example of Sinan architecture. . Personally I find this mosque more beautiful & magnificent in comparison to the Sultanahmet mosque aka Blue Mosque. I went to around 3.30pm and it was reasonably quiet. Not far from the grand bazaar so perhaps something to squeeze in pre- or post- bazaar.
Lovely. just amazing, fantastic ended there by pure chance, was not planned at all, and was extremely pleasant to visit, much better than the blue mosque.

A veiw from the mosque. This mosque is so big that walking around the garden is also fascinating. The dome is big and beautiful, too. I got into the terrace of the mosque, and could see the Golden Horn. The weather was cloudy, but the scenery was wonderful. After spending some time on the terrace, I visited mausoleums. One of the most recommended place of Istanbul.

The nicest of them all. Suleymaniye is located beside the university and very near the Grand Bazaar. In my humble opinion, it is more attractive than the Blue Mosque, and more ornate overall. The grounds surrounding it are not a grand as the Blue Mosques, but still very inviting to spend some leisure time and absorb the moment and the view.

Peaceful mosque. Compared to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque this one is very peaceful and quiet. None the less it is very beautiful and great place to spend some time after Grand Bazar. Its on the hill so be ready to climb.
Amazed . Suleymaniye mosque is actually amazing. A historic cultural symbol and an important place to visit while in Istanbul.

Beautiful, peaceful mosque. Stunning location of the mosque, found it when wondering through the small streets outside of the grand bazaar. The mosque is less touristy than the blue mosque so very convientent for those using it to actually pray or just having a little rest and quiet time. The mosque grounds are also great for having a little sit down and enjoying the beautiful architecture of this mosque.

must see. Must see .A unique art work of the greatest Ottoman architect Sinan.The complex shows how an educational ,shopping and worshipping areas come together within a great harmony .The symetric proportions of the mosque, the lighting inside tells a lot about an architectural wiz of Sinan.

Important place. Like most mosques in Istanbul, this was a really beautiful one. Located on a higher hill, and also having the tombs off Sulieman the Magnificent, his wife and others gives it an additional touch.Highly recommended.
Get in...and dream!. recently renewed, the decoration is breathtaking! in the back there is a terrace who dominates the Haliç (golden horn) and it s such an amazing place!!

A wonder of the world. No-one should ever leave Istanbul without visiting this mosque. It is truly a wonder of the world. It stands in great splendour with its towering minarets pointing to the sky. The entrance is free and there is an office where one can be supplied free of charge with the necessary head scarf. The ceiling is so beautiful and the vastness of the interior totally awesome. The whole architecture is mind blowing.

amazing. it is really an amazing place to see. u can walk from sultanahmet-blue mosque to there and then follow the way, see fatih mosque, yavuz sultan selim mosque, horse bazaar. also it has a very nice sight, like u r watching istanbul from sky.
Interesting mosque. Great visit. I've always been fascinated with mosque and this one didn't disappoint me. Very interesting and a great day out .

A grand mosque with a wonderful view. We walked from the Blue Mosque to the Suleymaniye Mosque, arriving after visiting hours. We entered anyway and stood behind the screen way at the back as the Iman was giving a lecture (?) which we could not hear due to the size of the mosque. Outside there is an area by a wall that overhooks the Golden Horn and provides a wonderful view.

Really beautiful!. Suleymaniye Mosque is one of the main mosques in the city of Istanbul. It’s not located near other mosques so it is a bit difficult to plan it all in for the day, but apart from that it is ok. The courtyard view is really good. Totally worth spending time here.

My best mosque . I fall in love at the first time when I see this mosque! Really huge! Really beautiful! Really nice garden. The mosque is very friendly, there are some volunteers who can tell you about the religion. If they are praying, you cannot enter the mosque, but I think everyone can wait 1 hour to see this lovely place. Also you can visit the thumbs, (Süleymaniye) which was for me intinteresting. Near the mosque, you can find some coffee place, where you can drink nice tee, and see the beautiful view. My favorite place in Istanbul.

A Special Mosque Worth a Visit. If you came to Istanbul to see architecture or cities views, this is a must-see. Best, it's just a short walk from the maze of small shops outside the Egyptian Market, so you can make it part of your shopping outing easily. The views are stunning -- pictures barely show -- and the courtyard and the Mosque itself masterworks. As with any mosque, I recommend to look around for distant corners of the courtyard to sit and admire the building. Also, walking around any mosque is a good idea (especially if you're looking for a 1TL WC), and here you'll find a beautiful, accessible graveyard.

My favourite Mosque. The Suleymaniye was a little off the tourist trail, and allowed for a quiet visit. Stunning views of the city from outside, and a beautiful court yard as well. The gravestones outside the mosque were interesting to check out as well.
Piece of art. Right in the heart of Istanbul, Sultanahmet, stunning architecture, amazing history, free entrance. Beautiful views through the windows on the top floor. Very photogenic mosque.
Very nice!. Loved the park outside and the initial architecture. Although not that impressive as Aya Sofia, this place is certainly worth visiting.
Just as good of an attraction as the blue mosque. This place is almost as big and resembles the same architecture as the blue mosque. The best part is that it's less crowded too.
The best . The best camii in The İstanbul You must go there we likea lot this place very good.... For us The best in The town amazing...

Sınan at hıs best. Wıth ıts four mınarets, saıd to represent Suleymans rule as fourth Sultan the mosque stands above the Haliç, the Golden Horn. In the grounds are the tombs of the Sultan , hıs wıfe Roxellana and hıs daughter Prıncess Mıharmah, and also the sımple tomb of the greatest Ottoman archıtect Mımar Sınan Such a tranquıl place should not be mıssed.

A tranquil mosque. The Suleymaniye Mosque is a tourist attraction with its grand size, architecture and history but it is at its heart a fully functioning place of worship for Islam.Even though I am not a Muslim, I could feel that this was a place of with a sense of peace,calm and tranquility. There were no queues to get in although it was a cold wet Saturday when I went which may have helped.The architecture is well worth studying, including the many buildings in the complex around the mosque itself.It is well worth taking the time to go and visit. For me, better than the Blue Mosque.
A nice mosque. A nice mosque with delightful landscape outside and marvelous views. Personally for me it is not as beautiful as blue mosque, but doubtless it worth seeing.
Spectacular but understated. Not the most highly detailed of Istanbul's mosques, but the setting is serene with amazing views. The grounds are lovely and the mosque is very peaceful.
Suleymaniye Mosque Istanbul. Suleymaniye Mosque is worth visiting at istanbul, beautiful architecture ,interiors ,carpet design ,light work .landscape outside .

Nice place. If you visit Istanbul, make sure you will visit this moque. It was my first time in mosque, so I was not dressed well (my skirt was too short). However, they gave me scarf or skirt and I didn't have any problems to go inside.

Sulaymaniye Mosque. Many cats can be found here
Local people also came for visit
Have shops selling souvenir outside the mosque
Great monument. Monuments like this make you feel very small. An aspect of what man can do and how many things can accomplish when there is money to support him.
good architeture. Beauty is a small word when you see art work like these, built beautifuly. Shame i couldnt speand much time, however the Mosque speaks for itself.
Beautiful Place. Unforgettable experience in Istanbul was another attraction for me to visit this place and gave good experience

Mashallah. I felt so lucky to go to Suleymaniya mosque
And we stayed there less than 1 hour but it's worth to stay..

Suleymaniye Mosque. The interior magneficent the mosque was constructed in the 1550& was completed in 1557. Built of the most famous architects of his time. The grounds are also beautiful and afford lovely view.

The most beautiful mosque in Istanbul. The most beautiful and my favourite mosque in Istanbul. The interior was amazing and the outside was also super beautiful. A must visit if you are in Istanbul. Located just a short walk from the Grand Bazaar.

Magnificent, beautiful, peaceful,incredible piece of architecture!. First time when i visited Istanbul i was on short time trip and could nt visit this place and regret it all the time, fortunately i could visit it this February and i can say its the most magnificent and beautiful mosque in whole Istanbul! You can't even compare the blue mosque to Sulemania! Its located to highest hill of Istanbul and the view u getting from there is incredible! Especially drinking turkish coffee in any cafe near by and looking at that great view its something everyone should experience for themselves! When you walk inside mosque its just breathtaking, i could feel how i just stopped at entry and stare! Maybe cz tourist were less and morw people were for prayer there,but i got this incredible energy of this mosque i sat inside for while just to enjoy this energy! The architect of the mosque really made it magnificent as Sultan Sulemain was for ottomans! Even blue mosque was built by the student of the architect of sulemania! Its must see mosque in Istanbul! I took taxi and i didn't to walk all up way to mosque, but after i just walked down to spice baazar. So don't forget to wear comfy shoes

My favorite of them all!!!. This is my favorite mosque in all of Istanbul . It is absolutely gorgeous inside and outside. This was recommended by our tour guide, therefore if you are visiting ask to see this specific mosque. You will not be disappointed.

Sinan's masterpiece. I think not many people know about this mosque. Mimar Sinan (the architect for this mosque) was the greatest architect of the classical period of Ottoman, in fact, Sinan's mentee (student) was the architect for the Blue Mosque! I was told that this mosque was located on the highest hill in Istanbul that's why you can get the best view of IST from this mosque. Go walk around its huge compound where you can find tombs that belongs to Suleyman the maginificient (and other significant Ottomans too). Get lost in those little streets and find your way to this beautiful mosque. Next to Istanbul University and it's on the way to the Spice Bazaar from the Grand Bazaar. Tips : Streets are cobbled pavement & very hilly ; therefore, comfy shoes are recommended.
Cant miss!. Get lost in those little streets and find your way to this beautiful mosque. Not big as Blue mosque, but also very impressive. Great view from outside.

A Must See. Our hotel told us that it was only a short walk to Suleymaniye Mosque but boy were they so wrong. It took us 40 minutes (inclusive of a lot of uphill walking!) But it was so worth the walk. Sad to say that it is not one of the the top things to see in Istanbul if you are only here for a short trip. However, after researching online before our trip we decided to make time for it. I believe it to be far better than the Blue Mosque as it sits on a hill and has the most amazing view of Istanbul. It was breathtaking.I did not enter to the praying area of the mosque as we did not see anything special that we wanted to look at (We just peeped from the outside). So, we just walked around the compound. There was also tombs within the compound that belong to Sulaiman the Magnificent".

The place to be in Istanbul. You cannot leave Istanbul without visiting the Mosque of Soliman. This is magnificent: specially the garden with a great view over the Bosphorus.After this visit that you will never forget, you should take a drink at the terace of one of the numerous cafes. Take a sit over there for sunset and just open your senses and feel.This is Istanbul !

Impressive mosque.... An extraordinary mosque a few minutes away from the Grand Bazaar. In my personal opinion this mosque is more delicate than Blue mosque and feels more authentic as it isn't full of tourists.

Beautiful mosque . As this isn't a very touristy place, or so I have heard, it was really quiet. The building is magnificent. The views of the city from the gardens are breathtaking. I went on a weekday and it was relatively quiet. Not many people. Very peaceful to just sit inside the mosque and admire it's beauty and watch people pray. There is no entrance fee to visit this mosque. One drawback, though. They charge 1TL to use the toilets, which aren't very clean.

The most glorious of the Imperial mosques. This hilltop mosque is one of the masterpieces of Sinan, the Ottoman Empire's greatest architect. It was constructed in the 1500s on the orders of Suleyman the Magnificent, the empire's greatest sultan. The result was, as would be expected, magnificent. In addition to the mosque, the Suleymaniye complex includes a library, hospital and soup kitchens that fed thousands of the city's poor, regardless of their religion. (Ironically, the street between the mosque and the charitable buildings once held cafes that sold both opium and hashish, earning it the moniker "Addict's Alley.") The tombs of Suleyman, his wife Roxelana, his daughter Mihrimah and his two successors, Suleyman II and Ahmet II, are in the main mosque, but the tomb of Sinan himself is just outside the building's walls. The mosque's central prayer hall, a huge, domed rectangle, is truly awe-inspiring.
Spiritual trip to this historic masjid. Another great must-see structure in Istanbul. It is amazing to visit and pray in this masjid. Awesome trip.
Not an expert.... I'm not an expert but after visiting 4 mosques in Istanbul I think that this is the greatest one plus its peaceful and the atmosphere feels like really positive energy
Beautiful . Massive masjid, looks amazing from the outside. Architecture is the same as all the other masjids in Istanbul. Great sea views as well.
Beautiful Mosque. Visited in February with my two daughters. Like the blue mosque it is free to visit.Internal views are a must.
One last Mosque in istanbul I had to see,,,. And wished I had more time... Tucked away past the Grand Bazar, its prayer hall is grand and spectacular.

Beautiful. This wasnt really on the list for us to see but we were passing and called in - i soon realised what a mistake it was for us not to have on the list - To me this was the best mosque we visited by far, absolutely stunning both inside and out with amazing views too
Peaceful. Bit hard to find the way in depending on which side you approach from. Peaceful, beautiful place with great views from one side

Needs alot of time!. On the other side of the grand bazaar from the blue mosque. Not as picturesque as the blue mosque but a truly lovely view of the Bosphorous. Need time to visit each of the separate enclosures and read their history.

great palace on the hill with amazing view to Bosphorus. The Mosque itself is located on the top of the hill, not far from Egyptian market. Great building with cemetery nearby. The view to Bosphorus is just amazing, especially during sunset. Also you can go inside the mosque (before you need to take off you shoes, as there is carpet inside) and have a look at the interior, which is also worth to see. Nice place for walking, as the yard is quite big.

More than expected!. I visited Soliman Mosque beginiing of 2016. Outside it was snowing heavily and this added a romantic touch to the visit.Great holy atmosphere inside.Unexpected beatuy and architecture.I liked it so much!

The most commanding views. Having visited the better known Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque and Hagia Sophia this should definitely be on your list of places to see. It's huge but is less busy so much more peaceful than the others. It sits atop a hill but is definitely worth the walk up.

Movingly beautiful. I visited the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and appreciated their beauty, but somehow I felt the beauty of the Suleymaniye Mosque in my soul. The exterior is a delicate interplay of cream, rose, and pale gray stone, while the interior is spacious, peaceful, and somehow inspiring, in a way that is unique to the most serenely beautiful buildings of every religion

dont miss out on this.. It has so much history, there is no crowd coz barely anybody thinks it is an important place. but this has so much history, and the view on the terrace is romantic and fabulous!
Don't miss the views from the terrace. Very beautiful mosque but it's quite a bit of a hike but well worth it. Don't miss the views from the terrace.

The next best thing?. This Mosque is ust as good as the blue mosque and no crowds...the lights and the colours different to the Blue but worth the trip...at night the lights come on and it is like a beacon over Istanbul

Amazing. This mosque is more calm and serene than the blue mosque and in fact bigger..after the bosphorus cruise i made my way UP THE STEEP HILLS and got there...was just a great feeling being there especially towards sunset were i could relax in the vicinity....could see the galata tower and bosphorus from the edge of the walls...a must see

Big and light. It is a big and light place. No spider webs due to ostrich eggs on the lights (only two original, other replaced). You can also ask the tourist guide anything about the mosque, he is friendly. If you go at the back you come to the graveyard and two parts with sultans and family graves. Sadly it was closed during our visit, but they did have opened shutters on windows, so we could see them inside.

Suleymaniye Mosque or the mosque of Suleyman. I have back to Istanbul in January 2016. It was a great trip. I had only one day to stay there between flights connections. I have booked a hotel and had a whole day to enjoy the architecture of Istanbul. I started my trip with Aya Sophya and then I visited the Suleymaniye Mosque - Ottoman imperial mosque -the largest and grandest. It is an easy walk of less than 10 mins arond the University from Beyazit Square and the Grand Bazaar.It was built in 1550s. Suleymaniye complex looks over the Golden Horn, Bosporus and the Sea Marmara to Asia.Inside of Suleymaniye is simply breathtaking in its expanse.There is an entrance for tourists on the other side from the building. Before to enter you have to take out your shoes and cover a head with a scarf for women.The Mosque is open every day, for free. Just avoid a prayer hours.I am pretty sure you will enjoy it too.

Phenomenal. Beautiful. Well worth seeing.. I can't think of appropriate superlatives as this is one of those places that is a wonderful piece of architecture, a very human space and quite awe inspiring. Just go and see it for yourself and you will know what I mean.

Excellent, amazing. A wonderful place. Near the mosque, you can have breakfast in one of the cafés there with an amzing view on the Bosphorous, the Bosphorous Bridge that connects the Asian side of Istanbul and the European part, the bridges that connect the old city and the modern city......Don't miss it.....

Beautiful - sister mosque of sultan ahmet. If you liked blue mosque/sultan ahmet camii then you will love this too! Unlike blue mosque which is famous from blue tiles this one has beautiful red/orangeishpink detail work on it! While you're there don't forget to see sultan Suleiman's tomb which is right next to it and mimar sinans tomb (the architect behind most of the beautiful mosques and structures in Istanbul)! The view from it is also amazing!

Less known, worth the trip. Not as known as the other mosques and in a less touristic area, this mosque is worth the trip (1-2 hours is ok). Quite sober on the inside, beautiful on the outside.Tip: don't forget to stroll around in the gardens, you have a magnificent view over the city from there.
beautiful !. My travelmates and I got lost actually to find this mosque haha . but this is such a beautiful mosque ! a must visited mosque in Istanbul :)

Less touristy than the Blue Mosque. If you are looking for something quieter than the Blue Mosque, this is the place you want to check out. It has beautiful gardens and some nice views across the Bosphorus from the vantage point of being up on a hill. It is said to be much more spectacular than the Blue Mosque, but I personally could have done without. If you have the time, it is worth the stroll, but I wouldn't worry if you miss it.

Possibly My Favorite Mosque in Istanbul. I got lost (multiple times) trying to find this mosque, but was so happy I stuck with my plan to go there. It's so beautiful and much-less trafficked than Blue Mosque (although you should go there too).

Amazing architecture. You can easily get there. Just get the metro to the Vezneciler station and then it is 10 min walk.The architecture is amazing. Make sure you visit the inside of the mosque from courtyard door. The courtyard is beautiful and has a magnificent view to the bosphorus.There are many coffee shop around that you can rest and have a nice tea.Since you can get there easily by metro don't miss it. You need about 1.5 hour to visit this place.

One of the most beautiful mosques in Istanbul. It is one of the most beautiful mosques in Istanbul, I don’t know how could they build it in 1950, it is great and beautiful building from out and in, when you visit it you feel the history.

Fantastic! . This was my third Istanbul visit and I'm glad I went to the Süleymaniye-Mosque. The architecture is breathtakingly amazing and the inside of the Mosque is also very beautiful. There is a little park outside the Mosque where you can enjoy a fantastic view of the Bosphorus and the Galata Tower. I was there when it was already dark out and would recommend to do that to other visitors as well.
Short trip. Very close from the metro. Cool and refreshing trip to this mosque. But the guard was extreme unfriendly and yelled at people.
Splendid. As beautiful as the Blue Mosque and emptier. Because of that the energy flows in a better way. The illumination is beautiful as well and the external area is very pleasant.
Thé Best . Thé Best place in Thé istanbul you should go this place... such a great Camii. .. Wè really like it a Lot. ..

Such a master piece in Istanbul. Probably the best of all. It is so far the best preserved kulliye (comlex) I would claim. Despite its extensive scale, it is such a peaceful atmosphere here. Much better maintained. Not only you can spend time visiting the complex, but also have the chance to try the best kuru - pilav in the city (white beans and rice). The neighborhood itself is also worth giving a walk through.

another Iconic mosques in Istnbul. you won't need more than an hour to visit this place, but it's worth the time, it is a beautiful mosque and is one of the distinct mosques in Istanbul you should see.
AMIZING. Hi every body Really Amazing if you want to get some good time in Istanbul, you should go to this mosque which are very beautiful ..Salah
I like it a lot. You can see the magnificent work of mimer Sinan in this imperial mosque. A piece of Art and harmony. Should be visited by all.
peaceful place . Are looking for peace , if you are really want to get some good time in Istanbul, you should go to this mosque. ..

beautiful. Very beautiful architecture. Built with delicacy to the smallest detail. Being able to see it from the inside is something else. I would encourage any body coming to Istanbul to check it out

She's beautiful.. She's beautiful. It is located right next to the Hagia Sophia and is specific because it has six minarets what isn`t typical for mosques. Built on a design by the famous architect Mimar Sinan during the reign of Suleiman the Magnificent. Represents a crucial point for a tour by all the tourists.

Bigger and nicer one at Old city. Crown Jewel building of the famous Architecture Sinan, nice complex and nice view from top of the hill into all surrounding, also there is a tomb of Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent “golden Age of Istanbul”, for me I would chose this Mosque over Slutanahmet if I don’t have time for both

Very nice view. Personally, I was more impressed of Suleymaniye Mosque than the Blue Mosque or Hayah Sofia, which are also very beautiful. But what I loved the most was not the mosque itself, but the architecture of the entire place and the breathtaking view it offers.

Absolutely stunning must-see. As restrained in style as the Blue Mosque is ornate, this is nonetheless a stunning building. The scale is amazing, especially the enormous chandelier.One of the most unexpected by wonderful parts of visiting this mosque was that there were volunteers there who explained the details of Islam and the mosque to tourists. The gentleman we spoke with was very patient and welcoming.
