Magnificent!. This mosque was built by Suleyman The Magnificent and shows the magnificence of his reign. One of the masterpieces of Mimar Sinan, this mosque sits atop a hill and can be seen from the Golden Horn. Must see!

Best one. You should come this spot in İstanbul. İt is one of the highlights of this great city. You can comehere any time of the day as long as you wait outside in praying time. This one is more quite than blue mosque and bigger. Has a fantastic galata tower and golden horn view.
Mosque Minus Crowds. Get your mosque fix here, & you won't have to navigate the crowds as much as some of the other mosques. Great city views to be had.

Less famous to tourists but considered more important - and it's magnificent. This mosque dominates the Old City's night skyline, so we were drawn to it. Descriptions that say that the inside is both vast and calming are entirely correct. Inside is beautiful. The view from the courtyard is magnificent, and the grounds themselves are interesting. Definitely worth a trek away from the Blue Mosque-Hagia Sophia-Topkapi triangle.

Nice mosque, great location. Not as busy and spectacular as the Blue mosque, but definitely worth a visit. I loved the location of the mosque, on top of the hill with some great views over the Golden Horn and Bosporus.

A must-see; grand and beautiful!. This is one of those "must see" sites in Istanbul. It is grand and beautiful. I certainly wouldn't advise you to miss it! After seeing many mosques, it can be overwhelming and underwhelming all at once (like cathedrals in Spain). But really, don't miss this mosque. Be sure to respect prayer time - arrive after it has ended or well before it starts (if you are aware of when the next time starts). As with most mosques in Istanbul, you will be asked to cover your head/shoulders with a scarf (if you are a woman) and possibly you legs if they are bare (men and women) and to remove your shoes, all before you can enter the mosque. The lines were not too long and well worth it! A bit out of the way from the other sites, but again, worth it! The grounds are beautiful and the view from outside the mosque is breathtaking!

One of the best views over Istanbul. I didn't even knew that this mosque existed. We just kept walking upwards and found it by surprised. And a pleasant surprise it was! You will get some of the best views over Istanbul from here but make sure to check the weather. The mosque is similar to Sultanahmet. Very beautiful.

Beautiful Architecture. Built by one of the most famous architects of his time, this mosque is a short walk from the Aqueduct. A bit off the beaten track, this is nevertheless a lovely mosque and - curiously unlike some of the more famous attractions in the Sultanahmet - very well preserved. The grounds are also beautiful and afford a lovely view out onto the Golden Horn. Especially good for anybody who is looking for a long walk out of the typical touristy areas.

Attraction. This mosque was constructed in the 1550 & was completed in 1557 during the reign of Suleyman the Magnificent & is truly something to see. It's size and height of it's dome is smaller than that of Hagia sophia and according to our guide the architectural elegance & size of the complex is much superior to any mosque.

Great Mosque. Every visitor should have a visit to this great Mosque which is built in reign of Sulaiman the Magnificent and also one of the architecture of Mimar Sinan. I always have to visit this Mosque in my every journey to Istanbul. The interior was magnificent as well as the well managed garden outside.

Best Mosque in Turkey. This Mosque was built in 16 th century by Architecth Sinan who is the best arthitech in Ottoman Empire. This Mosque was build around one km away from blue Mosque which was built in around 12th century by Bizans Empire as church.

Sultan Suleyman. Beautiful mosque, a very special made definitely need to be seen if you are visiting Istanbul and the aria is very historical.
It has been done at most powerful time of Ottoman and most powerful Sultan rule maker Suleyman and of course incredible Sinan the architect!

Beauty at it's best !. This is a very very beautiful mosque and not as crowded as the other Sultanahamet mosques. The ceilings in the mosque are so beautifully designed that you cant take your gaze away !

a peaceful site in a noisy part of the city. We visited and I just love how quite and peaceful the mosque and grounds are. It is a great place to take a short break -- and admire this wonderful treasure.

What an amazing building!. It was one of most impressive building I have seen in my life. What an Architecture of 16th century. I am planning read more about Architect Sinan who had built this impressive Mosque in 16th century.
Suleymaniye Mosque. Very few people at this beautiful mosque. We had a tour guide who took the time to explain the historic and architectural significance of the building.

Great city to visit. When I first arrived into Istanbul I was taken back by how large the city is, I was concerned about security also as I was staying in aksaray, however if you follow all of the usual personal security lessons then it is fine.It is a country in a worrying region and this have happened in the city but all that aside the experience has been great. It is a way of seeing another culture that is not always easy to see but with the benefits of western luxuries.January has been warm so far this year and a little rain but it does not take away the feel of the city.Well worth a visit, just play it safe and keep security in mind.

Magnificently simple!. We kept staring at this mosque without knowing which one it actually is. Not as talked about like the blue mosque or hagia Sofia, but this one is truly worth a visit. Airy and serene, it draws attention as the one giving full view to the golden horn! A masterpiece in providing all public amenities yet maintaining its stature as a religious site!
Poem. With the fall of the Ottoman Empire:As the Sultan abdicate, men fornicateDomes turn into butts, minarets into dicks

Very impressive Mosque complex, check out Suleymaniye's tomb when you are there. A very impressive Mosque complex build by Sinan. Have a look around the grounds as well as going into the Mosque itself. I would recommend Suleymaniye's Tomb, which is beautiful inside, and i was surprised how few people visited that area of the complex. It was a cold January day when i was there, but when i was in the tomb the only other visitor was a cat.

Beautiful . Been a big fan of the magnificent century series, so this mosque was a must. It is very beautiful and well preserved. Would say I prefer the blue mosque, but this is the most impressive I have seen in all of Istanbul.

This was my favorite mosque in Istanbul.. I could have stayed here for hours and hours and never stopped looking at it. Not outside or inside. It's probably the most beautiful place I've been. I took a lot of pictures. But even when I look at them, in my mind I know they are not the same as the way it really looked on a cold but sunny day right after Christmas. I think that beauty like that can't be described.
Beautiful and majestic. Designed by the great architect Sinan this is a must see. Stunning, majestic, inspiring. And great views over Istanbul.

Not to be missed - breathtaking!. One of those cultural sites that takes your breath away with its beauty. And then restores it with its serenity and welcome. Very well worth locating and getting there.

Beautiful!. Very nice mosque, fantastic architecture and historic background. It is not only the mosque, but also the turbes of Suleyman and Hurem, hamam, school and other adjecent places, making it a whole small district. The view from the mosque's garden is fantastic. This mosque is still an active one and pay attention to the times of the prayers. Wear a headscarf and decent clothes when visiting. A really nice and peaceful place where I had a fantastic few moments to myself in prayer. I loved it!

The Best Renovated Mosque in Istanbul. The views are amazing from this mosque and don't miss the Mirar Sinar cafe for another added adventure across the street. Great place to take a break from touring and good food directly across from the entrance which is not expensive
Sinans masterpiece. In my opinion this is the best mosque I have ever seen anywhere because the work of the sculptor is so precise and beautiful it is the best.
Stunning. we spend 2 days in Istanbul and visited several mosque. we enjoyed this one the most, especially the view over the Bosporus! we also felt that it was more quite and thus less tourist!

Extraordinary beautiful and much quieter than the Blue Mosque . This is a really great place to go without the crowds some of the other attractions in the city. Without the crowds we could really take our time appreciating the grounds, cemetery and mosque. The views of the Bosporus are spectacular. Also very close to Grand Bazaar and Spice Market.
Simply amazing architecture and beauty.. We were amazed at the architectural and artistic beauty of this Mosque. Definitely worth the time and effort to see.

Beautiful mosque. This was another beautiful mosque we visited as we did not manage to visit on our previous visits.
Walking around the outside of the mosque was amazing and you get a good view of the Bosphorus and everything else as the mosque is located high on a hill.

Suleyman resting place. We think this is one of the main attractions if you are familiar with the Ottoman era. Very easy access, nice coffee shops around and very secure. My wife had an ankle surgery and immediately they provided her with a wheel chair for easier access to everything. Is a place that we recommend and should not be missed if you go to Istanbul.
another good mosque. there are many mosques in Istanbul and Sulemaniye mosque is one of the best mosques to visit. The architecture of the building is very beautiful and very nicely maintained too

Wonderful volunteer guides. This is a beautiful mosque but the thing we loved the most was the wonderful volunteer guides. We met a young woman who is studying religion and English to help bridge the gap in westerners understanding of Muslim culture. She was so kind and wonderful at explaining her beliefs. My college aged daughter and her had a long conversation discussing her Catholic upbringing and her Muslim upbringing. It was beautiful and I wish it happened more often. When you go make sure to take full advantage of the well informed volunteers.

One of the largest mosque in the city with centuries of history. The mosque was built on the orders of the ruling sultan. The mosque is about 500 years old. Everyone must take their shoes off before entering the mosque. Woman must cover their hair before entering the mosque. The tile work are all flowers. There are no individual pictures on the tile. There is a high a dome and two levels in the mosque. The faucets on the outside for the prayers to wash their hands and feet before enter the mosque. There is a smaller mosque in the area. The Hagia Sophia Museum is in the same area.

Visit the Suleymaniye Mosque. Visit this mosque was very interesting because it gave me some insides into the style of the grave yard that seems to be typical for grave yards around a mosque (see pictures). The view of the city is great and the surrounding area is quit nice to visit.I recommend to set a aside enough extra time for taking a stroll around the neighborhood as it is quit nice to enjoy the view of the city and architecture of the mosque and other nearby buildings.
Very impressive , lots going on around it too. We walked around it and took in the grounds and architecture. Awesome architecture. Fun outside cafes and restaurants along its walls .

One of the most beautiful buildings on Earth. This masterpiece by Mimar Sinan is an obligatory stop on any visit to Istanbul. This is one of the mosques that you see from the Golden Horn, the one that dominates the city skyline. Its patio looks out over Galata, and provides amazing views. The real attraction, of course, is the mosque itself, which manages to enclose an enormous space without feeling at all cavernous. This is a must-see! The neighborhood nearby is a preservation district, and the adjoining hamam has been recently renovated and is open to the public. The Grand Bazaar is a short walk away, and a visit to the mosque can easily be combined with shopping in the markets.

Wow .... Another beautiful example of an imperial ottoman mosque, located right on top of the third hill of Istanbul. It sure is the largest mosque in the city and dates back to 1558 AD. The interior decoration is subtle, with very restrained used of the Iznik tiles. The white marble mihrab and the mimbar also feature a very simple and sober design.

Absolute Gem. This is easily the most beautiful mosque we saw in Turkey. It's sublime in its setting and original ottoman architecture. Well
Worth a visit!
Impressive. Shows the very fine islamic art. The impessive and pretty walls shows knowladge, hard working, concentration power and taste of the Otmani ppl.

Worth the Walk. We had a layover in Istanbul and wanted to see the sites we missed in May. We walked up the long hills from the spice market and ended up at Suleymaniye. It was almost as big and maybe better than the blue mosque. Easy to get in, no crowds, lots of blue tile and very beautiful. I would recommend seeing this mosque if you have time

Beautiful place. In my opinion, Suleymaniye Mosque is the most stunning mosque in Istanbul, better even than the Blue Mosque and certainly with fewer visitors. Incredible building, beautiful scripture artwork and large, peaceful grounds. Well worth a visit.

Suleymaniye Mosque. One of the most beautiful mosques I've ever seen, I've watched the series Muhtasem Yuzil and learned how sultan Sulieman ordered the architect Sinan to build it and I wanted to see it the building is beautiful inside out surrounding the mosque is a garden and you can see from it the view of Istanbul because it's built on a hill. Inside the mosque the view is like a square area with a huge chandiler and there is ten gallerias to show that sultan Sulieman the Magnificent was the tenth sultan of the Othman Empire, it has 4 minarates. This mosque lived through 2 fires and an earthquake, and is smaller in size than the one Sinan built. Don't miss vising it.

Glorious work of Sinan!. It's a challanging! Sinan the Architect and his great innovation! Great columns don't break your view like Blue Mosque and hidden buttresses by side galleries outside! The challenge to Hagia Sophia! Never collapsed!Süleyman's and his beloved wife Hürrem's (roxelana) graves and the good view of the golden horn in garden. You may be astonished when you see the grave decorated with beutiful tiles that are more than the mosque itself!
The best Camii . I went to there many many times I really like this Camii a lot I think the best Camii in Istanbul... everyone should visit this Lovely Camii...
Beautiful . Probably slightly better than the blue mosque. They have a nice little row of cafes outside the mosque so you can warm up.Mosque is fantastic. It's so beautiful.

The most beautiful mosque!. Just bumped into this mosque while Wal King the backstreets. There was not one person in there. I was handed a headscarf and we were welcomed in. It is mot as massive and old as the Hagia but it was certainly beautiful, I liked it more then the Hagia and the Blue Mosque. Just the simple fact that no one was inside and one can peacefully admire the coloured glass windows, the tile patterns, the domes, candelabra and a most amazing wall to wall Turkish blue rug covering all of the floor made it a memorable experience.
Magnificent!. This mosque is huge and has far less visitors than the Blue Mosque but is equally impressive. The lighting is magical and the atmosphere sacred and awe-inspiring.
A smaller version of Hagia Sofia. Everything inside is simila to that of Hagia Sofia , less tourist are coming to the place unlike that in Hagia Sofia

Beautiful mosque. Suleymaniye Mosque is a beautiful mosque situated on a small hill. Open daily but closed to tourists during prayer time. Free entry. Close to Egyptian Spice Bazaar. Well worth a visit.
Such a beautiful mosque. . This is a great tourist attraction for anyone visiting Istanbul for the first time. This mosque is absolutely breathtaking.

A Mosque. In our visit of May 2015, we went to see a lot of places, including this Mosque. What I can explain for any Mosque, so I dont have to explain. My father used to construct Mosques. He was greedy to see Mosques in Istanbul & Madinah's Great Mosque.This Mosque is built very beautiful, as my poor information, during the Era of Ottomon Empire, every mosque was built after having Wadu all of the workers. So, when you go there you will feel that.

Nice mosque to visit . The suleymaniye mosque is within walking distance to the grand bazaar and the spice bazaar and has stunning views overlooking the coastal lines. Great photo opportunities outside the mosque.If you get lost whilst walking, look out for the Istanbul university which is within close proximity; and ask anyone for directions!Mosque itself is very similar in style and architecture to other mosques in Istanbul with grand lanterns and beautiful arches.Note that all mosques are not accessible during prayer time for approximately 15 minutes; and on Fridays between 12h45 and 13h30. So be sure to time your visits to all mosques accordingly.

Same. Some times I feel like all the mosque in Isambul are same no doubt every mosque is located in different part of town and associated with some historical thingy but at the end of the day Mosque is a place where you pray to your god and can practice your faith in full spirtuality

One of the most beautiful mosques. The Suleymaniye Mosque is the most important monuments of the Islamic architecture. It was built between 1550-1558 on the order of Suleiman The Magnificient by Architect Sinan. In the courtyard of the mosque is Suleiman The Magnificient's tomb. Near the mosque there are a lot of traditional Turkish restaurants, where you must taste especially haricon bean and rice.

Overcrowded and malodorous. The mosque itself is fascinating but it is hard to stand the malodour as it is the custom to take off shoes while visiting mosques and this mosque is almost always very crowded. I would suggest tourists to visit Sokullu Mehmet Pasa Mosque which is nearby. It is a small mosque built by Mimar Sinan and it is not popular with tourists or local people so it has a calm and tranquil atmosphere just as you would expect to experience in a shrine.

One of the UNESCO World Heritage attarctions. This big mosque is situated near a huge meeting place in Istanbul: From outside this mosque has similar view like New Mosque or Sultan Ahmet mosque, it has different architecture inside.This beautiful mosque is situated on a small hill. Grand bazaar is near it. New mosque is not too far. Galata Tower is visible from here. Beautiful Bosphorus river is also visibleFrom city center it is very very easy to go by public bus or by tram. From airport taxi is the bets transport though a bit expensive, better to take taxi then change it at a metro station and then tram. It requires a walk to see it.
Nice place ! Great photos. Historic place . Nice landscaped gardens. Can get few good family photos.Can be reached easily by Istanbul kart.

A complex of wonder in the heart of Istanbul. The scale is phenomenal. The gardens and area around the mosque are in a UNESCO heritage zone and so they are beautifully preserved. Magnificent dominant building

Be Amazed !!!!. When I stepped in.. my tears appears in my eyes. Fantastic place. Turbe of Sultan Suleyman and his wife Hurem and children. I spent 3 hours inside. 2 Hours of sitting and enjoying my self. One hour of looking arround this fabulous place. If you are in Istanbul and you don't se this Mosque.... you are not in Stanbol... :)....
The best mosque we visited. Beauty of simplicity and elegance, an architectural masterpiece. Newly restored, the colors and details are amazing.
Great Place. A bit far from most of the attarctions. Can be covered in second day of the trip. Worth a visit in Istanbul
It's a biggest mosuqe. Suleymaniye Mosque is a biggest mosque. so the decoration is same blue mosque and it has the great city view for take a photo. you can walk from spice market.

Worth Finding This one!. Suleymaniye Mosque is definitely worth finding...much quieter than the Blue Mosque, the whole area has a very tranquil feeling. The interior is gorgeous, and those who work here are very helpful. A must see if you are in Istanbul!
Visit along with Grand Bazaar. This is a grand mosque just next to Grand Bazaar and so convenient for you to quickly have a look at it after some shopping.
AMAZING MOSQUE. This is as good as the Blue Mosque and accessible to the public whether muslim or non muslim and has amazing views over Bosphorus.
Best mosque in istanbul. I liked this more than Sultanahmet. amazing view to the city and outstanding interior. i strongly recommend a visit

Impressive structure. Impressive structure of the glorious past of the Ottoman empire. However, constant repair work without proper barricades somewhat diminishes the experience. I also would be happier if the lighting is made better.

Stunning Mosque Inside & Out. This was definitely my favorite mosque I visited in Istanbul. The entire grounds of the mosque were stunning. You can also take in the beauty of Istanbul from this mosque. No words can truly describe it's beauty.

Magnificent. The largest mosque in Istanbul, built on order of Suleyman The Magnificent by the chief architect Mimar Sinan in 1550-1558, years of possibly greatest power of Ottoman Empire. Unique piece of art, probably the best of Sinan's 94 mosques. Suleyaman The Magnificent was buried here along with his beloved wife Hurrem Sultan (ukrainian Anastasia Lisowska) and their daughter Mihrimah. Up on the third Istanbul hill, the complex is seem to be soaring over the Golden Horn. Celestial place...

Most impressive mosque in Istanbul. This is the most impressive mosque in Istanbul, although Sultanahmet is also very beautiful. The mosque is very old and still in use. it was designed by Sinan (one of the greatest architects of Istanbul) So making photos is prohibited during prayer time. On the grounds of the mosque there can be some tombes found. The most important tombe is of Süleyman I (the magnificent) and a separate tombe of his wife Roxelana (Hürrem).From the premises of the mosque you have a astonishing view towards the Golden Horn and the Bosporus.
Great Mosque to visit. A beautiful Mosque, where everyone can go. There is no rush. One can visit and admire the beauty. There is dress code.

Can't Miss. The view from the Suleymaniye Mosque is incredible. You are perched high above a grand city with a view of the sea. What could be better? The mosque's interior is less intricate than others in the city, which lends itself to nicely to a place that is meant for quiet reflection and prayer.

timeless icon that can't be missed. When in Istanbul be sure to take in the beauty of this site Be sure not to rush through as there are many things to consider when you look closely at the walls, monuments and surroundings

Great Architecture and amazing views. This is a free attraction located just behind the grand bazaar which is very easy to access. Once you get there try the eastern terrace for the amazing views of Bosphorous and Golden Horn area.
Nice. Just saw the Mosque from the outside, although it is allowed to go in. Its at one of the entrances of Grand Bazar.

Impressive !. Was a very nice journey, in all Sultanahmet area . But the piece which worth the struggle of the day, from my point of view was this one. Don't hesitate to take time when you are in town to visit this amazing , impressive hagia...

Wonderfull. It has very special architecture like other mosques in istanbul. Its not as famous as blue mosque but for sure it not less beautiful than that. I liked the atmosphere and the view of the city from Suleymaniye mosque. Dont miss it

Breathtaking View over the City. Suleymaniye Mosque is much less crowded than the Blue Mosque although as I visited it after the Blue Mosque the interior didn't have the same impact even though it is a very beautiful building. However, I would recommend walking up here for the grounds, as it's in an elevated position if you walk to the boundary wall you get amazing views across the city over the river, it was breathtaking at night.

Don't miss the Suleymaniye Mosque!. Our guide recommended we tour the Suleymaniye Mosque and I am glad we did. This mosque has very nice Sinan architecture and some amazing views of the city from the large courtyard. The minarets and domes are equal to, if not better than, the Hagia Sofia. I highly recommend visiting the Suleymaniye Mosque.
Do not miss this mosque by Sinan the architect.. This is the mosque to see in Istanbul. I found it more beautiful by far than the Blue Mosque. The architect is Sinan.

Stunning. I completely agree with the previous reviews, the Suleymaniye Mosque is an architectural gem in its own right. There is something about this building, along with the forecourt and gardens that is absolutely charming, the complex exudes a tranquillity conducive to quiet contemplation; all in all seemingly miles away from the commercial areas close by. It is worthwhile strolling out onto the Terrace behind the Mosque to take in the wonderful view of the Golden Horn.
مسجد السمانيه suleymanye Mosque. مسجد سليماني كبقيه مساجد تركيا تحفه عمرانية بحته تستحق الزيارة This mosque is another piece of art that shall be seen and appricated.

Huge and beautiful, much more than a mosque.. This is a community hub with ancient centralized services (school, baths, meeting spaces, graveyard, etc.) as well as a couple of impressive tombs. Beautiful views of the waterfront from the terrace too.

Don't miss this jewel. This is a little out of the main tourist drag but it is a treasure -- quiet, immaculate and ,above all, includes the indescribably beautiful tomb of Suleyman's beloved wife, known as Roxelana

Unforgettable day and place. My favorite and the most beautiful mosque I ever saw. So much air, light and history it carries that you just forget while you are in and around about your religious views and want to fall down and pray. And the greatest love of Suleyman Han makes this place for me even more special.

Really beautiful . This mosque is one of the most beautiful in Istanbul (also the biggest one), less crowdy than the Blue Mosque has nothing to envy to the latter.Close to the Grand Bazaar, make sure to visit the cemetery as well.Don't miss it.

Nice area. Wonderful area.. You will fill familiarity and you will be happy to walk between those simple fancy buildings and shops..Dont miss to drink a cup of turkish coffee at Mimar Sinan Cafe.. And then get a full fat dinner lunch with chopped meat on special bread under Istanbul wall

Peaceful gardens and really grand mosque. We kept missing this mosque, but made it on the last day and were glad to do so. It is the largest in Istanbul, and has decorations inside, rather than tiles. But the gardens and the setting are lovely and it is worth walking through the graveyard and where the two large tombs are. Exceptional views, too.

Magnificent mosque of Suleiman the Magnificent. Amazing atmosphere and beautiful scenery. You can see the graveyard of the Suleiman in the quad of the mosque. Also it is near many traditional Turkish food "kuru fasulye" restaurants to chill out and taste delicious foods.
Beautiful Mosque. Sacred space. Easy to get to, near the Grand Bazaar. Beautiful inside. Be sure to arrive before 5pm.

One of the 1000 places to see before you die. Even after the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, this mosque is a fifteen minute walk west through real neighbourhoods. Great view overlooking the city and the Golden Horn, Historical and beautiful
Definitely visit this mosque. After a while the interiors of the historic mosques started to look all alike. This mosque is distinguished by it fascinating cemetery and view.
Impressive construction. After the Blue Mosque probably most impressive mosque in Istanbul. Also the view over the Golden horn is fantastic.
Beautiful Mosque. This is different than the Blue Mosque - more of a natural beauty. The tombs of the Sultan and his wife are on the grounds as well.

One of the Best Mosques in Istanbul. Once you have seen Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, make your way to the Mosque of Suleyman the Magnificient. I think it is just as beautiful and worthwhile as the other more famous mosques. The grounds are well maintained and have a fantastic view of the city. The mausoleums of Suleyman, his wife Roxelana and the great architect Sinan are located on the grounds as well and are worth taking the time to visit. Make sure to have some fresh squeezed pomegranate juice from any one of the vendors on the side streets.One word of warning: Avoid the bathrooms if you can. They were the worst we encountered !!
November. We enjoyed this mosque over the Blue. More relaxed and less busy. Also has outstanding views of the city. Head scarfs and wraps to aid with entry
Beautiful. Another gorgeous piece of architecture. Also has its own hamam, so if a hamam is on your to-do list, you can combine them. Beautiful views of the city and the Bosphorus from the top.

grand and beautiful!. located near the grand bazaar, this mosque looks like the blue mosque. scarves and long wraps are available to cover your hair and legs. they won't let you in during prayer time.
from the side of the mosque, it has a beautiful view of the asian side of istanbul.
Best mosque. Fantastic mosque with great views. Chilled and less busy than the Blue Mosque. Great to walk around, interesting cemetery. Good cafe nearby.

Profoundly beautiful. This is easily reached by public transport and/or walking. I had the great opportunity of visiting this impressively beautiful place when hardly anyone was around. I was able to sit there in silence and look at the walls, ceilings, lamps, until it was time for prayer and tourists had to leave. As I left the building and stepped out of the enclosure, overlooking the waterfront, the call to prayer began to sound all around the city and the sounds started climbing up the hill, as if from the water, and up into the radiant sun. I'll never forget this experience.

Very satisfying and peaceful. Built by Suleiman I architect Mimar Sinan, the Mosque is huge with enormous domes. The inside is very serene. There are very helpful volunteers who explain the layout.The beautiful garden contains the Tomb of Suleiman I and his wife Roshanna.The views from the garden overlooking the Bosphorus are stunning.

Beautiful.. The Mosques in this city are astounding, the architecture is amazing. I took many pictures inside this one and others but they do not do them justice. The detail of the tiles on the arches and domes is breathtaking.All Mosques in this city are worthy of a peep inside you will not be disappointed.

Divine masterpiece by Mimar Sinan. Mimar Sinan, somewhat similar to Michaelangelo, tortured himself until he could reach perfection in grand mosque design. He was obsessed with supporting the massive dome with as few obstructing walls as possible. Suleymaniye is his first masterpiece where he achieved his great goal. The magnificent dome is supported by 4 columns only, making it possible for sunlight to enter in from all directions, making it so divine and majestic. The acoustic and natural ventilation calculations are still a mystery today.
great- ancient. you look for a place to be amazed? go there and watch the ceiling and floor, everywhere you can find something ancient and also you should listen carefully to the tour guide.
Best Mosque in Istanbul!!. This mosque is just amazing, outside is perfect, inside is amazing, the view this mosque has on the other side of Istanbul through the sea is just AMAzing.

Best in Istanbul. To my mind this is the most beautiful place in Istanbul. The Mosque itself is large and the veiw from its garden is splendid! If you look at Fatih district from distance, this mosque catches the eye first. Really nice!

Refined. I liked this mosque because its sobig and has its own story. Mosque of Sultan Suleyman and his Hurrem and most important architect Mimar Sinan, so beautiful, huge with beautiful garden. Near this Mosque there is cafe, Mimar Sinan teras, with most amazing panorama view on Istanbul. Drink coffe here or elma(apple) tea and you will enjoy!

Quiet and romantic place. The Suleymaniye is not so poplar as Blue Mosque. But I like it more. There are always less people, but it is very nice place to go. From there is great view on Galata Tower and bridge, park around is very nice. Near are buried sultan Suleiman and Hurrem Sultan, that makes that place romantic for all who knows their love story.
A surprise . We accidently bumped into this after getting lost from the grand bazaar. A lovely mosque set in a beautiful setting.

If you were to see one mosque this would be it.. We walked to the Mosque from our location in the old city. Not sure how we found it. Just kept heading in the direction and it was on the highest point. Worth the trip and worth touring the burial areas. We were here on our Mosque day. This was the best of the group.

Larger than Blue Mosque. Many tourists probably miss seeing this mosque because it's a little farther away from blue mosque and Haggia Sophia. But I would heartily recommend taking the time to see the Suleamaniye mosque. It is actually larger than the Blue Mosque and very beautiful.
great place to visit. one of the mosque in istanbul, huge one with breath taking view of the city. not very crowded. i definetley recommend this.

NICE BEST VIEW EVER. It got a fantastic view behind the mosque, which I did not realize until a nice Turkish volunteer told me about it. I am glad that I was there and take many many good photos of myself and the views. It's nice to know more about Muslim religion with volunteer who can speak good English and also is an University student in Istanbul, Turkey.You may get some information from the volunteer whether it's about religion, attractions or more mosques.

This famous mosque is beautiful. I had wanted to see this mosque since I was 17 studying Islamic Art in high school and it didn't disappoint after all these years! Set in gorgeous surroundings, it has beautiful views of the Bosphorus on one side of the grounds, and the inside is light-filled and the dome is awe inspiring.

More beauty than blue mosque. Amazing and impressive. This mosque has more beauty than the blue mosque, and less tourist crowds. Besides this it is biggest mosque of the city.Its location is a little away from all other tourist attractions. But it is very nice to combine this with the Egyptian Bazar which is just walking down the hill. On your way will find better priced stores.From the garden you have a view over entire Istanbul.
Stunning views. Despite its huge size, the mosque has a calm simplicity. Well worth going to see. The views across the city to the Bosphorus are stunning.
Beautiful mosque. Stunning inside and out. A pleasure to pray in. Lovely to see how it's been preserved over the years.

This needs to be on yor list. Sure, it's relatively new compared with the "big name" attractions, but it definitely rates a visit. Understanding the Ottoman portion of Turkish history is incomplete without seeing this place.

Lovely . My hotel was right near this mosque... so beautiful view when we walked up the street of our hotel.
Lovely open garden for you to walk in

Stunning architecture. This may not seem as exotic or beautiful on the outside as the Blue Mosque, but the architecture stands on it's own without the need for as much ornamentation - it's quietly spectacular!

If you cannot get to Edirne.... ...Go to the Suleymaniye Mosque to see the work of Sinan, the Sultan's architect for many decades, visit this mosque for exquisite perfection, and extraordinary grandeur.

Pretty mosque with amazing views from the grounds. I love this mosque, it is a little out of the way and less touristy (less queues) than the blue mosque, its beautiful inside, it's definitely worth going to, the grounds are nice too and the view over karakoy and Galata bridge is wonderful from such an elevated position.

I Say Very Magnificent !!. In my humble opinion , I thought this was a more impressive Mosque than the Blue ??Maybe because we were not on a tour and did it on our own and the crowds were way less ? The architecture was impressive and who really cares how many minarets or how tall, right ? The view is also pretty impressive and it ticks all the boxes . It seems to be held in second place but well worth a stroll through with your extremities covered of course !! Plus this is the Tomb of Suleiman the Magnificent and deserves a visit.

Mimar Sinan's Best Istanbul piece. Suleymaniye mosque was one the best Mosques, after the arthitect's masterpiece Selimiye in Edirne. It has a beautiful view from and for Goldenhorne. Since it's Sinan's it has this special elegance. One can feel the difference between many mosques you come across in Istanbul. It is maybe not bigger or not decorated as Blue Mosque, but Sinan's architecture has a unique feel for the house of prayers. Mimar Sinan's own grave is also very nearby. And if one has come to Suleymaniye, he or she should taste the delicious bean and rice dishes sold around the mosque.

Fantastic. Fantastic sacral building, very nice architecture and pretty surroundings. You may enter the mosque covering your arms and wearing long pants. Additionally you should take off your shoes. In the summer take a gas mak with you because of terrible smell of wet socks...
GOD GREAT !. So beautiful a mosque and Ottoman Empire important a art mosque . here l feel a people more believe and trust. And Quran so beautiful a voice and wonderful a prayer place.

Calm and beutiful Mosque. Its a beutiful Moque with some interesting corners and info boards. Not that many turists giving you time and space to enjoy the visit. However, the toilets are small dark and smelly.

Great. Entrance free. And you chat with an Imam. A must see. And if you have any questions, there is an Imam who will answer full of patience. If you are not willing to pay an entrance fee for a church/mosque, go there. Excellent alternative to Hagia Sofia. As well as Süleymaniye Mosque or (the even newer) Nuruosmaniye Mosque
Much better than the Blue Mosque. The Suleyman mosque is spacious and nice, better lit and no as overcowded as the Blue Mosque. You'll have a great view over Istanbul as well!
Architect Sinan's masterpiece. Süleymaniye is a complex (Kulliye) including the Mosque. It shows the wealth of Ottoman Empire at its peak, reflected in stone.

Elegant Mosque and Experience. Suleymaniye should be at the top of your mosque visit list without a doubt. It is a bit more off the beaten path and very close to the University district. It is elegant and stately and was not crowded at the time of our visit on our first day in Istanbul. It has superb volunteers who share all of its rich history and it is a very spiritual place. The grounds surrounding it are very pleasant with good views. Any return to Istanbul for me would start here.

The second largest Mosque in Istanbul. On a very dreary day, raining, this was a great place to visit, not overly crowded and a wonderful mosque to see. We took the No. 1 tram from the port where our ship docked and went to the stop for the University, from there it was just a case of a short walk to the mosque along some really quaint streets filled with the usual shops, restaurants and a bazaar outside of the mosque. It is a very impressive building with a large courtyard, check the prayer or services times before you go as they close it to the public. Once inside you cannot be nothing but impressed, we did manage to see the end of a small prayer service which was a highlight for us. Spend a little extra time while inside just taking in all of the nooks and crannies including the ladies only sections.
Very nice views. When I went, the interior was closed for restoration work, but only briefly. Still, the courtyards and surrounding areas offer many captivating views.

An Istanbul highlight. If you want to see a beautiful mosque with few tourists......then go to Suleymaniye, both for the mosque itself and the tombs, all with good explanations in English also. A friendly introduction to Islam from a volunteer inside the mosque was also very good.

One of many interesting mosques!. This was my second visit to mosque although my previous visit was many years ago. Stunning architecture but worth noting that as a working mosque entry may be delayed for prayers. Also, the grounds afford some excellent views of Istanbul and the Bosphorus!

Amazing view. We went here on our last day in Istanbul, when we were feeling a bit "mosqued out"! My husband reckoned, once you've seen one mosque you've seen them all, which I don't necessarily agree with, but this is worth going to just for the amazing view from the grounds. As with all mosques, you can't go inside during prayer times & you need to be suitably dressed, but clothes are loaned free of charge if they're not happy with what you're wearing.

Good area to visit. Great area to visit with an excellent Hamam for families And the mosque with all the history Lots of shops cafes etc and again easy to get around Public transport links in abundance

THE VIEW. Another beautiful building worth seeing in Istanbul. Superb workmanship that has been beautifully preserved. Set high over on the hills of Istanbul, the views of the rest of the city and the Bosphorous are probably the best from the back gardens of Suleymaniye
MUST SEE!. Extremely beautiful mosque (even prettier than Blue Mosque). Really neat and clean mosque with a stunning view! Near Grand bazaar, so you can combine those 2 activities in one day!

The most beautiful mosque in Istanbul. I have always wanted to see the Sultanahmet Mosque (Blue Mosque) in Istanbul. But after seeing the Suleymaniye Mosque, I must say that it is the more beautiful of the two. If you have time to only see one of the mosques in Istanbul, then I would recommend that you see this one.As our guide said, the Sultanahmet Mosque is like a woman who looks beautiful with makeup. The Suleymaniye Mosque is like a woman that is naturally beautiful. And after having seen both, I must agree.
Lovely Mosque. Beautiful mosque built by King Suleyman. Very outstanding from afar. Located on old side and easy to access
Suleymaniye Mosque and Magnificent Suleyman Tomb. Very very big Mosque, holy atmospher .Every travelers must be visit this place . You can visit Suleymaniye just 10 min far from Grand bazaar Area ..

The most beautiful Mosk I've seen. Not as glamorous as some other mosques, but the dimensions, the relationship of one element to the other and one space to the other are just superb. A masterpiece of architecture. Subtly enchanting. Built by none else but Mimar Sinan.
Architecture and views. Suleymaniye is the largest mosque in Istanbul and is as impressive on the inside as it is on the outside. There are also great views of the city from the terrace area.

This Great Mosque has a sea view. The Mosque of Sultan Süleyman the Magnificent (1557) is Istanbul's largest and grandest.Designed by the Ottoman Empire's greatest architect, Mimar Sinan, the Süleymaniye dominates the city's Third Hill, just north of Istanbul University, overlooking the Golden Horn (map).It's an easy walk of less than 10 minutes around the university from Beyazıt Square and the Grand Bazaar to the Süleymaniye.

Huge and beautiful mosque and not as crowded as the Blue Mosque. The Sulaymaniye Mosque is more or less between the Grand Bazaar and the Golden Horn. If you approach from the water side you will have to walk uphill. This is another incredible mosque but not so crowded as the Blue Mosque both because of location andthe fact that it is less known to foreigners. But go if you have the chance and peek into the tombs that are next door also.
Beautiful. Beautiful place to be. It's a bit hard to get there, that's why there are not so much tourists, which is good. Enjoy the view over the city and the river from the gardens.

History of Turks. In my opinion this ist he best museum in Turkey. You can find history of Islam, Anatolia, Roman Empire, Byzantine Empire, Ottoman Empire and Turkish Republic here. Not in very detail but some milestones and unique parts of history. Like Mohammed's foot step sign. You must visit here if you're in Istanbul.

Beautiful Mosque inside & outside with a great view of Istanbul. Firstly, this mosque is stunning from the outside. It's very grand and the architecture is amazing. There are toilets available on the site which, are clean and cost one lira (this is handy if you've come from either the spice or grand bazaar and walked up the hills!). There is a lovely view of Istanbul from the garden walls - the view points out over the Galata bridge. Inside the mosque is equally as impressive and I think very underrated on the tourist attraction suggestions. Great visit

Most amazing mosque of Istanbul. Yes.. This is truly the most beautiful mosque of Istanbul. It looks great has amazing location and great views of bosphorus. It's just 15-20 mins once you cross the Galata bridge (mosque side). It is pretty and grand. The place would take about an hour's time and definitely worth the time to go out of the way a little.

The most wonderful mosque. Definitely in my "MUST DO" List in Istanbul!I recommend to visit this mosque at nightfall...the colors are unbelievable. Very quiet contrary to the most popular Blue Mosque and Sainte-Sophie.
Another beautiful mosque. Very beautiful and not at all as crowded as the Blue Mosque. Volunteers answered questions on the building and islam, very informative.
Great Mosque!. The blue mosque is probably more famous because of its location, but i think this one is way more worth visiting.

Exquisite. The Suleymaniye Mosque does not seem as popular for tourists as the Blue Mosque or the Hagia Sophia so it is peaceful and you can enjoy your time taking in the remarkable decorations, etc. It is very beautiful and well maintained. It is a must see when visiting Istanbul. The tombs are also worth visiting.
The most amazing mosque ever!. Not Blue, not AyaSofia but Suleymaniye Mosque!! This is an awesome free entry place to visit and no need to queue! Love it!
beautiful. Beautiful light filled mosque with interesting tile work. Volunteers explain the history of the mosque and Muslim traditions and customs. Lovely surrounding gardens.
Quiet Less Touristy Mosque. This is a beautiful mosque in a beautiful hilltop setting. A visit requires some effort in the form of climbing steep stairs but the payoff is worth it.

BEAUTIFUL and much more peaceful that the Blue Mosque. We found it difficult to find initially but on our second attempt, a lovely local man helped us and we were blown away by its beauty. Perched on a hill, it offers stunning views over the Golden Horn. Peaceful with expansive grounds, it's well worth a leisurely stroll.

Big nice mosque. Women have to cover hair and leg when entering. I only noticed hair part so I brought a scarf. But the staff noticed the holes on my jeans so I had to use their blue cloth to cover my legs. Apart from that, everybody has to remove the shoes when going inside. It's nice to visit but inside it really smells a lot. I took a short visit of 5 minutes and then waited for my friends outside

found it a bit boring. All the hasle of taking off shoes etc. Women putting on a head shawl etc etc So prehistoric and oppressive. Introduction to Islam blah blah. Boring. Would not recommend it sorry.
Lovely place in Istanbul. Lovely place in Istanbul! Really worth visiting! And it's a pleasure walking on the streets of Istanbul!
Very interesting and lots less people than the Blue Mosque. We went to the Grand Bazaar, then over to this Mosque, then down to the Spice Market - had a great day!
Amazing place. Amazing place and a must, don't miss it, the location is amazing and the mosque art inside is magnificent :)

THE MOSQUE TO VISIT. Situated high above the city in lovely gardens this was a place where you could feel the tranquility of the mosque. You leave the bustle and pressure of the bazaar area behind and climb steadily up to its imposing site. There were resident "sisters" within the mosque who spoke in various languages about the place and the concept and traditions of their religion which was revealing and interesting. A little off the main tourist trail and a definite recommendation

GOOD, BETTER, BEST, BESTEST..... Reaching Suleymaniye Mosque was quite an uphill walk. But, its worth all the effort. You can see this magnificent mosque standing high on the skyline from the Galata Bridge. I visited around 5 mosques in Istanbul, and Sulemaniye tops as my favorite. Calm and serene gardens. Less touristy, very peaceful and an empowering feeling. Also, the volunteers at the mosque speak in most languages and explain to you the history and other facts of the place. This is best service an tourist attraction can offer to the visitors. I'll highly recommend this place than the Blue Mosque.
very nice. every body must be view suieymaniye mosque because is historical places in sltan solayman film & can be good memory

Magnificently simple and peaceful!. Istanbul is famous for its mosques, some more known than others. Most of them are crowded with tourists at most times and most also are decorated reliefs and tile work. Sulemaniye isn't different. It doesn't have tiles or too much decorative work to show off. It's simple and has magnificent arches. In the absence of decorative arts, the architecture of this mosque assumes its rightful place and catches the observer's eye. The mosque majestic both from inside and out. We visited it early in the morning around 8, straight from the airport, so there were a few people around. We sat in doors and soaked ourselves in the ambiance for a while. You admire how arches almost speak to each other when they come and meet at various angle up top to form inside of the ceiling around the central dome. There's not much to distract your vision. We visited after visiting the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and a few other mosques but found Sulemaniye the best. Don't forget to go in the back for the excellent views of the bay and the city across, even Galata bridge. It's a must when in Istanbul and should perhaps be the last or the first thing you visit, so you can unwind and just let go of yourself in there, admiring the peaceful retreat that it is.
Awesome. The greatest Mosque at Istanbul and nicest façade, really impressive patio and front made of luxurious marble captivating sight

Great setting, very peaceful. Unlike most other attractions in Istanbul, this place was very quiet and peaceful and the views from the place were lovely, although structurally the mosque is similar to other mosques in Istanbul. The surrounding complex has quite a few attractions and the interiors of the mosque were beautiful. Would recommend spending an hour at least to take in the mosque and the views. The place is not close to any tram stop so we took a taxi in and walked the way down towards eminonu.

excellent. probably the most impressive mosque in Istanbul. Great views of the city, not jam packed with tourists like the other two mosques around the corner. Definitely worth the hike up the hill. The views are similar to the Galata tower with the exception that they are free of charge!
Beautiful building. Not much to say. We went to three mosques and this one was the most attractive to me. You do need to know you will have to take off your shoes and dress properly/respectful.
Compares to Blue Mosque. We saw this on our second trip to Istanbul. It is stunning in its location and interior. Sinan did a great job building this one.
Amazing architecture. Beautiful mosque and surroundings. Similar architecture and style as blue mosque and other mosques in Istanbul.

one of the most beautiful areas and masjids i have visited.. ask locals for Sultan Ahmet roof top cafe located in a scenic passageway near this masjid to have amazing alfresco dining experience looking out over the city at sunset!!!
The place of pacification. I love this place, nice and queit park near.It is the largest mosque in the city, and one of the best-known sights of Istanbul.
Beautiful yet under rated . This is perhaps the most under rated place in istanbul.it's a beautiful mosque with an absolutely breath taking view of the bosphorous.It's a must visit

Also known as Blue Mosque. We were planing to go early in the morning after the first prayer and before the long waiting, but we didn't do it. However we went before the afternoon prayer and the line was not so bad, it rained when we were inside. Beautiful place
immpressive. beautiful, huge mosque. be sure to have covered shoulders and legs and head scarf for women. beautiful tile work

Sinan + Suleiman=magnificent. Of the mosques I've visited in Istanbul, this is my favorite. Located high atop a hill, the grounds offer shade and wonderful views of the Golden Horn and Bosphorus Strait. The understated nature of Sinan's design is beautifully elegant and harmonious. The courtyard arches are simply decorated, and the tall, slender minarets are highlighted with blue (tile or glass--I couldn't tell). The decorative tilework in the interior is very tasteful and lovely. Suleiman's tomb and that of his wife and daughter were not open for guests when we were there. Sinan's tomb is located off the grounds. A spectacular building in a gorgeous setting.

Underestimated topsight. The suleymani mosk is unlike the blue mosk or aya sofia much less touristy. On its grounds you find the tomb of suleman the magnificent. The neighbourhood is worth exploring and is an UNESCO protected sight. An hour or 2 should get you trough 2 or 3 other mosks, parks and the aquaduct.

Impressive Mosque with Beautiful Views from the Site. This mosque, built on the top of a hill overlooking the Golden Horn, is even more impressive than the Blue Mosque. Of course, as with visiting any other mosque, it is necessary to take off your shoes and the ladies have to wear a head scarf (take your own in order to avoid having to wear one that thousands of others have used) and cover up other parts of your body, such as your knees. If you have the time, this mosque is definitely worth a visit.

Magnficent Century Suleiman. There is a TV series in Turkey starring Halit Ergenç, one of Turkey's most beloved actors, entitled Magnificent Century (you can see it on YouTube with English subtitles). It's about the life of Suleiman, the most famous of the Sultans. The love of his life was Roxelana, a captured slave, born according to the source in the Ukraine or Poland. She's commonly thought of as a Russian. Their tombs are on the grounds and make sure you see them. The mosque and tombs are the work of Sinan (commemorated in the Architect's Apprentice by Elif Shafak, a famous Turkish author. ) The grounds are lovely with a beautiful sea view on one side.

Better than the Blue Mosque. Considerably less busy than the Blue Mosque, in a very similar style, this large impressive complex is well the visit. It offer a superb contrast with the Grand Bazaar, which is very close.

This mosque was recommended to us by a friend and it did not disappoint. We took public transport and walked to this mosque at the top of the town. It is an amazing place with so much to see inside as well as outside. The gardens and cemetery are beautiful. It's an easy walk then back down to the waterfront.

Another attractive mosque. After a week in Istanbul, i'm a bit mosqued-out, but we enjoyed the walk up to Suleymaniye Mosque through the lanes just past the Spice Bazaar, and the views of Istanbul from the terrace. It also has an interesting cemetery and mosques.

historical mosque. It is not over run by tourists, you have a good idea what the idea behind this mosque is (it was essentially a charity). Close to the Grand Bazar. It was built for the most successful sultan by the best ottoman architect.
Nice place. I can say it is hidden beauty of istanbul. because although the most popular mosque in istanbul is sultanahmet, this place really has a charming atmosphere.

A must visit in Istanbul. While checking the best attractions of Istanbul, one gets an impression that the Blue Mosque is the best but on visiting one finds that though this Mosque is very photogenic with its curvaceous exterior of a cascade of domes & six minarets but Suleymaniye Mosque offers a far greater interior which is breathtaking in its size and still pleasing in its simplicity at the same time. On entering the mosque through the main entrance at the Northwest side of the Mosque and walking through the great courtyard, one is awestruck by its grandeur.In the garden courtyard around the mosque ,stop at Lale Bahçesi, a popular tea garden with its interesting setting in a sunken courtyard to enjoy it has a cup of Turkish tea.The beautiful tombs of Süleyman and his sultana Roxelana (Hürrem Sultan) in the garden behind the Mosque are worth a visit too.

Exceptional. The Suleymaniye Mosque dominates the skyline and overlooks the Golden Horn and Galata district. It is not only beautiful but also huge. If you walk around the back there is a terrace area with incredible views of the city--great photo op. The interior is inspiring with its massive dome and supporting pillars. The colorful tilework adds to the beauty. If you are lucky there will be a service being conducted with wonderful music.
Church cum mosque.. One of the largest in the world, with minarets and domes. Entry is free. Little away from Sultanahamet, We took a bus to travel to the place.
More like tombs, and similar to bigger ones. If you see the other mosques, you don't need to see this one. These are basically tombs in the similar architecture as others, only lesser pretty
Worth a visit. Awesome to see. Don't walk through as so many did. It is a masterpiece of beauty that needs to be seen.

Well worth a visit. This is a beautiful mosque to visit. Another of Mimar Sinan's. Beautiful interior. Lovely gardens. The mosque is set up high on the hillside with views across the Golden Horn to the Galata tower and surrounding areas, to the Bosphorous. Also here are the mausoleums for Suleymaniye and Roxelana. Which are also exquisite.

Best visit to a Mosque. I enjoyed this mosque visit the most. When we were there two men were singing and it made it a richer experience for me. There don’t have the crowds that the Blue Mosque does and I think Suleymaniye Mosque has a lot going for it with the colours and design.
Beautiful!. A remarkable mosque! Our visit was just after prayer call so we had to wait a bit but it was worth the wait.

Stunning architectural gem by Mimar sinan - an absolute must see in Istanbul!. What a beautiful building - make sure to see the surrounding area also including the small mausoleum at the side and the graveyards. And the view if the harbour from the back is one of the most beautiful in all of Istanbul, to my mind.

Amazing Mosque, that dominates the skyline!. When you arrive in Istanbul, it is hard to miss the amazing Suleymaniye Mosque! it dominates the skyline! The design of the interior is simple, yet beautiful! The dome is the largest out of all the mosques in Istanbul. The courtyards are also special. An absolute must go when in Istanbul!
A more modest Mosque but very beautiful.. Our guide too us to this Mosque and it was very beautiful. But after other sights, it would have been ok not to go there. But it was very interesting.

Worth the visit. The outer garden is gorgeous, with amazing views across to Galata Tower. The interior, although not as incredibly decorated as the Blue Mosque, is arguably more peaceful: most of the massive cruise ship groups will be noticeably absent!

Who was the architect. Make the effort to go there and find out who the architect was and what other buildings he was involved in. One of his pupils was the architect for the Blue mosque. check out other famous people who were alive at that time. Definitely worth the effort

Worth the hike. We missed our ferry and ended up finding this place by accident. What a great surprise! This was my favorite of all the mosques we visited. It is far less busy than the Blue Mosque and the courtyard and exterior of the building is more expansive. Check out the tombs outside. It's a pretty steep hike up but you will be rewarded with an amazing view of the city.

One of the best mosques in Istanbul . There are no big difference between mosques in Istanbul But this one feels difference Must be visited, and it's very near to grand bazaar, so they can be easily visited together

Quiet. Compared to the Blue Mosque this mosque is quiet and not so famous but as beautiful.There was no rush to visit and get out because the mosque doesn't attract as many visitors but it was was really worth our time.After the visit we have spent some time relaxing in the park located near the mosque. Great place to unwind.

Magnificent!. The Blue Mosque, the New Mosque, Haghia Sophia and then the Suleymaniye Mosque. You would be forgiven for being a little weary by this stage, but the Suleymaniye is comparable to any of the others and, in the view of many people, possibly better.In short, it has everything, from the exterior, which is truly beautiful, to the interior, which is as calm and peaceful as one would expect, and on to the extensive views over the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus.In addition there are fascinating graves, the tombs of Suleyman the Magnificent and the (in)famous Roxelana and a large and impressive courtyard - amongst many other things.This site should not be missed by any visitor to Istanbul.

The Largest Mosque in Istanbul was the best!. The Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque are wonderful. Suleymaniye was my favorite. The courtyard is huge and open. It's simple, more understated interior felt serene,calming and accessible. The white marble and high dome and windows make it light and airy inside.

Probably my favourite mosque of those I visited in Istanbul. Even if you don't go into the mosque itself, the gounds and views make the trip up the hill well worth it. It is almost peaceful compared to the Blue Mosque with its hordes of tourists.At the front of the visitors area we found several volunteers who were happy to explain any aspect of the architecture, decoration, or indeed Islam to visitors. It wasn't hard sell but the information was there if you wanted (and if you didn't want the religion part, that seemed fine as well).
Memorable. Memorable visit, just as beautiful than the Blue Mosque. Worthwhile visited, near the Grand Mosque and visitors are welcome to visit.
So peaceful. Big mosque up in the hill with beautiful parc and wonderful view. Inside mosque is beautiful, calm, easy to get relax mood from Istanbuls athmosphere.

Almost better than Blue Mosque. It's worth trekking over/up to to the Suleymaniye Mosque. It is a beautiful building surrounded by beautiful grounds and a panoramic view of the Golden Horn. There are far fewer crowds here as compared to the masses at the Blue Mosque. Suleymaniye is not as beautiful inside as the Blue Mosque (Suleymaniye is all white inside), but it is so peaceful and its courtyard is lovely as well. The graveyard is interesting. Unless you want to pay tribute, I'd skip Suliman's crypt. Be sure to get the 'dry beans' at the restaurant alongside the mosque. I know that doesn't sound very appetizing, but they are really quite good! They are actually in a tasty light tomato based sauce and served with rice. Very flavorful.

Very important Mosque to visit. If you read about the Sultan Suleyman and his empire,this is a place to visit.Go to his tomb,you will also see tall his family and his wife tombs.I am so glad I went there,is the most impressive.

Magnificent building on top of Istanbul. In a city where "more" seems to equal "grander" this mosque appeals well to my Scandinavian esthethics ideals. Strict and harmonic layout combined with a restrained interior decoration. It is a beautiful structure. The mausoleums in the graveyard are interesting too. Maintenance better than that of the "Blue Mosque". The mosque seems to be either the prototype or the quintessentiel of mosques of Istanbul. There was no queue for entering (Friday approx. 15.00)
A memorable experience. If you visit only one mosque then it should be this one. It is a place for quiet conteplation and beauty. It is also a place of worship and scarfs are available
Supreme. Marvelous masterpiece by a truly great,extremely gifted artist.Perfect memories.Its also matters to me because of Hurrem turbesi.I ve passed trough a few times but couldnt get in.

An A+ highlight. Although this mosque plays second fiddle to the Blue Mosque, it is an amazing wonder in its own right. The grounds around the mosque are pleasant to walk in and the views are excellent. There is also the added benefit of it being less crowded than many other sights. The interior is more peaceful as you would expect in a working mosque. Definitely a sight not to miss.

A mosque with bright white walls and nice gardens. I stumbled upon this place while looking for the Grand Bazaar, and thought the grounds were lovely. Even the courtyard had a welcoming air to it. You can get a good view of the rest of Istanbul from the low wall facing east, and the adjacent graveyard, containing Sultan Suleiman I's mausoleum is worth seeing as well.The mosque was commissioned by Suleiman in 1550 and is a fine example of an early Ottoman Mosque. It has been restored three times due to fire and earthquake. As the Mosque is on a high hill, it doesn't have as many visitors as the Blue Mosque, so if serenity and peace is what you're looking for, I'd recommend this one as a pleasant alternative.

A monument to great leaders. It is large and magnificent, the domes are awesome, so much work went into the construction and the mosaic works are amazing, people did this without modern tools. The tiles are also lovely and the aura is one of awe and reverence.
Suleymaniye Mosque. Astonishing and magic place.... If you want to go to a less crowded mosque, this is the one, still beautiful and huge.

Impressive Culture. Travelling into another culture, this mosque will help us to understand the history, culture of the time of Suleyman, a man with c=vision and the ability to impose his own belief while allowing the world to appreciate the belief and culture of the Christian world - an impressive historical edifice.

Sadly Google Maps was wrong. We so enjoyed this building on the skyline in Istanbul at sunset so decided to visit. It We walked to the destination following Google Maps. That led us to the Blue Mosque, not Sulemaniye Mosque that i'd typed in. Unfortunately time did not allow us to walk to the correct building.Will just have to see it on the inside next time in Istanbul.

Very beautiful mosque. Yet another beautiful mosque in Istanbul - an amazing piece of architecture, well worth a visit. The art-work on the inside is beautiful and it is very peaceful inside. You may find a queue outside, but it moves fairly quickly, so do stay and have a look inside - you will not be disappointed!

Rivals Blue Mosque ... Worth seeing!. On our very first day in Istanbul, we walked to the Mosque of Suleyman the Magnificent from our hotel (Hilton Doubletree Old Town). It is located up a hill next to the Istanbul University. We were a bit lost navigating the streets but a nice young university student volunteered to help and walked us most of the way there - Turkish people are very kind and hospitable. The mosque is quite grand as you walk up to it. It is strategically located so the views overlook the Bosphorus Strait and out towards the New District. It is most impressive to walk in from the northside, through the courtyard. It is free to visit but avoid 30 minutes prior to the Muslim call to prayer & during prayer, as well as Friday afternoons (Muslim holy day). Both women and men should cover their shoulders and knees. Women need to cover their heads as well. Scarves and clothing are provided to borrow as you enter the mosque if you come unprepared. Everyone must remove their shoes before entering. The mosque is magnificent and recently restored. It rivals the Blue Mosque in its grandeur and seems more open and airy too. You are allowed to take pictures. Just understand the etiquette and not interfere with those who are there to pray. There were volunteers working when we were there to hand out pamphlets about Islam or to answer any questions about the mosque. I found the pamphlets very informative.There are wonderful photo opportunities outside the mosque overlooking the Bosphorus Strait. There is a cemetery located behind the mosque worth seeing as well. Featured inside are the tombs of Suleyman the Magnificent and his wife, Roxelana.
2nd most important mosque. After Blue Mosque, this is an important mosque in Istanbul.Huge history from Roman to Greek, would recommend the place anytime.
The best Camii. İ seen many camii but this is the best camii in the turkey big garden thanks a lot Mimar Sinan... İf you in istanbul you should go here...
Suleymaniye Mosque, Istanbul. Amazing mosque, massive dome, with beautiful tile work. Lots of people inside, but we were able to see everything of import.One of the biggest mosques in Turkey
Hard to fathom such a place!. This is really a lovely building and we appreciated the opportunity to learn a new cultural experience.
As beautiful if not more so than the Blue Mosque. This is not to be missed! We were very lucky as there were few visitors. The serenity and beauty was awe inspiring
Imposing building. This building is very huge and very imposing from outside.it's design in wonderfull.inside of that is very soothing and i was very comfort.

superb building. to my mind far more impressive than the blue mosque with the added bonus of far less tourists unlike blue mosque none muslims not allowed during prayer time so time your journey at side street is the tomb of sinan the architect walkable from sultan ahmed district also close to tram stop

You Should Visit. If you like to know the culture then this is one is certainly a great places to visit. We really like it and would be better if the tourist were a little bit quieter...there were loads of tourists but it's fine and worth the wait and the visit.

Elegant and peaceful mosque. We visited Sulemaniye Mosque on a gorgeous morning around 10 a.m. There were no major crowds to contend with and the overall atmosphere was peaceful and majestic. The esthetic is elegant and beautiful, adding to this impressive mosque.
Amainggg architecture.. DON'T MISS THIS. Much more beautiful that the blue mosque, not to miss. Its the masterpiece (in Istanbul) of Mimar Sinan.

Must see to be Impressed ...Close to the Grand Bazaar. Must see to be impressed. Parts of it are under renovation, but that won't deter from its size and beauty. It is not open during prayer hours and observe clothing requirements to be respectful or they won't let you in. Photos are allowed.

An architectural masterpiece. Suleymaniye mosque doesn't take long too see - but it is likely to stay in your visual memory for a long time. It is not highly embellished - it is just wonderful architecture.
HUGE Masjid. A Huge mosque. The largest mosque in Istanbul. its high location affords great view of the water and skyline
Beautiful and historic. This was one of the most favorite sites we visited in Istanbul - very impressive and great views. Stop and have some cold cherry juice to drink in the courtyard.

Bigger and better than the blue mosque.... We were recommended to visit this mosque which we had not heard of before. It is up the hill from the Grand Bazaar. Of our family of 6, 3 thought this was the best mosque we visited( other3 liked the Rustem Pasha)but all thought they were both better than blue mosque. Well, maybe shouldnt say better but we did like them a lot and highly recommend people to visit them. There are so many beautiful mosques that are not the ones that most people hear of. Some have more colourful mosaics, or are large and peaceful inside.

Huge and impressive.. Awesome and of a size appropriate to a Sultan whose name was Suleyman the Magnificent. Not just a mosque but a complex with graveyard, tombs, gardens, library etc. You can only enter when they are NOT praying. Do observe the requirements to cover the head and legs and arms and remove shoes. It's airy and beautiful.

The Mosque with the most. If you are only going to be able to see one Mosque this is the one to see. The Blue Mosque is great but the tourists can jam it up a bit. This one is off the path a little and worth the trip. More serene and quiet. Very well kept and beautiful.
Wonderful place to visit. Another lovely place in Istanbul. It is stated over a hill, so prepare yourself for a climbing trip (just joking). It is really stunning and a must visit mosque

Not to be missed - it is magnificent.. I think there have been many reviews so all I can say is - do go to this mosque. It is a wonderful place and it has great views over the Bosphorus but more than anything else - every time you get on a ferry to go up the Bosphorus or up the Golden Horn you will see this magnificent mosque and know that you had the privilege to go there.
nice view. it was nice but not as good as i expected. maybe because we have greater ones in iran. so it didn't catch me.

Istanbul's largest. The Sulemaniye Mosque, Istanbul's largest, was ordered by Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent and designed by the great Ottoman architect Mimar Sinan.The mosque was built in the mid 16th century. It's dome is twice as high as it's diameter, 85 feet in diameter and about 175 feet high. The mosque has 4 minarets reaching 236 feet.The mosque is built on a hill in the bazaar area of the old city close to Beyazit square. It is a vast complex with the mosque, Medrese (Islamic school), the tombs of Suleiman and his wife Roxelana behind the mosque and many other structures.From the side garden you can look down and see Beyoglu, the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus.One morning I started at Eminonu square, walked uphill to the Slemaniye mosque, then to Beyazit square, the Grand Bazaar, across Sultanahmet square to the Marmara Coast across (from the Golden horn to the Marmara). Good walk.
Magnificent Mosque. Truly a place to visit and take in the majesty of the building and its environment. Holds significant history worth hearing about and so close to many other Istanbul sights.

Beautiful Mosque. Great place to visit. Make sure not to wear tight pants, they will hand you a skirt to borrow if so. They will also lend you a scarf at no cost. Your head must be covered. Get ready to smell lots of feet. You will also be asked to take your shoes off. Go the earliest possible to avoid a long line.

All about the view.... The mosque is nice inside but we spent most of our time taking in the breathtaking views of the Golden Horn. Well worth it even if you don't go inside the mosque. Quite an easy walk from the Grand Bazaar. Note you can't take babies in the mosque.

Süleymaniye Camii... the one and only. Süleymaniye Camii... the one and only! The largest mosque in the city and a true chef d'oeuvre of the famous architect Mimar Sinan, built in 1558, has to be visited. The imperial mosque is built as a kulliye, a complex with adjacent structures. A great contemporary Turkish architect and professor, wrote many books, some available in english, which should be read prior to the visit... Sultan Suleyman's tomb (turbe) is within the complex, and the tomb of the famous Koca Mimar Sinan, the fabulous architect... This elegant mosque with mihrab and minbar in white marbre and the tiles from Iznik has four minarets.

Beautiful. Really beautiful mosque but it could be a little difficult to find - it is near the Istanbul university and Grand Bazaar. Behind it you can see mausoleums for Sultan Suleyman and Hurrem Sultans also for other Sultans family members aswell.

In awe. Such history .....I could not believe that we were allowed into this beautiful mosque where so many people come to worship...it felt scared to me...it was so awe inspiring to be standing there soaking up the experience.This is a must see. Woman need to cover their head and shoulders...but if you forget there is head wear available ....This mosque was a highlight for me in Istanbul.

Beautiful. This mosque was a short walk from our hotel and one evening we decided to walk the grounds and see inside. It was virtually deserted, and no less impressive than the Blue Mosque - perhaps even more. The views from the grounds are beautiful, the interior is stunning. If you want to experience one of Istanbul's most amazing Mosque's, avoid the crowds and enjoy beautiful views, Suleymaniye is a great choice.

Amazing . I have been there with my husband. To me it was breath taking The architecture of the mosque is amazingFrom the inside and the outside.Everyone who loves historical places and great architecture should visit the place.

Beautiful mosque, off the beaten track. Gets missed easily, but its an absolutely wonderful place to visit. Its a beautiful building, the grounds are well-maintained and the view of the city is lovely. Take the time to make it when you visit Istanbul.
A must see when in Istanbul. Incredible mosque to visit. A must when in Istanbul. Entrance is free, the line long but fast moving.
Nice place. Beautiful place with history and worth visting to see the culture. Very clean and people are helpful

Magnificent. You must see this mosque, as well as some others in Istanbul. Suleymaniye is the biggest and besides its great architecture is simply imposing both from outdoors and indoors. By the way, don't confuse it with Sultan Ahmet or Sultanahmed mosque which is the Blue Mosque. I read several reviews from people who are confusing both mosques, some of them included photos from the Blue Mosque instead of Suleymaniye Mosque.

Beautiful and serene. This mosque is not as accessible as the Blue Mosque but it is well worth the effort to find it. The outer courtyards are very special places with some of them having fantastic views over parts of the city. The mosque itself is a very serene and special place, and a fantastic architectural masterpeice.
Suleymaniye Mosque. Majestic - One of Sinan's greatest works. I think this is a must and the Sinan is buried near the mosque.

Outsdanding building beautiful views of the city. Surprised me more than the Blue Mosque. Perhaps for the fact there were fewer tourists. In the gardens at the side there's a marvellous view of the Golden horn, Galata tower. Really beautiful inside and out.
Your done if you have seen it from the outside. A large beutiful Mosque - its still in use so you need to consider the peak times to avoid the worshippers.
a must see, but be carefull with the long lines. check with your hote or tour operator de best time to visit to avoid to be in a line for more than 1 hour. I think friday is the worst day
