best mask in istanbul. ıt was fantastic ı lıke surronding voices.people pray there and we have watched it all day.In ıstanbul there ıs history

Beautiful Architecture and Décor. After visiting Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque, Suleymaniye Mosque seemed another wonder of Istanbul. Eastern courtyard of this mosque offers amazing views of Istanbul. The architecture and inside décor are magnificent – need to see in person to appreciate the beauty. Words or picture can only do limited justice.We visited this mosque early in the morning to beat the crowds and had a wonderful time walking around the complex – tombs and courtyards. This mosque is a little bit of a walk from public transport – you can take a cab if you are not comfortable walking. We chose to walk from Sirkeci and got the opportunity see many side streets and markets that we would have otherwise missed. There is a street with steps where porters carry load on their back even today – contributions celebrated with a statue at the street entrance. On our way back we walked past the University to Beyazit stop and took the tram back.

A must see. combine it with the aya sofya, the cistern and the topkapi palace and you will have a wonderful day :) there is no fees to enter the mosque , there is a big line if you enter it from the visitors entrance , but if you entered from the prayers entrance you would really enter quickly.

Don't miss it - combine with Hagia Sofia. An interesting experience to compare the 1000 year older Byzantine Hagia Sofia just opposite. It's slightly strange standing as a tourist observing people at worship, until you notice they are busy taking selfies too! When we went you could only stand at one side behind the roped off area, so it doesn't take long to see. Fabulous ceramic tiling.

Calm, beautiful and amazing architecture. Said to be 'better' than the Blue Mosque, both by the master architect Mimar Sinan in the 16th century (his tomb is nearby), though I would find it difficult to decide. They both have that huge, amazing open space under the large dome, seemingly almost floating yet the weight must be immense. The restored decoration's geometric design is, of course, beautifully done.This mosque benefits from its position, overlooking the Golden Horn and Bosphorus - good views from the outside - as well as having the (visitable) tombs of Suleiman the Magnificent and his wife 'Roxelana' in the cemetery at the side. It is also far quieter than the Blue Mosque, allowing a real appreciation of the building.The mosque is walkable from the Sultanahmet area, if a little far, but not far from the Grand Bazaar/ tram. There are a number of cafes and restaurants nearby (no alcohol near to mosques of course). Which leads to a small rant, like another reviewer: these are places of worship and there are rules about dressing modestly and acting respectfully. The authorities are very good about providing coverings (free) when they could easily just stop entry, but it's not difficult to dress correctly.... is it? No, I'm not a Muslim.It's also worth checking prayer times too, especially on Friday, to ensure it's not closed to visitors.It's free to enter, but a donation would be appreciated.
Historical Visit. No words can describe it. Basically you walk in time but hundred of years back. Excellent feeling . Try to be there during Prayer time when Azan is done

A Must. You must visit this Mosque. Covering clothes are available if needed but just make sure you are covered (women). easy to find and get to with eateries adjacent. eat something local Close to many other attractions
Must See. One of amazing historic places in Istanbul near from many good attractive area with nice and great building so clean and very crowded
Awesome Area. A visit to the Suleymaniye Mosque. It is very dramatic and awesome. It is within walking distance of the area known as the Hippodrome and the Hagia Sohpia .

Blue Mosque. Beautiful and quiet. You will certainly be amazed by the wonders of ancient architecture, design, and artwork. Lots of tourists so get there early. Women, make sure you have something to cover your head and legs. They do have wraps available if you forget to bring your own.
Don't just go inside, walk around the mosque too.. Just as beautiful as the Sultanahmet, as each has its own history. But avoid going early Monday morning, it may not be opened.

Impressive old mosque. Very busy yet impressive mosque.
Non workshippers have restricted access, outside the prayers area, which is totally understanable.
The building is impressive of size.

Magnificent !!!! Serene beautiful...... One of the most beautiful mosques I've been to ....it compares to Córdoba in Spain ...and the prophets mosque in medina ....years ago. Magnificent islamic architecture ....endless views ....vast spacious serene and the Qari sounds like an angel ....the ladies prayer section is not isolated so you feel part of the congregation. Beautiful landscaped grounds steeped in history ....no words can describe the light and nur this place emanates

Nice!. This mosque is the work of the famous Ottoman architect Mimar Sinan and was built on the order of Suleyman the Magnificient in 16th century. It is like most mosques from the inside. However, it has beautiful surroundings and is more calm and serene than the Blue Mosque due to less tourists. You can combine your visit to the mosque along with the Grand Bazaar and the Egyptian Spice Bazaar as it is nearby.

A masterpiece b ygreat architect Sinan. This is a beautiful mosque commissioned by Suleyman the Great. It was built in 1550-57 and Suleyman is buried here in a garden tomb.The views from the garden across the Golden Horn to the Galata tower are great

Breathtaking.. The sense of peace here, even with quite a few tourists there, was incredible. In addition the view from outside over the city is wonderful. There is something wonderful about the scale that rests so easily on the eye, whilst lifting the spirit. There again, this is true of all of the mosques I visited in Istanbul.I do wish people would pay attention to the signs and show respect for other people's religion. As the signs at the entrance say, the courtyard is just as important as the mosque itself. As such, you should cover your head if you are female as soon as you enter. You're not visiting a museum, you are visiting a place of worship. Everyone should wear appropriate clothes - it's not difficult.
Heard great things about it. I did not visit this mosque but my wife did and she said it was beautiful and not so filled with tourists.

Beautiful mosque with amazing view. Situated high up over Istanbul this spot affords great views of the water and skyline below. The mosque itself is beautiful and since it doesn't see as much traffic as the blue mosque there's more of a sense of tranquility here. Definitely worth checking out as a quiet break from the bazaar, just a 15 min walk from that area.

A Must See. Great architecture and history behind the mosque. It is also a place where one can hang out and take in the sights and culture of Istanbul. Unfortunately, I did not get to spend too much time there but definitely plan to visit again soon.

Magnificent example of Ottoman Architechture. I have visited this site many times in my life and each time I felt myself smaller and smaller with this huge example of architecture.
What I found very unfortunate this time was the odor hanging in the building due to foot-sweat. Men have to resolve this problem, before the number of visitors admiring this building reduce.

Amazing!. If you like to know culture and big places this is one of great places to visit. I really like it and would be better if the tourist stay a little bit quiet... Of course that there were line ans loads of tourists but it's ok. You should visit!

Nicer than Blue Mosque. Work of famous Ottoman architect Mimar Sinan was commissioned by Suleyman the Great in 16th century. It dominates the landmark of old city. Open, spacious building. Beautiful Iznik tiles decorate the prayer niche pointing out the direction of Mecca. In the garden behind the mosque is a terrace with beautiful views of Golden Horn.

Not bad for a converted Christian Church. The entire structure is a marvel of construction and a definite candidate for a wonder of the world. I was amazed to learn that the building was built by Christians and used as a Catholic church until the Muslims invaded and converted it to a mosque. In their efforts to dominate the world they too fell in love with the structure and used it as the definitive model for all mosques everywhere. A great sight to see but be reminded, Islam has rules and one must obey them when visiting.

Worth the effort to get there. It was tempting not to go here since I had already seen several. However, it was less crowded, had simpler decor and as well a local man had some literature he gave out and answered questions. The garden area and tombs of Suleymaniye and Roxelana were beautiful. The surrounding areas while walking also provide a chance to see more local life, have lunch, tea, or a drink in a bit more removed from tourist area.
A masterpiece!. The biggest mosque in the city! A wonderful camii, where are also located the tombs of Sultan Suleyman the Magnificent and his wife, Hurrem! Amazing view to the Golden Horn.
Amazing. Must visit, so amazing, I have visited 2 times, the mosque is very old, and the area is so amazing and old, old is gold :))))
'Masha Allah'. Mosque is located near to Grand bazar and walking distance to Blue Mosque. I was there for two times.
Beautiful Mosque. Beautiful mosque and surrounds with well appointed facilities. Easy access from Metro - beautiful walk as well
Interesting mosque. Beautiful architecture, interesting religious building. Definitely worth a visit if you're ever in Istanbul
Historical. Historical palace in the historical district within Istanbul City center. Beautiful architectural and caligraph

Eid Prayer in Süleymaniye Masjed . I planned to pray Eid AL Adha (Kurban) in Sultanahmet, however, since I was late I went to Süleymaniye. The mosque in heart of typical traditional Turkish area. The masjed is very clean and has fantastic architecture design and colors. If you like Islamic architecture, then don't miss it. TO reach it, either by metro Veznegilar station and you will see the mosque once you get out of the station, or Lalili station by Tram. You can plan to take Sultanahmet and Süleymaniye both in one visit.

The greatest. The most beautiful mosque in Istanbul, no doubt. From perfect architectural composition down to every tile and writing on the wall.The building is in perfect condition, and it is not as crowded as other more popular places. Must see.

Serene. After the short bosphorus cruise some1 advised me to go to this grand mosque...and grand it is...complex is bigger quieter n more serene then the blue mosque...was a mission and a half climbing the hills and thort id give up but eventually getting there made my day....spent until sunset in this calm atmosphere along with tourists...

An amazing place.... Suleymaniye Camii, a magnificient 16th century mosque built by order of none other than Suleyman the Magnificient, the greatest Ottoman ruler that saw the apogee of the empire. Strategically loclted on top of one of the biggest hills of Istanbul, there is a breath-taking view of this beautiful city and of the Golden horn from it and the mosque itself is one of the biggest and finest together with Sultanahmet Camii and Aya Sofia. A must see. Oh, and to reach it, get lost in the intricate maze of small lanes leading to the top of the hill, and you may get caught by the mesmerizing call to prayers, when everything seems to stop frozen...

An absolute must. One day f the major attractions in Istanbul. Worth going inside to take in the ceiling and tile work. But the best view is of course from outside and a little distance away to capture the entire structure

Walk from spice bazaar, beautiful view of Istanbul.. We walked here after visiting Chora Church and the aqueducts. It's impressive in size and beautiful, but nothing special compared to some of the other mosques in Istanbul. It's a quick walk from here to the spice bazaar and grand bazaar, if you wanted to add it on.

Mosque of Suleyaniye. I loved everything about Istanbul, but this holy site was, for me, a peaceful oasis in a bustling city. It did not have the large crowds, though I'm sure it was timing on my part. It was bright and comforting and welcoming. I went here twice just to sit. Some of the ferile cats of Istanbul claim this space as their own and they are quite lovely. I recommend it. The mosque is closed to the public during prayer time.

Take your time...find some peace and beauty. I mean, you of course have to visit here. It's really not optional. Note closing/prayer schedule carefully, as they understandably are pretty forceful and abrupt in terms of clearing people out...since it takes a while. You'll be given a plastic bag for your shoes. It will be mobbed, but I found I could find a quiet area and just enjoy staring at the tile work, dome and architecture. I had a guide, and so enjoyed 30 minutes of history, etc. But then found I wanted quiet time by myself...at least another 30-60 minutes...to just wander around, stare, and enjoy the amazing space. Don't rush through the courtyard and exit area, as that arcade is quite lovely. Let's face it, you aren't deciding whether to go based on a trip advisor review...of course you are going. I guess all I can tell you for here and Hagia Sofia is that you should not rush. Plan at least an hour or up to 2, and just take your time soaking it in.
History alive. It is the greatest architecture i have ever seen.I went near grand Bazar street and found the mosque on top of hill showing the Bosphorus and Galata tower.

A rival to the Blue Mosque as the must-see mosque in Istanbul. Despite the Blue Mosque being the main visitor attraction in Istanbul, this mosque is the biggest and best located. And there are no queues to enter it. It is perched up high with fantastic views and is beautiful inside. It is not far from the Grand Bazaar in the historic part of Istanbul so make sure you include this in your itinerary.

A peaceful place with a great view. I know that Blue Mosque is the most known mosque in Istanbul but, Suleymaniye is the one with the best view. It is up to the bosphorus. You can sit in its garden and see the bosphorus and golden horn from the top. It is just amazing. And do not forget to eat famous kidney beans from the old restaurant just next to the mosque.

Worth the queue. Worth the queue. We went during the public holidays so although most museums were closed, this probably made more people go to the open venues.Busy inside, but massively huge and of course the blue tiles! Don't forget to make a donation on exit. For those that forget, there are free shawls / sarongs to cover up shoulders and legs.

A great visit to Istanbul. Our tour guide took on us on 4 days of wonderful sighs and sounds of Istanbul and the Suleymaniye Mosque was amazing. It was beautiful and a incredible contrast to the Blue Mosque. very quiet and not heavily traveled by visitors. The surrounding buildings and the views were outstanding. Walk through the cemetery as well.

Beautiful Mosque. This is an amazing mosque, better than the Blue Moon and no lines either. I highly recommend a quick stop at this place if you really want to immerse yourself in the history and culture of Istanbul. Enjoy!
A valuable stop. The mosque is not as popular a stop as the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia, but I found it more pleasing.
Must Visit. One of the most commanding Sites on Istanbul. It is a master piece of Mimar Sinan Who is buried in the vecenety near His Master, Sulaiman Kanoni.

Feast for the eyes and food for the soul...... A must visit to marvel at Sinan's architecture (1550s), to learn about the history of the mosque during the reign of Suleyman - besides being a place of worship, the mosque provided food for over a 1,000 needy residents (Muslims, Jews and Christians) of Istanbul every day and to have a tranquil moment or two away from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. The mosque is unique - exquisite tile work, stained glass windows and the breathtaking dome and absolute tranquillity all leave one speechless......The views of the Golden Horn from the restful gardens are worth admiring too.A few tips:1) We took the tram to Beyazit (in the Grand Bazaar area) and approached the mosque via the University. The climb to the top is not steep. On arriving at the station, cross over towards the Grand Bazaar. You will see a line of cafes. Keep to the left and then climb the steps which lead to a kind of square in front of the University gates - through the gates, into the campus (pleasant park like space) and follow the path to the Sulemaniye mosque. You will enter the mosque where the cemetry is (worth a look). Between the campus and the mosque there are interesting university buildings.2) On the way back we went down the hill and then braved a visit of the Grand Bazaar!3) Bathroom facilities are state of the art - modern and very clean.4) This mosque is less crowded than the Blue Mosque. Staff are very helpful and polite and plastic bags are provided for shoes.5) Make sure to enjoy the views of the Golden Horn and to walk around the complex.6) There is a lovely cafe (with outdoor seating) in front of the mosque.

My favorite part was Roxelanas tomb. Roxelana is sort of my hero. She was a courtesan who wasnt particularly beautiful but very intelligent. Suleymaniye wrote the most amazingly touching poetry to her. Btw our guide said the ostrich eggs on the main chandelier are original and the theory was some chemical in them repels cobwebs. Wellllll, there certaintly arent any cobwebs ;) So who knows? ?
Nice Camii. Very good Camii Thé best i guess Wè love this place in Istanbul many Camii but this really Thé best...
Better than the Blue Mosque. I enjoyed visiting the Suleymaniye Mosque a lot more than the Blue Mosque because it is less crowded and doesn't smell like feet/BO.

Where beauty and peace come together. Just a short walk from Grand Bazaar, the Süleymaniye Mosque dominates the third hill of Constantinople. Its beauty is comparable to the Blue Mosque, and not crowded at all. Without the hordes of tourists, you can contemplate the details in peace and quiet. In the same complex, behind the main mosque, there are two mausoleums (türbe): the tomb of Suleiman I (Sultan of the Ottoman Empire from 1520 to 1566) who set siege to Vienna in 1529, and the tomb of his legal wife Hürrem Sultan (also known as Roxelana), who wield unprecedented political influence at that time. They also worth a visit.
wonderful visit. Beautiful views, beautiful place, worth to visit. Next a cemetery, not too many people. Really peaceful.

Great mosque . It's really amazing mosque with nice park. This place really inspire. You can see incredible view of Istanbul from the mosque territory . Here you can relax and spend a lot of time. Entry free . Came and enjoy))
Beautiful . Not to far from grand bazaar... amazing with tombs of sultans gone by....inside resembles blue mosque

Magnificent Ottoman Mosque that is worth a short walk.. The Suleymaniye Mosque is comparable if not larger than the Sultanahmet(Blue) Mosque or the Hagia Sophia and in immaculate condition. The only drawback is that it is not situated adjacent to the major tourist centers. This also means that it is not crowded with visitors and allows you to contemplate the building and its gardens.This mosque is on the brow of the hill overlooking the Golden Horn and the Galata Bridge. It is about a 10 minute walk downhill from the western edge of the Grand Bazaar. Its dome and 6 minarets are a prominent site on the skyline when viewed from the harbor.The style is understated to Western eyes with subtle stone colors and a lack of pictorial art. This is in keeping with the Prophet's injunction against human representation in order to bolster Islam's inclusiveness to all. The effect of the building is none the less powerful and beautiful. It is set in a lovely garden with a view of the harbor. The garden also contains a small cemetery with interesting toms. The entire complex was constructed 5-600 years ago as a mosque, school, and social center. The mosque is open to all visitors except during services. it is well worth a visit to see the beautiful architecture and the view.
Everyone must visit. Everyone has to visit and see this amazing incredible mosque. Everyone from different religious, nationality, thinking and etc

The most amazing place. If I could give six stars I would. Might not be everyone's top but I thought this place was superb and found the space very moving. Its huge, its light, the architecture is amazing with a mesmerising central dome and walls supporting it. To be honest its difficult to write down because it was so awe inspiring this place. I found it lighter and more interesting than the blue mosque but that's probably my taste. I would really recommend this place, its close to other attractions as well so fits in well with any itinerary.

A stunning example of a very well-preserved mosque. This very large mosque, unlike the very shabby Hagia Sophia, is beautifully maintained. The interior lighting, in particular, is a visual delight, and the paintwork is immaculate. Don't miss it.

Lovely mosque and very much still in use.. A lovely mosque, and grand in scale. It was not as ornate as the Blue Mosque, but a must see on its own. We enjoyed the mosaics and view from the second level as well.

Still incredible 40 years later. The only difficulty for me as a non-Muslim was not being able to get inside because it was Eid and there were large groups of tourists. Still, VERY beautiful and amazing architecture.I first came to this mosque in 1975 and it was a orgeous building then - esy to see the interiour etc because it was the older way without tourists...
The best camii. We were there with friends i guess this camii the best in istanbul we really like this place if you want can go there you will like it a lot...
must see. beautiful.....so glad I took the time to see it. well worth it. the carpet, walls and atmosphere to moving go see it for yourself

must see. This really was an experience, my first time visiting a mosque. The building is beautiful and imposing and the sounds of the call to prayer just beautiful. This may have been my favourite part of my trip. Just sitting quietly and people watching. Be careful to dress modestly and always be respectful whilst you are visiting. Cover your legs, shoulders and arms and bring a scarf to cover your hair (or you can borrow one there). I really think this is a must see when visiting Istanbul.

Headscarfs can be borrowed. . The Suleiman Mosque has a peace inspiring quality, once inside you feel restful and at ease. Headscarfs can be borrowed at the entrance for those ladies who forgot to bring one.

Stunning Mosque. I loved this place, it wasn't as crowded as the Blue Mosque and even though it was storming when we visited it, the interior patio was absolutely gorgeous. Inside the mosque... I could only say "wow".
Neutral. Considering the other mosques i have visited in countries around this region there is not much to view in this one but for those who are interested in historic places it may be interesting.

Largest mosque in Istanbul. This is the mosque that dominoes the skyline of Istanbul, but is not visited by as many tourists as it isn't easily accessible by bus. We walked up from the Galata bridge to the mosque. It was a difficult walk as its all uphill through winding streets and alleys. We got lost but we're fortunate to have locals point the way.The mosque is entered through a large courtyard. Here we removed shoes before entering the building. The tiling and stained glass windows were stunning.This is a sacred space so dress accordingly. Head coverings and robes are available but we'd recommend using your own.
turquois. One of the most astonishing mosque, where you understand why Tourquois is the name of this kind of light blue
Great mosque. Huge mosque with very beautiful decoration. Nice views ove Vosporus and surrounding area. It is near the Istanbul market for locals where you can find better prices than Grand Bazaar.

Amazing structure . Visited and offered prayers almost 5 to 6 times, amazing stunning structure and interior design.... No doubt Turkish kept it very well and the internal beauty will really memorise you.
Very easy approach, juat across the eminon terminal.

One of Istanbul's highlights. The Suleymaniye Mosque is one of the highlights of any visit to Istanbul. It is an architectural triumph: a majestic design and decorated with beautiful simplicity. Inside it is less crowded than the Blue Mosque. Outside the courtyard is stunning and the garden of trees and grass is lovely. From the terrace, there are stunning views of the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus. Highly recommended.

The best of the mosques. This is sinans masterpiece and is the most beautiful mosque i have seen in the entire world. Please go and experience the magnifecent design by this sculptor and consider the time period that it was built. This man was a genius and thank him for leaving such a mosque to visit in modern day.
Rise and Fall of the Magnificant. A must visit place for history lovers particularly those having interest in Ottoman Empire of Sultan Sulaiman. Spectacular, fascinating simply awesome.

Really worth a visit . I'd missed the Süleymaniye on a previous visit to Istanbul and was very glad to correct that mistake. The Süleymaniye is a lovely complex and a beautiful mosque from the exterior, however I was particularly overjoyed to find in the grounds the tombs of Suleiman the Magnificent, Hürrem Sultan and Mimar Sinan - for any student of particularly Ottoman history, this is an absolute must. The actual mausoleum part was closed but you can see in through the window to the coffins about a metre away which, seeing as you can't exactly climb in and shake hands with the Lawgiver himself, is about the same as able to go in. Inside the mosque is very nice and, as with all, has very helpful volunteers inside. The point of the mosque is that it's a lot more simple inside than, say, the Blue Mosque and that's fine, but is also why I felt it limited to a 4/5. An additional plus is the nice grounds and great views over the Bosphorus.
Historic Mosque with a view to match. This is a big and ornate Mosque that can be viewed by tourists and used for worship at the same time. The view from the garden was well worth a visit.
Magnificent. for its historical importance, but don't spend too much time here if you have just a short time in Istanbul.
Great views. An amazing mosque and more so the journey getting there if you go by foot and want to do more than just the "sites"

Amazing!!. If You want to get rest from the crowds, You sholud go there. Sulejman Mosque is situated on the hill, from which you have beautiful view on Bosphorus, Golden Horn, Galata Tower and bridge.
A must see. It's really worth going to. It's a bit of walk to get to it but well worth it. It's beautiful and breathtaking.

Not to be missed!. This superb monument deserves a special visit. The courtyard are marvelous. The whole ensemble, with its dependencies, is remarquable. Also, the neighbourhood offers several Ottoman houses still standing.

Amazing Place. A stunning mosque and complex - which I would personally rate as better than the Blue Mosque. The views of the Bosphorus are fabulous and the mosque itself has some fabulous guides who will answer all your questions about the mosque and islam - I learnt a lot.

you will be in awe of the sight of this beautiful place. beautiful and clean and serene a massive mosque not to be missed on a visit or stay in Istanbul. fully carpeted so remove shoes before entering as in any mosque, and women have to cover there arms and heads. headscarves are supplied at the entrance. a delight to see.

Masterpiece of ancient architecture . This mosque designed by Sinan is my favorite in Istanbul. The bright humongous building is impressive in every way. But please respect that it is not just a sight, but a religious place. You should cover your hair as a woman and men should not wear shorts (although you will still get in). Enjoy the peaceful atmosphere in and around the most beautiful mosque in Istanbul.
Blue spirit !. it is really different as western style building. you must see it and take a breath with its different unique atmospher ..

The Most Beautiful Building in Istanbul. Probably the most photographed mosque in all of Istabul, Suleymaniye's interior easily lives up to its reputation of being the most architecturally beautiful mosque in the entire city. Stationed throughout the mosque are several volunteers who will outline the history of the mosque, its architecture as well as explain the fundamental tenets of Islam to interested visitors.
Amazing. A beautiful mosque in sultanahmed, free, the second in size (first is Hagia Sophia). Dont miss as it is really nice.

Beautiful. Awesome architecture. Watch out for the schedule of the services, you have to leave . Women have to cover heads, and make sure to cover legs. Remove shoes before going in, they provide plastic bags for you to carry shoes.

Suleyman in all his Glory. Very impressive building built by my favorite Sultan, Suleyman the Magnificent. Maybe not as beautiful as the Blue Mosque, but quite nice all the same. Old Suleyman is actually buried right next door. Amazingly clean bathrooms here...I just had to mention that.

Beautiful mosque complex. Quieter than the Blue Mosque and even more elegant.You can get a goos appreciation of the way the mosque itself is at the heart of a complex of related buildings and open spaces. Wonderful views across the Golden Horn. On a more prosaic note we appreciated the super clean, smart and free loos! Be sure to stop for a drink in the very chilled tea garden in a sunken courtyard behind the mosque.

The Suleymaniye Mosque rules Istanbul. It is a must for the history minded person to visit this imperial looking and prominently positioned mosque. The simplicity of this enormous building complex and its gardens and surrounding buildings are breathtaking. The grand design of the most famous and talented of the imperial architects, Mimar Sinan pays proper tribute to its patron, Suleyman the Magnificent. The simple and clean lines, huge inner space, elegant wall ornaments and stained windows create a spiritual feeling not felt in other, more popular places.
What else? -free-. This Place is to die for. In a beautiful neighborhood on the other side of hagya Sophia there's the blue mosque. Beautiful, secret, all blue. Also this is for free.

It is a part of the history you shoul know about. I had a business trip to Istanbul in 2010. It was a business trip but I had some time to view some historical places. Suleymaniye Mosque it is amazing place to visit while you are in Istanbul. A lot of history, you feel like you have been moved centuries back while you are there. 10 of 10.

Nice view. Nice view but the interior was not as spectacular as the other mosques in the city. Free to enter, need to avoid prayer times, they hand out shawls if you need them and bags for your shoes.

Lovely, elegant mosque by Sinan. I loved the understated elegance, the lovely motifs, the chandelier and most importantly the symmetrical, clean lines of Sinan's architecture. Also the story of Suleyman and Roxalana is so romantic!

beautiful ceilings. this is a must see - there are no words to describe the beautiful ceilings we saw - i understand that this was converted into a mosque before it became a tourist attraction. loved it well worth a visit.

Quieter Mosque. The Suleymaniye Mosque is very similar in size and architecture to the Blue Mosque but its much quieter. So if you are looking to experience an impressive Mosque but side step the large crowds then give it a visit.
Amazing building full of history.. A must see, amazing architecture. Even better if your of the Islamic faith and actually pray in it. It is well maintained and organised.

Get away from the crowds!. If you want to get away from the hustle & bustle of The Blue Mosque - come visit here - exquisite! Its such a beautiful mosque to visit without all the crowds & queues of the more popular mosques closer to town. Its situated just up behind the Grand Bazaar, so you could visit both at once.

One of the biggest mosques. Lovely mosque and the biggest in Istanbul if I remember correctly. Head here in the evening, walk around, enjoy some breath-taking views and then head to one of the rooftop cafes nearby and enjoy some tea and shisha

Süleyman The Magnificent. The masterpiece of Ottoman architecture, designed by Mimar Sinan, stands above the Golden Horn. In the gardens is the tomb of Kanuni Sultan Süleyman the Magnificent and his wife Roxelana. Sinan's simple and plain tomb can also be seen as a testimony to the modesty of the greatest Ottoman architect
Ceilings.. Beautiful mosque. Like many places I visited scaffolding took away complete satisfaction but places must have work done to keep them safe.

The spirit of the mighty sultan. If you are a fan of Ottoman history, you must see this amazing mosque, build by great architecture Mimar Sinan! In the backyard are tombs of Sultan Suleyman, his wife Hurrem and their kids - you can really feel the spirit of Sultan the Magnificent. I recommend you to grab a camera and take a photo in front of mosque, where is great view of Bosphorus.
A msut see!. A must see! This was a former church converted into a mosque then opened to the public by the Government as a tourist attraction.
Tuckey must see. Istanbul is a trip of a life time , it is hard to take in how old everything is and they look after things very well

Impressive. I was impressed by the beauty of the mosque and its simplicity yet it has been the 1st and main mosque built under during the "Magnificent Century" of Suleyman Khan. The mausoleum of Sultan Suleyman as well as of Hurrem Sultan are also worth visiting.

worth the long line!. This mosque was a very interesting sight to see, large, and detailed. However, the staff there were so strict on how the women had to fully cover their bodies, even though this mosque is used for tourism now rather than praying.

Must see! Free access, avoid prayer times!. This is another must see in Istanbul. A beautiful site to marvel. You have to dress conservative, and bring a head scarf to cover your hair ladies. No flash on your camera but be prepared for some beautiful photos.

Beautiful, serene place. Beautiful, serene building and gardens, with some good views over Istanbul and the Bosphorus. It is much quieter than the main tourist spots in Sultanahmet, and well worth the visit - it's certainly not 'just another mosque'! We also had a delightfully leisurely lunch in the restaurant in the old kitchens, which has a lovely shady courtyard and fountain.

Beautiful Mosque. The Suleymaniye Mosque is awesome in its beauty and grandeur. When you look up you will be awestruck. You really must see all the mosques in Istanbul and the Suleymaniye Mosque is one of the most beautiful of them.

fascinating experience!. after watching the series for so long... finally i really got to see it!.. it was the high light of my trip!... the beautiful tiles iznik tiles all the work and detail that was put into this mosque is amazing..absolutley a must see!

One the places you must visit.. One of the most beautiful mosques in Istanbul.
The best time to visit is on a sunny day when the sun shines throught the fantastic mosaiques in the celing

Worth a visit however similar to the blue mosque. Worth a look, quite similar to the blue mosque, large and has excellent views of old Istanbul. Not far from the spice market and its free, best of all!

Enjoyable experience ! . The Blue Mosk needs to be on your list !
Awesome place you shouldn't miss !
Enjoyable and really sacerd and holy place . Breathtaking ♡
**Free Entrance**
Do not forget to dress modestly there.
Scarf needed for females and long pants for males.

Grandest Mosque. This was a great example of an over the top Mosque and personally I liked it much more than the "Blue Mosque". One consideration is that it is close to the Spice Market and the ferries so you can combine them for an efficient afternoon of walking and sightseeing.
Maybe worth a look for historys sake. This place is jaw dropping ! there has been a lot of time & money gone into the building, pity i'm not religous.

great mosques with very interesting architectural features!. in contrast to the other mosques - the architects here have used musical ratios to design and build the mosque - that way it feels alot more human then other large monuments. also the surrounding buildings were built at the same time (unique for a mosque)
Amazing views and stunning interior. The views of the sea and Karakoy were amazing from the garden of the mosque. The interior of the mosque are stunning. It's free to visit, avoid prayer times.
Besutiful. I loved this, there is a serenity about it, we went early and there were very few people about which was lovely

Highlight of the trip. While this was the least busy mosque, it was by far our favorite. This one is a little out of the way for some tourists (if you consider a 15 minute walk out of the way), but it is beautiful and very peaceful. The mosque itself was really beautiful and the grounds had the most breathtaking views of the city. We spent an entire afternoon walking in the grounds. The Grand bazaar is close by so you can definitely couple the two up.

must see. Stunning beautiful place, highly recommend visiting. The architecture is great to see you can go with shorts also but you will have to wear a cloth that they give you for free at the enterance
Amazing. Amazing place, beautiful experience. You have to see on your visit in Turkey!! But it is really crowded, especially at weekend.

A must visit place. This historical site is a must visit place for tourists .It is beautiful outside and inside too. We went in a local group tour so the guide was able to enlighten us and they are so well organized in dealing with the number of visitors daily.

Master Work or Great Sinan. master works of the Great Sinan and a must see in Istanbul. A beautiful building that takes the breath away inside and out. If you are an admirer of such architecture, then it is worth stopping, Easy walking distance if you don't might a short hill climb from the main historical area - but well worth it.

Beautiful view of city. On top of the hill so hard to get to it but well worth it. You can see it from far away, one of my favorites attractions in Istanbul. We visited around 11am in the morning and Mosque was empty no tourists buses at tis time. View of the city from the garden of Mosque was amazing, took lots of photos. Nice inside and out. Woman please bring a scarf for the head to cover your head, they will give you one at the entrance, but best to have your own for hygiene reasons. If I will be back to Istanbul, this place will get second visit.
Get a guide. If you are not with guided tour go to the top of the line and engage a guide. It;'s worth the money to get in ahead of the crowd.
A must see on any Istanbul visit. Amazing views across the Bosphorus and Old City. The mosque itself has beautiful architecture and lovely gardens.

Visiting the Blue Mosque. Although breathtaking beauty all over the walls, the smell was stinky and almost unbearable. During the summertime with hot temperatures it is hard to stand this place filled with tourists and people praying (men on one side, women on the other).
Beautiful Experience. Dress conservatively, and go enjoy this beautiful landmark. Absolutely stunning interior, with towering, decorated ceilings. Truly awe inspiring.

Just a beautiful building. Just beautiful , how clever was Sinan to design and build this for Suleyman.
It is worth pointing out that this Mosque is not as busy as the other famous Mosques in the city so you don't have the crowds to worry about

Amazing Experience. It was our first stop in Istanbul thanks to our friends suggestion who came Istanbul earlier than us. Location of the mosque is quite hard to find by walking but all locals are very helpful against you if you lost your way. It is one of must see place in Istanbul.
Interesting but crowded. Worth a visit but try to avoid visiting during the weekend. Make sure to wear socks ( you will need to take of shoes) and long pants.

Highlight of Istanbul. A must see while in Istanbul. You do not need long inside the Mosque but it will still take your breath away. Ladies they will provide you with modest layers for free of charge if you are not prepared so do not worry about carrying an extra layer if you are out all day and it will inconvenience you.

Amazing. This was one of my favourites. It's located on the highest part of istambul. There you have a park, with a lot of restaurants, and an amaxing view to the city on the gardens.On the inside the musk it's amazing. The biggest chandeliers i ever seen.You have to cover your legs, shoulders and hair if you are a women, and take of your shoes.Its free.

Built to impress. With Hagia Sophia just a few meters away the mosque was built to prove empires capability and to compete with Constantine masterpiece. The mosque is truly striking but Hagia Sophia is the original and must go there before going to the mosque in order to understand the mosque.

More beautiful than the Blue Mosque. Definitely worth a visit, beautiful interior, and lovely views from the gardens across to Galata tower. Very easy to reach if you are coming from the Grand Bazaar, Gate 11. If you come from Eminonu, there is a very steep hill to climb.
Suleymaniye mosque. I went seeking Peace and serenity found it even my baby was smiling all the time , a need to wear conservative clothing and cover your hair

beautiful building and nice views. you can enjoy really nice views over the whole city from park around this mosque. building itself is very impressive and beautiful, we visited it couple times while staying in Istanbul, I would say that this is my favourite mosque, it is not too overcrowded.

As beautiful as the other mosques...less crowded. Spectacular vantage points over the City and over to Galata from the Mosque's gardens. Inside, the mosque is as beautiful as the Blue Mosque, without the crush of visitors.
A rare gem. Suleymaniye is easily the most beautiful of all the mosques - the view from the terrace is wonderful

Huge interesting mosque. This is an enormous place, in a beautiful location with excellent views.
Very simple but peaceful interior, great stained glass too.
Remember this is a working mosque so avoid prayer times.
Beautiful!. What a building! Somehow it felt a bit like stepping back in history when entering the Mosque. Lovely!

Magnifiqué. The first thing that catches your breath here is the grand architecture! This mosque is gigantic! And the view from the mosque courtyard, facing the Bosphorous is outstanding! This mosque is not to be missed, certainly

The mosaics and light are wonderful. We spent a lot less time there than we thought. It is a beautiful building and gorgeous to look at but I lost a lot of the awe because it was so full and noisy. Would love to go back when its quiet

best mosque in Istanbul. beautiful and historic architecture at it best, this mosque is the best mosque in Istanbul, great location, and amazing sunset view, and access to lots of local roof top cafes serving amazing Turkish tea and overseeing the city
Airy beauty. Crowded at any time of year yet still absolutely worth a visit - a huge, peaceful place of worship with an airy beauty and wonderful tiles.
Beautiful . Simply beautiful. If you walk from Eminonou through street, maybe using help from Google Maps, it is walking distance. Shops outside also great and cheaper than Grand Bazar

Beautiful - be careful of fellow sightseers!. Very good although was suprised at how flippin rude some of the other visitors were I got nearly pushed over at one point. Was a very long queue to get in but well worth it - beautiful place.

Beautiful, breath taking, amazing. Me and my husband visited this mosque we went in the evening. The mosque is beautiful the architecture is amazing. This place is a must see its the biggest mosque in the area. I loved it. It really was breathtaking when i entered inside. To experience this feeling ud have to go and see it in person and its literally a 10 mins walk from the grand bazaar. Its amazing.
Large mosque, beautiful decorations. Beautiful inside decorations, can be busy but worth going in, remember to cover up, wear socks as you must take shoes off

Impressive but there are other more beautiful mosques. Istanbul has over 3000 mosques apparently and this is a fine building in its own right but like the Blue Mosque we thought that it was much less inspiring than several others, such as the one at Eyup or the one built for Rustem Pasa near the spice market

One of the great mosques in Istanbul. The Suleymaniye Mosque is one of the greatest mosques in Istanbul, at least one of the greatest we have visited. Very nice from an architectural point of view and certainly worthwhile a visit.

A must see in Istanbul.. Put on your best headscarf and take the time to visit this mosque. I can advise to come early in the morning as the waiting line will build up quite quickly. An impressive room and a must see in Istanbul. Scarves are available for rent before entry, but bring your own to enter in style ;-)

More Impressive than the Blue Mosque. We visited the Mosque on the first day of a religious holiday, but went in the morning between morning and mid-day prayer, so we were virtually alone in the massive, spiritually impressive structure. It is a place of stillness and great beauty, inspiring a sense of peace and well-being. Even when empty, it is easy to imagine the mosque filled with over 3,000 men prostate in prayer.The grounds around the mosque are beautifully maintained, and the garden area to the rear offers great views of the Bosporus.
Crowded but worth it...and it's free!. Dress appropriately. Men, long pants, long sleeves. Women, long pants or long skirt, cover for hair, shoulders and arms.Both, remember to wear socks that day!
very nice and quiet. The most beautiful mosque in Istambul. It was quiet and cameral since not many tourists have guts to go so high ;)

Forget the Blue Mosque. Seriously, don't bother with the massive queue.This mosque is just as pretty, if not more so. There is no wait to get in and the grounds contain some spectacular tombs as well a panoramic views across the city.Ditch the crowds, and try to spot the tiny kittens that live in the grounds!

prepare to be awed!. An inspiring and peaceful building. As non muslims, we were still made very welcome and all questions answered. All visitors are advised before entering and ladies given a scarf/veil to wear if not appropriately dressed. Shoes must be removed too. Beautiful and well worth a visit.

Dissapointing!. The one place I was really looking forward to seeing on my first visit to Istanbul was the Suleymaniye 'Blue' Mosque.This remained the case on walking along the impressive approach area to the Blue Mosque but once inside it did not live up to expectations. It certainly had the size but lacked the grandeur - and quite frankly - the level of maintenance/TLC/upkeep of other similar such attractions I have visited.That said, this is a purely personal view which should not stop others from visiting both the Blue Mosque (plus the many other nearby sites) and making up their own minds!

peaceful, uncrowded, awesome views of the Bosphorus from the garden.. this was my 7th visit to this mosque which I love to share whenever anyone visits me from Istanbul. It's a bit apart from the usual tourist attractions, located behind Istanbul University in the old town, on a hill overlooking the Golden Horn. It is a large mosque, beautiful in its own right and the tomb of Suleyman the magnificient and his wife are located on one side of the mosque. Both the tombs and the mosque are worth visiting and the garden will show you magnificent views. You can see Galata Tower across the Golden Horn. As an added bonus, it's a fine place to have lunch, because across from the mosque is a row of restaurants serving relatively cheap food, specializing in fasulye, the well-known bean dish of Turkey. I always go there on foot, usually starting from the Grand Bazaar and walking along the walls near Istanbul University, with the numerous small shops and the maze of Eminonu on one side. After the mosque, the other bonus is that you can navigate your way through the maze of shops and end up at the Spice Bazaar.
A cult site. Too long queuing... They give a head cover or a full cover depending how you are dressed. Inside, the mosquee is huge but without a guide it is not so much interesting.

Oasis. The mosque is not so central located so it takes you about 20-30 minutes by foot from Sultan Ahmet. During the walk there are other things to see so it's not that bad.Once I got there I was dazzled by the majestic architecture the mosque displays, I propose coming there in the afternoon - close to sunset, when you can witness the colours of the sky contrasting the domes and the minarets of the mosque. If it happens that you've got there in the time of prayer don't sweat it, just lay down in the green flowery gardens and enjoy this quiet oasis in the city centre, there are people enjoying in the sun the same as you are. Once you get inside you can see the very best of Islamic art and culture, even more so since the mosque isn't so popular with tourists. There are guides inside who can tell you a bit more about the place and it's history. They can also get you acquainted with Islam in a not so pushy manner. Take your time to really feel the grandness and energy of the interior.Once you're done with your visit don't forget to take photos and enjoy the view of the Bosphorus from the eastern side of the mosque.Hope you will enjoy your visit as much as I have!
Biggest mosque. magical City to explore with historical places. the biggest mosque in istanbul. one of the recommended place to visit.
Stunning. This is an awe inspiring creation a massive mosque which makes you take the time to ponder the interior is absolutely stunning plenty of photo oppotunities
blue!!!. beautiful mosque. very peaceful and crowded during certain prayer times. they provide shoe bags so you can carry your shoes with you to the inside

worth to see. This place bit up the hill. beautiful architect outside or inside. and it also has nice garden. must wear appropriate clothes to go in, same like to go to blue mosque. I went here in the morning so less people. But be careful with guy who wear traditional dress, who sell drink to you. He will ask you that drink and suggest taking pictures with him. He charged me 40Lira for 2 drink n 1 time photo with him, which is really expensive for that.
Beautiful calm. Very nice construction. You should visit this mosque when you're in Istanbul and enter inside. Visiting Istanbul mosques is free.
THE BEST . THE BEST camii in all of ıstanbul everyone should go there very great place THE BEST place... we Will be there again there...

Best view of Istanbul. If you walk to the near of Mosque, you can see amazing view of Istanbul here. It was one of the most attractive views of Istanbul. Mosque itself, mainly visited by local people. so there is no so much people like in Blue Mosque. Also. entrance is free.
A must see in Istanbul. A gorgeous mosque. The history of the mosque together with the beautiful tiles makes this a memorable site.
Beautiful. Loved the Mosque in and out stunning and a must for visitors to Istanbul , remember to take something to cover your head and shoulders to go inside

Most impressive active mosque. A bit of a trek up a hill to get there - which isn't bad unless it's during the summer. It's a very impressive building which also gives a good view of the bosphorus strait and Karaköy district.

Cultural landmark. Beautiful Blue mosque. The line was a bit long because of they were handing out appropriate attire for everyone. Scarves and skirts for women, long cloth over shorts for men. Inside was spectacular. The scale and blue tile mosaics were breathtaking.
Worth the climb!. Impressive and beautiful mosque that is well worth the uphil climb in the August heat! Antoher great example of the beautiful architecture of Mimar Sinan.

Beautiful mosque. Great place to visit especially with kids. Our daughter thought that being able to take off her shoes and enjoy the quiet lovely interior was a highlight of her day sightseeing. It is also lovely to view at night.

Suleymaniye Mosque - The Biggest Mosque In Istanbul. Suleymaniye Mosque or Sultanahmet Mosque - which one is the Blue Mosque?. As a first time visitor to Istanbul we may be confused by the names. Suleymaniye Mosque is named after the Sultan of the same name Sulaimaiye 1, built between 1550 - 1557. The Sultanahmet Mosque is actually the Blue Mosque, smaller than Sulaimaniye Mosque but more popular due to its location at Sultanahmet Square and the 21,000 izmit tiles adoring the pillars and ceiling.Sulaimaniye Mosque is located on top of a hill and that could one of the reasons why it is not as popular as the Blue Mosque as it is more difficult to climb uphill. This Mosque represents one of the finest structures ever built during the Ottoman Empire stretching from 1299-1923. It was built by non other than the most famous and greatest architect of the Ottoman era of all time, Sinan. The Mosque is considered Sultan Sulaiman and architect Sinan's master piece and rich in history. Both of them were known to have built hundreds of magnificient structures together.Unlike The Blue Mosque, The Sulaimaniye Mosque has less blue izmit tiles but there are blue stained glass windows all around. The location which is perched on top of a hill makes it the most imposing skyline of Istanbul of the Old City while Galata Tower represents the most imposing structure of the new city seen from the Old City. Some the good view of Istanbul could also be seen from the Mosque.Like The Blue Mosque, it is functional and operational Mosque used for daily prayers and Friday prayer. Occassionally, we will witness wedding ceremonies and photo shoot being taken inside the the Mosque to commemorate occassions of a lifetime memory. The position of Sulaimaniye Mosque as the biggest Mosque in Istanbul will soon end as the present Turkish Gornment is constructing a new Mosque on top of a hill on the Asian side which is much more bigger than the Sulaimaniye Mosque.The Sulaimaniye Mosque is located quite near to The Egyptian Bazaar or the Spice Bazaar and the Galata Bridge but it is advisable to take a taxi to go uphill to visit the Mosque. As a tourist in Istanbul, we must not missed the two most important Mosques, i.e the Sulaimaniye Mosque, being the biggest Mosque built during the reign of Sultan Sulaiman 1 and its reknown architect Sinan and the other Blue Mosque or its actual name The Sultanahmet Mosque, being the most popular Mosque built during the reign of Sultan Ahmet and architect student of Sinan, Mehmet Aga. In Istanbul Mosques are everywhere as there are about 3,000 Mosques altogether!.Saharudin & MariamVisited 30 August 2015Reporting: 03 September 2015

Suleymaniye Mosque. A must to see in Istanbul. Dedicated to Sultan Suleyman the Magnificient. Which all the construction costs was totally paid by Suleyman's personal income.A masterpiece of great architect Sinan (though he says that he built it during his master apprentice period). According to one story;the construction takes too long time and rumors about the laziness of architect Sinan reaches the Sultan's ear.With great anger he goes to the site and enters the semifinished building and sees Sinan with a pipe of a nargileh (Sisah) in his mouth sitting just under the dome.The Sultan yells at him and asks what he was doing. Sinan responds, " your highness there is no fire and tobacco on the nargileh, I'm just listening the acoustics".Another mith about Suleymaniye Mosque is;for the construction takes too long, a cest filled with gold and precious stones was donated from the Shah of Iran. Upon seeing this, Suleyman orders this content to be thrown into the concrete mixture to help strenghtening the walls.It is possibly a myth.After visiting Suleymaniye ask historic VEFA BOZACISI. It is a short walk away from the mosque. Visitors may take BOZA ( a fermented traditional drink) or SIRA (a fermented grape juice without alcohol) there and have a rest.Ice cream is good as well.Then you may walk horizontally to Grand Bazaar or down the hill to Eminonu.

An Incredible Site. A definite must see even if you only have a short time in the city. The Blue Mosque is a must do walk through. Notice the lovely tiles adorning the mosque. Also note - this attraction is free of charge! You will need to cover but no need to stress about dressing in layers - they provide what you need at the door if you are in a sleeveless top or shorts.

A mosque for today. I enjoyed the Suleymaniye Mosque more than Aya Sofia. It is a working mosque and you can visit free of charge outside of main prayer times. Visitors have access to one side and are cordoned off from the main body of the mosque which is in constant use, but you have great views of the whole of its impressive architecture. They also offer a free service of an English speaker who will explain the Islamic beliefs and practices. Make sure you are suitably dressed with arms and legs covered and a scarf to wear over your head - although if you don't come prepared the mosque will lend you a long gown and head-scarf for the duration of your visit. As the entrance is free, it's possible to give a small donation as you leave.

Most interesting mosque in town. Nicer and not too busy compared to the blue mosque. It worth a visit even if it is bit more far away.
Historic mosque on the banks of Bosphorus. Historic mosque set on the banks of Bosphorus. Serene beauty all around. Another archeological marvel from the Ottomans.

Best Historiocal Place. You will see a hundred of yours in front of your eyes , shown in a very organized and professional way , just amazing place to spend the day , u will need to purchase the both tickets ( Mosque and Haramlek ) to have the full image of this amazing place

Prefer this Mosque Over Blue Mosque. I recommend seeing this mosque early during the day (as we did) before it fills up with visitors. Looking back, I found Sulemaniye Mosque more impressive and moving than the better-known "Blue" Mosque.
Incredible. You must visit this incredible mosque. It is breathtaking and if possible go early or late to get an uninterrupted view.
A must. espectacular palace.It takes at least 2-3 hours to enjoy teh whole complex.You can buy a combined ticket to see other monuments and buildings.
Suleymaniye Mosque. I love this Mosque and I think it means a lot to Turkish people also.it is spiritual place you will feel it easily

Beautiful and peaceful mosque. I almost missed this place as I was unwell, but the rest of my family went and insisted that I should see it. I am so glad I did. It had a very peaceful atmosphere and the building itself was impressive, being another shining example of the famous Ottoman architect Sinan's work. It also looks fantastic from the distance, especially as the sun sets and the call to prayer sounds. The people in the area were also friendly and welcoming.

not like Aya sophia. me and my family admired this mosque , the interior part of the mosque which include the prayer hall and the mihrab is such an amazing part -recommended . its not so popular which make it not crowded so you can easily explore the place . at night the mosque has a great view

Calm atmosphere, worth the climb.. This mosque is beautiful on the inside and very impressive from the outside. It is much quieter than the Blue Mosque meaning that it is calm and pleasant and you don't have to queue to get in. There are good views of the city and a collection of cafes nearby. Just be warned, it is a VERY steep climb and probably not suitable for people with mobility difficulties. It's not an easy walk up to the mosque, especially in the August heat.

MOSQUE. A must see!!! This is an outstanding piece of architecture and the lighting and carpets is breathtaking. The effect is has on an individual is spiritual even if you are not a Muslim you can feel the presence of holiness.

One not to miss. To my mind the best of all the Mosques. It has wonderful gardens with a fantastic view, interesting tombs, anf the building itself is drop dead georgous inside and out. In my opinion the calm atmosphere the magnificent architecture and interesting decoration make it a much better option than queing up for the Blue Mosque.The sunken cafe is interesting and the resturants at the side will sell you a complete meal for under 10 TRY. If you want to go upmarket the Resturant next to the cafe is rather more expensive. Just down the road is a great Hamam - Turkish Bath just for couples or families. Nearby id the tomb of the great Architect Sinan but we couldnt see how to get in (if its possible at all)

Suleymaniye Mosque. We learned a lot visiting here. One of the most interesting facts was how those who had the means felt responsible for others and built mosques for them to use as well as to demonstrate their wealth. The villages were built around the mosque as the centre of peoples' lives.

beauty lies in simplicity. Simply decorated as it is yet one of the most beautiful ones. Sinan's masterpiece. Reflects the sultan's personality (as far as I read about him that he was a modest sultan and had a good taste). You can track some identical structural elements of Hagia Sophia.

Beautiful Mosque. We were advised by our hotel the Suleymaniye Masque would be worth a visit and we are glad that we went. It's not far out of your way if you are going to the Grand Bazzaar and it is a beautifley built Mosque. It is not as popular with tourists as the Blue Mosque which makes it a nicer experience.
Great place. My children were amazed by the size and I was amazed by the way they built it.Is it so huge and beautiful to see.
Grate time. It's a very wonderfull place if your in to Islamic culture you should go there we took lodes of pics and there are near bey restrunts.

Beautiful. One of the popular attraction of Istanbul and considered as one of the largest mosque in Istanbul. Great architect and great interiors and one of the must to visit location. Visiting inside is recommended for those who want to see all the detailing of mosque and associated history and culture. However the mosque looks so nice from the distance, specially in the evening/night with lights.

Exquisite.... The masque is huge...and gorgeous. But when I got there it was the time for prayers and I had to wear scarf to be able to get inside the masque...so I didnt get inside...I just sat in the yard outside the masque.

An absolute stand out. I loved this place! It was so serene after the madness of the chaos of the Blue Mosque and they had people there who were so friendly welcomgin people and offering to answer any questions. And then...there is the amazing building. So beautiful! By far one of my favourites in Turkey and just such a great experience to visit.

Not to be missed. This is a beautiful Mosque and is one of the beauties in Istanbul. Take your time to walk around women ust have heads and shoulders covered so take your scarf and no shoes are allowed in the Mosque so be prepared to put plastic covers on your feet.

Our Favorite. This is a beautiful mosque and so much more. In fact, we likeed it better than the Blue Mosque. Definitely make the time to come here.It is located on top of a hill where we felt our first cool breezes in Istanbul. Suleyman really picked a magnificent spot! The views from the top are fabulous. There are gardens, cemeteries here as well as the beautiful mosque. I saw volunteer interpreters here in the mosque for the first time answering questions that tourists had about the mosque, or services, or even religion. Worth the trip (and less crowded than the Blue Mosque)!
Great A place. Wè were there with my girlfriend really great mosque i guess this Thé best mosque in istanbul and ÍF you go evening its better and great views Wè go back again there soon...

So Glad we Went!. We had a couple hours free time. I had read that this Mosque was beautiful and was often overlooked. We were so glad we went. The grounds are beautiful and serene and the view of the city from there is magnificent. Very calm from the hustle and bustle outside the enclosure.

Beautiful Ottoman Masterpiece. Visited many buildings of Ottaman Empire in Istanbul, Turkey. It is located on third hill of Istanbul and is largest mosque of Istanbul. Build by King Suleyman the magnificent. The beautiful art pattern in maroon and gold colours complement each other.

Suleymaniye Mosque. Another amazing Mosque that any-one visiting Istanbul must visit.Free entry, need to take off shoes and women need to wear appropriate clothing with a scarf over your head.The shear size and majestic structure will leave you in awe.

Beautiful grounds and important historical sight.. The mosque is where the man (Mimar Sinan) responsible for the most stunning of Ottoman architecture is buried, so it's well worth seeing for that reason. Of course, Suleyman the Magnificent is also buried there. However, the most attractive thing about the mosque is its beautiful gardens that lead to a stunning view of the Istanbul skyline. Not to be missed.
beautiful Mosque. True Spirit is surrounding the place. Real place "must see" . Even you don`t have time you must visit this marvelous place

Excellent Mosque. We found this to be far less touristy than the Blue Mosque, and we were able to absorb the real atmosphere of a revered Mosque. Lovely views of the city and a great opportunity for fantastic photos, so the climb is well worth it.

Magnificent Mosque. This is the pick of the mosques in Istanbul. It is magnificently situated on the top of one of Istanbul's 7 hills, is austere but stylish both inside and out. From a westerners perspective some of the mosques could be considered a touch garish or glitzy in terms of internal decoration but not this which is Sinan's masterpiece. Don't miss it.
Most impressive mosque. By far the most impressive mosque in Istanbul, which passionated guides, waiting for your questions. A place for contemplation, which only a few tourists.

Nice place to visit and reflect on Suleymaniye. Not so many tourists, so its a lovely place to visit for a quieter time and the lovely trees and views. The mosque itself and tombs are worth spending time in. If you fancy a little reflection time, this could be it. I came before the call to prayer, as i like to hear it. I sat in the grounds, and did not enter the mosque until about 40 minutes later. They provide coverings should you not be dressed appropriately, so you can relax and enjoy the experience.
Veery nice. Mosque is beautiful, however if you are not Muslim its just another nice building.Has a great garden and is open for everyone to visit
off the beaten track. The triumph of Architect Sinan's career, and with good reason. Less "touristy" than Sultanahmet Mosque, great view of the Bosphorous from the North Side.

Must visit place. Don't miss it. Must visit place. Don't miss it. Such a great place to be around. Takes about 1 hour. Across from the Topkapi Palace. These are the two spots to visit if you have a 9 hr layover in Istanbul

inredible. don„t miss this place if you visit Istanbul. The entrance is free and you will let your shoes at the entrance, but it is worst it. it is a great architecture, just beautiful, it is impressive how they have dome this construction so many years ago. full of history and culture and spirituality.

Definitely a MUST for all travelers to Istanbul--along with Hagia Sophia!. We were there in the early afternoon because we took the tram to Topkapi, stupidly thinking that it would be the great old castle of the sultans. Of course, we had to go on a long line (but not as long at all compared with the ones at the St. Peters, in the Vatican City!!) in the very hot sun! But it was bearable. After all this, we found ourselves in one of the most sacred and serene places in the Muslim world.
Beautiful - a must visit. Simply beautiful and very welcoming to all - a must visit. Great architectural features and amazing to witness prayers there.

It's a beautiful building for sure. It's nice to look at, but the clothing restrictions during non prayer times a little ridiculous, especially for women. It is beautiful inside, but best to go early in the summer as it does get hot and there is no cooling.

Spectacular Artistry. Please when in Istanbul visit this mosque. In my opinion the artistry and architecture of this mosque supercedes that of the Blue mosque. A walk through the gardens brings you to the courtyard of the mosque where the ablution fountain is. On entry you will gasp at the magnificence of this complex designed and built by the master Mimar Sinan. Columns, arches, windows and the spectacular high dome beautfully decorated with arabic calligraphy leaves you breathless. make sure to go to the upper level for a view from the top. A definite masterpiece. When leaving you be lucky to encounter the traditionally dressed Ottman fruit juice sellers. make sure to take some pictures of yourself with them. on exit opposite the mosque is the humble tomb the the great master Mimar Sinan. The gate may be locked but nevertheless you can pay homage to this great builder.

A Grand Mosque. A friend of mine was given a copy of the Koran written in English by some very nice Muslims in the Mosque. We skipped the Blue Mosque, but from what I understand, this one smells much better than its famous cousin across town!

Our favorite mosque. We came here after seeing all the other main sites (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, etc) and were blown away. It was so beautiful!!! The view is also incredible. Additionally, since it is not in Sultanahmet Square the visiting process was much more peaceful and relaxed. There were far less people. Would take a visit here over the Blue Mosque if I had to pick.
Artistic beauty and thousands of years of history. so incredibly beautiful, with the sacred geometric designs and thousands of years of history in this incredible mosque, truly exquisite
historical and evocative.. Suleymaniye Mosque is another must see destination in visiting Istanbul. Excellent location with views out over the Golden Horn - an historic and evocative site.
Magnificent mosque. Striking colours, soaring hemispheric domes, detailed decoration - this is another fine example in Istanbul of a great mosque - well worth a visit

Bigger than the Blue Mosque. Some refer to Süleymaniye Mosque as the orange mosque for obvious reasons. After visiting the Blue Mosque it’s hard to believe there is one even larger but here we are. The prayer area is decorated with an incredible orange print Turkish rug.The mosque is too large to photograph from the grounds. If in Istanbul, you must see both mosques and the Hagia Sophia
Gorgeous Suleymsniye Musjid. In this gorgeous masjid with its great kocation at the top of a hill you are going to see all Istanbul from above and the Bisphorus bridge .

Masterpiece. I visited a lot of mosques in Istanbul. Some people say that all of them are the same. I don't agree. Each carries its own story and it's really worth of visit. In my opinion, Suleymaniye is the greatest of the greatest in Istanbul. Stay there for a while and you will feel amazing peace and tranquility. Don't miss this Sinan's masterpiece.
Classic ottoman mosque. This mosque as other ottoman building have almost the same design with colourful paints inside and well finished yards with beautiful looking at golden horn worth to visit.

Even more beautiful than Blue mosque, but be aware for scammers. We went to this Mosque today and I was impressed. The garden offers really good view on the other European side of Istanbul. The architecture is marvelous. I want to warn you that there were two guys who were dressed in traditional Turkish apparel (one was wearing their giant tea dispenser) at one entrance (outside of the Mosque). They offered to take photo with us and while taking photo, the guy poured us drinks - we didn't ask for them, we didn't want them. I asked how much they were and in response they had started explaining in broken English that it is actually contribution for Mosque community? or something like that (but now I am certain that was a lie). So we figured, lets not offend them, it would be like 2-3 TL per peson or something like that anyway... NOOOO not even in ballpark. We finish our drinks...THEY WANT 14 TL FOR TWO SMALL DRINKS. We were shocked. Then they lowered price to 10 lira, we payed and left. So be careful not to get scammed.
Nice experience!. It is a very nice opportunity for a non-muslim to visit a mosque. On site, they offer the clothing items that you need for your visit, like handkerchief. Worth the visit!
Visit after the Blue Mosque. More prayerful than Blue Mosque, which has a more "touristy" feel. You need to take your shoes off before entering (plastic bags are provided). Impressive architecture.

Favourite mosque in Istanbul. A small hike is involved to get to this Mosque but the beauty of this Mosque is definitely worth the trek. It is significantly less busy than the Blue Mosque but in my opinion much more beautiful and worth visiting. The views you are able to see from this location is definitely a plus.The green grassy area surrounding this mosques is also a great place to relax and take a break from this bustling city. It doesn't take a long to visit this place so don't miss this!

Beautiful inside and out. Along with Hagia Sophia this is a must see (making it one of two amazing sights that are a short walk from one another). Stunning inside. Stunning out and helps make up Istanbul's beautiful skyline. Women must cover up. This was free when we went and they lent the ladies clothes to cover up. Where as you had to pay to get into Hagia Sophia
Beautiful Blue Mosque. The Blue Mosque is incredible. The entry is free but the queues are long. It is closed on Friday mornings and during prayer times. We went around 2pm

Pure beauty !. That mosque is something that I cant even describeIts breathtaking, charming.. you just fall in love with it once you see it.It saw so many kings and atashas ..each centimeter has so much to tell you.. Its located in old Istanbul where you can drink traditional tea with pakhalva and enjoy an amazing view.No doubts you have to visit it!

Stunning. This huge mosque is absolutely stunning. The main vault is covered in blue mosaic and the feeling and atmosphere of this place is absolutely worth a visit.Entrance is free, lines are fast, and the staff lends you proper attire for free.

Amazinf. very historical place
it is an unforgettable visit to the mosque
i like the architect and it was not very crowded in the morning
Unique. An amazing mosque - very different from the others you may or may not see. Its massive. This is a place of worship in Istanbul that must be visited.

Beautiful art work on walls and ceiling. Before I tell you about the mosque i should inform that one one must have their head,shoulders and knees covered in loosely fitted closed. Although the mosque does provide you with sarongs I would consider carrying my own for hygiene purposes. The mosque is not very big but the art work on the walls n ceiling is beautiful. I loved sitting inside for a while,its very quiet and beautiful.
Mosque Visit. Must see in Istanbul to learn more about their culture and experience the hospitality Istanbul has to offer

Stunning landmark. This was recommended to me by my hotel as preferable to the Blue Mosque in being both beautiful and not as crowded as the alternative. The Mosque is a bit hard to find from the tram stop but worth the search and walk -- it is truly beautiful and peaceful inside, with spectacular tiles and decorations, while the views from the rear garden over Istanbul and the golden horn are spectacular. Also, don't miss the graveyard and mausoleum which are beautifully presented.
The best. If you go to one place in Istanbul this must be it. The architecture the serenity are stunning. Not our first visit and it will not be our last
Offer. I offer you see this place in your extra time of your trip ( when you do nothing to do ).All of the Turkish mosquitoes are same .

3rd nicest mosque in Istanbul. As we heard, this is the 3rd nicest mosque in Istanbul. It´s situated on the hill and you will have amazing view on the whole city. It´s good to know times, when the mosque is open only for prayers (5 times a day).
Must go. Great and holy place to visit. You can pay at the auto selling machines and avoid queues. The price is the same as buying at the offices.

what an amazing place. I think it's the most beautiful mosque that I've seen in Istanbul. It's huge and one of the best-known sights of the city. It has six minarets which means that was endowed by a Sultan. The dome is over 50 metres high and almost square 57x58 metres. It is very spacious.But the most I liked subtle reddish interior. You can feel warmth of that place. White mihrab makes an impression too. Next to the building are located mausoleums. There are tombs of Sultan Suleiman I and his family next to the mosque. It's a "must-be" point when you are visiting Istanbul.
Gorgeously Peaceful Mosque. This mosque rivals the Blue Mosque! It is not as well known yet the beauty is breathtaking. So glad our concierge suggested seeing this unique wonder.

Appropriate attire must be worn before entering the Blue Mosque. Before entering the Blue Mosque, all women must cover their legs, shoulders and head. If you do not know this before you arrive, don't panic, the Mosque provides all the ladies with clean appropriate clothing so you can admire the beautiful interiors of this amazing feat of architecture, inside and out.

To me, better than the Blue Mosque.... An extremely beautiful and peaceful mosque. There is more than the mosque to see, such as tombs and the grounds around the mosque. This was one of my favorite sites in Istanbul.

Quiter than the Blue Mosque with great views. We devised a walk up to the Suleymaniye Mosque from Eminonu docks, passing through some of the older districts of Istanbul. In my opinion, this is a more impressive mosque than the Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet plus it is much quiter, less touristy and has great views over the Golden Horn towards Galata.It is easily walkable from either Sultanahmet, Eminonu or take the tram to Beyazit and walk through the park. The grounds of the mosque are quite extensive and you are also able to visit the tombs of the Suleymaniye family/dynasty within the graveyard, which is also very interesting.

Gorgeous . A functioning mosque it's just amazing how it's also a tourist attraction. One side of the mosque is simply a tourist site where you can be amazed with the architecture.
