It was rather wide a place. Beautiful indeed. Visitors had to queue to get into the functioning mosque where you can borrow the necessary clothings to be in compliant with the mosque's rules. There was no entrance fee payable. Just before you enter the mosque, there is an area where you can take off your shoes and put them in the plastic bag freely available there. Whilst in the mosque, visitors are expected to be respectful and not to make noise as people may be praying. I found the mosque to be beautiful indeed.
BREATHTAKING. Stunning mosque with incredible intricate design. The mosque was so peaceful and magical - a wonderful experience!
Breathtaking. A breathtaking mosque that will leave you stunned, The artwork, architecture and beauty of the place is amazing,

Pleasant architecture. The mosque is an awesome architectural edifice even if you're of another faith. And people of so many different faiths you will see there. One of Istanbul's better mosques and a definite recommended stop if you are touring that fabulous mystical city that is full of such friendly people as you will ever meet.
a must see. a must see in Istanbul... a monstrous structure with great architectural aspects. beautiful tiles and detail on the walls inside.

worth the trek!. we were debating about visiting it but we are glad we did. its outshines all mosques in turkey. walk from the egyptian bazar, its hardly 10 mins you will maze your up through tiny streets with interesting shops and cafes. on way back we detoured a little on the tiny streets and found wonderful wholesale shops selling trinkets you are likely to pay a fortune for in grand bazar or tourist spots.
A place of peace. Yet another mosque? Yes, but each one is very special in its own way. Well worth a visit even if just to enjoy the calm and impressive interior.
Spectacular!. Beautiful blend of Islamic and and Byzantine architecture with amazing details. Proper attire is required to visit here as with all mosques. Must see landmark in Istanbul.

Sulemans the Magnificent outstanding mosque and tomb.. A beautiful mosque and tomb of Sulyiman and his wife Uureem 'Roxelana' that can't be missed. Designed by Mina Sinan. His humble tomb is on a street corner near by.
Beautiful grounds and views over istanbul.
Impressive building, great views of the city. The mosque is huge. It's situated on top of a hill so it provides lovely views of the city. A nice place to spend some time away from the crowds.

Astonishing!!. Hi guys, I have visited this mosque during the NY holidays with my friends. We went there before our Gran Bazar Tour and unfortunately the mosque was closed when we arrived. Anyway we have visited all the surrounding area and I found it very very beautiful. At the back of the building there is a fantastic terrace where you can see all Istanbul above your feet. I strongly recommend it for an Istanbul experience. Cheers and have fun guys!!
Ancient mosques. Its worth visiting this place you can not visit Istanbul with out visiting Suleymaniye,near by there are few restaurants and cafes, you can treat yourself with a Turkish hammam .

Welcome to the Great Mosque. Calm and magnificient mosque. Wonderful to join the worshipper.Non Muslim are all welcome to visit it as there are free robes for visitors. Shoes can also be carried in plastic bags which are available for free at the entrance of the Mosque.
Booooring. Just boring, the mosk is quite impressive from the outside but inside there is NOTHING to see. If you compare to curches mosks are simply boring....

Beautiful. I reached Suleiman’s mosque around 1:30 in early July, when calls for prayers were loud and clear. It was closed to tourists from 12-2:30. I entered through another door. I sat in the courtyard. While adults prayed inside, a group of lovely small girls played outside under the supervision of several women. Sunshine and breeze cancelled each other out. After the service was over, countless people came out. The mosque is on the top of a hill, and the view of the city skyline and Golden Horn and Bosporus is breathtaking. I finally visited the tomb of the Suleiman the Magnificent. His coffin was covered in green materials and surrounded by those of his relatives. Since he was one of the most famous sultans, I wondered why he shared the rather limited space.

They will lend you a long dress. Don't worry about covering up before as they will lend you clothes to wear and cover your head (head only for ladies), not as impressive as expected but lovely all the same. Free. Only open at certain times for tourists, check before visiting what hours of the day it is.

Suleymaniye Mosque. The architecture is really something to admire. The colours are beautiful. Don't give money to beggars when you exit - I made this mistake and I got attacked by the entire group where they forced my hand open so I would drop the coins. Quite scary experience. I gave money when I visited other mosques and there was no trouble at all, only here. It's hard not to give when children look hungry. There are a lot of Syrian children in Istanbul selling tissue papers or prayer beads, I bought stuff from them as a way of helping them. Please do the same if you can.
Suleymaniye Mosque. This is a beautiful Mosque up near the Grand Bazzar and the University of Istanbul. Full or history and excellent view of the river too! Don't miss this Mosque.

The one mosque of the bunch you should definitely visit. Istanbul is full of mosques so it may be a little overwhelming to pick one to go. For me, Suleymaniye stood out (with the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque following closely), but it was a clear winner because of the surrounding terrace, city views and the courtyard. The other two mosques were overrun by tourists, but the Sulemaniye Mosque had space and air.

Gorgeous. Marvellous place to see. Would highly recommend making a beeline here on your arrival to Istanbul. Never mind Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque - this is the most awe-inspiring place we visited here by far.
A "must do"..... Really spectacular piece of Islamic culture. Very welcoming and worth the wait in line. The mosaics are stunning.

Best Mosque to visit. Loved this Mosque. Less visitors… but beautiful by all accounts. Spend half a day here learning about the history behind it, and also talking to the volunteers about any questions you might have.

Sulaymaniyah Mosque. Peacefui and beautıfui ti ıs a wonderfui example of Seljuk architecture. I feel like I went back in time. One needs to see it for himself to really understand its grandeur. I enjoyed the environment there.
beautiful. very impressive and beautiful active place of worship. was very interesting to see everything and experience it all

The Beautiful Mosque. This mosque was truly beautiful. The carpet and chandeliers, the architecture and artfully adorned walls all work to make this mosque beautiful to behold. There is a pungent smell of feet since shoe removal is a requirement for entrance. The carpet however retains its vibrance.

Very pretty, bu really crowded. This building was hugely impressive from the outside, especially. Also very pretty on the inside, however, very crowded. It is free, though! Just know that around call to prayer no tourists are allowed in the mosque, but then you are welcomed back in as soon as the faithful are finished praying.

Amazing place. We absolutely love this place. It is away from the Sultanahmet area where all the tourists go so it is very peaceful. The mosque is gorgeous. The tombs of Suleyman and Hurrem are behind the mosque, they are worth seeing. The view of the Golden Horn is unbelievable. This mosque is not as decorated as the Blue Mosque but the peace and quiet of the place are to die for. I enjoyed visiting this place and I would love to go back.

Excellent architecture. Before visiting this place, do a little research about the architect to make you better understand the excellent aspect of architecture of Suleymaniye Mosque, the attention to details is mind blowing.
a peace of art. it was as good as described in the reviews ,the architecture of the mosque was magnificent ,one of the best places that i have seen.

Simply beautiful. We were happy that our guide added the Suleymaniye Mosque Complex to our itinerary. He explained the brilliant, thoughtful architecture of Sinan and how it is quintessentially Muslim. Unlike Hagia Sofia, this beautiful building was built as a mosque. It isn't as ornate as the Blue Mosque, but has a great sense of serenity and airiness.Suleymaniye is the favorite mosque of several Muslim tour guides and now it's our family's favorite too. Fortunately, there weren't as many visitors there as the other big mosques in Istanbul so we were able to fully appreciate this masterpiece. It's a little more out of the way, but well worth the trip.

Short Visit. This was a beautiful mosque, but our visit was cut short by the noon prayer time. Beautiful grounds, interior is stunning, the view of the Golden Horn is hard to beat. Wish I had more to say, but then again I wish I had more time there.
The most beautiful mosques I've ever been to. The mosque is very beautiful inside out. Anyone interested in ancient history or architecture should definitely visit the Suleymaniye Mosque
Blue Mosque. This historical place of worship is a must see. But expect crowds. And please remember to dress appropriately.

Be careful of your wallet. It was very interesting to visit this mosque and quite the eye opener about the Muslim traditions. Very interesting. But be wary of people asking you to buy tour books outside the mosque. A gentlemen from our tour had his money taken right out of wallet as he tried to,purchase a book on Istanbul. Very disturbing.

A place filled with spirituality , heritage and architecture. A MUST VISIT. This is one of the best mosques in the world in terms of architecture and spirituality. Your Istanbul visit is not complete without visiting it.

The view from Sulemaniya is beautiful. Sulemaniya mosque was one of the first places we visited on out day trip our sightseeing tour.The view of the Bosphorus from there is amazing.The atmosphere inside the mosque is tranquil and beautiful.
Amazing. Amazing!!! Every bit of this amazing building every part of the architecture was fascinating, the script, the mosaic pattern, the dome what can i say. Made me feel humble and

An insight into cultural Istanbul!!!. AMAZINGGGG!!!! such a beautiful experience in Istanbul!!! This cultural experience of going into the mosque is an experience of a lifetime. The Suleymaniye Mosque is so beautiful that you must see it yourself to truly feel the atmosphere. You have to cover up to enter, both men and women but scarves are provided by staff. It is spiritual experience which is beautifully ornamented by intricate decor and stunning columns.
Nice. Only managed an exterior visit but from what we saw it was an amazing huge building With a great deal of history attached going back to the ages.

Amazing amazing amazing. A truly beautiful mosque which houses the tombs of Sultan Suleiman and Hurrem and others. If you have watched the drama Hurreem Sultan.then you know who I am talking about.The inside of the mosque is beautiful and the view of the city from here is truly breathtaking.
A must !!. Great block to see when your are in istanbul . less touristy then blue mosq. blue mosq is very busy and u have to wait in line for hours to get in .

Suleymaniye Mosque. The internal decoration of this mosque impressed more than the interior of the Blue Mosque. The warm color gamut of a painting of walls and Suleymaniye's dome is more sincere in comparison with coldness of the Blue Mosque.

My accidental visit to this lovely Mosque. On a recent visit to Turkey, I went looking for the Egyptian Spice market. On my way I came across this Mosque. Tourists appeared to be going inside so i also joined the queue. This is a beautiful building and is gloriously decorated inside. As it is an active Mosque, I was required to cover my head and shoulders and also remove my shoes. Being prepared I carried with me a large scarf to cover my head and shoulders plus a pair of socks. I was given a plastic bag to store my shoes. Inside I was
One of the most see in Istanbul.. With Its location,Süleymaniye is one of the most see Mosques in Istanbul. Try Süleymaniye Hamam next to it.

Very Nice!. This mosque is very beautiful and not very touristy at all, at least during my visit. The interior is wonderfully beautiful and the views from the surrounding grounds are wonderful as well. This is definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful mosque with a view to match. We walked all over Istanbul and enjoyed every moment. An easy 30 minute wallk from the center of Sultanahmet allows you to explore the neightbourhood and enjoy Istanbul rather than just the main tourist areas. This is the largest of the mosques in Istanbul and simply beautiful. Less crowded than the Sultan Ahmed Mosque( The Blue mosque) allows you to sit and soak in the history and say a prayer. The mosque is located on the third hill of Istanbul so from the back you get an amazing view of the Asian and European sides of Istanbul. Watch your timing as the mosque is closed during prayer times. In the garden behind the main mosque there are two mausoleums including the tombs of Sultan Suleiman I.

Bueautifull mosque. It is a very beautifull mosque,everyone who visit will enjoy here.Grate like the men for whom it is build for.I liked that the mosque is so quiet and peacefull,you can use camera inside,you must to take of shoes and to cover up your hair and shoulders,so I recomend(for women)to have a scarf with you.It was a grate visit for me and I recomend it.

Impressive. We visited after 3 PM, after the praier. The mosque is beatiful and impressive.Ladies, do have a big scarf you can put around your head, even if they give you one and a long skirt, if not they will give you some dresses to wear.Also, remember to have sox, you are not allowed to enter with shoes.

MUST SEE. The Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque get all the love but this mosque is the most under-rated site in the city. Beautiful inside with a more beautiful view overlooking the entire city. There are guides in the mosque that explain the history of the building and religion. I was thoroughly impressed with this mosque. You won't be disappointed.

The residential neighborhoods near Suleymaniye. So much has been written about this jewel of architecture that it's impossible to say something that has not been said already. The focus of this review is the residential neighborhoods to the immediate northeast of the mosque complex. As you leave the mosque from the grassy area facing the new city, you see a set of stairs leading down to the street. At this point, make an almost U-turn along Mimar Sinan Cad. and wander towards, but don't go into, the Cafe Haliç Seyi-Istanbul. (They have a great view but horribly overpriced menu). Along the way and as you make your way down toward the Golden Horn and Eminönü, you will pass through neighborhoods that detail the history of the last several hundred years. You'll see Ottoman houses still standing, some partially devastated by earthquake and fires, some rebuilt, newer structures of stucco with distinct European influence, and slipped in between, newish houses and businesses that have taken advantage of changes in building codes and commercial trends. You will need a detailed map for any of this to make sense but my advice is to get "lost" in some of the residential areas of the old city and "see" the history of the city played out in the variety of building styles and conditions.
so beauty. so beautyi reccomended you can pray in this locationbig musqu and clean and i hope see god on this location

Worth a visit. Beautiful mosque with a great view of both the Asian and European sides of Istanbul. It's a little off the beaten path, so it was less crowded. The dome is magnificent, but otherwise I found the Ayasofia and blue mosque's to be more impressive
A Marvel of Ottoman architecture.. Tip: Try to visit the mosque in the evening when the crowds had died down, also photography s allowed as long as flash isn't used.

Turkish Architect Sinan's Masterpiece (or so it is said...). Sinan was the chief architect of the empire for 50 years and the originator of classic Turkish architecture. I decided that I needed to see this mosque. It is a hard to find mosque on the highest hill in Istanbul. Even my iphone GPS couldn't help me. It is not "over the top" in design but regally simple and clean in design structure. The mosque courtyard is outstanding and a lovely place to sit and reflect on the beauty. Outside the mosque is an impressive cemetery and breathtaking views of the city/waterway. The streets surrounding the mosque are truly old Constantinople so I enjoyed the experience. FYI, this is not the touristy area of Istanbul.

Mosque Jewel. This is truly a must-see. A jewel of a lovely holy place. Serene and calm with fewer visitors and fine grounds for walking and contemplating. Mausoleums of Suleyman and Roxelana (incredibly influential chief consort of Suleyman's) are also worth seeing.
So beautiful. This is a really beautiful mosque. I'm not even Muslim and I had a great time here during Eid/Bayram. Wonderful spiritual and festive atmosphere and very welcoming helpful people.
biggest mosque in Istanbul. Very majestic building, huge and beautiful. Has an old cemetery next to the mosque, with the tomb of Suleiman the Magnificient.
Mosque of Suleymaniye the Magnificent was...magnificent!. The mosque itself is magnificent but the setting provides for wonderful vistas of the Bosphorus and the city, both European and Asian sides

It was free. There was definitely some hype about the Blue Mosque that may have led to the minor disappointment when we walked in after waiting in line for 30 minutes but it was still worth the wait (if only to check the box and connect the art history lessons). The interior is open and large but lacks the grandeur found in some of the cities other mosques. I'd recommend the New Mosque if you're only going to see one.

Nice to see but nothing new. Not a lot to do here, just go inside for a few moments to enjoy the architecture and atmosphere. Make note of opening hours and avoid prayer times since it will be closed to tourists. Worth the hike up the hill to walk around the neighborhood.
Second after Blue Mosuqe. after the blue Mosque this is THE MOsque, The location on top of the hill viewing the city makes it unique

Remarkable!. This mosque is worth a visit, such a remarkable sight! The architecture and details of the mosque are so beautiful, and just being inside is so calming. Be sure to be respectful and don't forget to turn off your cameras flash!

nice place, the view of istanbul from here is better!. we preferred the view from the courtyard than the mosque itself. the blue mosque is more impressive. there are volunteers inside who gave us literature on islam, which is not what we were looking for.
Beautiful. Beautiful mosque, definitely worth the trip. It's not a blow-you-mind-beyond-amazing mosque, but it's an eye opener for sure.
Calm and beautiful. Go early in the day or right at sunset. Take socks and a long scarf. Take a camera, but be respectful of your surroundings.
a very nice mosque to see. at least as nice as the famed Blue Mosque. Good visitor relations - people to welcome you and give some information about the mosque

Disappointing. I looked at the reviews on Trip Advisor to find something to do during my 6 hour layover in Istanbul. It looked like the blue mosque was a great choice. It was a 20 minute taxi ride from the airport and it cost me 50 TRY. Over the last several months, I have visited numerous places of worship (St. Stephen's Basilica & Matthias Church (Budapest), St. Paul’s Cathedral & West Minster Abbey (London), Jumeirah Mosque (Dubai) and Notre Dame (Paris). I have to say; the Suleymaniye Mosque wasn’t that great for me. Seeing it form the outside as you approach is stunning. Unfortunately, I was unable to get great exterior photos. It felt very touristy and less like a place of worship. Those who were their praying seemed to be on display. It wasn't as quiet as other places I’ve been. It just felt wrong to be in there. We were ushered through a line to get items to cover our heads, shoulders, and knees; we had to take our shoes off, so I was really expecting to find a peaceful and beautiful place of worship. That wasn't my experience at all. Don't get me wrong, it's nice inside and while the walls and ceilings are beautiful, there are these large iron chandeliers with the bright lights. I thought the lighting took away from the ambiance. It was just weird for me. I spent a total of about 10 minutes inside. ☹ Disappointing.
Don´t bother if you are not there between prayers. You have to be really at the exact time, which is difficult to know, otherwise you will never get inside!Beautifuland magnificient!

Peaceful, remarkable beauty. This place has unbelievable beauty. It is worth the short walk from the Hippodrome area. The crowds are far less than that of the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sofia. It is very peaceful, simple, and it feels really holy.
Suleymaniye Mosque. Suleyman the Great was the Turkish Sultan who died in Hungary when besieging Szigetvar - it was a consolation to see all that beauty and meet the art of Turkish Architect Sinan

Amazing. This is my favourite mosque in Istanbul. While not quite as grand as the Blue Mosque, its location and the surrounding area are just amazing. It is beautiful - much more refined than the Blue Mosque and stunning in its more minimal style. The location is amazing - it looks out from its hilltop location over a sea of domes towards the Golden Horn and the Bosphorous. Less touristy than the Blue Mosque as well. Well worth a visit.

Miracle Artwork of Architecture.... With the limited eqipment and technology this piece of architecture looks like a miracle artwork. So many little details and symetry of the design unbelievable. Must see.

a different trip to Istanbul. I have been to Istanbul many times and on many different occasions. I have been there with or without tour guides and until the summer of 2014 I thought I more or less knew the most important there is to know about this marvelous city….and then we met Ensar. I had some friends visiting from the US and Norway and I had promised to them to Istanbul. A friend of mine offered me a tour guide who had made a great impression on them. I was pretty lazy myself so I agreed and called the guy and made appointments…then we set off to what proved to be a lifetime experience for all of us. I rediscovered the city and found out that I had never actually known anything worth it about the place. Ensar took us to places off the beaten track, gave us so much extra and intercultural knowledge that we could never have got otherwise. With his zeal and dedication to what he is doing, Ensar made the 2 days round the landmarks of Istanbul feel like a few-hour’s trip. At the end we felt we wanted to know and see more and as much as possible. That is why we booked right away for this year and this time I am going back with a larger bunch of friends. Thank you, Ensar for your hospitality (making us feel at home at any of the places we went), for the nice and unique sense of humor and for your patience. We can’t wait to re-live this in a month and are looking forward for the itinerary you have prepared for us. R.S.
Really Worth Visiting. Great experience and wonderful architecture. Atmospheric. Access no problem as staff provide suitable attire if necessary.
The most incredible of Istambul!. It's the most amazing place in Istambul! It's hard to tell how incredible we felt being there. It's amazing.
Peaceful visit. Its where the locals go,nice one, it has a very peaceful feel to it.We sat there for a bit taking in to the environment.

One of the most beautiful mosques I have seen. This is the biggest mosque in Istanbul and well worth seeing. The architectural beauty inside and outside is mesmerizing. The peace that one finds just sitting inside the mosque, or while praying there, or sitting in the courtyard is something else. The views of istanbul from the edge of the garden of this mosque are unbelievable. We also had iftaar (breaking of the fast in Ramadan) right outside the mosque, where hundreds of tables are setup by the restaurants there, and that was quite an experience.
Worth a visit. Beautiful mosque, worth visiting.You can have a nice city view from the edge of the park where you can take amazing pictures if you have a good camera
Magnificent place. This place is magnificent, If you are wearing shorts or short skirts they will give you a long dress to wear in order to cover your body .

Better than Blue Mosque & Less Crowded. Bigger and better than the Blue Mosque with great views over the city. Appropriate dress is supplied to tourists for free at the door, so you don't have to hike around the city in long pants and long skirts.

My favorite spot in Istanbul. Sometimes it is not easy to find as it is off the main drag and a bit away from other tourist spots, but worth the challenge of getting there, either by climbing the hill or a quick walk from the tram. During the warm months the grounds are an excellent quiet spot to read, with plenty of shade. Pick up a Boza at Vefa and enjoy some quiet time away from the bustle of Istanbul.
Beautiful mosque in a beautiful setting. Thought Suleymaniye Mosque was much more beautiful than the Blue Mosque, was much less crowded and had amazing views over the city.

A breath taking monument. A MUST see by day and if possible night too . We were very lucky to be here during the month of Ramadan and all mosques were open to the public , Muslims and non Muslims alike . It's one of the most beautiful , if not the most beautiful , I've ever seen anywhere . Pictures can be taken without any problems and everyone is welcome , both men and women , properly dressed ( no shorts or summer tops ) It must be on top of the mosques worldwide , and I've seen lots of them . Can't be missed .

Magnificent with great views of the harbour. If you are not suffering from Mosque fatigue this mosque can be included when visiting the Grand Bazaar as its in the same general area. As well as the huge interior the forecourt offers wonderful views of the Istanbul harbour

Most stunning mosque in Istanbul. During my stay in Istanbul I visited a couple of mosques in the city. The Suleymaniye Mosque was the most impressive and beautiful active mosque of them all. Take your shoes off and take some minutes to sit down on huge carpet and watch the prayings.

Wonderful Mosque . Breathtaking architecture with a great history. One of the most peaceful mosques in Istanbul, with a wonderful view of the city. Make sure you have a tour guide during your visit. Have a cup of turkish coffee in one of the cafes near the Mosque.

Wonderful- if you've got the time!. This mosque is beautiful. It is much less crowded than the other mosques, and worth the trip. However, if you are strapped for time, then you can catch this place on your next visit. Also make sure to wear pants/skirt/dress that goes past the knees- they have a dress code here (as all the mosques do here).

Impressive. One of the most beautiful mosques in Istanbul for sure. You can go there from Sultanahmet mosque and visit Old Bazar too. The mosque is so big and it is beautiful outside and more beautiful inside. You can aslo have lunch there. In front of the mosque there is restaurant which serves "Quru Fasul". It incudes a plate of rice and a plate of spicy bean. It is very cheap (4 TL)

Beautiful mosque dating history. Historical area and the stalls selling handicrafts and artefacts good very good and cheap Turkish.Where the combination of the two faiths can be seen as a good and safe place for travelers

The best mosque to visit in Istanbul. Make sure that you head there earlier on in the day so you get to see the neighboring hamams, the compund and the tomb, its architecture, both interior and exterior, are quite a sight to behold, and its sheer size is awe-inspiring... the views from the terrace are not to be missed too!Don't forget to take pictures in the flower garden!

Majestic. Majestic mosque hard to believe they began construction in 1550. Very well maintained. Purchase a museum pass for 85 TKL this gives you access to all the major museums in Istanbul. The Hagia & Topaki Palace alone are 75TKL. The Mosques are free.
Perfect. For me that I saw Harim series, it was really special sense to visit Hurram Soltan's grave beside of this mosque and see how people respect her.
do not miss this!. beautiful mosque, the architecture and painted ceilings are special, as is the entire outside courtyard.
Majestic. My favorite, hands down. Loved the architecture and the grandeur of the site. The views across the Golden Horn are superb.
Don't miss it. One of the most amazing structures ever built - anywhere! Unbelievable it is still standing. Incredible dome.
Worth a visit!. I found this more beautiful then even the Blue Mosque! Not as much tile, but quieter and much more elegant. And not as crowded!

Excellent. Wasn't sure what to expect but got a pleasant surprise. A totally different atmosphere to the blue mosque. We were there first thing in the morning before the crowds so had the whole place to ourselves - 7 of us. The chandeliers are amazing.
better than the Blue Mosque. tranquil, amazing architecture and very few tourists....fantastic views of the city, serene. next to the University.

Amazing. One of the most impresive monuments in Istanbul.
The square is beautiful and you have a stunning view of Hagia Sofia.

Impressive.. A great experience but prefer the Mosque Sofia.
I am non Muslim and found the mosque too commercial for my understanding of the faith.
BEAUTIFUL DON'T MISS IT. Beautiful mosque, the outside is amazing. They provide robes outside of mosque if needed. I loved the outside area for taking pictures just gorgeous

My favourite mosque after Haram and Masjid al-Nabawi. No doubt this mosque is one of the masterpieces of Koca Mimar Sinan! everything about this mosque is beautiful, love the domes, the gardens, the whole surroundings and complex, even the madrasahs. We were given a full guide by the a member of the mosque authority during our study trip and he was very knowledgeable and helpful in explaining the khats, the architectural profile as well as the history of the mosque. no doubt this is a must visit place when you're in istanbul!

Quiet mosque worth a visit. A beautiful mosque that appears to have less tourists visit, which made it more appealing. Well worth the walk up the hill, but you get to return by walking down the hill. Free to enter. Ladies need to remember to dress correctly.

GRANDIOSE. I loved the fact that this mosque is not as well known as the others so we had it literally all for ourselves. Beautiful, impressive. It is the largest mosque in the city a real Ottoman Imperial one with 4 minarets and a huge dome.

Not to be missed . Amazing architecture and beautiful grounds. This mosque is a masterpiece of architecture. It is located on top of a hill in a quiet neighborhood. Many tourists don't bother to climb this hill, but I'm telling you, this was one of the most beautiful mosques I visited in Istanbul. Of course women have to cover themselves up in order to be allowed to enter the main building. There are some pieces of clothing provided. You should pick up a plastic bag (also provided) and you should put your shoes in that bag. Because no body is allowed to enter wearing shoes.You can visit Sultan Suleyman's thomb, too. It's in one of the small yards surrounding the main building. This mosque was built in his time and he asked for himself and his family to be buried there.Schedule the time of your visit. The best time is before noon, when the place is not too crowded.

Stay outside and enjoy the viw.. The interior of the large mosques are very similar, so after struggling with the lines at the blue mosque just focus on the exterior . . . which is lovely. And the views of the city are magnificent.

A whirlwind trip of historical delights. Speechless was the only thing that struck me as I walked in to this truly remarkable mosque. At every turn there is something else to study and wonder at. A must for Istanbul visitors.
a nice Mosque which isn't over crowded.. highly recommend this Mosque if you don't mind a bit extra climbing uphills. Beautiful and peaceful, and has a nice view over Istanbul.
beautiful mosque. this mosque is beautiful and in a wonderful location. definitely worth a visit. we liked this mosque very much.

Breathtaking view over the Bosphorus. We had escaped the Grand Bazaar, passed the University when we cam across the most beautiful mosque in the city. As you walked through the cemeteries covered in flowers, you arrived at the most astonishing view of the city.

Must see in Istanbul. An amazing place that is one of my must-sees each time I return to this great city. It's a wonder just trying to think how this was built over 1,000 years ago. Simply find time to go.

Great view of the city. It was free to enter after the prayers. Around the mosque are pillars that tell you a bit of history.
It has a great view of the city. Also there you can visit the tombs of Suleyman the Magnificent and his wife Hurem

architectur at its best. quite an incredible place to visit and made more magical by the way all religions mingled with no animosity.
The building itself is awe-inspiring and should not be missed
Another gem. This was my most favourite mosque in Turkey. Its vast space felt warm and welcoming, and attending prayers there was an experience I will always cherish.

A hidden gem not to be missed…. Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque are were all the tourists flock to, but this mosque is truly a hidden gem not to be missed. The views of the Bosphorus River and the city from outside are breathe taking as is the history, religion and architecture surrounding the Suleymaniye Mosque. The grounds and area are truly quiet, peaceful and extremely well taken care of. The mosque inside is just beautiful. A must see for anyone planning to visit Istanbul.
Great architecture. Stunning and peaceful. Just sit quietly in a corner and enjoy the space around you. Don't rush through it. Take your time to view the marvellous scripts on the walls.

Running away from tourists. The best option to visit in the Sultanahmet area. This mosque is within a short distance from the Grand Bazaar and it is very beautiful. Not many tourists visit it, which makes this place even more special.

Stunning Must See. Of the mosques we visited, this was my favorite. Built by Mimar Sinan (1490-1566), this was one of 90 mosques he designed one which was Hagia Sophia. This mosque is bright with light and feels so modern. The grounds around it are beautiful and cafes...some on rooftops nearby...allow you to enjoy the elegance of Sinan's artistry as well as breathtaking views of the city and the Bosphorous. A Hammam, is close by where made reservations for a Turkish bath,completing a wonderful morning and afternoon.

Built to overshadow Ayasofya - and it does. This is of course one place in Istanbul that one must see - and it deserves this. The mosque (a working mosque if you didn't know) was built to overshadow the Ayasofya and it does. It is huge. But the tiles in side make it just beyond description. Photographs will never do this justice. You must come. Wait in line it moves quickly.Although they would like everyone to come dressed appropriately for a Muslim holy place (you know women covered up) they have temporary coverings and plastic bags to put ones shoes in when going inside.
Great building. A nice bit of turkish culture and religion. A very interesting and fantastic building. Definately worth visiting during a stay in Istanbul.

Amazing. One of many Mosque to visit and experience. You may need to dress appropriately to be able to enter and visit this site. No shorts or bare flesh for woman. Fortunately you do get provided with a clothe to cover yourself if you have forgotten. A lot of History to appreciate and discover. The architecture and stories behind it made so fascinating. Not to be missed.
Suleymaniye Mosque. It's hard to pick a favorite mosque in Istanbul... all are beautiful in their own way. But the sense of community at this mosque, especially during Ramadan, was awesome.
Visit to mosque. Very well organised establishment taking care of all traveller requirement on the visit. Excellent sculpture and wall carving / painting. Wonderful indeed !
Suleymaniye Mosque. Awesome - but very crowded. Largest mosque in Istanbul but not the most beautiful ... visitors appeared tolerated rather than welcomed

Largest mosque in Istanbul, recently renovated. This is the most important mosque of Istanbul (for the Turks). It is larger and older than the Blue mosque. Since it was restored a couple of years ago, it is very bright and clean.

Don't miss this real gem. Tourists all go to the Blue Mosque, but this is a real gem - beautiful, calm, peaceful. It's not as busy so you can really enjoy walking round the place.It's in walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and the historic areas.Highly recommend a visit.
Simply Magnificent. There is a lot to appreciate here in terms of history, but take time to simply sit and absorb the magnificence of this spiritual and architectural marvel.

My first mosque visit and I was enthralled. The largeness of mosques and the clean enclosures. .the huge facades so impressed me..it being my first played a big role in making me feel great too..The walk around the enclosure..the lovely gardens and those tall arched gates through which we took great photosDo sit at a restaurant outside..any of them and enjoy an evening over flavored teas or Turkish coffee..
An architectural wonder. Words are not enough to describe the beauty of this mosque. The interiors and the architecture are breath taking.

Great place. They have done a lot of restoration work which makes the mosque look wonderful.Easy to walk round. Plenty to see in this area of Istanbul. The area has the Grande Bazaar and the spice market close by.

best mosque in Istanbul. Most of tourists go to the Blue mosque - it is almost impossible to find a time when there are not much people. Suleymaniye is somehow less popular. It's a beautiful and calm place with much less people around. Also it's situated on a hill and has a very nice view on Istanbul.

enchanting place,. Magnificent building, the environment is spacious and everything is very clean.It was the time of Ramadan and there was a lot of believers .I felt some dignity, although I do not know the customs .
Preserving the old. Not the largest or oldest (built around 1560), , it has the most stunning views of the city, lovely gardens, massive architecture, with huge interiors.

masmerazing place. when visiting such places you feel respect to these people how they try to keep their traditions and how important their religion is for them... as being an orthodox christian i was really impressed by the size and colors of the mosque decorations...the number of tourists was quite big, though you didn't feel it...it is quite popular among tourists; the entrance if free
Interesting mosque. It's well worth the time to wander around this interesting building - one of the must see places in Istanbul
the building of love. it was amazing to see what could love create. We heard that the building was dedicated to the beloved women.

THE BEST OF THE MOSQUES. To be honest the mosques began to look very similar after awhile..
This was most distinctive and impressive
WE DID NOT FIND LONG LINES AT ALL...NO WAIT.
Definitely worth a visit.

A wonderful attraction that was very well maintained. One of the greatest historic mosques in Istanbul. Its architure has followed the same traditional style of many other mosques in the area, but with a great view either from the self area, or opposite from the Bosphorus' golden horn bay. A wonderful attraction that was very well maintained.
Marvelous Architecture. The only reason you would want to go here is to admire the architectural marvels's. It wouldn't be a great fit in the 21st century, but this mosque is over 500 years old!

Worth a visit.. It was a fair walk up to the Mosque but you travel out of tourist Istanbul if you walk from the river side. It is larger than the Blue Mosque and in many ways more magnificent in its structure. It was the last of many Mosques we saw during the week we were in Turkey but I am glad we made that walk.

A Beautiful Building. A world famous building which is a fully functioning mosque and tourist attraction.Beautiful inside and very peaceful (if you block out the crowds of people standing near you behind the railing).The blue tiles on the interior walls (hence the name) are attractive.We joined a queue to enter that snaked across the front and down the side of the mosque but the queue moved quickly. There were seats to sit on to remove your shoes and lots of dispensers for bags so you could carry your shoes around.

Beautiful mosque. One of Sinan's best. Why do I have to say more than this. It was very good to visit. I have to write at least one hundred characters. At least one hundred characters at least one hundred characters.

Don't miss on your travel schedule. Long lines, crowded but worth the wait. If your schedule allows, get a tour of the Mosque. A lot of history and insightful fact are presented. Women must cover up and wraps are available at entrance free of charge.
Istanbul's Most Marvelous Mosque. Magnificent Mosque, seems less touristy than The Blue Mosque. The area around is also very beautiful.

Beautiful!. I preferred this over the Haga Sophia. The architecture and the surrounding design was exquisite! A true work of art. It was the most beautiful place I visited to during my trip to Istanbul. It's a short visit (visitors are restricted to an area) but worthwhile.The line outside looks long and intimidating, but it goes quite fast. We waited around 30 - 45 minutes during an afternoon. Please respect Islamic traditions: take off your shoes before entering and wear a headscarf. If you did not bring a scarf with you, you can borrow one in a booth towards the end of the line. I'm not sure if there is a fee though.

nice place to see. A long as I live in Iran I saw a lot of mosques but this mosque was different. really huge and firm structure with enormous and stunning luster.It wasn't crowdy and it was divided in tow area which in one of them just prayers were allowed to go and other people could see prayers from behind the paling.there was no entering fee and for going into the main building you need to loose your shoes and women should wear scarf.

Looks a lot better from the outside.. Great from the outside for sure, but not a great deal going on inside it must be said. Maybe because it is still an active Mosque, they have kept the visitor experience to a minimum, but I'm glad I went here solo and didn't bring my teenage children.

authentic.... the mosque and the district are not very far from Sultanahmet district which is the most touristic part of Istanbul..but still it is like 2 worlds apart...why?because you are really in a living neighborhood full of real Turkish people...working , studying , living...and a very important thing is that , there are no so called guides(!) here to offer you their free(!) services...after the visit of the mosque , pls go behind the mosque to get a very beautiful view of the old town, new town , Asia , Golden Horn and the Bosphorus...

Very different and interesting!. A must-see place in Istambul. PS: Although it's a very interesting place, many tourists doesn't respect the traditions and the culture. I was very upset about that.Cannot wear shoes or sneakers.
Very old and historic Mosque. This is very old and historic Mosque and just opposite to Hagia Sophia and in SultanAhmet District. Must visit there.
Great Mosque. Impressive architecture. Cannot imagine that how long the mosque been build with that huge building and area.

Large and beautiful. This is the largest mosque in Istanbul and with its location near the spice market and the ferries, it a very busy mosque. If you wish to enter, you may do so but must observe the Islam conventions of head covered, proper dress, no shoes and should be aware that it is a fully functioning mosque and act appropriately.
Lack of respect. Although I don't practice in this faith, I found the lack of respect from the visitors unsettling and took away from the beauty of the Mosque.

free entrance !. and just as jaw droppingly beautiful as the paid ones. ottoman heritage at it's best. the surrounding gardens are another delight. there is head covering scarves for women, and tourists are expected to dress decently.

Very nice. Nicer than Hagia Sophia! No queue, so a good option if you're only spending a couple days in the city. 15-30min inside is enough. Of course, if you're a woman bring a scarf and wear a long skirt or trousers.

Felt strange. Hmm.. I felt like.. it was not my place there.. everithing had order, it's a nice construction with superbe mosaics and imposant architecture. I could had studied those outside in photos.. I really hate to interrupt people in their prays

Wonderful mosque which is still in use for prayers.. Very nice mosque. Still in use (not just for tourists). Make sure you wear long trousers and a long shirt when you visit.
The ceiling of the mosque is amazing. If you have time, just sit inside for a few minutes and enjoy the ambiente.

Well worth a visit. Beautiful mosque opposite Hagia Sofia - looks very impressive from the outside. We visited around midday and only had to queue for about 5 mins to enter - all very straightforward. The visit itself took much less time than I thought - once you're in, there's only really one main area to view (allbeit a very beautiful area!). Men and women need to be covered - as you're queuing, you pass a booth where the ladies will check that you're suitably attired. If you're not, they will lend you a cloth to cover up with. My suggestion would be to view the Blue Mosque before going to Hagia Sophia - although we really liked it here, the Hagia really blew us us away so this felt a little underwhelming in comparison. I think had we come here first we may have felt differently.

Most beautiful mosque in Istanbul. There are bigger, green grounds to walk around and the views of Istanbul are amazing. There are less people here and it's more pleasant visiting the mosque without the crowds. No entrance fee and bags are provided for shoes as they have to be removed. I personally think this is more beautiful than the Blue Mosque. Definitely worth the visit.
Visit a Mosque. Worth a look to see a beautiful mosque, hassle free entry, generally no restrictions on where to walk.

Grand place with a great view. Although its a bit of a climb to reach the mosque, it was probably worth it. We weren't allowed to go inside the mosque but the courtyard is quite grand and there are lawns all around it so you can just sit and relax. Also, it provides a terrific view of the Bosphorus harbour, so do check that out

Largest mosque in Istanbul. This mosque is bigger than AS or the BM. It was designed by Sinan, the most famous architect in Ottoman Turkey, for Suleyman the Magnificent. Sinan designed several other mosques in Istanbul and his work influenced the Tah Mahal.
Another great place. Mosques in Instanbul gives you a great insight into the treasured history of this great city that spans 2 continents.

Mandatory Visit . Together with the Blue mosque this complex is one of the most significant mosques in the city. Also designed by Sinan, this mosque and the surrounding buildings were built by sultan suleyman the magnificent. He is also buried there together with his perfideous wife Hurem and members of his family. The mosque is magnificent, elegant and there are good views from the garden. It is a bit of a long walk from the center of the old city, but it will give you an opportunity to explore more. It's about 30 mins from the hippodrome. You won't need more than 30 to go though it. Enjoy!

Very peaceful and beautiful. I find the place around the mosque and the mosque itself, very peaceful. Probably it is slightly outside the main tourist area. I spend half a day around the area and an hour in the Mosque. I found very peace and silent here. I wish I could have gone there again.I would recommend to go here in the afternoon or in the evening just before the sunset. The view from the Mosque compound is great. The Mosque very clean and well maintained. A must see in Istanbul.

Beautiful and educational plus no crowds. We went with a guide who shared so much with us about the Turkish way and Islam. This mosque was designed by Sitan and has a rich history. The "space" is tranquil and spiritual I highly recommend this on your istanbult list of to dos

Absolutely fantastic. We were a bit disapointed after visiting Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace because half of the buildings were being refurbished, and we were pleasantly surprised and charmed by Suleymaniye Mosque. The park around is very beautitul, the building is splendid and we spent some time just hanging around and drinking tea. I kind of felt outside of the city, a haven of peace and quiet. Very nice!

perfect place especially when you know history. Try to relax first sitting at the garden and inspire the air. After that imagine that you are at those century when all those places were more active and only after that stand up and go to see inside. Good to know how to do salaat inside of the mosque.
Beautiful. Famous mosque in Istanbul. Serene, peaceful and atmospheric. Well worth a visit, but be aware of times of their prayer when access may be limited.

People available to ask questions to. I really like this mosque. It is not crowded and you have helpers who will sit down with you and talk to you/answer any questions that you lay have. Also the views from there are magnificent.
Breathtaking. It's so big, and clean... The architecture, everithing is too much! You'll find an amazing view of istambul from there.

Magnificent!. It is almost impossible to believe that this magnificent mosque was built more than 350 years ago.What kind of exact and powerful technology was used?!What level of art was inspired in the mind of engineer Sinan when he designed and oversaw the construction of this eternal monument?!If you happen to be in Istanbul, this mosque is a must see. Otherwise, without paying a visit, one will never be able to have a full grasp of how glorious the Ottoman Empire has been at its peak.

Beautiful place of worship inside and out. Beautiful mosque with lovely blue tiles which gives it the name of the blue mosque. Arms,heads of women need to be covered but scarves are provided.Take your own if you want to avoid a further queue or to avoid using other peoples.Shoes also have to be taken off
Y. Very nice but at the time it was part closed for renovation A lot of history to learn .you can see many tombs like Suleiman the Mafnific and his family .nice garden around the place
Most amazing mosque in Istanbul. It is not only a mosque but an historical complex with lots of other historical points. A must see for every history person.

Lovely. It's lovely, and not too difficult to walk to/from if you are around the Grand Bazaar. It's interesting both inside and out. On my visit it was much less crowded that the Blue Mosque, so that was a bonus. Still, you can only visit the small section at the back.

Relatively quiet compared to the Blue Mosque. The mosque is less than 10 minutes uphill walk from Laleli - Universite Tramstop. This is the largest mosque in Istanbul and it is slightly off the beaten track for most tourists. it is also about 15 minutes walk from the Spice Bazaar though I was unsuccessful in finding the way there when I attempted it,The prayer hall is very large and of course the decorations and tiles were very impressive. After putting your shoes in the provided plastic bags, please do not put the plastic bags on the carpets that are used for prayers as the guards do not allow it. This is one of my favorite mosques in Istanbul, the other being the baroque style Ortakoy Mosque.
Not to be missed. A huge mosque that belies belief that it could be built when it was. Walk there from the bazaar to make the visit more interesting.
Stately. Lovely gardens surround the mosque, and while it may not have the grandeur of the Blue Mosque, it certainly has its fair share of beautifully adorned walls and ceilings.

Beautiful Mosque with history. You can take a look at sultans' coffins and others.It is a beautiful mosque, and free!Buildings are well designed beautifully and please take photos as many as you want.

Pretty and Quiet. The Süleymaniye Mosque is surrounded by huge gardens. This mosque really is prettier. Quieter also. It was commissioned by Sultan Süleyman I, also known as Süleyman the Magnificent, the greatest and richest of all Ottoman sultans. The construction began in 1550, and the 3.500 craftsmen that worked on it finished the job seven years later.Just like most imperial mosques, the Süleymaniye Mosque is more than just a place of worship. Apart from the praying hall (camii) and courtyard (avlu), the complex also included four Koran schools (medrese), bath houses (hamam), a hospital, a caravanserai (kervansaray, a roadside inn where travelers could rest) and a public kitchen (imaret) which served food to the poor; Muslims, Christians and Jews alike. Once inside, you’ll find the mosque with 59 meters in length and 58 meters in width breathtaking in size. The main dome is 53 meters high, exactly double its diameter of 26,4 meters.Behind the mosque are a graveyard and two mausoleums, including the beautifully restored tombs of Sultan Süleyman I, his wife Roxelana (Haseki Hürrem), his daughter Mihrimah, his mother Dilaşub Saliha and his sister Asiye.Just outside of the mosque walls, at the front, is the tomb of architect Sinan. The latter is however not open to the public. If you can, take your time.....

Worth the view. The mosque is nice by the inside, though it was the mosque nº34556 I saw in Istanbul and all are quiet the same. But this one has a beautiful sight of the golden horn from the gardens, and it's quieter than the famous blue mosque. I recommend giving it a visit!

Miracle of Architecture. Eminönü is everytime worth a lookaround. If you are there and you didn't make the shortcut for mosqueseeing at Yeni Camii, I totally recommend you a visit of the Süleymaniye-Camii. It is suiting the mosqueskyline of Old Istanbul. You reach it after a walk through the tradeplaces at Eminlnü harbour. If you are there you can take a rest in the beatuful garden inside the mosques area. Enjoy the view over Pera.Inside the mosque you will see one of the most astonishing interior designs made by the famous Architect Koca Mimar Sinan. He created, for example, a invisible window system, which kept the soot of the candles in the huge chandeliers hanging from the ceilingy, for producing ink out of it. Sustainability at it's best.

A spiritual experience not to be misssed. The mosque is exquisite in its architecture and beyond words for its spiritual presence and history. I like that it is managed orderly so that prayer times are respected, yet tourists can be exposed to it and so too get an opportunity to appreciate it. So make sure you know what times you can visit. It was disappointing though to see how both locals and foreigners alike showed disrespect during pray time by snapping photos and selfies. if you fortunate enough to go to a friday sermon (Jummuah), go early to ensure you may be seated inside the mosque - definitely by noon.
A must visit. Great architect, a must visit if you are in Istanbul, A praying place the sound of the adhann is amazing.
Beautiful mosque. I wanted to keep that scarf for the entire life. It is a magical mosque that makes you think differently.
beautiful. Closed during prayer times, but well worth the wait. Discreet clothing is essential, but can be obtained before entering.

Don't Miss This. This mosque is elegant, open and has a grounds well worth walking. It seems less crowded than the other "tour" mosques in Istanbul, and thus, one can enjoy it for it's considered simplicity.

My favorite mosque in Istanbul. This beautiful building is inspiring to visit if only for the aesthetic experience. Many of the mosque's original outbuildings still exist, so you can get an idea of what it was like when first built. Suleyman's tomb is in the cemetery, as is that of his wife, Roxelana.
Neat. Vast inside. Great to visit and each mosque appeared to have it's own personality, being slightly different then the last. The exterior is also very dramatic!

Certainly a cut above the more popular ones!. Firstly, it's not really that popular with tourists so it's not crowded allowing visitors ample space and time to admire the architecture. There were helpful volunteers who gave a brief info on the mosque.
Would strongly recommend.

As beautiful as ever. remember this is a real mosque. Respect is required. Peope will reward you with appreciation. PAy attention to the ceramics, but also to the carpets and the caligraphy of the charter.
Great mosque!. Great mosque! Actually better than the Blue Mosque, which is a tourist machine. You get a calm and relaxed feeling coming into this mosque. Absolutely worth a visit!
Awe Inspiring. Include this on your visit - a visit to Istanbul would not be complete if you missed this from your itinerary.

Mosque with a view. Beautiful mosque with amazing green territory and view of the Golden Horn. There is an interesting small cemetery right next to the mosque. It's smaller but of the same beauty as The Blue Mosque & not that crowded.
The Blue Mosque. Beautiful architecture of the mosque. The minarets and the blue tiles inside the mosque add to the serenity and beauty of the place.
Stop by, dress appropriately. While the mosques begin to look the same inside, that doesn't mean that they are boring. Each does have something unique, and this is a lovely one to visit.

This is definitely worth the hike!. This beautiful serene complex is a little ways away from the other old Istanbul sites, but well worth seeing. It is up on a hill with lovely gardens and a panoramic view. Not only is the mosque designed by the famous architect Sinan (whose tomb is around the corner) so it is spectacular, it also has the beautiful tombs of Suleiman the Magnificent and his consort Roxelana.
Splendor!. What a fabulous and most impressive sight! This mosque is an absolute "must-see". I continue to be impressed by how well organized everything is.

Beautiful Mosque. After visiting a few mosques in Istanbul, everything start to look the same. This is quite a large mosque, with less crowd than the blue mosque. However Rastem Pasa mosque was my favourite as it had a very homely feeling to it. Suleyminiye mosque is in quite a steep hill so be prepared for it if you are planning to walk from Spice Bazaar or Galata bridge area. We took a taxi to get there and then walked on our way back to the Spice Bazaar which was a downhill walk.

AKA the Blue Mosque. One of the most astounding and memorable sights in the city. Make sure you take a picture of the sign that tells you when the Mosque is open to the public because you will want to go back. If I had done that, I would have gone to the mosque on time every day. Just amazing.

Worth the work to get there. A beautiful mosque located on a hill above the rest of the tourists sites, surrounded by spacious gardens and several historically significant structures, including the tombs of Suleyman and his wife, and the architect Sinan who designed so many of the mosques of Istanbul.

Beautifully peaceful.. Located outside the main hub of Istanbul, it misses the masses, which is a pity as Suleymaniye is equally a mosque of great beauty and tranquility, inside and out. The courtyard gardens are shaded and wonderful places for families to gather and enjoy time together. Inside it is so light and beautifully decorated. A lovely touch were the young mosque helpers there to relate to visitors. A great experience, so,pleased we made the effort to get there.

One of the most beautiful mosque i have seen (so far). Perfect interior and exterior. I love how they are so accommodating to visitors even though it is also a fully functional mosque. If by accident you are wearing shorts/ anything inappropriate for a mosque, they provide you with some cover so you can still visit the place.The place around the mosque is also nice. Many shops, and food. Almost picture perfect from every angle. Would definitely visit again and again.

Incredible feast of architecture.. All the pieces of architecture on this list represent the most unbelievable collection of the human genius. The books or Words can't possibly describe it. Go and see for yourselves. Be prepared not to believe your eyes.http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g293974-d294497-r281495854-Hagia_Sophia_Museum_Church_Ayasofya-Istanbul.html#

Beautiful, epic and stunning. Alhamdulillah visited here in 2002. Very impressive building and gives impression of strength , beauty and intelligence. Also do visit the mausoleum of the Sultan. May Allah keep this building standing thru the ages.
impressive. very impressive mosque, the history surrounding this place is almost impossible to absorb completely. well worth a visit or two

Came across this Mosque by mistake. I was actually looking for another Mosque when I stumbled across this one. I'm glad I did. The Mosque is located in a compound which is great to review and the Mosque itself was quite stunning.
Rindge Leaphart
the largest cami in the old Empire. This demonstrates to the historically minded the cultural differences when one compares this with the European cathedrals built at the same time
Beautiful and amazing. Wonderful building, friendly staff, great to look at. This is an absolute must-see when in Istanbul. Recommended.
No crowds!. Blue mosque has massive crowds. Come to Suleymaniye Mosque and see a beautiful mosque in a quiet environment. Well worth the visit!

Underrated marvel. The hill on which the complex is built has a breathtaking view of the Bosphorus and the Golden Horn as well .
In addition, the mosque itself is very elegant with a nice peaceful garden .
And it is not crowded compared to Blue Mosque , i enjoyed it so much.

Need a guide. Lovely mosque with tons of history. You need a guide to fully appreciate it. Please be aware that this is functioning mosque, so you cannot visit during prayer time and check out appropriate dress before you go.

Great architecture but do go inside to understand the building fully. A dominating building and magnificent from the outside. You can go in for free, carrying your shoes in a disposable plastic bag. Remember no shorts and upper arms covered. Women bring a head scarf. Entrance is free which lets you experience the cavernous area inside and do look up at the dome. Well worth an hour of your time and close to lots of other attractions as part of a day's itinerary.

Beautiful mosque. Plus awesome food right outside it!. The mosque is beautiful. Both from the outside, the courtyard and inside. We also head the best meal in Istanbul right outside the mosque at the back left corner. It's not a touristy place. No one understood English I literally went into the kitchen and pointed to what we wanted to eat. But the cheapest and most delicious food.
Amazing. I think it's one of the most amazing mosques ever built. Beautiful walls and blue ceiling. Great atmosphere inside. Definitely visit it if you are in Istanbul.

Lovely views from terrace. This Mosque is free to visit, you need to remove shoes and ladies need to cover your head (not with a hat) and your shoulders and knees need to be covered. Nice gardens to walk round and very peaceful inside definitely worth the up hill walk from the Laleli-Universite tram stop
Must see. This is a must see place. The mosque has an excellent architecture and a high area, in the middle of a shopping area. It is very well maintained, and deserve to spend few hours.

Wonderful. The Blue Mosque gets most of the attention and therefore the crowds. This is just as beautiful but you get the chance to sit and contemplate the purpose and passion that created such a wonderful building.

Take a look inside!. Not only is the Blue Mosque spectacular on the inside, but it is beautiful on the inside as well. If you have an interest in learning about Islam, take a tour of this place. Even if you want to be an observer of the faith, there is a space for tourists to walk in and view the mosque beside open areas for muslims to pray.

What a beautiful place!. Definitely take the time to stop in to the Suleymaniye Mosque. I truly feel this was one of the most beautiful places in Istanbul. This one definitely beats out the Blue Mosque in terms of beauty (not that it's a competition).
My visit. A great mosque to visit not as crowded as the more well known ones and just as worthy. Well worth the visit

Beautiful place.. Excellent architecture,design and paintings inside the mosque. it's a huge religious place with lots of glass work,well carpetted floor.Bathrooms were chargeable but poorly maintained.

Beautiful, yet another peaceful oasis in busy Istanbul. The dome at this mosque is particularly beautiful. As the biggest mosque in Istanbul, you'd think it would be bustling, but instead it exudes a peaceful feeling. The grounds outside the mosque offer panoramic views of the city. Recommend going at dusk (Maghreb prayer time) where the lights in the city are coming on and look just breathtaking.
Really Beautiful ! Not so crowded !. Not as crowded as other historic Mosques.....Great natural light near the grand bizarre and spice market ...all within walking distance

Surpassed my expectations. What a magnificent work of art that is the perfect showpiece for Islam. It would be impossible not to be impressed. And a nice touch was the little Muslim boys running around inside the prayer area with no one shushing them. For me this exemplified the tolerance that is true Islam.

Beautiful mosque.. The exterior and interior of the mosque is stunning! Loved the Iznik tiles on the walls as well as the light fixtures in the mosque. For Muslims, you can also pray at the mosque and when I was there, there was someone available for you to ask questions on islam.

Istanbul's Most Beautiful Mosque. The Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque receives most of the attention, but the Suleymaniye Mosque received all of the beauty. This mosque demonstrates what makes Ottoman architecture so iconic and is the strongest testament of Mimar Sinan's work.
Easily accessible in Istanbul and well worth the detour from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque.

Not to be missed. While everyone flocks to the Blue Mosque to get a better understanding of the history and culture it provides many miss the Sulemaniye Mosque and that is really a shame. Not only do you get a chance to see a beautiful mosque that is not nearly as crowded but you also get to see a beautiful view of the city, wonderful gardens and a well maintain cemetery that has survived through the ages.

Just a short walk from the other sites. This is the mosque that dominates the sky line from across the Golden Horn, bigger than the Blue Mosque it also gets less visitors which seems to add to it's more peaceful attmosphere. The view from the gardens over the city are impressive and on the other side of the mosque the restaurants are cheaper and less rushed than around Sultanahmet.

Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful. The building and grounds are huge and amazing and the ceiling is incredible - don't forget to look up! Avoid prayer times, dress respectfully (knees and upper arms covered), you will need to take your shoes off (plastic bags provided for carrying) and women need to wear a head scarf (bring your own if possible). Remember to be as quiet as possible so you don't disturb those who are praying outside the major prayer times. It's easy to get carried away taking photos but spend 5 minutes sitting and absorbing the atmosphere. Don't miss the amazing view over Istanbul from the grounds.
Beautiful mosque. Definitely worth seeing, the courtyard the mosque, the view, the gardens.... very evocative, perhaps the prettiest of them all in the center of Istanbul. Don't miss it.

Worth climbing. It is simple and serene, very different from chatolic churches, and just.. beautiful. It was very calming, and even with all the tourists around, so peaceful. Definitely worth a visit.
amazing. Fantastic view over the city. Mosque area is very peaceful, fantastic after shopping in the grand bazaar

Suleymaniye Mosque. Well worth the walk up the hill to this the largest mosque in Istanbul. It is simple and serene, the cemetery is also worth a visit. The views from the wall across to Galata Tower are a bonus. The food from the cafes is good and cheaper than the area around the Blue Mosque.

Beatiful panorama of Istanbul. This is the biggest mosque in city it has very high and biggest diametr of celining. One of the great works of Mimar Sinan. Also when you reach backyard garden panorama of Istanbul will be under your feet. And you can take photos of the mosque with better angle and whole mosque in one shot from backyard. It's a must see!
A must see when in Instanbul.. For a non-muslim this was my first experience and I would not have missed it. We were on a tour and visited several and this was excellent

brilliant place to visit. we went there and it was amazing - hardly any tourists - and the views from the grounds were spectacular. it's a little of the tourist trail - but don't miss it - it really is amazing. it was so quiet and peaceful also - away from the hustle an bustle of Istanbul
The best Mosque. I think this is the most beautiful, and certainly the most serene, out of all the ones I saw. I loved it and worth the trek up the hill.
Best of the Mosques. This would be the most spectacular of all the mosques I visited, absolutely amazing artwork on ceiling, a must see.

Beautiful. But way too touristic for my taste.. Beautiful building, very quick to visit and free (donation on voluntary basis at the exit), so why not!? But there is so many tourists that it overall ruined it for me. Maybe try to go when there is less people, probably early morning...Not being muslim gave me a sort of "imposteur/voyeur's feeling" as people were praying right next to me and I could hear tourists speak too loud and see girls snapping thousand of selfies and laughing about how cute they look wearing the mandatory scarf women have to put on in order to enter the mosque.Meh...
Great mosque. This is a beautiful mosque and grounds, also fantastic view of the city. A big complex that is a better bet if you don't want to wait in the lines at the Blue Mosque.

Amazing structure !!!!. What a awesome place to visit , while there a place I really recommend you to go an eat , which is right opposite the mosque is Ali Baba . The food is absolutely yummy , simple traditional home made Turkish food .

The trek is worth it.. A bit of a trek, high up and tricky to find but beautiful inside. As always spotless and friendly. There were male and female students offering explanations with very good english. Worth a visit.

Beautiful elegant mosque. This was my favourite of the mosques, really beautiful and quite serene. It is a vast complex of buildings outside. And a stunning position with wonderful views. There were hardly any tourists when we went , maybe because it is not as well known as the blue mosque or the Hagia Sophia. Built by Sinan , and a must see.
Mosque. Another Big Mosque close to Spice Market is also worth Visiting if around the area. Very Huge & pretty.

Beautiful. If you're visiting Istanbul, you're going to this Mosque, which is active and historic and beautiful and amazing and all those things that make travel exciting. It doesn't take long to move through, and the line moves quickly. I dressed conservatively and brought a scarf, but if you forget, they have cover available. Gorgeous.

My favorite site in Istanbul, what a view. This is a beautiful site with interesting cemetery and views from the back grounds to the Bosphorus/Golden Horn. Very lovely mosque and so restful. Next to the University of Istanbul and a quick walk from the Grand Bazaar.
A true mosque atmosphere.. Beautiful mosque. Great docents inside gave us a free mosque and history talk. Views from outside of city below are worth the trip. Nice little cafe outside the walls.

Amazing. I loved the location, it is full of history and not very far from grand Bazar. I found this mosque more attractive than Hagia Sophia. IStanbul is great an the people too. the guard allowed in though it was 8pm.
Must visit. Leave you shoes outside and admire the stunning architecture of this must-see Suleyman mosque in Istanbul

My favorite of the mosques to visit. I found this mosque more impressive than the Blue Mosque, but it is more distant from the other sights so you have to make an effort. Magnificent in scale and decoration, this was, at least to me, the better place to visit. As with the Blue Mosque, there are rules about visiting, including appropriate dress and removal of shoes. If you have the time, go out of your way to visit.

Awesome. We all thought this mosque had more character to it than the blue mosque. Great architecture and a real feeling of history. The beautifully kept gardens are perfect to sit and relax in, especially in the shade of the trees when the sun is beating down.

Oasis of calm. This is a beautiful place, that has a good atmosphere. It is off the main tourist route so is not crowded. There were no queues and it was quiet. Lovely views of the city from the gardens.
Impressive architecture. One of the must visited places. The largest mosque in Istanbul. Women should cover their hair while entering.
Feel home. With this great architecture building I feel like I'm home while I walk around it.Also It's near the historic areas of istanbul
Simply Majestic. Can't express the feeling of having the chance to offer Jummah Prayers at this historical Mosque. It was surreal.

Awe-inspiring. So beautiful - the architects/engineers of this period, must've had such foresight to build such magnificent structures that still stand today. The quality and colour of the original tiles still so good.

Impressive mosque in a quiet setting. We visited this mosque with a guide and found it to be very impressive in terms of the size and design. It is not as elaborate in terms of the colors that one sees in the Blue Mosque or even the Rushem Pasta mosque but it is beautiful nonetheless. There were few people there so the visit was more relaxing than the Blue Mosque and consequently the chicote (sweaty feet) smell was not detectable for those that are concerned about those things.

Amazing..... We only had one night in Istanbul and the morning before our flight left went to mosque. A gentleman came up to us while we were in line- he said he was not a tour guide- but ended up acting like one. A must for visiting- he told up things we did not know nor would have know to look for.
Loved!. I was lucky because it wasnt so crowd :) Spend time looking the details, all of them. Read about the construction before go inside and then try to understand.

Great example of world's Islamic architecture and the final resting place of Sultan Suleiman and Hürrem Sultan. You won't see too many travelers visiting Mosque daily, but this is the special place all serious guys must see. This is the great example of the best Islamic architecture in the world. The Mosque was build by order of Kanuni Sultan Suleyman, known in the West as Suleiman the Magnificent, in 16 century and it has historical cemetery with many great people resting there. You will find Great Ottoman Empire's Sultan Suleiman and his Russian wife Alexandra tombs in two buildings next to the Mosque. The great history of Sultan Suleyman and Hasiki Hurrem Sultan inspired creation of many books, movies in the world. The latest and may be the best historical drama movie I've ever seen was recently created in Turkey and named as "Muhtesem Yuzyil". I'd recommend watch this movie at first, as we've done with my wife, before visiting Istanbul and the Mosque and Topkapi Palace.

Calm. This mosque isn't seen by as many tourists (or tour groups) and we only stumbled on it when we were lost! The grounds and mosque itself were both very relaxing - and this in the the middle of a very hectic city.We saw the Blue Mosque later, and preferred THIS one!
Lots of History. A must see. Beautiful architecture and a place to quietly take in the grandeur. I look forward to a return visit

An Ottoman masterpiece. Monumental mosque built by Suleyman the Magnificent. One of Sinan's best works, so anyone interested in architecture should consider a visit. Offers breathtaking panoramic view of the sea and Asia.Scarf and skirt are provided for visitors who forget to bring these items.

Worth the climb!. This is the biggest mosque in the city and also topographically most dominant as it is atop a hill in the old town. It looks very impressive from every corner of the city (especially from the water or Beyoglu district) it's a steep climb from the water to the top of the hill, but it is worth it. The layout, the gardens, the views of the city are amazing! This mosque was built to impress and it does so centuries later.
Imperdivel. Not a chance to be in Istambul and don't visit Suleymaniye! Historical, very well organized and worth the ticket. Takes at least 4 hour to be visited .
My best memory of Istanbul.... The location, the magnificent building, the peaceful gardens, the view over the city, all that made my visit to the mosque so special... just a perfect mix
Majestic. Walking through, one wonders at the magnificence of architecture when tools were limited and materials, mostly natural. Spend enough time here to admire, digest and absorb the artifacts
Istanbul Treasure. We had an excellent guide thru Gate1 Travel who made touring the site a very educational experience. A must see in Istanbul
My third visit. Very nice place you must visit it nod by some nice intiques, believe you will nor regret and a new experience will be add to you
Architecturally brilliant. This should not be missed if you are in Istanbul. Its a huge mosque which still has prayers and also allows visitors to have a view of Islamic heritage.
Truly magnificent!. Much less crowded than the famous Blue Mosque, this great building is perhaps even more impressive. Set on a hill top it has a stunning setting with magnificent views.

Beautiful and friendly mosque. The garden surrounding the mosque is a nice place to relax and has a great view. Inside, as in all mosques, you are required to dress appropriate - cover your legs(also applies to men) and shoulders and hair. Inside the mosque there are people volunteering who are very happy to answer any questions - this was the only mosque where people actually approach and offer this. Really great, don't miss it.
My favourite mosque . Breathtaking views out over Istanbul. Beautiful architecture. Very colourful compared with other sights we visited. Definitely my favourite
