My favorite. As a non Muslim, I thought this was the most beautiful mosque out of the 4 I visited in Istanbul, including the blue mosque.
Beautiful historical landmark. great peak into the history of Turkey. Settled in the middle of old town where you get a true feel for the city.
beautifl atmosphere. you have to see it for the suggestive atmosphere, the oriental art inside and the beautiful zone around it

A view from the top. This less visited mosque is truly beautiful. It's simplicity makes it even more beautiful than Sultanahmet. The view from the mosque over the city and the Golden Horn is stunning. Well worth the effort
Greatest mosque in Istanbul. It is less touristy than Blue Mosque but better and mystical atmosphere in there. It is located close to Istanbul University an Spice Bazaar.

Beautiful.. When we first went early in the morning, the lines of tourist groups were extremely long. Going back at around 5:30 pm we joined a short line and walked right in. The space is bigger than I had expected, and awe-inspiring in it's simplicity.

The soul of Suleiman the Magnificent. Situated on a hill with a beautiful view, this mosque is immense and simply breath taking! Build by Mimar Sinan to the order of sultan Suleiman, this mosque is the soul of Suleiman the Magnificent, turkish sultan who lived in 16th century. He is buried here, together with his wife Hurrem, who was very important figure in turkish history. Amazing courtyard and view.
Another beautiful mosque!. We understand how to respect a different culture starting by leaving our shoes outside and covering our heads (women should do it).

Lovely on the Inside and Out. I enjoyed the views from outside this beautiful mosque as much as I enjoyed them on the inside. Females, make sure to bring something to cover your hair. Take your time walking around outside as well - there are beautiful views around the perimeter of the city!

Breathtaking. I had already visited other mosques in Istanbul - all beautiful; this one was not an exception. Breathtaking architecture and peaceful vibe (despite the tourists). They also offer free literature about Islam in many languages, and have volunteers answering questions from visitors. I highly recommend a visit to this amazing mosque.

Istanbul's Most Important Mosque. Of the 3,500 mosques in Istanbul, the Suleymaniye is likely the most important as it was built by Sinan, perhaps the world's greatest architect for Suleyman the Magnificent, perhaps the Ottoman empire's greatest Sultan. Built on the grounds of a historic palace in the 1550s, this mosque served as a charitable foundation featuring a hospital, schools, a caravanersai, soup kitchens, and a bath house, as well as a place of worship. The mosque served as a massive support system for over 1,000 of the poor of Istanbul, regardless of religion. This mosque dominates the skyline of Istanbul, beautiful beyond belief.The Suleymaniye has a massive courtyard featuring historic columns from earlier civilizations, a soaring golden interior with a massive dome whose height is double its diameter, a lovely gateway, and the tombs of Suleyman the Magnificent and of Sinan, his architect. Scholars say that Mimar Sinan was a Christian Armenian youth adopted into the elite palace schools via the annual roundup of talented Christian youths via the desrime (draft of the young). After serving as a Janissary military engineer, he became chief Imperial architect to Suleyman I in 1538, building over 131 mosques and 200 other buildings as well as bridges and forts. Sinan is most frequently compared to Michelangelo. Many regard Sinan as the world's greatest architect.
Beautiful breathtaking place. I´m just sorry that we came in the wrong time and we were not able to get in because of the prayers; but just sitting outside was really relaxing and calming experience.

Take it all in. What can I say I could go on about the age the vast size and everything else about it ,but really! Just take the time to go and see for yourself and then you will know it's a wonder and not a waste of time because it's Abigail world , enjoy!!!!!!!

Huge mosque, beautiful city views. This is really worth the walk up, if you can find the way! We ended up going through car parks and building sites and on the way back passed chickens in the streets - but it all adds to the atmosphere. The terrace outside has great views over the city. The tombs area is also well worth visiting.

Beautiful mosque - worth a visit. This is one of the biggest mosques in Istanbul and it's easy to get to as well, so definitely worth the trip. You have there the traiditional painted tiles and Istalmic art type of paintings on the domes. And it's really impressive just due to its size. Women are required to wear head scarves here - both in the mosque and in the gardens. If you need to use the bathroom (Bayan) - go for the new/ modern one close to the entrance in the gardens - the one that's free. The one where you see them charging 1 lira - avoid that. It's a hige line of women inside and it's progressing slowly. And it's older and not as well kept.

Tops on my list. We visited several mosques on our trip, but this one was my favorite. They just finished restoring this mosque and really makes an impression how all these great mosques looked when first built. Glad we decided to visit yet one more mosque. Not as busy as some of the others.

Keeps me thinking. This place made me finally understand that only travelling and making experiences of your own are valid in order to understand other cultures. Great Place to be, spend some time on the side inside and let it have an effect on you.Somehow i find it even more gripping everytime i am there.

Unbelievably magnificent! The pictures do not do it justice.. We visited the Suleymaniye Mosque (Camii) about 4 to 5 days into our two week trip. It's a long walk up from the tram station- uphill as well! It doesn't look very far when you see it in the skyline as it almost appears to be right next to the New Mosque, but it is a bit of a trek! However, this mosque is a MUST SEE! When we arrived to the courtyard area I was stunned at how large the mosque and grounds actually were! The domes are larger and more obvious than the other mosques we visited during our stay in Istanbul. The grounds were clean and are well kept, also the washrooms were spotless which was a plus. The interior was of course spotless- as were all the mosques in Istanbul. But the interior of Suleymaniye Camii was just more breathtaking to me. It seemed higher up when looking at ceilings and the temperature was great inside - especially on a hot spring day. Another wonderful aspect was the view from the side of the courtyard. You get a great view of the Golden Horn and the cityscape. Go to this mosque and you won't regret it!

Large mosque, open to tourists.. This mosque was undergoing renovation when I was last in Istanbul, so I was pleased to be able to visit this time. Some guidebooks say that it is possible to climb the minarets, which is NOT true. If you want a great photo spot, the University grounds across the road are on higher ground - we found it possible to follow the wall around to the pedestrian entrance and then access the garden/car park area on foot and take photos from there.

Impeccable and incredible. The walk up from the river is hilarious; we thought we could walk up the golden horn until even with the mosque, then navigate up the twisted alleys... Ended up walking through carparks, someone's hallway, dead ends. It was crazy, but we weren't the only ones. Coming from Grand Bazaar direction is cleaner and easier.The mosque and grounds are enormous and spectacularly clean. Stunning paintwork. The volunteer guide is excellent and very interesting. He's by the free literature stand.
A beautiful attraction. The mosque is beaitiful along with the courtyard, it is about 10-15 min walk from spice bazaar. so visit these 2 places together.
Blue Mosque. Absolutely stunning! Do not miss this site . It is awe inspiring when you think of the construction and it'S ability to withstand years of constant earthquakes.

This mosque is huge. The walk up the hill to it's location is very interesting.. Incredible views of the Golden Horn from the outside area of the mosque. The mosque is closed during prayer times but open to tourists any other time.
Beautiful Mosque. One of the largest an impressive Masjids in Istanbul. Highly recommend for anyone interested in islamic history.

Suleyimaniye Mosque. This is a very impressive mosque and well worth the visit. Visitors should remember that it is a mosque and their heads, arms and legs need to be covered. The mosque provide fabric for this is you should forget

Suleymaniye Mosque and Hamam. located close to Blue mosque,only 15 minutes walking distance,after that try to have some time for Suleymaniye mosque,one of the most modern hamam in istanbul,both genders can go inside and very clean,do try !!!!!

It's beautiful!. It's actually a must! Great view from outdoors over a nice part of the city and the water. Inside the Mosque it's really nice. More quiet than the Blue Mosque and maybe just as pretty. There are also people who can tell you a lot about the history.
Awesome place. We took extra pair of socks...lots of people barefoot and smells a little like dirty feet :-) That aside--the place and history were amazing.

One of Istanbul great Mosque. There are 14000 Mosque in Istanbul,I am sure that you will not be able to see 10% of them but this one and few more that you must see, These Mosque also in great area which you will be able to visit as well

Stunning architecture. Prepare yourself to crowds and queues . Undoubtedly a stunning Mosque, it will leave you speechless for sure!Just be prepared to big crowd, long queues, and make sure you are dressed appropriately for it. Also females are required to cover their heads before entering. Shoes are to be removed at the entrance, if it's a hot day be ready for a pungent strong smell due to the thousand people shoes left there!!! Pictures are allowed ;)

Distinctive. This is a beautiful mosque and once you enter you leave the busyness of Istanbul behind you and enter into a tranquil haven. Its huge and beautiful and impressive. Definitely give it a visit if not to pray then merely to see its beauty.
Wonderful. Take your cameras and read about this mosque online before seeing it. It was impressive and diverse. Wear socks because you must remove your shoes to enter.

Beautiful and Peacefull. you can see the whole city from the court yard, and the you can take sun and enjoy the leace and quiet all day long, the mosque itself is huge and full of amazing architecture and deisigns

A place of magnificence. This mosque is a piece of history and culture. A must see in Istanbul. Built on the order of sultan Suleiman the Magnificent it is modelled as a 59 meters in length and 58 meters in width. Apart from the main mosque with the prayer hall, the mosque complex includes a caravanserai, a public kitchen which served food to the poor, a hospital, a school (medrese) and a bath-house (hamam).In the garden behind the main mosque there are two mausoleums including the tombs of sultan Suleiman I, his famous wife Roxelana, his daughter, his mother and his sister Asiye. The small discomfort is that you have to take off your shoes while visiting the interior of the Mosque:-).
Big, beautifull, dominant. I liked a lot, it is so impressive, one can see this Mosque from far distance as it is situated on the top of the hill and it is really huge.

Beautiful!. Well worth a visit - tucked out of the way and after you have walked around, plenty of places to eat and drink outside. Try the famous Fasuliye and Pilav (white beans and rice)... alternatively, if you want great views of the Golden Horn and Galata try one of the cafes on the far side of the Mosque - well worth a visit.

Quieter, different interior. A great respite from the spice bazaar, climb the mountain and find yourself at this peaceful view of the city. The mosque itself lacks the typical blue tiles which tends to emphasize its larger size while maintaining a sense of simplicity. For those who are into taking pictures, the interior is much brighter than the other mosques most visited.
Haven of peace. Liked : Spiritual, beautiful, very helpful volunteer . Courtyard a cool and peaceful place to rest up.

Beautiful and peaceful with an incredible view and friendly people. Amazing! Beautiful architecture and friendly people. We visited to watch prayer time in action and couldn't have been more welcomed. The building is beautiful and the view is stunning. There's a lovely hidden courtyard in the mosque complex full of locals having coffee...a must!
Classic Design by Famous Architect. One of the most impressive mosques anywhere. The architect who designed it had over 120 major projects to his credit and the quality of this building shows why.

Wonderful Place.. While the Blue Mosque is very well known this mosque is on the top of one of the hills in Istanbul. The grounds are as fine as the interior of the Mosque which is stunning. The Burial places of Sultan and their wives has now been opened and the grave stones show how many children each wife had denoted with a rose on the top of the gravestone, one of each child. The views are absolutely stunning and the whole complex is steeped in history, quite, tranquil and a place to reflect. This is one of the real treasures of Istanbul. Unfortunately I had to make three trips to the city before I discovered it.Well worth the climb up and down.

A beautiful mosque with great views of the bosphorus. This huge and very impressive mosque is well worth the walk up to the third hill of Istanbul. It's the largest mosque in Istanbul and dominates the city.As well as seeing the courtyard and inside of the mosque, make sure you have enough time to walk around the gardens. The North side in particular affords great views of the city and the flowers when in bloom make the already spectacular mosque look even more impressive.
Gorgeous!. Amazing mosque, really beautiful on the outside and inside. Just check the opening hours, because they close on praying time.. If I remember, it´s between 4:45 p.m and 6p.m.

Fantastic Views. Quite difficult to find on foot, (complete lack of street signs!) but worth it for the viewsThe nearby restaurants don't serve alcohol (I assume because they are so close to the mosque)
Beautiful. A simply beautiful building with the history behind it as amazing as the architecture of the building
Mosque. This is an amazing structure filled with history. It is well worth having a guide to explain the story. The grounds outside the mosque are lovely, too.

The most beautiful mosque. Perched on a hilltop above all the noise and crowds, the grounds offer a nice, cool, grassy escape for a while. And the mosque itself was renovate fairly recently, so it's a lot cleaner and prettier than the other mosques we saw in Istanbul. A volunteer was walking around answering questions about mosques and Islam, very helpful.

Most amazing Mosque in the world. Definitely worth a visit (rather than the Blue Mosk).Its much quieter and rich in history.the Mosque closes to the public for prayer time so if you want to go inside avoid prayer times. Its wonderful being in the courtyard for prayer though.
Beautiful. Sat on the carpet with our guide to hear the history and features of this stunning mosque. The architect also designed one of the Turkish baths near the Iron column.

Excellent. Its minarets from outside, dooms from inside and calligraphy. Its location and maintence are all very good. It needs to be made more accessable to pedestatrins. Its exterior should be reburfished.

My favourite mosque of Istanbul. Gorgeous view over the Bosphorus, plus nice grounds and outbuildings make for a lovely space. Indoors and out the mosque is stunning. I went inside, then later waited in the shade on the grassy area outside to hear the call to prayer. You can see the worn areas where millions of footsteps have worn down the stone, reminding you of the long history of this building.
Great Mosque. Almost an exact replica of the Blue Mosque, so if the lines are long there you can visit here. And the view is also great.

Iconic & must-see. The inside is just as impressive as the exterior. The mosaic ceilings are so intricate. Don’t be put off by the long line, it moves very quickly. They have a prayer period at 2pm where they will close the mosque, you may also be approached by guides who (for a fee) will help you skip the line, but honestly we lined up quite close to 1.45pm and only waited for 10 mins tops and entered with no problems. You’ll only need approx. 15 – 20 minutes in here as there isn’t any activities, more taking it all in. Ladies – do remember to bring a scarf to wrap around your head, or alternatively they will have rental shawls available at the entrance. As you enter you’ll need to put your shoes in covers (which are provided), as the interior is carpet flooring.

One of the most beautiful mosque in Istanbul. this mosque is less touristy so it makes visiting and appreciating the mosque easier. No entrance ticket is needed. The mosque is beautiful and still in a very good condition. The exterior part of the building is tranquil and serene. I love sitting in front of the mosque admiring the architecture of the building. Tips : Visit early in the morning like 8.45-9.00 am before any tourist comes in. It is amazing as it can be.

one of my favorite mosques in istanbul. it's a bit of an uphill walk from the grand bazaar but not really that hard. I love this mosque because it's so peaceful and it has magnificent views across the golden horn - lots of photo ops! Also good food just outside the mosque. worth a visit,.
Beautiful Mosque. A beautiful building, very simple but with a lovely calming atmosphere. Slightly away from the central Sultanahmet district but worth the walk.
Great view over the city. Mosque is on a bit higher side of the city so it gives a wonderful opportunity to get a great view over the city! (: Also Mosque is just huge.. and a must-see in Istanbul!

The most decorative mosque . The inside of this mosque is the one I liked best in Istanbul. The painted black/white/red/gold patterns definitely stick out in comparison to the blue and green schemes of other mosques. One of the must see mosques also as the size is amazing and the courtyard is beautiful.
Takes your breath away!. Takes your breath away in more sence than one! The climb up is pretty steep but you'll never regret it..the beauty of this Mosque takes your breath away!

Excellent. The Suleymaniye Mosque provided an authentic look at a mosque used for prayer and worship, instead of tourist visits. The dress code is strictly enforced as well as the request of no talking. My favorite mosque in Istanbul.
Great Mosque. The is one of my favourite Mosques in the World in one of the best historical settings. Highly recommended and a must on any Muslims bucket list of historical Mosques.

My ranking of Istanbul mosques:. Istanbul has several mosques and they are all majestic buildings. But they are very much alike. Once you saw two or three, the next one is not that exciting any more. Particularly because the interior designs are rather bare. Some have beautiful mosaic tiles (mostly blue). I recommend Suleymaniye as No1, Sultan-Ahmed (the blue mosque) as No2, and Rüstem-Pasha as No3. The latter is small and unpretentious, but has a lovely atmosphere.

A quieter mosque to visit. Except at prayer times, this mosque, with a history of its own, is a quieter mosque to visit, not so many tourists as with the blue mosque. Also not as obviously highly decorated but still a beautiful space of worship, nonetheless.

One of the most perfect structures I have ever seen!!. Please do not miss this mosque when you are in Istanbul!! I was in the Eminonu area, I had just gotten off the bosphorus tour so wasn't too far from there. It is a bit of trekking uphill from there, up narrow streets and markets to find the path. It's not clearly marked so you have to ask....you will see the mosque towering over the hill.When I entered the actual mosque it was in COMPLETE AWE. The second you step inside you are completely taken aback. IT IS SO PERFECT! The grass is the lushest green and the mosque is amazing inside and out. I couldn't get enough of it. From the border of the mosque, you can get a panoramic view of the city and the bosphorus. I want to go back so badly. I would kick myself if I didn't visit! You should read up on the great architect Sinan before you go to get some background.Ladies please cover your heads and bodies, as this is the etiquette and must be respected. You will get some awesome photos here. It's definately less busy than the blue mosque.You do have to pay a small fee if you want to use the washrooms which are located on the outside border of the mosque, other than that, free.

my favourite mosque. i think this was the most beautiful of all the mosques we visited whilst in instanbul. perhaps it was just because there were less people, but it was expansive, peaceful and just perfectly beautiful. the views across the water were amazing. i'd love to go back and lounge about in the gardens some more.
Historıcal nice place. Actually, i really Wanted to visit Here since so long time, and at last ı have walked around , and im pretty sure ti ıs Good choıce to vısıt in İstanbul as a traveller.
Beautiful.. I Liked most of any one. Because the atmosphere, the building, the people. I recomended to go for sure. You can feel the real islam there. Just for culture, it's nice.

Excellent little Sister to the Blue Mosque. We have visited most of the historic sites and the key Mosques in this beautiful city. But visited here whilst on a tour and came away delighted with spectacular architecture and less people.Well worth a visit, and you will be surprised at the size and wonderful colours
worth the visit. excellent visit full of history learn about the mosque and its history easily reached by walking tour

Spectacular Inside And Out. The structure itself is quite spectacular but the interior is a bit drab with the vast expanse of old red carpet and low hung lights. Outside in the square is more impressive with a view of the Minarets.
Don't Miss Visiting the Mosque. Really worth while visit. Ladies, remember you will have to cover your head, shoulder and legs, but you will be given scarves to allow you to do that (Free of Charge)

Worth to see the architecture. You can't imagine this place was constructed a couple of hundred years ago.
Magnificent and impressive, one of the most important mosques in there.

Magnificent!. It is one of the most amazing architectural masterpieces of Sinan, the Architect. From my view it's one of the Wonders of the World. Just make sure that you visit the mosque with a knowledgable tourist guide or read the details before you go. The acoustic design, the details in construction and the myths about its construction era are great. The tomb of the Magnificent Suleiman who was one of the strongest emperors of Ottoman Empire is also in this mosque.
Amazing Place. I have been here before, the architecture outstanding, I love Istanbul & Turkey, the whole area is soaked in history, their are lots of eaters in the area.

Sulemaniye Mosque. I was told that this mosque was more impressive than the Blue Mosque and I would have to agree although neither impressed me as much as the Hagia Sophia (museum). The building, grounds and view are phenomenal and there is not as much of a crowd as the Blue Mosque. Very
My favorite in Istanbul. We also visited the Blue Mosque and New Mosque. This one was, in my opinion the most beautiful, also there was no line. The roman aqueducts are also nearby.

Great Architect Mimar Sinan Art. Suleymaniye Mosque is a complex of mosque. The biggest mosque in İstanbul. It has a great acoustic system. There are four minarets and ten balconies. This means Sultan Soliman is the fourth Ottoman Sultan. Recently renovated.I recommend to everyone to visit this mosque.

Quieter alternative. If you like mosques suggest you visit the Suleymaniye Mosque near the Grand Bazaar, it’s quieter and I thought nicer than the Blue Mosque. The grounds are lovely to sit in and there is a lovely view over the city, Golden Horn and Galata
Nice to visit. Visit it during the week, in the weekend is full of tourists and you don't have a nice experience. Great value to see the Turkish religious ways.

Splendour away from the crowds. This mosque and surrounding grounds were beautiful. Tulips in April were breathtaking. Not so many crowds at this mosque which was more pleasant than some of the most visited landmarks in Istanbul. Some vendors outside with souvenirs and cafe nearby. Would highly recommend a visit to this landmark.

Our best experience in Istanbul. This Mosque is really special, because of it's beauty and hilltop location, but more than that, it's much quieter than the Blue Mosque, so it gives you the time and space to sit and reflect. They have an active volunteer staff that is there to answer questions, mostly about Islam but also about the location itself. This personal touch makes it really special. The grounds are stunning. Don't miss the tombs of Suleyman and his wife as well.

The most beautiful mosque we visited. A stunning mosque and far less crowded than the Blue Mosque or the New Mosque. There are guides there to answer questions about the mosque and Islam, which was incredibly informative.

Massive mosque!. The weather was great, which always helps. The grounds are extensive and one part of them gave some very good views across the water and across some odd roof top structures. There is a very welcome, good quality, toilet in the grounds which has to be paid for but which is worth it.
Beautiful. This was a nice smaller mosque. Very beautiful and without the crowds of The Blue Mosque, but not as grand either. Still this was well worth the visit.

The most beautiful mosque in Istanbul. For me this is the most beautiful mosque in Istanbul and should be in the must to see list of everyone who comes to this city. It was built almost 5 centurys ago by Sultan Suleyman the Magnificent. The architecture is absolutely stunning. Luckily not many tourists decide to climb uphill to this place and that's why it remains kind of intact, there is no rush and noise. You can enter the mosque if there is no prayer at the moment, and walk in the gardens and the small ancient streets around. Don't miss the tombs of the sultan himself and his beloved (Polish?) wife Roxelana.

masterpiece of sinan. really liked this mosque with its tiles; a masterpiece of the architect mimar sinan (whose own tomb is nearby). great views of istanbul and the bosphorus from the mosque area also!

Fabulous. This is well worth the walk up the hill! - fantastic view point as well as a beautiful mosque. There were no queue's to get into the mosque and the volunteers were helpful and knowledgeable.

Just a nice mosque. We went here when it was totally not busy, which was nice. Basically it's just an old nice looking mosque. Don't expect to be able to walk around in it like you can do in Abu Dhabi. You can only take a look in the front. Also you can't visit the thombs. But the gardens are really nice as well as the mosque.
Just beautiful. Inside area is stunning, skip the Hagia Sophia if you don't like hours of waiting in the line and include this one in your visit. You wont be sorry.
Stunning. Beautiful historic grounds and architecture! A bit of a walk but takes you on some side streets and local neighborhoods that are fun to see along the way.
Must see. The inside of this mosque is truely outstanding. Some would say it's even better than the blue mosque. Definitely worth a visit.
Nice Architecture!!!. A beautiful and peaceful place to visit. The architecture is amazing and the interiors are very royal.
Majestic structure. What a majestic piece of architecture. Must see top attraction in Istanbul. Way less crowded than the Blue Mosque - larger and more majestic

Architecturally stunning. Architecturally stunning, interior and exterior. Definately a must add to the list of sights to see in the Sulltanhamet district of Istanbul. Normal procedure for entering an Islamic mosque is required - removal of shoes, women to dress with dicorum and a head scarf. I have visited this sight several times, and only once felt that I was not welcome (as a non Muslim).

The beautiful mosque Suleymaniye. Suleymaniye mosque was a little walking distance from Beyazid tram station past Grand Bazar.The day we visited it,it was less crowded as compared to Sultan Ahmet Blue Mosque .It was magnificent though much smaller than the Blue mosque with great domes.The cemetery and the Tomb of Sultan Suleymaniye,the great conqueror were added features where everyone was on level ground despite having enjoyed years of power,wealth and grandiosity in lifetime..An eye opener for all.The tomb of Huram Sultan was also there.I liked the architecture and relative peace at the place. Inside the mosque,in an enclosure scarved ladies were studying Quran Tafsir as per routine. One memorable scene witnessed was four Japanese tourists taking photos with head covered in a position of prayer.I caught them on a camera with their permission..As the routine,one has to take off one's shoes before entering the sacred place.

beautiful and very interesting structure. Probably the best experience visiting a Mosque. Less crowded, and well illuminated with natural light. There, the architectural explanation is a must do, especially the structure, how the lighting has been set, the natural wind blowing, a lot of details very well thoughts and build out of experience, therefore use a guide to visit it.
great mosque. I went there after seeing a dozen mosques but it still managed to impress me. Must see if you visit Istanbul!

Superlative. What a place. Nice views of Bosphorous from the back side Excellent peaceful mosque interiors with very little crowd Nice outside area - liked it more than Blue Mosque - looks majestic I when lit too
magnificient. magnificient beautiful mosque with views of galata towers i like this mosque morethe mosque is near the istanbul university

sublime. This is a fabulous site. A huge precinct wall surrounds the mosque and the buildings are wonderful. Not as much on the tourist trail as the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia so a little more relaxed to wander around. make sure you walk out through the precint wall on the sea side and admire the stunning view, accessing this past the small cemetery.Do beware though, there were some very agressive guide book and post card sellers who were very persistent and almost spoled our visit as they were unwilling to take no for an answer.
Could not see the inside. We got there more than 30 minutes before prayer time, still the guards, who was kind of agressive, did not allow us to put a foot inside. Beatiful from the outside, though.
A great Mosque for an ever greater Sultan. The grander and the architectural beauty of this mosque has no equal. The great Sultan Suleyman, "the law giver" was an exceptional ruler.
Don't miss it. A very special place and the views of the city from the yard can't be missed. The accoustics is amazing and the whole complex impressive.

Summary of Ottaman Turkey in one location. This is why millions of tourists visit Turkey every year; one of the grandest and historic mosques in the country, surrounded by peaceful gardens and an enchanting view of the bhosperous. It summarizes the might, elegance and pomp that the ottoman empire once yielded. This mosque is less bold and ostentatious than the blue mosque, but its relative simplicity is what provides it an aura of calm. It is much less crowded with tourists than the blue mosque, an extra reason to visit.
magnificent Süleymaniye. As you approach the mousque you get it clearly it is architectural work of Mimar Sinan while he calls this mousque as his semiskilled work.
incredible architecture. It is one of the best mosque in Istanbul, it has beautiful city view and also mosque is seen from every where in Goldenhorn area.

Another gem. This located further up from the old city. Walking distance from grand bazaar or galata bridge. A very beautiful mosque without long queues to put you off. Beautifully decorated inside. The fond is decorated in lovely peach colour patterns. Only annoying thing was the volunteers trying to shove religious books at you. The grounds are very lovely to sit down and relax. There is beautiful views of Bosporus to be had from the grounds.

Wonderful views over city.. Not as touristy nor popular as the Blue Mosque, but very important and beautiful. You take your shoes off and they give you a plastic bag for them and a skirt if you are showing knees. Very serene and holy place. There were guides to explain Islam in your language. There was interesting information and books for free about the religion and much disclaiming terrorists and violence. The mosque was trying to educate tourists that Their religion hates violence and stands for peace. Very informative and interesting. It is up a steep hill but worth the hillwalking for the breathtaking views. Good local bargains in the market closeby too. Much better value than in the Grand Bazaar.

Beautiful interiors and surroundings. The grounds of the mosque is very well kept and boasts a great view towards the other side of the European Istanbul. Interiors are decked out in soft pastel colors and the floating chandelier adds a sense of loftiness to the space. As this is a full-functioning mosque, please check for prayer timings prior to visit and ladies are required to bring a scarf for covering hair and shoulders.

One of the biggies. Even if Mosques and the like are not your cup of tea this is one you should try to visit. After the Blue Mosque this is probably the next most 'must do' Mosque in Istanbul.There are multiple reasons to come here. Firstly if you are relatively fit and are in the New Mosque/Spice Market area you can walk up the hill towards it. Secondly it is the site of the tomb of Suleyman the Magnificent. Thirdly it.... well thirdly it is a really impressive structure when you consider how old it is and how stupidly impressive it must have been at the time of its construction.As an added bonus there are lovely views over to the Galata area of the city including the Galata Tower.Apart from the interest of seeing this very impressive structure there is the added bonus that you feel that you are in a mellower part of the city. There is far less street noise and hustle and bustle here than, say, at the Blue Mosque. The interior is as impressive as the exterior and rewards a bit of reflection.One tiny problem is the fact that the place is accessed by some narrow old streets - and once you are in them you are guided by instinct as to where it is because once you are in those narrow streets it can be hard to get your bearings by being able to see the minarets! But you'll get there. And it will be worth it.

One of the most beautiful. I think its even more beautiful than the blue mosque, not so overcrowded with tourist. Volonteers welcoming the guests (tourist), answering your questions (even the provocative ones), ready to explain you anything. They give out free materials and books in foreign languages. Stunning decorations, huge complex. Do not miss the terrace on the side of the mosque, from where you have a breathtaking view of the entire Golden Horn! Nice graveyard behind, with mausoleums of sultan Suleyman the Magnificent and his wife Hurem (a ucrainian slave girl, daughter of a Orthodox priest, who's been taken to Sultan's harem, but eventualy stole the SUltan's heart and beacem his Empress). A must see! Great bazaar streets arround!
Very informative. Lots of information inside about Islam. Stunning mosque both outside and in. Amazing architecture and decoration.

👍. It is a very beautiful place, it is nice, it is well done, you can take photos in it
But very tight schedule, suddenly they may tell you to go out..it is prayer timd
Magnificent. Amazing mosque bearing name of the greatest Sultan of the Ottoman Empire. Better than Blue Mosque- a bit less crowded and architecture's stunning.

Rewarding uplifting experience!. This was my first experience in visiting the interior of a Mosque - it was both educative, interesting and quite uplifting. The location of this Mosque contributed to its impact - built on the top of one of Istanbul's many hills there were great photo opportunities to be had when wandering around the grounds. The architecture was awe inspiring in its size and simplistic interior design. I would definitely recommend a visit!

A must see in Istanbul – however watch out for opening times and dress code!. The Blue Mosque is a beautiful mosque with amazing blue ascents which will truly take your breath away. The mosque was quite crowded with a long line (which did move quickly). This is the number one thing that you must do in Istanbul however there is some logistically items that you need to know about. First, the mosque is closed during the times of prayer – which is five times a day. Look for the opening times on line to make sure you do not go during those time periods. Secondly, there is a dress code to access the mosque – cover your legs and for females wear a head scarf. The mosque now lends out dress items for those who are not prepared! However, I would dress appropriate to avoid wearing used head scarfs.

Beautiful Ottoman Mosque. This is one of the hidden mosque in Istanbul. It looks clear from Galata bridge, but to go there, you should go through the small alley near spice market/grand bazaar. Very easy to miss this mosque when you visit Istanbul. For me, this mosque is better than blue mosque, with huge courtyard. Very peaceful atmospher inside. From there, you can get the view of the golden horn, with domes of surrounding old building as the foreground. Beautiful.

A must see, especially the view. This mosque is a little bit of a hike from the Old City, but not that far. It should be considered a must-see. The view over the Bosphorus, Golden Horn, Galata Tower and the New City, and Asia is spectacular! And the inside is light and beautiful.

Most beautiful mosque in city!!. Very peaceful, soaring, beautiful! Great views of Istanbul from the grounds. Much less crowded than the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Procedures to enter quite simple.

Awesome. Remember to bring socks and respectful clothing. Shorts , tank tops are not allowed. I would recomment to visit in between praying hours. The mosque itself is beautiful, also the tomb of Suleyman the magnificent is a must, right there in the gardens.
Great alternative to Blue Mosque. Getting into the Blue Mosque is almost impossible unless you want to wait in line for hours. We chose this mosque instead. A little hard to find but worth it.

a must see. This is a must see and its a very impressive site. Its beautiful on the inside and outside. When we visited the mosque was not crowded so we got to take our time. Our guide had great knowledge so this was a fascinating visit.
Beautiful Mosque, Outstanding Views. Decent uphill trek from the Grand Bazaar. Beautiful Mosque, gorgeous grounds, very serene. Surprisingly stunning views of the City. Worth the trip across town.
Wonderful view. It is not only that the mosque itself is marvellous, but also the view from the yard to Beyoglu is amazing

The stand-out mosque in Istanbul. This was a surprisingly wonderful mosque to visit. The area is far less touristy than Sultanahmet and we came upon the mosque up some unprepossessing stairs in a wall. It is a haven of tranquillity and a beautiful example of Sinan's understated but statuesque architecture. It is also the mosque that the local tour guides deem to be the most beautiful and the pinnacle of Ottoman architecture - despite the popularity of the Blue Mosque. Miss the queues at the Blue Mosque and come here instead!

As big as beautiful!. This mosque has it all- it's big, it has an amazing view and a beautiful courtyard. If you have to pick 1 mosque this is the one, it gives you the complete experience without the heavy crowd of the Blue Mosque!

The best Mosque in Istanbul!. What a mosque! It is even better than the overrated blue mosque. Easy to find and the view overlooking the Bosphorus is breath taking. The inside is really spectacular, and it gives an insight of the golden era of the Othman Empire. Mimar Sinan, the architect was an artist!

Better than Blue Mosque. Great view from this Mosque. We found it much nicer the than Blue Mosque and not so crowded. The gardens and surrounds were well maintained. A great little cafe just down from mosque called Safranbolu Borek Pide Salonu was worth the find.
10/10. Its so beautifull when you stay in aistanbul you HAVE TO spend time in this mosque it is fantastic and the view are also great

Magnificent structure!. Its an awesome experience to go inside the Suleymaniye Mosque. It is truly spectacular. The entire area around it is very calm and quiet. The mosque itself is a brilliant structure with some very nice paintings encapturing the history of the various empires of Turkey.A must see.
A nice surprise. Went there on a rainy day. It was free and I really enjoyed it almost as much as the Blue Mosque. Didn't get to see too much of the outside grounds, but the inside was beautiful.
Impressive. Calm after the bustle of nearby streets. Uphill climb if approaching from the Golden Horn. Beautifully kept grounds.
It's a long walk but totally worth it.. Biggest mosque in Istanbul. There's a lovely rooftop restaurant nearby from where you can see the whole city.

Much better then Blue Mosque. There are not a lot of people visiting this mosque and I dont know why. It is very beautiful and it is nice to see the place where sultan Suleyman, his son, wife and daughter are buried.

Quick and beautiful . No line. Just walked right in. It's an active mosque so it's quite clean and ornate, which can be a nice change from the old city. Highly recommend stepping in for a second before or after visiting the bazaar.

One of most interesting mosques in Istanbul. It is the second largest mosque in Istanbul. The tombs are worth visiting. Also the cafe behind the mosque offers great views of Istanbul and the Golden Horn

A classic. This mosque was the first mosque I ever visited in Istanbul. Built earlier than the blue mosque and much bigger and grander than the little mosque by the spice market (Rustem Pasha) , built by Sinan in the 16th century, it is the most important mosque in the city. Not only a place of worship, but also a seat of learning and charity., with its own bathhouse , hospital and lodgings. It is a fascinating complex.

Less tourist traffic than Sultanhamet.. Very interesting mosque. Excellent view of the Golden Horn. The back of the mosque contains the burial sight of many dignataries, including Suleyman the Magnificent and his wife Hürrem.

Blue Mosque. I must be sincere and nothing to disliked !!!!!!! This is an amazing place, full of magic. Dont loose the chance to visit inside mosque! Have a turkish coffee nearby and enjoy that magnificient view ....... wordless !!!!!!!!!

Great place to visit!. We had a great time visiting this mosque. There were very few people there compared to the Hagia Sofia and other main attractions. It was quiet and we could walk around, look, and take pictures without huge crowds all over the place. The view of the Golden Horn is great! A little far away from the main attractions. But well worth the walk!

Largest mosque of Istanbul. Largest mosque of Istanbul, and from the outside a great building, especially the views from the Bosphorus. Shorter queue than the Blue mosque because it is a bit further from the historic centre, but well worth the walk. Close to the Grand Bazar.

great!. Only seen it on the outside because I was getting short on time, but boy, this mosque is HUGE and beautiful. It's a less overrun by people then the blue mosque which makes the visit more enjoyable, it's located on the top of a hill and has a nice yard that offers you a breathtaking view on Istanbul.
great view. There's a great view over the city from the terrace! I found it much more enjoyable to visit here than the crowded Blue Mosque. Its also nice to stroll through the cemetery right outside.

Very beautiful but. The mosque itself was pretty but was a long way to get there. Quite a bit of hiking but still worth to go. Also less people compared to the blue mosque. Overall peaceful and beatiful

Beautiful mosque without the tourist zoo atmosphere. Th is mosque is close to 500 years old but has been renovated in the past few years. It is a grand complex. It is as good if not better than the blue mosque, but with little to no crowds in comparison and with little to no hassle around it either. In addition outside the mosque there is a great view of the city and water due to the fact it is up the hill a bit. Definitely worth seeing if you want to see a mosque.

Fantastic View. One of the best views of the river from the grounds of the mosque. The mosque itself is a "Must See" Very spacious and serene. Lovely place to stroll or just to sit and admire the view. Not far (walking distance) from the old Roman Valens Aqueduct.

Beautiful. This mosque was a beautiful, meditative place with a gorgeous interior. It was interesting to compare it to the Blue Mosque which, although beautiful, feels a bit like a zoo with all of the tourists.

nothing much to see or do inside. Its an old mosque.. nothing much to see or do inside . one can admire the ceiling of the complex .there are name tags of ALLAH and prophet saww and all khulfa and ahle bayt ( hazrat imam hasan and hussain RA)

The beauty of the blue mosque but without the crowds. The Suleymaniye mosque is the largest mosque in Istanbul, located a steep hike up the ‘Third hill’ of Istanbul. Despite this it receives only a fraction of the popularity and visitors as its famous cousin. It was built in the 1500’s under the direction of Mimar Sinan and is structurally similar to the blue mosque. A famous point of difference is in the garden behind the main mosque which contains the two mausoleums containing the tombs of Sultan Suleiman I and his wife Hurrem.It is free to enter although the standard dress code applies (women need scarves). It is an uphill walk from the grand bizarre. The two things I enjoyed most were (1) The spectacular views of the bosphorous (2) The steep reduction in tourist numbers. This allows you time to explore the interior of the mosque without being herded like cattle, a process which steeply undermined the blue mosque.I definitely think it’s worth the extra effort getting here.
A great place to visit. If you want to see the tomb of Suleiman take care to be there before 17.00 o'clock as it closes. A perfect view of both sides of Istanbul and great grounds and history.
Wonderful mosque. Greatly enjoyed the visit to the mosques, reading the history behind its build.Great place to visit around.

The museum and its surroundings. Less interesting than the Topkapi. If a choice has to be made between the two, visit the latter. Interesting understand the grandeur and the fall of the Ottoman Empire and culture.

Stunning. From every ferry you can see this mosque lighting up the skyline. It is quiet inside, not as crowded as the Blue Mosque. The marble columns are magnificent. Enjoy the lovely grounds and the view of the Bosporous. If the cemetery is open you can see the tombs of Sultan and his wife.
Beautiful Mosque. We happened upon this one and we were glad we did. Beautiful location and views and beautiful inside.
next to big closed market. it is really interesting to visit the mosques of istanbul.one of them and really beautiful it the suleimaniye mosque.

Magnificent mosque . If you have been to Istanbul and you did not visit this mosque then you saw nothing ... It's mind blowing , amazing , beautiful , largest and grandest mosque in Istanbul ☺️ the view from the side garden was amazing too and there are tombs of Sultan the magnificent , his one and only legal wife Hurrem Sultan , and their daughter Mihirma Sultan and many more tombs were there . (Back garden of the mosque)
Beautiful and Serene. Its is amazing from the outside and inside. Definately try and spend time in there if you can. It is worth the visit even with tons of tourists around.
Amazing mosque:-). Wow,unbelievable mosque.A must visit for all.we went with our 4 children and they all loved it.such a great sight and wonderful peaceful mosque.a must view for all:-)

Amazing mosque,a must see. Wow,what do I say,you have to see to understand the beauty of this wonderful mosque.we went with our 4 children and loved it.so glad we visited:-)You can't visit Turkey and not visit this mosque.
Grandiose. As all mosques of the great Sinan it is beautiful and peaceful...Always a good way to sit and be quiet in the chaos of Istanbul
Quiet and peaceful. This mosque is so much quieter than those in Sultanhamet. Lovely views up and down the Bosphorus from the walls. Ladies, remember to bring a headscarf!

A lovely mosque with fewer tourists. This mosque was a bit out of the way near Istanbul University. It is easy to reach by taking the trolly to the university stop and then walking a few blocks. Like other mosques it is not highly decorated but has several domes that make it quite spectacular. It is closed to tourists for 45 minutes during prayer call but there are several restaurants close by to sit and relax while waiting for it to reopen to visitors.

Best mosque to visit. This mosque out shines the Blue Mosque. Not just size and location but beauty and peacefulness make this a stand out. This is the essence of spiritual resonance, without the jostling crowds of the Blue Mosque.
Don't miss it. Better than the Blue Mosque and no queues; a little difficult to get to but well worth the effort. And great views of the city
Big Mosque. It is an art monument, a great one. You can admire the special architecture and the big walls. It worth!

An impressive mosque on top of a hill with a wonderful view. Perched on the top of a hill is this beautiful mosque. Its interior is similar to the Haghia Sophia, but feels calmer and quieter, with less colour and vibrancy. Its simpler design lends a more tranquil feel to the place.In the adjacent cemetery grounds are the tombs of Suleyman the Magnificent and his wife Roxelana. The architect of this mosque Sinan is also buried here in a tomb he designed himself.The gardens surrounding the mosque have a wonderful view of the Golden Horn.

Just your typical, monumental, gorgeous mosque.. It's a little trek up a fairly steep hill, but well worth it. Not as ornamented as the Hagia Siphia, but still full of colors and textures that make this a must see. Being only 500 years old, a baby compared to the HagiaSophia, it is perfectly preserved. No shorts here and women must wear scarfs.

Go for the Mosque, and the view . We went in the morning, 9ish. Very few tourists there then. We were able to essentials be alone in this magnificent building. Walked all around the grounds and enjoyed the spectacular view of the city.. It's a short walk to the grand bazaar from here so it makes a nice combo day trip to this area of Istanbul. The mosque itself can be photographed well from the Galata Bridge too.

History. We liked the mosque as a building and how wonderful it looks and it's history but have to confess that once you have seen a big mosque or a big old cathedral it sort of blurs.Someone once described it to me as the ABC syndrome which means bluntly :another bloody castle/cathedral or in our case a mosque and there is only so much information about a particular building that our poor brains can stretch to retain.

Truly amazing building.... This was one of the highlights of my visit in Istanbul.The queue can bi quite long so get there early... don't know when the queue is the shortest. (I walked buy 3 times and the last one was on a Monday 30min before evening prayer on a rainy day.. there was no queue!)On Saturday and Sunday it had long queues...Be wary that there are a lot of hagglers outside the gates to the mosque saying the you can't get in the mosque from this gate and will try and guide you to one of their carpet/leather shops.. (You can get in from every gate! and just walk to the entrance through the courtyard - they will not follow you inside).Be respectful and dress appropriately, they will give you a scarf for your head if you are a woman and cover your shoulder/knees also with other scarfs that they provide.And for me also long pants, or if waring shorts you will get a scarf to cover up knees.

Serene and beautiful. The simplicity of this mosque is beautiful. What makes this such a special place is the overview of all of Istanbul and the golden horn. It is breathtaking. Right beside this mosque is the Suleymaniye Hamam, which was a treat!

Beautiful ... a must see if you are in Istanbul. A beautiful mosque ... and a wonderful leisurely walk through the area. The building itself is a wonderful architectural wonder as is the religious significance. Recommend a half day to go and visit.

Be ready to visit. Check time and clothes.. Few times I have toyed to go there, but it was time for pray. Then it was Friday morning close for visiting. And it was really big line of people waiting to come inside. Finally on Saturday morning we get there. Near the mosque workers check how you wear. Woman must cover the head with the scarf. Man and woman must cover hands and legs. Man can not go in shorts, woman can not go in short skirt. On the entrance to the mosque there is carpet and workers check that u take off your shoes put them in bag with u and then u can walk inside . So I recommend you to have socks for walk inside . This place is amazing so big, so great, you will be very excited to see it inside . Make lots of pictures and feel the energy of history and spirit .

WOW - the view is worth the hike!. This is one of those rare places in Istanbul where I would say the mosque and grounds is worth the hike up the hill! The view of istanbul's Golden Horn makes this a hike well worth the effort. Or take the metro to Veznicilar and walk from there! Make sure you go to one of the roof top terraces and take in the view - simply amazing! It is on my list of must see places when visitors come to Istanbul!

Nice but not much to see. We enjoyed the walk about that we took to get here. It is an impressive mosque and you can enjoy the builing and its surroundings, but unless you are particularly interested in mosques then I can t say that it is the most exciting place to visit.

lovely mosque. We we're staying at a hotel very near to this mosque, its on one of Istanbul 3 hills,lovely and soaring at the very top of hill,a bit of a walk but well worth the effort. Its like something out of the Arabian nights, tall minarets and domes really beautiful ceiling huge chandeliers,lovely stained glass windows truly amazing, near by the tomb of the architect Mimar Sinan well worth a list and its free.

Our favorite site in Istanbul. We loved the grounds of this mosque that was high above the city on one of it's 7 hills. We had unparalleled views of the city and Bosphorus Sea that were unmatched at any other site . Don't miss a visit to this magnificent mosque.
Great history and Islamic Information. Amazing structure with peace and tranquility. Must be aptly dressed, Avoid prayers times as no visitors are allowed then.
Stunning mosque. This is one of the most beautiful mosque I've seen in Istanbul, I think it's my favourite one, there's a magic atmosphere surrounding it, and it's definitely worth a visit.
Definitely worth seeing inside.. First time entering a mosque built more than 200 years ago. It contains one of the largest dome structure in the world as well as numerous tiles and arabic scripts.

A truly great place to visit. I visited this Mosque while walking through the Spice Markets. It is truly awe inspiring and very peaceful if you arrive through the middle of the day otherwise really busy. It is the largest mosque in Istanbul and the grounds a really great to explore.
Whole Building is an Art. It's a place where you can find inner peace. Whole building, inside and outside, is an art. When you are in the mosque , you fell something very special deep in your heart
Superb example of 16th century architect. The brilliance of architect Sinan's work. Less frequented than many other mosques, it shows brilliant design amd construction.

An Old Building with Sophisticated Technology. This mosque is one of the works of Mimar Sinan, the Ottoman architect genius. It uses earthquake-proof technology with rings around the foundations of its minarets, that was only found out later when modern engineers was going to add them.It also has ventilations to manage the flow of smokes from candles that were used to light the inside of the mosque, so that the smokes did not stain the walls.Another bright thing is that it uses ostrich eggs hung together with the chandeliers that is said to repel unwanted animals such as snakes and scorpions with the frequency generated from the eggs.From the back yard you can see a beautiful view to the sea.

I liked it better than Blue Mosque, recently renovated. There a lot of Mosques in Istanbul, but I am happy that we did not missed Suleymaniye Mosque. It was recently renovated, so it is beautiful, the garden too and you have a great view from the garden. There were some voluntaries who speaks english and encouraged you to ask about the mosque, about islam, about habits..etc. they were really kind. In the garden there are the tombs of Suleymanye and his wife Hürrem. (However Suleymanye was died in Hungary and his body was burried there). To enter to the Mosque is free, and there is a public toilet in the garden (1 TL)

Beautiful Mosque, a must see, and don't forget the view. Nice mosque, close to the university. When you come from the Big Bazaar, you can cross the university terrain, which is really nice to pass on. Once you see the Suleymaniye Mosque, you can walk down some stairs and enter the Mosque garden. Do not forget to go inside, since it is really nice.

Go, go, go!. This mosque has just reopened after extensive renovation. We missed it on our first visit to Istanbul in 2008 but made sure not to miss it this time. It is worth the trip. It's a little ways outside of the historic old city so the crowds are much smaller. And the renovation has left it in must-see condition.

Agree with Rave Reviews. In my opinion one of the finest mosques in the world, and the atmosphere is peaceful and serene. Here the views of the city and water combine with the stateliness of the structure to make a visit more than worth the uphill hike. Plan on spending some time just resting from the more hectic tourist areas and enjoying the mosque's interior without the rush or crowds of the Sultanahmet attractions.

Not to miss. Try to visit, even if you have only little time - we liked this mosque even better than the blue mosque, beautiful, enlightening, less crowds. take some time to explore area around the mosque, too

Beautiful mosque but be careful with your belongings!. The mosque and the courtyard were stunning, but we lost our bag here after leaving it with our shoes. The mosque is definitely worth a visit but keep your belongings with you!

After Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque... .. a bit of a letdown. The former 2 are just breathtaking. The first for its antiquity and the boldness of its innovative architecture, the second for the exquisite perfection of that same basic design. Suleymaniye is just a bit spare.

Beautiful mosque and grounds - with no lines!. This mosque is a little out of the way but definitely worth a visit.
Mosques, grounds and cemetery were beautiful. Unfortunately, mausoleums were closed when we were there.
Magnificent Camii. The most towering mosque in Istanbul. I simply loved it and its wonderful blues. It is absolutely thrilling. A must see!
Be sure to visit this mosque. The Blue Mosque is almost always crowded, and can be odorous when weather is warm. This mosque is far less crowded and unique.

Beautiful and quiet place. Very nice mosque, its a perfect place for tired tourists, we just sat down on the carpet and look at its astonishing interior. Worth visiting, you can ask locals about details you want to know about the mosque; we met there a volunteer, who kindly answered our questions. There were just a few people inside, its a quiet place.

Incredible. we were early in the morning - so not too crowded
entrance is free
also please consider - that you will need to take off your shoes. It was quite uncomfortable for me as I was wearing high boots. There were small packets, but still.
we were facinated by the beauty of the building
must visit for sure!

Better than the Blue Mosque!!. My wife and I ended up touring the Suleymaniye Mosque because we rode the metro to the neighborhood and had to pass through the mosque to get to where we wanted to go. This stop was well worth it!! The grounds are stunning and provide wonderful views of the Bosporus. It is off the beaten path and not overwhelmed with tourists so you can enjoy the views in peace. Finally, an impressive example of architecture.

Gorgeous mosque (I like it better than Sultanahmet). This is my favorite of the city's mosques. I love the courtyard, the walk to that area is interesting, and the mosque is less busy (artistically and tourist-wise) than Sultanahmet)
Suleymaniye. Worth spending a while reading about the background and seeing all the different areas as this will add to the experience but if not the buildings are still lovely.

A MUST for Mosque visitors!. I can't believe why a place like this does not get more hype, as with the case of Ayasofia and The Blue Mosque. In fact this should be considered a MUST for Mosque-lovers!Exquisite architecture both inside and out, impeccable taken-care-off gardens, located in a high point of Istanbul on which you can have a great view of the city, plus a burial site which holds the remains of Suleyman the Great, simply AMAZING!A bit further away from central Istanbul but you'll be rewarded with sightseeing to remember for a lifetime!
Spectacular Mosque. Friendly help with describing the Mosque is available to travelers inside the structure. It is actually very easy to walk to from other historic areas.

First time in my life removed shoes were stolen!. First time in my life the shoes of my two friends left in the Mosque were stolen! More over the security, after theirs claims had brought a new plastic packed rubber slippers. So it means it happens frequently!

Straight from the Arabian nights and a period of enlightenment. the atmosphere was fantastic all that history , a very moving experience ,the work and effort put into constructing this building is awesome , you can quickly understand the power and wealth of the ottermans and their desire to leave a lasting legacy and tribute to their religious beliefs ,The whole atmosphere in Sultanahmet is electrifying and the areas around the major mosques and tourist attractions are clean and tidy and a great credit to those looking after the tourism industry ,I have visited many important historic religious sites but this one beets them all , No touts no beggars just a quality unforgettable experience
Historical Place. It's a historical and religious place with nice architecture. It's an old mosque and delight to tourists.
lovely. Very nice architecture and lovely grounds. Not as congested as the blue mosque. Nice to walk around the area as well, since there is a University close by and you see a lot of locals :)

Needs more care. Süleymaniye Camii is located in Zeyrek,Fatih area of İstanbul on European side.This is not one of the touristic attractions in its kind,so this holly place is always quite to visit.However,it needs more care with maintenance and cleaning.Good option to see it if you are off the touristic route in this area.

A beautiful sight. We stumbled across this mosque by accident, but were very glad we did. On the outside, it's a fantastic mosque in the same style as many others in Istanbul, but with an incredible view of the city and water from its hilltop perch. Inside, the interior is even more beautiful than the Blue Mosque. This one is definitely worth a trip up the hill.
Wow!. What a fantastic building, we did not go in but was impressed at the size of the complex and as there are approx. 2500 mosques to visit, there would not have been enough time!
Nothing special. nice but nothing special, not worth a visit if you have only 3 days in Istanbul - should have done something else instead.
Beautiful!. The biggest mosque of Istanbul, with a beautiful interior and exterior. Must visit for Muslims especially.

Perfect atmosphere, nice views. Very nice mosque with wonderful interior, calm atmosphere, volunteers waiting to help you to explain local traditions, Islam, turkish life.Plan the visit at the end of the day, recommend to visit everyone during sunset, from outside of mosque there is a great view of Istanbul, free entrance
Lovely. A sample of a less ornate yet still magnificent mosque. There are also tombs on site, which were closed when we were there. We were able to peer in though. Fascinating experience.

few tourists. Great view.. So this mosque is the second biggest in Istanbul but is the most beautiful one, and you really tell that. Located not far from eminönü tram stop, 10 minutes by foot, passing by the spice bazar. It is on an elevated area, so take a good cam with you as you will be able to see most of Istanbul from up there. No crowding inside like the blue mosque and a free tourist guide offered us information and answering questions about the mosque. No entrance fee as in all other mosques in Istanbul. A must go to if you are visiting Istanbul.
Fantastic interior. Visited on our first day and wasn't disappointed. Lovely decor, such a peaceful place to visit. Quite central but easy to reach using public transport

If you want to visit a single mosque, the this is the one to choose. The most magnificent mosque of Istanbul, not only the inside but also the two adjacent courtyards reflect the perfect architecture of the master architect. The view from the side courtyard reflects the harmony of the space. Its worth to do a walk around.

Exquisite and Simple. Less crowded and magnificently maintained, the Suleymaniye Mosque is a must for any trip to Istanbul. My guide even says he prefers this mosque over the Blue Mosque, as there are no crowds and the simplicity of the interior is true to form for Muslim places of worship. I have to say the highlight was watching a father teach his two sons how to do the prayers. Go and experience the wonder yourself...

Worth the Visit. The largest mosque in Istanbul is easy to get to, is free of charge, and worth a visit. Make sure to check the prayer times as no tourists may enter during prayer. We got there around 1:30pm and had to wait about 20 minutes until they re-opened. Like some other mosques in Istanbul, women must wear scarves and shoes must be removed (they have plastic bag dispensers if you forget to bring your own bag). Take time to wander by the northern walls for a view of the water and Northern part of Istanbul. There's also a cemetery behind the church that is possible to visit.
A grand mosque.. Splendid Islamic architecture, well maintained in and around. Caters to the local people and tourists with tradition and acceptance.

Worth a visit. Worth a visit and very close to the University and the Grand Bazaar, so not difficult to find. Much more peaceful than the blue mosque. Lovely views from the garden as it sits on the third hill of istanbul.

Finest of Islamic architecture. This beautiful mosque has 6 medreses, soup kitchen, a school, shops amongst others. It has 4 minarets The stained glass windows are absolutely stunning with such detail.Be sure to have socks. Ladies should be modestly dressed and wear a headscarf.

Location! Location!. This grand mosque is situated atop one of the hills of Istanbul commanding spectacular views over the city ... including the famed city rooftops so often photographed. There is a cemetery on the grounds near the mausoleums; the graves are planted with Irises which were beautiful in April.
Nice and quiet Mosque. Placed on a hill has a nice view over Golden Horn. Is free to visit and is not so crowded like Hagia Sophia or Sultanahmet Mosque (Blue Mosque)
Must see. Free entrance, one of the things to see. Be sure to be very respectfull of others while visiting. Women must always cover their head.

Nice. Nice but not really impressive. A short visit is sufficient
Go in the early morning so you do not have wait long

Not quite what I was expecting. Before I start, the Blue Mosque is very impressive. However, somehow I was expecting more. It is relatively new, being only 500 years old as opposed to the 1500 for Ayasofia. The floor space is enormous but is fairly sterile. While the Ayasofia is geared for tourists, Suleymaniye is a working mosque and is, therefore, primarily a place of worship, not a tourist attraction. The requirements for entry are similar to going to the great Basilicas in Rome, i.e.men and women must have their legs covered and women must cover their hair. However, unlike Rome, if you don't have the wherewithal, they will provide a wrap to cover legs and scarves for hair. The interior is very solemn and one is reminded of the nature of the building. The walls are covered with blue decoration, hence the name, which is truly beautiful. It is well worth the time spent, but don't expect the wall to wall antiquity of Ayasofia. It is a place of worship and deserves the respect one should give it.

The most beautiful mosque complex in Istanbul, not crowded and nice view from the viewing terrace. From the outside, the most beutiful mosque in Istanbul. The interior was very simple comparing to the Blue Mosque for example, but still beautiful.The are no lines, it is free and if you don't have your own scarf, they will borrow you one. I just loved the surrounding buildings of the mosque complex, with the many many little domes, lovely :). Go in from the university gates, there is a platform you can get a great view to the mosque!There is also a nice view over the little domes to the city and Bosphorous.Over all, this was the nicest mosque we visited in Istanbul. If you don't have much time, skip the Blue mosque (which was also very beautiful!) and visit this one instead!

Skip blue mosque, go here. Don't understand why hords of tourist stand in line for the blue mosque if you can be by yourself in this 10x more beautiful Sinan masterpiece. What a difference! Tip: visit the Prince's mosque too, you will be allby yourself. Especially before 10 am in the morning.m

The most beautiful mosque I've ever seen. There's a lot of mosques in istambul and this one is by far the most beautiful to me because of the history behind and the modern architecture it has. I recommend to take time to see all the details.

Wonderful architecture with history... It is one of the few big historic mosque and still in use today with history which will interest you. Actually these are big ones with beautiful artworks inside on the walls and tombs.
Amazing. Make the effort to visit this mosque as it is outstanding inside and in my opinion nice than the Blue Mosque. It is just beyond the Grand Bazaar so not too far away.

Must visit. I loved this mosque, the atmosphere, all the life going on inside and the imposing architecture. We went at night when there was a full moon then we went back again during the day. Well worth a visit.

Superb architecture of Mimar Sinan. This very beatiful mosque was designed by Mimar Sinan by order of Sultan Suleiman. I think it is the combination of the tall, slender minarets and the large domes that fascinates me. I should also add that there were volunteer guides there who were very knowledgeable about the mosque, the architect and history in addition to different issues regarding islam as a religion.

Impressive. This was the second Mosque that I visited. The grounds and the Mosque itself are impressive. I also appreciated the placards which contained information about Islam. And yes you can get all that information online etc. but being in the Mosque itself makes a difference. We stayed in there for around 15 mins.

Beautiful Mosque. Beautiful mosque with some interesting descriptions of Islam on the inside. Volunteer inside very happy to answer any questions in English. Learned a few things. :-) No queue to get in and no fee either. About a 10 minute walk from the Grand Bazaar and well worth it. Beautiful grounds with view over the Bosphorus.

Peaceful. Built around a beautiful marble courtyard, this is a beautiful place to spend some time appreciating the amazing architecture and magnificence that surrounds you. not so crowded as some of the other places in Istanbul.

Less busy than Blue Mosque. This mosque is located in the Bazaar district and is about a 25 minute walk for the Blue Mosque in the Sultanahmet district.It has beautiful grounds and the architecture is fantastic. You can only fully appreciate how beautiful it is by actually being there.There is a designated visitor entrance, they do not allow you to enter during prayer times so you may have to wait to enter however this was no problem as you can explore the outside.This mosque was also far less busy than the Blue Mosque.

best architecture. the mosque has unique architectural themes and it has also great location in the city of Istanbul where you can find near by bazars and traditional shops for old and antique collections
A surprise. The smaller size and coloring, its clever architectural details, the complexity of the compound--my favorite sight
beautiful mosque. beautiful mosque and excellent restaurant serving local food(white beans called fasulye)guide was very descriptive and informative

Massive building, mind blowing decoration, and Suleyman!. Wanted to check this place out after the Blue Mosque proved too crowded. It's actually a short hoof or metro ride from Sultanahmet. Fewer people and excellent view made this place a nice spot to linger and contemplate. Plus Suleyman's there!

Better than the blue. Sitting on a hilltop with greater view and fewer tourist this is a place to visit unless your already "mosqued out". Lovely courtyards and gardens around the place. Worth the extra effort.

Amazing architecture. Istanbul has a lot of mosques, and each and every single site is amazing. The Süleymaniye Mosque is one of my favorite mosques. The architecture is very impressive, the acoustics are amazing and the whole structure is a site with full social services.This historical site survived several earth quakes and the structure is still undamaged.Around the mosque, you will find wonderful cafés and restaurants.
its a must in Istanbul. although its too crowded inside,we don't even have a photo with no other ppls fingers or hair somewhere in the pictures ,its a place where you'll regrets if you missed it .

Serene and Beautiful. The mosque is set in such a beautiful location that the view offered is a good incentive for you to visit it. Compared to other mosques, this place may not be very extensive in its décor since its simple but its elegant and stands at par with other beautiful ottoman architectures around the city. While at here, one should not miss the beautiful view of the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus from up here. The view is the best and makes it worth the visit. The mosque is also set midst a Bazaar and shopping can be another activity on your list of things to do while visiting the mosque
Grand yet inviting. Not as well-known as the Blue Mosque, the Suleymaniye Mosque is grand yet inviting. It is a worth a visit if you are in the area / vicintiy of the Grand Bazaar.
grand mosque. it's a beautiful place to see. interesting history of the place too. Especially the areas where they have to wash first before entering the Mosque.

great. after seeing more than 10 mosques in istanbul i think is one of the most imposing and beautiful .... the location is great you can see bosporous from the garden and its very important since süleyman himself and his beloved wife hürrem are being buried in the nearby tombs ... you also see the mosque when you come from a small trip from prince islands or dolma bahce palace .... and in the night is so nicely to look at it from the sea ....
Spectacular. Beautiful setting with an amazing view from the terrace across Istanbul. Inside the mosque has amazing ceilings. It does rival the blue mosque for beauty and there were no queues!

Grand and beautiful. It is quite close to the Grand Bazaar and has a great beauty, a great size. It can be easily seen from the other side of the Golden Horn. From the courtyard you can see a great picture of the Golden Horn and Galata area with dozens of ships. Inside is an atmosphere of prayer, which invites you to calm, peace and introspection. Are present explanatory panels about Islam and Prophet Muhammad

Worth to come although Similiar!. It's so much similiar to Blue masque but of course it is lot more bigger and you can see nice view from the city from there and nice views inside and outside of the masque.Also you can see the tomb of Soltan Soleiman and his wife!The masque seems to be well made and very new!I suggest you to go there after you finished your tour in Sultanahmed area!you can get Tramva from Sultanahmed to Beyazit and then ask and follow the university and you will get to the masque.Please go there when the sunlight is ok cuase of security.After visiting you can come on the right side of the masque and walking in downhill till you get near the sea (Eminonu).in the streets you can find nice good price things!Go there,and visit the biggest masque.
beautiful. liked a lot, beautiful inside, you have to take your shoes off, be ready. try not to get inside too close to praying time, you will have to leave

Big Mosque with very nice view. When visiting Istanbul you are definitely should pay a visit to one of it's best mosques, which is located on the hill, overlooking Golden Horn. Mosque itself looks more laconic than Blue Mosque or New Mosque - it's decorations are simpler, but yet even more beautiful. Also, don't forget to take a look from the balcony yard to Golden Horn and Bosphorus - in my oppinion it's even better than from Galata tower and it's absolutely free!

Massive structure. A huge building that fills the air with Calls to Prayer. Overwhelming experience to enjoy. Walking around the site has you wondering what it would have been like to live in 'Constantinople".

Quintessential Ottoman mosque. Atop one of the lovely hills of Istanbul, this mosque is a must-see. Built by Mimar Sinan, the Ottoman architect par excellence, this imperial mosque is an enormously important landmark for Ottoman architecture, and also a much more authentic and relaxed visit than the busy Blue Mosque. Definitely make sure you take in the view of the Golden Horn from the courtyard and take a stroll through the graveyard to see the tombs of Suleyman and his wife, Harem Sultan/Roxelana. Reading up on their history before you visit for a better appreciation of the place.
