Gorgeous. The Mosque is beautiful with a serene feeling inside. This should not be missed when traveling to Istanbul.

holy experience. we visited almost every mosque in Istanbul over 2 visits but spending a Friday and being able to pray fridays there we more special and spiritually fulfilling than other mosques. other than the architecture of the mosque and the parks around it .. its location on the top of the hill was simply amazing

Beautiful!. A beautiful, huge mosque! Instead of the Blue Mosque, we visited this one, as recommended by friends. A wonderful experience – except for the fact that only a few square meters’ corner of this huge place is reserved for women to pray... But, alas, that’s something that comes with the territory.Also the surroundings of the mosque are wonderful, including a beautiful view over the city. No queues, only a handful of people when we went there last week.

Contempletive. This doesn't have the WOW factor of the Blue Mosque with its verses, tile and other decoration. Instead it is understated and simple and warmer. Come and experience it, then leave with a sense of calm. ThenTake in the view from the grounds, the city, the gardens and the architecture. And not one offer of a shoe shine!

Not as impressive as I thought. The mosque of Suleyman the Magnificent was a bit disappointing, although it is truely big and harmonious inside, something was wrong with the dome, it had different colours and decorations than the rest of the building, and that seemed odd.. But it is in a very nice location, overlooking the Golden Horn, and so it's worth the visit.

Don't miss it. Don't miss this old architectural monument even if you stay just one day in Istanbul. It is a great monument, very spacious with a large green garden with flowers and a big interiour court with spectacular arhitectural design. Inside you can admire the big and spacious mosque with stained glass windows and it's architectural scultures and cupola. The chandeliers inside are also a wonderfull piece of work. The central one is the most impressive
Best Mosque. The mosque is quite and female tourists can go under the central dome and that just changes the overall experience.

one of the most beautiful mosques in the world. don't miss the opportunity to visit this place, its great architecture and stained-glass windows will impress you a lot. the access is free, if you forget to take a scarf (i'm speaking for ladies) - don't worry -You'll be given it on the entrance
Great views!. One of my favorite mosque to visit. The views of the city were amazing! A highlight was talking to the volunteer for 25 mins about Islam and Muslims.

impressive, friendly volunteers. The mosque itself is very big and impressive. It was opened for tourists after 13:00 and they are well-prepared for them. Tourists can be in the back of the mosque, there were some volunteers who can answer questions about the mosque, Islam and probably any question a tourist could have. Outside on one side of the mosque you have a great view (you will get Bosphorus bridge and Beyoglu with Galata tower on one picture). On the other side there are some restaurants that sell good and cheap foor, especially Kuru Fasulye (9TL including rice, drink and small salade)

nice palace. the mosque is huge and shows the excellent ottoman empire. it is better to buy the direct entry pass from your hotel as everywhere there are huge ques and hence to save time, you should buy the fast access pass. the mosque is studded with the islamic architecture and is very beautiful.
Gorgeous!. This mosque is better than the Blue Mosque. It is not as big, but is much more beautiful and less touristy.
One of the "must sees". There are over 1000 mosques in Istanbul, so you'll have to pick and choose which ones to see. This one is one of those that makes the list.

Peacefully beautiful. What an amazing feeling you get when you entre this place of peace and sanctuary. It was my first visit to a mosque so i was unsure of the etiquette. The gentleman outside explaned and also gave me a headscarf to put on. Im so very pleased I took the time to enter & not just admire the building from outside. The information at the gate was intriguing. Well worth the visit.

Very Impressive!!!. If you are Istanbul you most visit this mosque... it doesn't matter if you are of the faith or not this place is worth the visit! I loved it!!If you are a female out of respect you must wear a headscarf... outside of the Mosque and around the city it is not needed... only in holy places like this one. Knowing this ahead of time I bought a cute little headscarf to wear inside of the mosques. Make sure you look up the times of prayers as the Mosques close for the tourists while they are in prayer. be sire to go at least 20-30 min after the prayer or an hour before.
Ottoman art. The mosque is excellent and I can recommned you the graveyard next to the mosque is full of Ottoman tombstones & sarcopgahus
interesting. Nice to see and learn more about the history. Better to buy an audio book, or have with you a written guide.

Ladies, bring your own scarf. Very easy access between prayer times. You no longer have to leave your shoes at the front door. In fact, you now enter at the back side. You get to carry your shoes in a plastic bag. Be warned, the carpet smells like well used gym shoes. And if you are wearing socks, they will assume that odor. Despite that, it is a beautiful structure and easy to move through. Entry is free, but if you wish to make a donation at the exit, you will receive a receipt.

Splendid. Very nice and relaxing place. It is not so overcrowded as Sultanahmet, but definitely is a must go place. In the back side of the Mosque there are the tombs of Kanuni Sultan Süleyman and Haseki Hürrəm Sultan, as well as many of those from Hanidan family. After leaving the place, in case you are lucky, then you will get a taxi passing by, otherwise it will be about 1,5 km way to the seaside through the small shops and narrow streets.
Peaceful pause. Beautiful mosque and friendly, non-pushy students there to answer questions about Islam and Turkish culture.

Amazing Mosque. I liked the interior of the mosque so much. I liked the view of Bosphorus from the mosque yard (try to look for it, the point where you can see the view is not very clear, but if you find it, you'll have a nice photo indeed)

Spectacular, Quite Austere Mosque. Well worth a visit. The Suleymaniye doesn't have the baroque details of some other mosques, especially the ones that were originally churches. It is quite beautiful, quite austere, and quite impressive.

Serene buiding with wonderful views. Quite different from the Blue Mosque, the Slueymaniye sits high above the city with a terrace that has superb views over the Golden Horn and Bosphorus. It's very calm and simple with a lovely serene quality. The immediate area is being restored (some way to go though) and is now a conservation area.

Peaceful. This large mosque sits on a hill, towering over the Old City. One enters the wall around the mosque into a garden. On a sunny day, the grass, flowers, trees provide a beautiful setting to the mosque and its minarets. This mosque was less crowded than the Blue Mosque and there was no entry fee. Follow the signs to the visitors’ entry off a beautiful open marble courtyard. Modest clothing for women and head covering is required; shoes are removed at the entrance. There is no entry during a prayer service and hours of these are posted. Once in the mosque, there is a large carpeted area where visitors can photograph (no flash, no tripods) the central area under the dome. The decorations within the mosque are different from the Blue Mosque so it is a worth a visit. There are no other areas inside the mosque that can be toured. Exiting to the rear of the mosque, there is a large open area with views across to the new city (e.g., Galata Tower) and of the Bosphorus. Returning to the front entryway, walk through a peaceful walled garden with tombstones and two pavilions with the remains of Suleymaniye and his wife. Toilets (WCs) are available in several areas of the mosque grounds. They are large, modern and clean with some European-style toilets.

Beautiful!. The history behind this place is amazing, you can't visit Istanbul without seeing the Suleymaniye Mosque! Read the history or have someone there explain to you how it was designed and built. It'll blow your mind away how intelligent the architects were!

很清幽很美的清真寺 amazing mosque. 喜歡這裡悠閒寧靜的氛圍，雖然要爬一小段坡，但沿路有許多商家，道路也很有特色。清真寺外可以眺望博斯普魯斯海峽的景色，很適合拍照；而進入清真寺感覺放鬆不少，雖然沒有藍色清真寺大，但帶給我的感動卻更多。逛完後清真寺附近有好吃的豆子燉飯，很推薦嘗試看看，是我有史以來吃過最好吃的豆子飯。總之來到伊斯坦堡，一定要造訪這裡。You must be visit here if u come to istanbul!!!
amazing experience. I could attend to the function on Friday. It was a real spiritual experience. The chantings were soul touching.

Best mosque to visit. If you only have to visit one mosque in Istanbul, you better find your way here. It is a bit of a hike, but you will be rewarded for it. Situated within a walled compound, you could miss one of its many entrances if you didn't know how to find it. The compound itself was very beautiful, just like a small park. The view of Istanbul from here was priceless. Inside the mosque, it was serene with few much fewer tourists than the Blue Mosque. Guides are also available if you have any questions about the mosque or Islam.
Don't miss it. Although i don't like to draw comparisons, i have to confess that this is most beautiful Mosque of it's period....
great architect. great architect and perfect atmosphere.feel the real ottoman style mosque and surrounded area of istanbul.its an amazing city with all part of it

Mosque visits. There are some 3000 mosques in Istanbul, however the Blue mosque was breath taking. The trip there could be a bit fraught because of the traffic, particularly getting back to the hotel at the end of the day. Though the tour was well organised be prepared for a LONG VISIOT.
Better than the Blue Mosque. It is well worth the trip up the hill to visit this mosque. The interior is really beautiful and far more colorful than the Blue Mosque.
nice than bluemosque. A little bit hard to find but it deserve the effort . You will see this mosque from every place in the town and it is really amazing
Great. It was big, and very nice, I was amazed of all arcitechture. A bit crowded, but I guess it's normal.

A Bit More Spartan in Design, MUCH Less Crowded than Blue Mosque; Magnificent. While it appears smaller on the inside and not quite so high, the main dome of the Suleiman Mosque is actually larger across than the main dome of the Blue Mosque. In every respect, I found it to be more attractive: cleaner lines, sparer in decoration, better lit, much less crowded. Altogether a delightful even if slightly less transportive experience. Highly recommended!
Must see- but keep ahanky handy!. Great place to visit. However, with hundrerds of people visiting it at the same time, taking of their shoes, the smell is something else....

A hidden treasure. This Mosque and the graveyard around it, including the Tomb of Suleyman the Magnificent are situated on top of a hill that presents the best views of the whole Istanbul panorama. Fewer tourists make it easier to appreciate every corner of this hidden treasure. Even though you can see the mosque from different angles and spots in the city, it is "hidden" from the majority of tourists being not advertised as an important attraction in the tour guides. Please make it a point to take a walk up to this beautiful place in Istanbul.
Fantastic Mosque. Worth the visit! I will return because the thumb of sultan Suleyman and his wife were closed for reconstruction, and I’ve heard that they are very interesting to see
Inner beauty. Amazing place to visit for sure in Istanbul. Stunning view and very peaceful mood if you avoid peak hours. It is really a gem from many points of view.

a must visit. Traditional and the surrounding is amazing.
Istanbul never stops to amaze me, if you are there make sure you go there along with your Cameras and take 1000's of pictures

Better than Blue Mosque!. It is a similar design and era to Sultanahmet Cami (The Blue Mosque), having been designed by Sinan, Istanbul's greatest architect and the teacher of The Blue Mosque's architect. The interior and exterior are similar to The Blue Mosque, but I visited twice, and although it is bigger, there were no crowds. The view from the grounds toward Sultanahmet and Galata Bridge is magnificent and FREE. No lines, unlike the Blue Mosque, definitely worth the visit
Perfect for Sunsets!. Amazing and wonderful free mosque to attend. Make sure to stop by when the sun is setting as well because the view is amazing! The architecture is stunning!

Simply Beautiful & an Absolute Must See. The Sulemaniye Mosque should be the 2nd thing you visit in Istanbul after the Haghia Sophia. We stayed right beside the Blue Mosque but this is an entirely different experience. Set in beautiful gardens, this is a beautiful Mosque & when entering is awe inspiring in design & decour. The Blue Mosque is a get in line & 'quick, get in' experience. This is not. It is completely tranquil without the vast hordes of tourists. Was given a history of the Mosque but a very polite & informative Muslim volunteer who took time to explain lots of parts of the Mosque. You can take your time here & take in everything it has to offer. It's a little further out than most of the 'must see's' but go & see it. Beautiful.....

Magnificient. Atmosphere of Mosque is excellent and it gives you pure peace during pray. And also structure of mosque shows that love of Islam. You need to read and learn more about art of Suleymaniye mosque before visit.

Beautiful mosque. As I understud from talking to locals this is for people of Istanbul most important mosque,maybe due to fact that it was build during the era of Suleiman the Magnificent when Ottoman Empire was at its highest peak. Mosque is really beautiful ,entrance to it is free of charge and there is a besutiful view to Istanbul from the mosque's backyard.
Historical mosque. A sight not to be missed. A full morning required to take everything in but cafe's available and not highly priced. Value for money entrance fees.
Definite evening trip. Nice view of Golden Horn, and Galata, scenic in the evenings, dimensions awesome. Visit after sunset.
Beautiful. Way better than the Blue Mosque! This is a lot bigger and newer, a little bit out of the way though..............................

Nice. Nice architectural wonders
Very bigg mosque
Fascinatig mosques 'mmmmmm Nice architectural wonders
Very bigg mosque
Fascinatig mosques 'mmmmmm

Lovely!. Suleyman's architect did an impressive job! The mosque is impressive, and for those who love the turkish culture and especially the Suleyman's era,it will be fascinate to visit it. Don t miss it.

Excellent view, no queues. Biggest mosque in Istanbul. Was built by genial Mimar Sinan for Suleiman the Magnificent.
It's located on the hill and provides great views on Istanbul.
Must-visit place for "The Magnificent Century" fans, as both Roxelana and Suleiman are buried here.

Amazing. This is beautiful and elegant . Impressive through and through. It may not be grand as Hagia Sophia but it definitely is bigger in size. Also being an active worship place, you have to be careful of what you are wearing. The mosque is an amazing view with the backdrop of sunset illuminating its silhouette. The views from up here are beautiful too.

Superb:) . Architecture of the mosque itself is amazing ( the bonus is free entry:) From behind u can oversee Bosporus and if u r in to the photo taken session that is also the right place to go:) Nice coffee, restaurant around to have a small break in between exploring this big area.Worth visit for sure!Me & hubby stay next to blue mosque so we take tram which takes us almost to the mosque. If u would like to walk it will takes around 30 min.

Beautiful . A must see if you're in Istanbul! Just a short ride in the tram and you are basically at any attraction! Wasn't as great of an atmosphere as if hoped but memorable and beautiful! TIP - for women ... Wear long skirts / thick jeans .. You will still be let in with any bottom half attire but you will be given a fabric to cover yourself with (leggings shorts tights..) I have also visited in the winter when the snow was thick and it was beautiful! I definitely recommend the winter months!!! Very atmospheric compared to the beating sun!

Splendid architecture ,really Grand Mosque . Being a non-Muslim this was the first time i visited a mosque,&the experience was amazing and uniqueThe architecture of the mosque is simply beautiful &magnificient.There was a long queue of visitors to experience the beauty &tranquility of the mosqueEven after a big crowd inside the mosque,it had a peaceful aura .Must visit if one is visiting IstanbulPoints to Keep in mind:>Visitors need to cover legs&arms(in case one is wearning sleeveless attire) (whetheer male or female)>Wearing small dresses or sleeveless dresses aint allowed.>However the mosque admin provides Shawls and Some wrap around cloth if one us wearning short dress/half-pants.However,It is always better to wear something that dsnt show much skin as The mosque is a holy place.P.S.-Do pay a visit to the mosque after sunset.It looks spellbounding with all the lights & a beautiful fountain outside.
Great Istanbul. Great mosque to pray and relax. the mosque is very beautiful. there is a great carpet i can sit and see the architecture

Late morning visit allowed us to avoid the crowds . We arrived at around 10 to find the mosque relatively peaceful and uncrowded. Unlike the nearby Hagia Sophia, this is a working mosque, and so one should seek to visit when the daily prayers aren't in session. This is beautiful and colorful and well worth the visit.

loftyrob198. A must for all visitors to Istanbul the Blue Mosque is an iconic landmark. Free to enter, all visitors must remove footwear and are given plastic bags (for the shoes) for this purpose. First time I have been in a mosque and a pleasant surprise. The architecture and murals were particularly interesting.

Go See It.. If you are visiting the Grand Bazaar, then it will be worth your while to take the 15 minute walk from there to this mosque – you will not be disappointed. It probably doesn’t have the same reputation or popularity as the Blue Mosque, but it is definitely worth seeing every bit as much. Less crowded, a less touristy feel than the Blue Mosque, more peaceful, wonderful architecture, a beautifully decorated interior, and as it is on one of the city’s seven hills, there are great views of the city, the Bosphorus and the Galata Bridge from it’s grounds.

A nice old Mosque, great view of the city!. I huffed and puffed up the hills with my smarphone using walking maps. Wow! Quite a hike that I did not expect, especially lugging 20lbs or so of fabric from a recent purchase. The mosque is quite lovely and open, but I think the best part is the views of the city around and outside. When you try to get here from surrounding parts of Istanbul, try to stick to main roads. My phone map gave me some rather sketchty alleys to climb, and I am sure there were more direct routes and more people for company!

Very beautiful.. Very beautiful mosque in the old city section of Istanbul. My very sweet hotel manager gave a few of us a mini tour of this section and this was one of the stops. Of course no shoes are allowed inside and women must cover their heads. Scarfs are provided at the door.

underrated. i think Suleymaniye Mosque is the most underrated of the big mosques in Istanbul. nonetheless, it is still picturesque. you can get inside for free anytime. at the back is the spice bazaar and across the street is the galata.

Well worth the visit.. Really atmospheric, interesting place to visit. Bit of a queue to get in and note that you need to be dressed appropriately and will be asked to take your shoes off before you go in.

Must see. This mosque is extraordinary, both for its architecture (mainly the exterior) and for its location. If you go there after prayer time (after 14:00), since it is on the top of a hill, it is also recommended to go in one of the local terrace bars to relax and enjoy the breathtaking views across the see and the different districts of Istanbul. A favourite not to be missed!

Beautiful. Took a cab to this Mosque and there was no enterance fee which kind of surprised me. They even have a place where they give the ladies scarfs to cover their head and a plastic to put your shoes when entering the Mosque. It's a beautiful place and everyone should visit it at least once.

one of the must sees in Istanbul. very interesting experience to be inside a mosque, great information was given by the "guides" about Islam, very peaceful place, great views of the city, fantastic architecture! When you're there also great place to have lunch in one of the kebab/doner places (not expensive and delicious!)

Istanbul never sleeps. Well the fact that you have to take off ur shoes, but is their way of life, u even take off ur shoes before u enter a hose, thats the way they take care of theur beautiful rugs, but the mosque is a breath taking buiding
BEAUTIFUL Mosgue. Very big and beautiful place to visitin istanbul ousit the mosgue any restaurant nice view you can see the old city from the place

Largest and best known.. This is the largest mosque in the city and one of the best known sights! This place has great history (it dates back to 1500s) and it is worth picking up one of the leaflets being handed out inside. The architecture and scale of this mosque will leave you amazed. When it was built, the dome was the highest in the Ottoman empire. Like other Ottoman mosques, it has a grand courtyard with columns of granite and marble. To the side and back is an area which house the tombs of the sultan and his family. The architect of this mosque is also buried just outside the mosque walls. What he would make of all the fuss today is anybody’s guess. Oh and there is no charge for going around.
Blue Mosque. Very impressive mosque, not so famous as Hagia Sophia. When a woman, you have to shield your head. They wanted to have 6 Towers and Saudia Arabia would not let them.
Great for quiet reflection since it's not crowded. and great for views of Galata Bridge. For the ornate details and beautiful interior - it's Blue Mosque for you.
Worth the walk. This mosque is quite stunning and although the walk to get to the mosque has some steep streets it is really worth the effort. There is also a strip of very good restaurants opposite!
BEAUTIFUL. This place is amazing. beautiful inside and out. Definitely worth a visit and also everything around it was walking distance.

The most beautiful mosque. Maybe it was the most beautiful mosque we have seen. If you have free time, don't miss it. We visited this mosque after the Bosphorus Tour it can be reached directly from the port on foot.

A mosque on the hill.. This is a beautiful mosque location on the hill area. The mosque itself is very beautiful and not less than Blue mosque, but less crowded. Therefore, you can have some leisure time to. enjoy it. Outside the mosque has a row of restaurants. They all looked great. From the court yard in this mosque, one can have good view of the Galata bridge and the water. It was beautiful
Spiritual time. One if the great mosques of Istanbul and may be the best. Very relaxing place. The area around is not interesting but you should be there.

beautiful mosque and great View. This is a huge mosque and probably among the few which are up hill, so the height give a natural advantage of the view from this mosque. you can see the entire old city from this place.  Mosque itself is very quite and beautiful.
Beautiful. You can spend hours gazing up at the amazing architecture and marvelling at the sumptuous fixtures and fittings
Breathtaking!. Get there very early in the morning and experience the mosque with no one else around! Ladies, be sure to remember a head scarf (duh), or you will not be allowed inside.
One of the nicest mosques in Istabul. Compared to Hagia Sophia and the Blue mosque, this one might be even nicer. Don't miss this one because it is an incredible sight to see.
Impressive!. It's the largest mosque in the city. It's impressive and because of its location it's visible from almost anywhere in the city.
Perfect. Although it was snowing when we visit this place, but it was still one of my favorite places... Nice historical and spiritual place.

Beautiful mosque . Beautiful mosque to visit. Have nothing in the US that can compare to the beauty of this building. I enjoyed my visit. Although i am Muslim, j was in the visitor section in the back quarter of the mosque. It was a cold and rainy day so no line to wait in before entering.Ladies: Hint, avoid wearing leggings/yoga pants, tank tops. Wear conservative, respectful, looser fitting clothes and pack a scarf!

Away from the crowds. You have to walk uphill to get here and that keeps the crowds down. The majesty of the building and grounds are well with it. Don't forget to look for the small understated tomb of the great architect, Sinan who is responsible for many of the beautiful buildings you see. His tomb is just outside the main grounds on a street named after him. There is a small plaque giving some historical context in english
One of My Favorites. This was one of my favorite Mosques to visit in Istanbul. I thought is was very beautiful. However I was sad to see all of the small children begging for coins around it.
Do not miss it !. Super view on the Bosphorus from the gardens of the Mosquee. The interior of the building is gigantic. The Islamic art is really well highlighted in thie Mosquee Suleymaniye.
grand looking Mosque. It is grand looking Mosque, very few tourists, and not thing special to me. It is open all day, near Spicy market.
Incredible the snow made it even more magical.. Some sites in the world take your breathe away and this fits that bill, add this to your list of must see
Takes you back in time. I am a history buff and this place topped the list ! The structure as well as the history that it holds simply transported me back to that era when it had been built.

Everyone must visit. This mosque isn't as popular as Blue Mosque, but we love it more. It has a more misterious and elegant atmosphere. The old buildings used as kithcen, accomodation etc. are still existent for other purposes. If you have a time when you visit Grand Bazaar, you must drop by this place.

Awesome view!!. It has the best outside view in the city.. The massive off white mosque surrounded by lush green grass, the blue sky over it and the view of the sea over the descending smaller tomb tops.. Oooh..it's just breathtaking..! But stay where you are... The interior is a bit of a disappointment after you have seen it from outside.. My advice.. spend the time you have enjoying it from outside.. :) It is so totally worth it..

Who isn't impressed with this mosque?. Sinan's Suleymaniye, is opulent and, yes, luscious. This is one of my favorite places in Istanbul. As with all mosques, wear shoes easy to take on and off, carry your own head scarf, and keep your skin showing for another time and place, they don't want to see it. In case you don't know, all, mosques,or at least all I've visited, have a toilet, it's one of the services mosques provide.
Great guide. We went in winter it was snowy and icy and very slippery on the marble pathways. The mosque was delightful.
beautiful outside. We didn't enter, as the prayers were approaching, but the outside is impressive and the panoramic view from up there is very beautiful.
A great mosque. Apart from Hagia Sophia which was built by the Byzantines (and not the Turks), this is the finest mosque in my opinion. It is just very fine architecture built for Suleyman I in 1538.
SUPER!!. Its a very huge Mesquite and its one of the must beautiful in Istanbul. Its located near the Spice Bazar, if you walk a little more you also can go to Sultanameth in the same day.

The peak of Ottoman architecture. Süleymaniye is the masterpiece of Sinan (Although he doesn't consider it as such) and also of the medieval Ottoman architecture. The place indeed fills you with some holy feelings as soon as you step in it - even if you are a non-believer.

A truly amazing civil engineering achievement. Having survived three big earthquakes without any cracks and structural damage this is a true civil engineering marvel. The architecture is also top and best craftsmen of the time (the peak of the Ottoman empire) worked on this. Truly amazing. One of the 5 places you must visit in Istanbul.

Mosque visits. Whilst most people head to the famous Blue Mosque or Haggia Sophia, this mosque is an absolute gem and outside are marvellous views over the city. Inside it is a stunning place and even better, no queues to get in. I would definitely recommend a visit.

Fantastic Mosque. Make sure you vist this and some of the other Mosques in Istanbul. The size and scale of everything is sooo impressive. I appreciated the opportunity to be allowed to visit this mosque and to be able to gain at least some understanding of Islam religion ... they have some story panels at the back of the visitor area which helps explain some things about the religion. We need much greater tolerance for each other and a visit to this mosque is a good start :-)

Masterpiece of Sultan Soleyman. Sultan Soleyman was almost greatest king of Ottoman Empire and it seems he had tried to build the greatest mosque in Turkey . its really great , with six minaret which shows has been built by a Sultan , stands upon one of seven hills of Istanbul with a most beautiful view to Golden Horn . really every thing is great . I think this mosque was the most favorite for Soleyman too because his dearest son (Mehmed ) and too loved queen( Hurrem ) tomb located in this mosque .

Deservedley famous. Unique in all respects. The high ceiling dome, the minarets and the courtyard show this mosque as the work of an extraordinary architect. The tiles are unique in their own right and fabulous in colour. The Turkish carpeting still feels soft to the feet despite its age. the chandeliers are another work of art.
not bad.. we have many beautiful mosque in our country, some of them is old where mostly is in traditional bazaar. so the Turkish mosques weren't interesting us.

Almost Better than the Blue Mosque. It's not as richly decorated as it's lauded cousin, the Blue Mosque, but it's just as grand and has a fraction of the crowds. The views outside are great and you can swing by the tomb of Suleyman the Magnificent/ Lawgiver.

The best work of Mimar Sinan. In my opinion the best work of Mimar Sinan. Imposing and typical of the Ottoman mosque architecture. There are also the tombs of Roxelana and Suleiman the Magnificent in the yard. I think the best choice to visit if you want to see only a few mosques in Istanbul.
Enjoyed the Soup Kitchen. Top TipThey have a great restaurant to the back of the Mosque that has been open for hundreds of years and their food is Awesome!!

Giant and worth it of a sultan. After blue mosque, this mosque is the greatest ever. The cementery in the premises keep the sultan and his relatives as well as other members of the royal team. Everything is very well mantained and around this mosque are many coffe places and shops. Alsa, from there you can go to the grand bazar.
really so beautifull. .. very historical place... ı really loved this pretty mescid... with a great view.. ı been there for pray... so nice

Nice View. We liked this mosque almost as much as the Blue Mosque. It wasn't as nicely decorated inside (but still nice), but had a wonderful view from the back patio area of the mosque. And it was not crowded. The walk here from the spice bazaar is along streets with shops that the locals go to. Those are the places you can get better deals on things like tea glasses than at the spice & grand bazaars.

For fans of mosques/ottoman architecture only. Suleymaniye mosque is historic in that it was built by the architect Sinan for the sultan Suleyman the magnificent, but it takes a while to walk there and to be honest, it's not really any different from any other mosque. Unless you really appreciate the ottoman architecture of mosques, just go to the Blue Mosque instead - it's much more central.
Serenity..beauty..must see!. Suleymaniye Mosque is definitely worth your while! Such beautiful architecture and interior.. The mausoleums are worth a visit as well!

Great and with a gorgeous view. The only but, is what you have to climb to reach the place. But the view over the Bosfurous, and the rooftops of the city was amazing. Near by you can see a lot of very beautiful wooden houses.

WOW fantastik views over the Golden Horn. The moske and the mausoleums is worht while to strole around, but do it in your own tempo and with the help of a guide book. Find a small cafe on a rooftop nearby to take in the view an ekstra time. ;)

Stunningly Created.. It's a mosque that is hard to miss. Even from the outside, it looks breath-taking. Peaceful atmosphere, incredible architecture. The ceiling is also beautifully designed & it's satisfying to take it all in. Overall, I highly recommend coming here & checking it out for yourself.

Photogenic. We couldn't visit inside, given that we arrived late, since it was far walking from where we were. But took good pics outside, and great pics from far away in the bridge and docks around the golden horn during the dusk.

One of the best Mosque in town.... The Suleymaniye Mosque is located very close to the Hagia Sofia. As this area is a major tourist district. If you stand in front of the mosque when the call to prayer, it is a very special atmosphere. Behind the mosque there is a clean public toilet (cost € 0.50). In the mosque itself has enough room to move around. The place for those who pray is specially separated. Taking pictures is allowed. A visit to this beautiful mosque is heard in Istanbul a must

Beautiful. This is also another mosque around Istanbul that is worth visiting though not as crowded and popular as the other mosques. Compared to Blue mosque and Hagia Sophia, the interior might not come across as anything extra ordinary but no way it is any less as the intricate works around is worth your visit and add to this there are beautiful views from up here that will make it all the more exciting
Great Mosque. Very unique. a lot of stories about it. should visit during the prayer time where you can meet a lot of other visitors from other countries

Europe and Asia. Free and beautiful views of the divide between Europe and Asia. It is worth walking around and it is close to the spice market which is also great. Clean bathrooms and free bathrooms toward front, don't pay the 1 lira for the one in the back (not very clean at all)

Architectural Gem. It lacks the heft of Aya Sofia and the grandeur of the Blue Mosque, but for my money this is the most beautiful mosque/church in Istanbul. It has that kind of monumental presence I associate with the Jefferson Memorial or the Acropolis. It is wonderfully maintained ...including the out buildings which were used for charitable activities. There is an interesting cemetery to the rear of the mosque.

Wonderful views. We walked here from the Galata Bridge, uphill and easy to find. It was just before prayer time and quite busy. There are grassy areas all around and plenty of cafes and tourist stalls. A beautiful mosque with a huge capacity inside.
A must do. The sights, sounds and the magnificence are amazing. A must do when you visit Istanbul. Nice views and grandeaur
Go there just before dusk. A beautiful mosque and a beautiful view and when we were there no crowds of tourist. I can only recommend.

Beautiful mosque. Amazing outside, although its difficult to get a decent view of it. Inside is simple but colourful and it's strangely nice to walk around in yoyr socks (you have to remove your shoes at the door and carry them round in a plastic bag provided). Women are asked to cover their head, legs and arms, while men just have to cover their legs and shoulders. Still used for prayers daily

The sultan's Mosque. The Süleymaniye Mosque is one of the most important landmarks of Istanbul since it dominates the Golden Horn from its position on one of the city's seven hills. Built as per request of "The Magnificent" and designed by the Ottoman Empire's greatest architect of the time, it was named after the sultan.
It worth to be visited. One of the best mosque in the city with a very beautiful view of the Bosphore! It Worth to be visited
Great huge Mosque with a lot of history. There is a people with dress from the time of Suleyman whit which you can taka pics. There is also a man with Candy for the childrens.

must visit. this is a great mosque was made by sinan it is a must to visit,
i will highly recomend you this mosque it has great art inside from the ottoman empire

beautiful inside and outside and backyard!. we were lucky as we came here when it open at 11 am. So there were not many tourist.after entering mosque and the cemetry,dont forget to go to backyard and see the beautiful bosphorus..soooo beautiful view!
Majestic. Very crowded. Watch your bags when in vicinity. Mosque looks so grand and majestic. Many food and drink nearby. Spice market just behind. Grab a Turkish coffee if you can!

Beautiful. Located in the spice market this is one of the important and beautiful mosques around Istanbul that you cannot afford to miss. The architecture and the interiors are almost equivalent or more to that of the Blue mosque. For me personally, it’s the location of the mosque that adds further appeal to the place. Make sure you are appropriately dressed. After the visit, you could also try the restaurant for a traditional Turkish meal.

Must must seen. Hello everyone,I am Turkish resident and visited lots of mosques' in Istanbul and Turkey. Can not say Suleymania Mosque is the best (because hard to rank them all) but this is absolutely one of must seen mosque in Istanbul. Not only the inside of the mosque itself, you should explore the nearby of the mosque as well.
Scenic view from the Garden. The view from the garden of the Mosque towards Galata and the Bosphorous is a must to see. The inside is truly grandiose and impressive.

Another very important mosque. Its another iconic mosque in Turkish history close to the spice market . Read up on the history of it before going and you will appreciate it more. Its a massive place that to this day is as important now as back then as a place of worship. millions of tourists flock to this mosque so go early is my recommendation if you want to take good photos without having to jostle for elbow space. Interesting to know that this mosque when built in the 1550's was not only a place of worship but also a service to the community housing five madrases or schools , a hospital and a kitchen to feed the poor.
Must see period. One of 4 must sees in Istanbul . Hire a tour guide and see them all worth the color they add . Incredible history to this mosque .

Best next to the Blue Mosque. This mosque is near the Spice/Egyptian Market. We walked in towards the ground through the cemetery...take your time and take in the details! This opened up to a large open court yard overlooking the Marmara Sea/Bosphorus river. Beautiful views!The mosque is large, open, and light! This was my favorite next to the Blue Mosque!
Great. Great mosque , beautiful archtec , nice surrounding , wonderful. Restaurant Lovvvvvvvvvvvvvvved everrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrry thinnnnnnnnnnng
Very Interesting. Mosques are mosques but this is a pretty one with a wonderful, local restaurant across the street on the corner. Serves delightful Turkish fare at a low cost.

Replica of blue mosque, for me.. This is a similar replica of blue mosque but with a slightly different characteristics. The carpet of this mosque looks nicer and there are many tourist as in the blue mosque.

Wonderful. The area around Suleymaniye Mosque has changed since my first visit there are small cafe's and a hidden walk are that sales copper items some jewelry and other objects its nice and quiet the mosque is a great place to meditate and of course pray.

Beautiful Mosque. First- if you are a woman and in Istanbul, it is imperative that you bring a scarf or something to cover your hair. They provide them at the very popular sites such as the Blue Mosque, but they are not provided here, and it would be a shame to miss out on seeing it for that reason. The inside of this mosque is beautiful, and it has a much less touristy feel than the blue mosque. The courtyard is also very nice. It's definitely worth a visit. It's very near the Grand Bazaar, so I would definitely pair these sites together in a day.
You feel connected!. If you ever felt that you are alone and down, then just go there because it makes you feel connected with God in so many ways, most importantly the atmosphere of peace!

Architectural wonder. Better than Blue mosque in terms of grandeur, space and archittecture.Abt 20 mins walk from Beyazit tram station. Behind Grand bazaar and University ground. Cheap food nearby too.
Beautiful Building. This mosque is situated a short walk from Vezneciler metro station. A beautiful building with beautiful views of the Bosphorous.
No queues at all. Not as ornate as Blue Mosque, but definitely worth a visit. Best of all, it's not crowded with tourists.

Amazing. Beautifully set up on a hill overlooking Istanbul with many small domes and 4 tall minarets. A large uplifting prayer area was adorned with lighting and Quranic inscriptions. The highlight was the special Jumma (Friday) prayer, commanding a full congregation of worshippers!
Off the beaten path and historically most intriging. So welcoming and peaceful atmosphere, a historic and spiritual experience for any traveller. Be respectful and get overwhelmed by their warmth.

My Favorite Mosque of the trip. After seeing the Topkapi Palace and learning about Sultan Suleymaniye, seeing this mosque is amazing. It is spotless and pristine. I enjoyed this more than blue mosque.

A gem!. This was quite a surprise. I loved the place, the garden, the mosque itself, and the fact that we had the silence and the atmosphere to read all the Muslim info inside. Another big plus is the fact that it is not so crowded.
Really Amazing. This is truly amazing Mosque, especially at dusk, he history and culture of Turkey is something that is a must see.
Tranquil place. Visited a few mosques on our trip but this one really stood out. It was so tranquil both inside and out. The view from the terrace was lovely.
So beautiful.... Such a stunning mosque! I wish I could have gone in but it was during prayer time - but the outside was amazing!

Such a Beautiful Space!. Don't miss this one! You can feel a little overwhelmed by all of the beautiful mosque/museums in Istanbul, but this one is not to be missed. The design work is so serene and wonderful. Must see.

Surprising mosque.. Typically, travel advices point you to the Blue Mosque or the Hagia Sofia. We were there just by chance, as the Blue Mosque was closed in the morning for touristic visits. The entire area is very quiet, the architecture of this Mosque is very clear, there are only few "paintings", the atmosphere is very relaxing and the Mosque is very big. We enjoyed the visit and the view from the Mosque area over Istanbul.

A must visit mosque in Istanbul, Turkey. A little distance away from the main Sultanahmet attractions but definitely worth the walk, the Suleymaniye mosque should not be missed. It's close to the Grand Bazaar.

splendid mosque. Splendid, clean, huge mosque, still in use. Tomb nearby also interesting, and small cemetery. Entry system for enforcing modesty and shoelessness (a form of respect) was a little awkward, but an active mosque has an awkward job of supporting worshipers and allowing tourists inside. Tourists can be obtrusive and offensive, noisy, disrespectful, and distracting. I wish the authorities well in their effort to balance their different constituents. It was lovely to see the inside and to appreciate the great sultan's work. I enjoyed learning about the impact of the mosque on the whole neighborhood, its role in building the market and hosting and feeding travelers and the poor. Again, I was glad to have studied in advance of the trip.
Too Exotic. Modified copy of Ayia Sofia Its a beautiful building and rich interior But I did not feel the same essence of the mosque as I did when Entered Ayia Sofia
very nice. more beautiful than the blue mosque. and you'll have a wonderful view over istanbul since it's on top of a hill.
A must see. Very similar to the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet Mosque) but in much better shape and well kept. in my opinion, it's a must see if you have time.
The Best and Beautiful Mosque.... Dont miss it.. One of the must see places in Istanbul.. 2 hours of peaceful time spent in our lifetime..
Wow. This is by far the best mosque to see. Unlike the blue mosque, this is not visited by as many visitors, however, the architecture and the colours are much more superior than the blue mosque.

Beautiful Mosque with lots of to see around it. The beautiful architecture of this mosque is apparent for the eye to see. It was designed and built by Sinan, who built Ottoman palaces and mosques of that era. He was their main builder. The inside is spaciously huge and the chandeliers are humongous. The outside grounds of the mosque are rich with landscaping and places to sit, visit, take a stroll and enjoy. Recommend dedicating about 2-3 hours to visit this mosque masterpiece. .

Great views!. The Suleymaniye Mosque is actually a short walk from the Grand Bazaar if you know where you are going! If you approach it from Galata Bridge then it's a bit of an uphill walk and some of the side streets show a different Istanbul than you'll see around the more touristy areas.The Mosque itself is nicely restored and I like the fact you can walk around outside along the turrets and see great views.When we went it had relatively recently snowed but little effort had been made to keep the pathways and steps ice free and it was like an ice rink so if you go during similar weather take care when walking around.

Istanbul and history. All I can say is wow!! Hired a private guide who gave me a personal tour. The only way to go. Her name eludes me but the memories are embedded.The place is a treasure trove of history. I truly believe that if you have the time as a traveler and go to Istanbul, go there.

A must see!. The Blue Mosque, as it is as known, is a rare opportunity for non-islamic people to see and experience a real mosque. Just in front Hagia Sofia museum, this mosque has an interesting history regarding its construction.
Another lovely mosque.. Yes if you're into these sort of things I'm sure you will enjoy seeing it. I can appreciate the beauty, and the work that must have gone into building it.

Great experience. Don't miss this place when you around in Istanbul. The building is very impressive from the outside but also within you will wonder about the phantastic tiles and domes and patterns you can find there.Put this mosque on your sightseeing itinerary within the top 3 things to see in Istanbul.
Fascinating. It's really great mosque as The Blue Mosque. It's near Grand Bazaar area. You can use tram to go there...

Amazing mosque. The interior is really stunning. The moment you walk in the mosque you get the feeling that you're in a totally different world.You can see a lot of religious people in a mosque. Before you enter, you have to take of your shoes, and employees will give you "slippers". Before you visit the mosque, you need to put on some long pants and so on...so you don't reveal too much of your skin... plus, women need to wear scarf around their heads. There are some street shops that sell scarfes right infront of the mosque so don't panic if you didn't bring one with you. I really liked the mosque and I recommend you to visit it! :)))))

Do not skip this!. Please don't make the mistake of skipping this lesser known mosque. This will not impress with its scale like the other two giants, but it is truly stunning. The blue mosaic work is just exquisite, and peaceful atmosphere (in contrast to the other busy mosques) allows for a truly immersive experience - in all honesty, I could say this is my favourite spot from all the ones I saw in Istanbul.

Holy place . Wherever you are in Istanbul.. You can see the Sulaymaniyah mosque on the one of the seven hills of istanbul.. You can reach it by tramway, Beyazit stop.. A short walk to reach Sulaymaniyah mosque.. The ottoman architecture is clear & magical inside the site
Nice. It was nice to see but honestly, I liked it more from the outside :)I don't like the fact they didn't allow us to be in our socks like in other mosques...
Another spectacular mosque. Just under par of the blue mosque, but with great views of the city - if you get there on a clear day!

Don't miss the view from Suleymaniye. Amazing view after you see the inside. But then just for the view I would go here again. View over the Golden Horn. Time your visit for sunset and hear the call to prayer and the glow of the twilight. Some of my favorite photos of my trip were taken here. You can see Suleymaniye from Eminonu, Galata and almost anywhere as it holds such a high location. Nice to be below after being up there and enjoying that fact the you are now in the view. Great perspective!

Don't miss this spectacular Mosque. This mosque is located at the center of history with Galata Tower and bridge, Egyption Bazaar and Blue Mosque and other important mosques around. The mosque itself is amazing and also the view from the top is breathe taking. The Mosque, was built on the order of Sultan Süleyman (Süleyman the Magnificent) and the architectural genius Mimar Sinan had a lot input. It contains Islamic and Byzantine architectural elements with slender minarets with large domed buildings supported by half domes in the style of the Byzantine church Hagia Sophia. It is at the top of a hill but definitely worth the effort. You can try the small restaurants around where you can eat delicous "bean & rice".

Beautiful. I liked the whole place , full with history and amazing view of the Galata Tower and bridge as well. There you can also visit the Egyption Bazaar, with its Spices and souvenirs collection. You can also have some nice lunch at one of the restaurants there around.

Worth the steep hill! . Beautiful mosque after trudging up a hill looking for it but well worth the trip. The mosque itself is gorgeous and also the view from the top overlooking the water can't be beat. There is also a cemetery on the grounds which stood out for me since the other Istanbul mosques I had been to did not have cemeteries. The detail once inside the building was pristine and we happened to catch a bride-to-be taking wedding photos inside so that was a treat. Definite can't miss if not for the view of Istanbul alone
amazing. its amazing when you enter the mosque. The blue tiles, the architecture, the calmness.. and its just opposite of aya sophia!

An Oasis of Calm. This place is huge. Whilst the Blue Mosque is spectacular you can't beat this one for the calm and serenity of the place. You can virtually have the place to yourself compared to the hustle and bustle of the Blue Mosque. Felt really peaceful here.
beautiful. beautiful mosque but not as fantastic as the blue mosque. The hamam nearby was great (though a bit pricey).

Fabulous views. There is a true sense of calm in this gem and the view from the garden outside across the water to Galata is great, as are the numerous domed rooves which line the view down. One of my favourite places in Istanbul

Worth the hike. We probably did not take the most direct route to this mosque but had a difficult time finding someone to give us very good directions. We went there after the Spice Market, which looks like an easy walk and it might be. We ended up on some old streets of Istanbul that were authentic and charming that we would have seen no other way. As far as the mosque itself is concerned it is very beautiful and we were glad we made the unplanned trek. If time is a big issue I would see the Blue Mosque first and Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar but with light crowds and more than two days you can fit it in. It has a very informative wall with an English explanation of the Muslem faith and how it originated and what their beliefs are. We found this very enlightening. Worth mentioning is we found the tombs there not to really be worthwhile. Also, they had the cleanest restrooms we found the entire trip so take advantage.
Worth visiting. An imposing religious building with exceptional view to the modern city of istanbul. Very good place for taking photos. The Mosque is open to tourist between praying hours.
Beautiful, clean and free. You must see it because of the mausoleums of Sultan Suleyman and his wife. theentrsnce is free but mausoleums are closed on mondays
Enjoyed this much more than the Blue Mosque. The Blue Mosque gets all the attention but I found this mosque (also known as the New Mosque) to be more interesting.

Impressive. Be prepared to take your shoes off and cover your head with a scarf (ladies). As this is a functional mosque, it is open for worship several times a day. It means that if you come during the time of worship, you will have to wait outside (it can last up to 2 hours). Best if you find out in advance when the mosque is open to visitors. Inside the carpet is impressive and warm. Very close to the Grand Bazaar.
Beautiful. This mosque its simply beautiful I felt a great peace in there, don´t know why it meant to me more then many other, highly recommend

Great View. Although is not the most famous of the Mosques of Istanbul by my opinion is the most beautiful because of it's location! It has the greatest view !!! If you are a woman take something to cover your head if you haven't they offer !!!

Sinan’s greatest masterpiece. The Suleymaniye Mosque is the largest mosque in Istanbul, considered to be the greatest achievement of Mimar Sinan. (Mimar means “architect”.) It was built between 1550 and 1558 on the order of Sultan Suleyman the Magnificent. The style of the mosque is extraordinary elegant despite the enormous dimensions of the building. The mosque was damaged by a fire in 17th century and an earthquake in18th century. Part of the restoration was not successful and acoustic deteriorated. There are two mausoleums behind the mosque with the tombs of the sultan and his wife and other members of the dynasty. The mausoleum of the sultan is now under reconstruction but you can look inside trough the small windows. The tomb of Sinan is on the other side of the mosque, so the great master, the Ottoman Michelangelo, remained close to his masterpiece in the eternity.Before leaving, enjoy the nice view to the town and the Golden Horn from the large terrace.

Gorgeous. Suleyan the Great's great mosque contructed by Mimar Sinan....Long out of tourists's attention, this masterpiece is just being discovered. Donn forget to visit Sinan's tomb next to the mosque
Only outside interestig. Inside there is not much to see. It's the outside of the building that's more interesting to me. INside everything looks the same as in every mosque. Maybe a beatiful lamp.

A great complete complex with a grand view of the Golden Horn & the Galata Tower. A visit to the Suleymaniye mosques is mandatory to understand more what the complex of a mosque usually consists of! you can see the hamam the madrasa the kulliya...the complete complex is still standing on the hill safeguarding the golden horn and a bonus is the grand view you can see from this hill of the golden horn & Galata Tower. Stroll the calm and residential streets around or keep walking to see the next attraction the Grand Bazzar ( a nice walk through the streets full of markets and mosques)
Beautiful. This is my favorite mosque with great views of the city. Go near sundown for the prettiest views. The inside is very nice as well.
Stunning. lovely mosque, in pure Turkish tradition: Huge pillars supporting the structure. Worth the visit to note the differences between Blue Mosque, New Mosque and this one :)
Simply amazing!. Beautiful mosque and was able to get in right away as there wasn't a lot of people waiting outside. Was really mesmerized by the amazing architecture.

beautiful and interesting place. Everyone makes a beeline to AyaSofia (and it is beautiful...) but if you want more space, less crowds and beautiful architecture, try Suleymaniye. There is a very interesting display on the history and philosophy of Islam in the foyer as well as a volunteer guide who will happily answer any questions you may have.

Amazing, and you will not have to queue at all (compared to the queue at the Blue Mosque). It was a great place to see, just as beautiful as the Blue Mosque and there were no queues at all!!! It was slightly hard to find and we walked fall the way up from sultanahmet. However there is a new metro stop just 5 min away... but it is not on most of the maps/guides as the stop is new.
Beautiful Mosque. Absolutely stunning mosque with beautiful architecture and history. Was able to get in quite quickly due to the poor weather that day.
Beautiful mosque. Serene and beautiful mosque. I wanted to give a donation, but could not find s place to give it. The grounds and interior area of the mosque are very well kept.
History at its best!. Of course this is a must see in Istanbul. Even though the weather was terrible in December but the place and experience were really magical.

simplicity with extraordinary architecture. Icon of Istanbul , an imposing structure and can be seen from far distances. But once you step inside , its very peaceful and serene with artistic ceilings. All holy places have a sense of calmness which touches your inner heart.
Suleymaniyemoskén. This is a must see when in Istanbul. Fantastic architecture and everything is so big. Right across it there is the spice market.

worth the wait. Beautiful.but again long queues.bit of a jiggle getting shoes on and
Off on the threashhold but understandable-you wouldn't like people tramping through your front room with their muddy shoes on!
a nice mosque with a view. This mosque is situated not far from the bazar. it has a nice vew on the golden horn and morden istanbul. The inside is very beautiful.

Awesome. A bit manic at the entrance where you have to remove your shoes, but once inside, the enormity and grandeur of the mosque is quite awesome. Beautiful domed ceiling, chandeliers and architecture. A working mosque.
Breathtaking. Amazing building and environs - we enjoyed this with wonderful blue sky December weather too........

Magnificent. The Mosque of Suleiman the Magnificent (Suleymaniye Mosque) is much more beautiful and tranquil than Blue Mosque. The design of the stained glass, carpet, and walls is magnificent, with a courtyard and cemetery that are also quite interesting. The best part is the chance to wander through the shopping district on your way there, experiencing the real life of the Turkish people who live in Istanbul. Enjoy the beauty of the Suleymaniye Mosque and the view to Bosporus!

Visual Gem!. Although much less famous than the Blue Mosque, the Mosque of Sulaiman the Magnificent (or the Sulaymaniye Mosque) is much more beautiful and tranquil, not to mention the nice view of the water. The design of the stained glass, carpet, and walls is beautiful, with a courtyard and cemetery that are also quite interesting. The best part is the chance to wander through the shopping district on your way there, experiencing the real life of the Turkish people who live in Istanbul. Grab a pomegranate juice en route and enjoy the beauty of the Suleymaniye Mosque!

Very lovely interior. First saw its exterior at night from a distance and then close up, beautifully lit. Decided to come back during daylight to look inside. Very beautiful prayer hall, huge dome, intricately decorated. Stained glass made the daytime visit a justified decision. Great views over to Galata from its perimeter.
Worth seeing. I was not able to go inside as it was night time and I was there for a Whirling Dervish performance in a nearby building but the outside was fantastic.

Magnificent building. The mosque is a short 15-min hike (or 2-hour hike if you stop at Rustem Pasa mosque like we did) from the Galata bridge area. The building and the view from the area are magnificent. The adjacent cemetery is the resting place for many of the sultans. It's a must visit place while in Istanbul.

Best Mosque to Visit in Istanbul. This Mosque is not as famous as The Blue Mosque but is less crowded. The ceiling paintings and stained glass are amazing. The history of Suleymaniye is also very interesting as he married a foreign wife and killed his first son so another son would be the next Sultan. Our guide told us he was the best sultan, but not sure why if he killed his own son? Best thing about visiting is it is free.

Absolutely Magnificent !. Built during the Golden Age of the Ottomans, this Masjid (mosque) is a tribute to it's architect, the genius Mimar Sinan. Be prepared to be left speechless as soon as you enter. If you are a Muslim, and it's Friday, this is the place to perform your Friday prayers. The experience will be overwhelming. This place should not be missed on any visit to Istanbul.

Beautiful. When you think of Istanbul you instantly think of the Blue Mosque so its nice when you get the chance to check out another Mosque in the city. Even though this one is not as elaborate and as fancy as the Blue Mosque... the crowds are a lot less and I believe you can still get a great experience.
Interesting historic Mosque. I thought this mosque was great until I visited I visited the Blue Mosque which is even more impressive. Nevertheless this mosque is worth visiting

Best in Istanbul. This is the best mosque in whole of Istanbul. Its a grand mosque situated on a hill overlooking the city. The architecture is magnificent and the courtyards and inside is very peaceful.
State of Art Architecture. one of the world's most wonderful buildings , I love the story of building such a state of art by the arctic Sinan .

A beautiful serene religious building. We visited the Suleymaniye mosque the day after visiting the more famous Blue Mosque. The Suleymaniye Mosque is much more visually imposing. It sits in its own attractive gardens and has wonderful clean white lines.When we visited on Christmas Eve, it was empty enough to sit on the carpeted floor (you need to remove shoes and put them in a bag) and appreciate the interior. There is a stunning Italian rococo ceiling and the interior is calm, peaceful and religiously significant.We were approached by a mosque volunteer who answered questions in various languages and was extremely keen to help with queries about the building and Islam. In the gardens, there are tombs of the sultans and their families, which are also historically interesting.
Excellent place to visit. Not as crowded as the Blue Mosque. It has beautiful architecture and wonderful views of the Bosporus.The Spice market is right below and plenty to do in that area
Astonishing view. We walked from grand bazzar to Suleymaniye Mosque but what we saw really was spectacular! Great place with grate view.Peaceful scenery and tranquility from city noise

remember - it opens and closes all day :). Well organized for getting in and looking after your shoes. Not the same as seeing a Cathedral in Europe. If you want to take photos, need a camera that is good in low light.

Older but better. It is very quite place, where you can leave your footwear, sit on soft smooth carpet, and think about your life or everything you want. It's much less people then in Blue Mosque for example, and it's older one, but definitely better one.

Utterly beautiful. I visited the Blue Mosque (1616) and the Süleymaniye Mosque (1557) on the same day. I was struck by how different the experiences were. The Süleymaniye Mosque presented a real contrast to the crowds queuing to enter the Blue Mosque and the hawkers targeting tourists in the line. Here there was barely a soul around, making for an altogether different, more contemplative experience. The interior decoration is less elaborate than the Blue Mosque, but all the more powerful for its subtle use of colour. Utterly beautiful.

History alive. We loved visiting this grand place. It has been a home for Muslim and Christians alike and is now a magnificent museum, a testament to time. Istanbul has many significant historical sites and this is #1, the place to start. I highly recommend getting a tour guide or into a group so you do not have to stand in line to purchase tickets. With a group, you go in before those in line to purchase, and have information about what you are seeing, the significance and relevance. It is relevant to visit by all who are interested and capable of understanding majesty and history.
Breathtaking!. Our guide took us here as well as some of the lesser known Mosques, Churches etc. and we never grew tired of seeing such great architecture. See as many as you can!

The mosque that inspired the Blue Mosque. This mosque is most certainly beautiful although I will admit that after having visited the Blue Mosque I have my biases. In terms of interior beauty I still prefer the Blue Mosque although while visiting the grounds of the Suleymaniye Mosque, you have a great view of the city. This is the HUGE mosque you can see from the different bridges whereas the Blue Mosque is visible but not as well lit-up.
The Most Beautiful Mosque in Istanbul. Had many more colors than the blue mosque and was less crowded. Beautiful mosaics. Well worth the time to visit.

Quiet and magnificient. It is a magnificent mosque with great corridors and gardens, very well kept! We were there during prayer time hence, the main hall was closed for visitors (between 2 to 3:30 pm) hence, we could not enjoy the detailed work of art inside the main hall. It felt very peaceful there!!

better to visit on a nice day. the beauty of the mosque is visible both outside and inside and so you can get better photos of the building from outside if you visit on a sunny day. it is free to visit even during prayer times and ladies will be given a free shawl to cover thighs and shoulders when you queue, if the guards decide that you need one. bags are given for all shoes and you carry your shoes with you. it can be bit crowded especially mid day but you can spend as much time as you want. inside its only one big hall that you view, and the decorated ceiling, windows and hanging chandeliers are the main attractions. bet photos of the mosque can be from surrounding buildings a bit higher up especially at different times of the day.

Off the beaten path. The most majestic mosque is still the Blue Mosque, while the most famous is the Hagia Sophia, but if you want great architecture and good history while avoiding the crowds, try this one just west of the Spice Market close to the Eminonu ferry docks. The nearest tram station is Eminonu via the T1 line.

Spectacular Building and Wonderful View - Best Istanbul Mosque. This Mosque is in a Spectacular Building and is high on a hill with a Wonderful View of IstanbulThe beauty of this Mosque is unique and well worth the time to visit. It is high on a hill and offers a great view of IstanbulThe location is next to the Spice Market.The Tombs of Suleymaniye are next to the Mosque. You are not allowed into the tombs, but they can be viewed through the windows

Just marvelous . Must see historical destination highlighting the bewitching ottoman architecture. Beautiful during the night too. Should not miss the scenery from the mosque's balcony. Behind the mosque there are small shops and local cafes. Very enjoyable to grab cai (tea) in the cold weather

Sinan's Architecture!. Enjoyed the story and history centred around the building of the mosque by the architect Sinan! The design of the mosque was simple and it contributed to its peaceful atmosphere! Sinan's humanitarian vision to surround the mosque with places to shelter the poor and provide them with food, soup kitchens, hospitals, libraries and places to rest was eye-opening! Overall, it was a great learning experience!
interesting. Very nice and worth to see. Very detailed work and people are very friendly! It is also very clean. You need to respect theirs religious traditions....
quite. during our visit, not many visitors, may be because of December period and also this mosque received less coverage compare to other more popular one

Favourite Mosque in Istanbul. This place has a different feeling to it. Unlike other Mosques I have been too. Also do not miss the overlook and tomb areas.If you have top 5 places to visit, this should be 1 of them. Worth the walk.

I'm in love with it <3. One of the most amazing mosques that I've ever seen. Its actually my favourite mosque, I can't be in Istanbul without visiting it. It contains amazing structure, architecture and history. The simplicity of the interior design is a breath taking view. The minute you enter the place you will not want to leave.Every friday noon most of the times will be bride and grooms taking pictures ;)DO NOT MISS the SULYMANIA

It`s not just a mosque. Don`t forget to visit also the tombs of Suleyman and of Hurrem - you can`t get inside, but it gives an image of what a tomb means.
The Mosque is huge and impressive and worth a visit of at least one hour.

Magnificent. Beautiful structure and architecture.peacef and serene .
The minarets and the walls stretching Infront of eyes draws u In.
On the main lawn the views on bosphorus strait are amazing and the urban istanbul on the back drop is amazing .

Very beautiful. That was the first mosque which we saw and it is stunning. You don't need to queue there for hour to get in. You can sit down and absorb the atmosphere...
Quiet and peaceful.
Next to that mosque you will find the oldest hamman in Istanbul ( unisex) and 500m away you can reach street bazaar.
Have a good trip.

Must see. So i was there during Ramadan , the center was full of tourists and locals, we really enjoyed the walk up to this mosque where we found a quite place, 3-4 families awaiting for the Iftar , men praying inside this huge place, we did get the chance to enter and stayed on the rouge for 15 minutes, it was a great experience and also the view from there of the Golden Horn and the streets is lovely , the streets around it are good also, packed of all sorts of stuff , you can go down directly into the Spice Bazaar.

Must see. Amazingly beautiful, audacious construction of Sinan in the 1500s. Quiet, peaceful, park like. Great place to read a book or enjoy a meal at the cafes outside. Also contains one of the largest digital libraries of classic Islamic texts.

Stunning. Even although there were many tourists milling around, the atmosphere was quiet and peaceful. So much beauty in this building - both inside and out.As others have said, this is definitely worth a visit, regardless of your religion.

Excellent and Captivating. this Mosque holds your attention because of its cavernous and carefully crafted interior. With the way it was designed you simply cannot be anything but in awe of this marvel of a house of prayer.
Respectful & Peaceful. Visited during prayers. But it was a man reading from an extract - just wished I could understand what was being said. It was relaxing just observing!

Magnificent. Simply a jaw dropping sight....enuff said. A must see for all regardless of which faith or religion you hold. Thank you Turkish Air for providing this experience to all its transit passengers.....it was worth the trip.
Stunning. Beautiful mosque, amazing structure, super impressive. Make sure you take the time to see the tombs round the back.

Beautiful. It was wonderful to see. We had an amazing tour guide with a great amount of knowledge. I would recommend of course to try to go when it is not at a peak time. We turned around once because the line was so long. The architecture is lovely and definitely something to see while in Istanbul.
Good historic place to visit . It is nice place , altered from the old original one but it is still worth the visit . Definitely top 10 attraction in Istanbul .
Nice Historical Place. cool! it was nice to see all the coffins there with written dates. I don't have things that I didn't like it in this Place!!
so interesting. Free to enter and its actually quite fun taking your shoes off to go in. exciting place, full of energy, just for sit and admire,
BEAUTIFUL. I really enjoy in exploring this mosque, beautiful arhitecture and great view from gardens.would visit agian.
Suleymaniye Mosque. The mosques grounds are quite beautiful. The mausoleums and the cemetery has stunning architecture! Definately worth visiting!
So Beautiful. This mosque is not to be missed when in Istanbul. It is truly beautiful and you feel the history of it as you walk through. Don't miss it when you're in this great city.

Marvel in blue. its Huge and magnificent try to visit a sunny day to wonder the light comming inside and stay to hear and watch during praying times wonderful, No im not mosleem but its an amazing experiance to hear the praying inside.
Blue Mosque at its Best. What a masterpiece! A beautiful mosque and best to visit either early when it opens (before the crowd gets there)

One of the most beautiful domes!. Don't miss this one out. You might have to walk uphill, and go an extra mile (literally). But this is worth it. All the domes in Istanbul mosques are beautiful, but this one is exceptionally beautiful, so go, enjoy, pray (or don't), take pictures and experience some peace and love :)
Appreciated the volunteers. this working mosque had male and female volunteers to answer questions about the mosque and about Islam. Lovely interior.

Mesmerising. A must see. A total masterpiece, you would not regret it! Its dimensions, the architecture, the elements design, the manual art... Shows how incredible was the ottoman culture and how dedication could make such incredible places as mosquée Süleymaniye!Highly recommend it for art and history lovers, but too to all ones who like aesthetic.The queue is a little hard because it's very popular, but If you go early in the morning the wait could not be that long ;)
Favorite Mosque. We visited several mosques, this was my favorite. Beautiful! Take the time to see the Mosque and enjoy a Hamam near by!

Masterpiece of Sinan. Most tourist head to Sultanahmet, a pompous mosque with lots of unnecessary decoration. On the other hand Süleymaniye is a masterpiece of Sinan, the court architect of Süleyman the Magnificent. No need to rephrase Wikipedia information, just experience it. The courtyard, views and restaurants in front are great. In particular Darülziyafet on a side street inside a courtyard is true gem. If you have time check Süleymaniye and later on walk to Spice Market. On your way you will see the Rüstempaşa (Rustempasha) Mosque with marvellous tiles, again from Sinan himself. Just no need to waste time on Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque).

Great visit. the Suleymaniye Mosque icy a must during your visit to Istanbul. The staff at the mosque is very helpful for giving details information about the historical background but also very open on the Islamic culture. Fantastic views and perfect location for taking pictures of Istanbul.

Engineering Masterpiece. Situated on one of the 7 hills of Historic Istanbul, 16th century Suleymaniye Mosque is an excellent example of Ottoman Architecture at its peak. This structure will take your breath away from any angle. Carefully detailed interior settings and acoustics are impressive. There is much more to it; just make some research before you get there and you will have a very rewarding trip.

splendid. so glorious building, great chandelier and possible to take photo when it is no prayers inside. Entrance is free and must behave according Muslim culture, body and hair covered , shoes off...It is well guarded so your properties would be safe.
A Must-See in Istanbul. The history and architecture of Suleymaniye mosque is a must-see in Istanbul. There are also several tourist sites to see within walking distance.

Beautiful Mosque and Incredible Views. The mosque is beautiful and well worth the hike up some steep hill. Also, don't miss the amazing views of the Golden Horn from outside the Mosque. There are a few cafes nearby with roof terraces that provide incredible views.

A must visit landmark. I come to visit this mosque two times during my short business visit to Istanbul. It is very nice with wonderful architecture and fantastic islamic decorations. More services are required, however, for visitors such as visit times marks and historical background guidance.

The Most Beautiful Mosque in Instanbul. We visited several mosques in Istanbul and were underwhelmed with them all. I was ready to call it a day on the mosques but my dad insisted that this one be our last. I'm so glad we went because it was beautiful. Architecturally, it is a work of art. The outside is beautiful, and inside is stunning. Definitely worth it!
mosque. this mosque ıs surrounded with historical places.it was built by Architect Sinan for Sultan Süleyman.it is a wonderful mosque to visit.

huge buildind & religen mosque. this msque one of the huge mosques that i visit ever ; as a moslim i being exiting from the place as archetecture ; building ; places to prie ; it make me happy in the heart from all directios of view ; travel agent ; art ; obiective view ; & the religen view.

beautiful mosque, hilltop location. Basically it was tie between the Suleymaniye and the Blue Mosque for beauty of the building and grounds, but the view from the Suleymaniye of the city and the Bosphorus was exceptional.

beautiful mosque. quite, almost no tourist, great water view, at the moment the area behind the old orphans' building is a shanty town (safe though) so try to not get lost there if this stuff makes you queasy.

Best view of the mosque city!. Would rank this as number 3 in the long list of mosques that should be seen. A working mosque so be careful of timings one chooses. Beautiful interiors with a volunteer present to guide you through the history. Must go in the back yard from where you could glance over the city through cascades of domes which end with the view over Bosphorus.

Smaller mosque. Beautiful, smaller mosque. Very welcoming and worth visiting for the exquisite tile work. Please note that in any mosque you must have your legs covered and take off your shoes. you'll be given a bag for the shoes and a long skirt if needed. And please don't complain. I heard some people saying that they weren't Muslims so why did they have to take off their shoes? Uhh duh. Oh, and covering your hair is a must too.

A Must-See. Be prepared for long queues. It may be advantageous to either visit early or late in the day. The mosque is only open at certain times and there is no entry fee, so plan accordingly. Some interesting brochures are available on-site.

Amazing experience. In istanbul you can leave this mosque. Simply Amazing, better to go early to avoid the rush. The mosque is very huge & the architecture is awesome.
