The space is well divided for visitors and worshiper. The atmosphere is touching & you will like to sit some time even if you are in a hurry.

Huge!. In the top 5 of the best Mosque in Istanbul. Seeble from the distance, is one of the hugest. You cannot say to have visited without half an hour spent in the inside! Visits are for free and allowed only in certain times of the day!
The biggest mosque in Istanbul. You should certainly visit, great mosque. Hurrem sultan and Suleyman tomps are there also. I think there is a metro station near by.
Istanbul solo at 71 years. an enormous mosque; expansive well-kept and presented grounds ; best was the view looking down to the Golden Horn
Nice experience.. Suggest you go early because it gets packed out by lunchtime. The Turkish mozaics & architecture are sight to be seen.

Amazing. Amazing, worth the wait which you can avoid by arriving early, the space for visitors alongside worshipper a is done very respectfully, the inside structure and design is worth the visit but it is the atmosphere, which left an impression on me. A must see visit whilst in Istanbul.
On the Hill. It is the biggest Mosque in Istanbul and on the hill. It have the very nice view for the sea and sunset. Inside the Mosque is normal.
First visit to a Mosque. The history of the site and the different places of worship there and the wall adornment with the tribute to Allah.
Great place. Free to enter and its actually quite fun taking your shoes off to go in. Peaceful inside and beautifully decorated. Must for anyone who visits Istanbul

Huge mosque. Like most mosques (and there are lots in Istanbul) this one is absolutely beautiful. It is currently undergoing some restoration works but this does not detract from the enjoyment of visiting the largest of the mosques in Istanbul. Quite a sight to behold
amazing. very interesting place, you have to respect their traditions but they respect you, the cupola is superb, as well as the cemetery beside the mosque
a must... I must say that in my opinion I like this mosque more than blue mosque,specialy the acoustic of the mosque and the view from the garden,try to go there when no many people around .

Amaizing mosque. Way to the mosque was interesting. Narrow streets with many beautiful (some of them semi-demolished) houses bring us to Suleymaniye Mosque. Actually in Istanbul I often caught myself on thought that new buildings grow up from old historical constructions. I felt it on our way to Suleymaniye Mosque also. I have not been in many mosques but Suleymaniye Mosque is the most beautiful. View from viewing point on Bosporus is breath-taken. And many cats around as well as everywhere in Istanbul.
awesome.... incredibly impressive mosque.I regretted that I had not seen this beauty for ever.No matter which religion you can be absolutely sure that you will be affected.
Peaceful haven. a steep walk to find it, but well worth it. suleymaniye mosque is an oasis of calm in a mad city ! lovely architecture and away from the usual tourist crowds. delightful.

First time in a mosque. For our first visit to a mosque this demonstrated what a wonderful, calming and soothing space they can be ... the atmosphere is superb and provided a real opportunity for quiet reflection (in spite of the frequency of tourists passing through). So much more inspiring than most of the cathedrals I visited in Spain.

Most beautiful. This was my favorite of the mosques I visited in old town. We walked up from the Rustem Pasha mosque to get here, there are some very interesting buildings and small mosques along the way. A great walk, excellent hilltop location with beautiful views, less crowded, and in my mind the most beautiful. This was designed by the master architect, Sinan, whose tomb lays nearby. Also, there is a large complex surrounding the mosque with haman, school and other buildings, plus the Sultan's and Roxelana's (his mistress) tombs are within the grounds. Very peaceful and beautiful inside.
Beautiful. This is definitely a must see tourist attraction. Beautiful both inside and out ... Loved it and will visit again on my next trip!!

Beatifully lid at night. Longer walk from hotel, but worth that. Gorgeus construction, visible from all over. Best view from the other Golden Horn banks or possibly from a boat. And, obviously, at night. When visiting the area, you should respect the Islamic traditions dress-wise. Long sleeves and a shawl or pashmina.

A good option to Blue Mosque. We didn't want to spend our short time in Istanbul in the queue of Blue Mosque. That's why it was a good choice to visit Suleymaniye Mosque instead. Actually the mosque was nothing really special from the inside but outside it's a great mosque. And the best thing: no queue!
Awe inspiring. Even though we were in Istanbul in the shoulder season, the line-up was a block long. But the wait was well worth it. This is one of the most beautiful places of worship in the world.

Superb. Not a busy as The Blue Mosque but we thought it more impressive, really well worth the visit. Other than the obvious beauty of the mosque itself you get fantastic gardens and a really good view across the city!

Second biggest after the Blue Mosque. Very impressive building and in some ways of greater magnificence than Blue Mosque. Dominates the skyline of Istanbul and is far easier to visit as no queues to enter.
Fabulous. Exceptional views and architecture. Worth visiting, lovely calm atmosphere and location. Good insight of history.

Beautiful, especially at sunset. The mosque is just lovely and a beautiful, peaceful place to spend some time. If you can time it right, head there just before sunset so you can peek inside before prayers (it closes at 5, I believe) and then while the call to prayer happens, aim to be out on the lawn overlooking Istanbul. It's a moving experience, seeing the lights of the city come on, while the voices echo. Don't miss it.

Looks beautiful at night. At night this impressive building is lit up and looks beautiful. Inside it has a magnificent dome and wonderful decorative features. There is a large courtyard and the mosque is fully wheelchair accessible. This mosque is still used for worship, so you need make sure your visit is outside prayer times.

Interesting . Architecturally and historically very interesting. Amazing place to see and explore.I think it's beauty is a distraction from the current horrors in the Middle East in the name of Allah. How could a religion that can build such impressive structures be so badly hijacked and abused?I would urge people to see this and go next door to the Blue Mosque.

One of the Largest. This mosque is supposed to be the largest in Istanbul capacity of 9,000! The building outside & grounds worth the visit & inside when no prayers in session which is often (about 5 a day).
the date and the venue. The date and the venue is a great concept, breath of the cemetery in Garden clearance, incredible peaceful atmosphere.
Great. Really it's grea place and you feel the power of Turkish historical period and they must be proudly to serve these places and keep them clean and bright all the time

Great learning experience. While visiting this mosque, there were volunteer guides to give short talks and answer questions, which was fascinating. There was also a wall with information on Islam and other religions that was very educational and informative.
Stunning - dont miss it!. its scale and architecture are phenomenal. great spot for just sitting, watching and absorbing the world going by
the final statement. very grand and beautiful with stunning red and gold dominating the colors inside. this was the final mosque built by Sinan for the Ottomon Sultan and his wife

Beautiful mosque in relatively peaceful setting. This mosque from the 1600's sits atop a hill, with commanding views over the Golden Horn and Bosphorus. The mosque is less crowded than the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia but just as impressive. It seemed more well-lit than those two and everything was very well-preserved. Well worth the fairly steep climb up to the mosque.
good. its good experience to reach to sultan ahmet through a tram and also good places to shop and see near by.
Absolutely gorgeous. Do not miss it if you go to Istanbul. Halfway between Grand Bazaar and Spice market. My favorite Mosque together with Blue Mosque and Little Santa Sophia
new religion. Women must be veiled and everyone get their shoes off when enter in mosque. Beware to schedule prayers. Without visits in those hours.
Take Your Shoes OFF/Put your scarf ON. The Tile, the worshipers, the building, Make sure you read about it prior to entering. Chech out the women's section

A historic mosque. This mosque is one of the most important places which every tourist must visit it.
A very big mosque where shows a part of history of turkey: Ottman age

Beautiful!. If you visit just one mosque in Istanbul, this should be it. Beautiful gardens, view - a little off the beaten track - no line-ups and no entry fees. The sultans' cemetery on the side is pretty amazing!
Most amazing Mosque. We were in Istanbul three days, and found this Mosque the most beautiful. It is a must see sight. It is huge, clean, amazing tiles etc.

Wonderful Place of Worship. We went there twice as we spent a lot of time just wandering in the neighbourhood. Some visitors sat in a reserved area to watch the worshippers praying and listening to the recitation of the Holy Koran.
Beautiful. We took this tour with a guide and he pointed out many things we would have missed had we been doing it on our own. You can shuffle through on your own of course. Beautiful mosque.
Simply amazing. Such an amzing atmosphere at this mosque. Performing salaahs there was just amazing and an experiance I will never forget.

450 Years of Beauty. No crowds here.....but our time was limited since we were on a tour. We don't usually do tours and did this one against our better judgement. However the Suleymanie Mosque did not disappoint - still majestic after 450 years.

A place of beauty and greatness. Definitely is better to visit such a place early in the morning. I had time to wash my face and my feet and to enjoy the peace of the place. Just few people were in the mosque and I could admire the beauty and the greatness of the mosque. I felt very good while I was there.
No waiting. A real place of worship, no waiting , friendly staff, don't waste hours waiting to go to blue mosque go here for authenticity
Grand Mosque. Beautiful masjid which was designed by the great architect, Mimar Sinan. He also designed a great many buildings in Istanbul.

Spectacular Mosque. While the Blue mosque is the most famous, this is just as much a wonderful bit of architecture. This is also not as busy and entrance is free as with all religious sites in Istanbul. The mosque is beautifully decorated with mosaics and long hanging chandeliers. The walk from Sultanahmet gives you a good mix of touristy and local shopping neighbourhoods. Worth a visit.P.s No need to visit other mosques (unless you want to pray in them) as all mosques in Istanbul have the same basic structure and decor.
Interesting to visit. Very beautiful inside. Two times per day they have presentations about Mosque and Islam. Very interesting for those who are not Muslim. A lot of new things you can get to know.
Wonderful Mosque!!!. Free entry!!! Religious place. Wonderful construction, located on walkable distance from Grand bazaar, you can spend an hour to see this beautiful architecture.
Awesome architecture!. Architecture, brilliant design, still being used as a praying place, quite clean and busy!The hippodrome and theegyptian column also beautiful!

Spectacular and peaceful. From Sultanahmet to the Suleymaniye Mosque it's a fascinating, winding walk through the centre of Istanbul. Because of its location, there are hardly any crowds, offering visitors an unhurried, peaceful experience in a spectacular mosque -- wonderful. Entrance is free.

A Must Visit. This is an amazing place to visit and an integral part of the Istanbul experience.Busy with people but this is all part of the ambiance and atmosphere of this amazing Asia meets Europe city.

Beautiful Exterior. Unlike Yeni Cami or Sultanahmet, there is not much of a crowding problem here. The mosque is surrounded by beautiful gardens. You can sit and relax and marvel at the size of the mosque. However, I thought the interior was mediocre. Many people have been telling me that Suleymaniye is the pride of Istanbul, but the artwork and craftsmanship on the ceiling and walls is far below that of Sultanahmet or Yeni Cami. The tomb of Suleyman the Great is in the same complex. I would say the greatest attractions at this mosque are the gardens and the tomb.

A must visit - the architecture is remarkable. Just go, look and imagine what it was like back then. Oh, to be a sultan - and with a harem! Exquisite tiles, beautiful faces, delicious food and Turkish coffee, too

Mosque. This is very beautiful and in the heart of Istanbul. When one walks through this ornate building one gets a feeling of how old and important the Mosque is. The design is very unusual as was this type of architecture during the time it was built. This is a must see when visiting Istanbul because it can give you a history of what went on during this time.
must see. one of the best masjids I have seen it is just mind blowing to see how this beautiful masjid was built.

oh so beautiful. to be really honest - suleymaniye, sehzade and fatih camii are more beautiful than the blue mosque - with lesser of the tourist crowd and really tranquil complexes ... the gardens with huge trees...a very beautiful place to be....
Stunning. Beautiful, peaceful site. You are expected to be respectful and cover knees and elbows; women also cover their hair.
Beautiful. The mos elegant, intriguing and delightful mosque in spite of the size it felt welcoming and friendly.
worth the walking. you can enoy the nice view of the city especially at night, the mosque is impressive but closed after 5pm

More Beautiful than The Blue Mosque. Everybody seems to go to the Blue Mosque but this mosque is even more beautiful in my opinion. The interior is really stunning with pretty domed ceilings and amazing lighting. Plus there are some really helpful folk on hand to answer any questions about the building or Islam if you have any. Well worth a visit.

peaceful and beautiful. Visited in September and it was peaceful and quiet, not too many people around. We walked to it through spice bazar. The whole mosque area is very nice and relaxing. The best thing about this particular mosque is the view to the Bosporus - just walk around the mosque and you will see.

Must Visit. to me it was similar to the blue mosque but the history of it is amazing and hence a visit should be paid to this fab mosque.
The sheer size of the mosque is breath taking.

The beauty of a mosque. One has to be there to know the feel of the beauty. It is also called the Blue Mosque. Not because it is colored blue, but because it appears blue from a distance.The legend goes that soldiers approaching it from a distance could see the the top of the mosque and the blue color, hence it got its name. The interior is beautiful and very well maintained.One has to take off the footwear and the queues are serpentine.
nice mosque. a beautiful mosque inside and outside.. although we need to wait in line for half and hour, but the wait is worthwhile.
Again a must see. Very cool, took a group of high schools students, we went all over Turkey. Bucket list a check!Tell the ladies to cover up to be respectful.
Stunning. The sheer ingenuity of craftsmen to build such a edifice with no computers, slide rules, H@S is perhaps the best testament. There are others of course but this is truly magnificent.
Largest Mosque in Istanbul. This mosque is easily reached by the T1 tram. You will find it right across fro the Eminonu.tram stop.
Fantastic. Get their early to avoid long queues, if not you could be queuing a long time. Ladies remember a head scarf, but they are provided if you forget.

Wow a must in Istanbul. It is well worth the walk up the narrow streets, because once you get to the top, you are rewarded with a stunning Mosque. Not overcrowded and plenty to see, allow a couple of hours and take your camera.

Beautiful. Although it is not as highly decorated as the Blue Mosque, this one has significantly less people which makes it much more of a peaceful place to take in the beautiful mosque. Highly suggest to visit this mosque.

Worth a visit. Everybody seems to go to the Blue Mosque but this mosque is even more beautiful and slightly less touristy. The interior is really stunning with pretty domed ceilings and atmospheric lighting. Plus there are great views from the terrace.

Perhaps nicer than Blue Mosque ?. Suleymaniye mosque is one of the top mosques of Istanbul … no doubt ! Just renovated and polished off. Remarkable and beautifull but not so crowded as the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia. Go west from Eminonu and take a few alleys over 700m, towards the end steeper and steeper (or take a taxi). At the grounds of the mosque you have a view (partly obstructed) on the Bosphorus. At the backside and next to the mosque you will find a few restaurants … Daruzziyafe restaurant is a good one (see tripadvisor) to have a break and sip your tea.
Spiritual place with high standards of art and architecture. The blue of this mosque is shinning and make you feel serenity within you ,art is in every detail around you.

Impressive strucure - simpler inside. Another mosque - after the Hagia and the Blue mosque, this also looks impressive (slightly larger structure) however feels the same as the Blue Mosque. Worth checking out.

A Gem - great for quiet contemplative moment. This mosque does not attract the number of tourists the beautiful Blue Mosque does. In fact, if you go close to closing time (around 4PM when I was there) there will be hardly anyone there. The visitors area is somewhat restricted and women have to wear scarves. But in the quiet of this beautiful building you can enjoy a quiet moment for contemplation and/or prayer, no matter what beliefs you adhere to.
Better than blue mosque. Bigger mosque than the blue mosque and very historic. Stunning architecture both inside and outside.
Better than Blue Mosque!. Prettier, more soulful and far more imposing than the Blue Mosque. Fewer tourist as well. Slightly off the beaten path though. MUST visit if in Istanbul.
Amazing!!!!. So beautiful and amazing!!No hideous crowds and hassling from sellersOne of the greatest buildings in the world!!Please go!!!!!!!
History History History. I'm not a history buff, but i left this location with a much greater appreciation for the world history that occurred here.

Favourite mosque in Istanbul. In terms of grandeur and spectacle, there are other mosques on a higher level, but this mosque has the benefit of being much quieter than the Blue Mosque, and that's what made this a more enjoyable visit. Beautiful interior, well kept and maintained, and the Imam had a beautiful recitation.

Amazing!. Great mosque, which can bring you up under the floor. Big building in a center Istanbul but also the oasis of calm and meditation. Sometimes I felt disappointed that Western tourist do not follow the rules with silence, shoes and women hair covers. Advised for all the tourists.

Beautiful and peaceful. This place was lovely and so less crowded compared to the Blue Mosque. The view is amazing and after the mosque we went to a nearby rooftop cafe. The walk down to the subway was thru a very poor area...eye opening.

Suleymaniye Mosque (New Mosque). Loved this mosque, does not have the queues of the Blue Mosque. As with many of the other mosques, the decoration is wonderful. There are crowds that feed the pigeons outside.
Best mosque in Istanbul. Stunning. The best mosque in Istanbul - and there are lots. Simpler in decoration than the Blue Mosque but equally As impressive.

IndeedPeacefulSensationInside. Light in shape and in luminosity , a pity fwere Work in progression for mantenace of esternal greves. We had opportunity to hear starting of a pray and was a deeply touching emotion
Beautiful Mosque. Different then SultanAhmet Mosque, but for my opinion is more beautiful then other Mosque in Istanbul.
Extraordinary. You may see the architectural aura but very crowded indeed. You may also visit the Spice Bazaar next to it.
Very beautiful and quiet mosque. The Suleymaniye mosque is very beautiful and quiet. The Building is very large, but the interior is kept very 'simpel' in contrast to the Blue Mosque.

very peaceful and a different type of mosque. it is a less crowded and less touristy... peaceful and spiritual mosque. the route to this mosque goes via the main university of istanbul .definitely worth the walk and the views from there are awesome.

Peaceful surroundings. Took time off to walk up to see d mosque. A beautiful mosque though you cant really feel how huge it is from the grounds. You must go and see the area where you could see the Bosphorus sea view..
review of suleymanlye. less crowded than blue mosque_much quieter with less tourists.very good photo opportunities,highly recommended.

Great Place. Take the Tramway and drop in Bayazit station and it's gonna be around 12 minutes walk. The Coffee shops & restaurants are surrounding the Suleymaniye Mosque if you need to take a break.Inside is a very nice mosque surrounded with a quite environment... but they said that the sultan suleiman Tomb is not open for visitors and they add no more about when to get back or till when it's closed !WC access is for 1TL

Blue Mosque, (without the waiting in line). This Mosque is on a hill, looking over the Bosphorus, just as impresive as the Blue Mosque, in fact more so. The architecture is amazing, but as it sits atop a hill you have all round views as well.

Elegant Mosque. A break from the hustle of the Blue Mosque, this massive mosque has an elegance about it. Clean lines, nice shape to the arches, beautiful worn marble everywhere, etc. Bonus interesting graveyard next to the mosque is photogenic and worth a stroll.
Suleymaniye - worth the extra walk. Stunning. More beautiful and peaceful than Blue Mosque. Even if you think you've seen enough mosques, take the time to go.
Beautiful and Elegant. The Suleymaniye Mosque is a magnificent piece of architecture. The crowds are not here and you can absorb the splendour of the the architectural design and structure.
overlooking the city. Large and basically seen from all areas of Istanbul.Great view from the back garden overlooking the Bosphorous .Look for the tombs of Roxanna and the tombstones.

A 2-hour wait to get in!. I enjoyed the outside rather than wait in such a long line. Others who did wait said the famous blue tiles were less impressive than in some of the smaller local mosques that require no line. Do be aware that you probably need to get there at opening time and that even if you get to the front of the line, you may need to wait through a scheduled prayer time to get entrance as a visitor.

Impressive. A very impressive mosque inside and out with interesting grounds with social provision, such as helping to house, feed and educate the poor, etc. Definitely worth a visit and is close to the Grand Bazaar and the University. There are plenty of cafes around as well.
Out of the Way, But Worth the Effort. Take a taxi if necessary, but go. Once their, an easy walk to the Galata Bridge - Eminonou tram-and-transit complex.

Sinan's Masterpiece. This mosque is a good steep walk up from Eminönö or down the street from the university near the grand bazaar and is worth the effort. Friday bet 11 and 2 the inside is closed and very busy. The exterior is a whole compound, more than just a mosque. The detailing and stones work is exquisite. As a bonus check ou the rooftop cafe just east of the grounds you can see the entrance on the side street, great views on top to sip tea and take in the city.
Absolutely Beautiful. It was beautiful and the history is very interesting. Our private guide Zerrin was so much help. It is a definite must-see when you are Istanbul.

Go see it but don't skip the Blue Mosque for it. Several people told us to go to this mosque suggesting that it's much nicer and more interesting than the Blue Mosque. I don't know why people were even making a comparison. They're nothing like each other. Go to both. If you can't, go to the Blue Mosque. This mosque is lovely but simple and plain. On the upside, you can see it in 10 minutes.

Not a welcome spot of visitors. It took quite a bit of effort and lira to get up to this mosque only to be turned away. And rudely turned away at that. Some visitors were being allowed in and others turned away to wait for who knows how long (nothing to do with dress).
Must go mosque. We went there last week . Entrance is free . 10 min walk from Besiyat tram station . Its better than blue mosque and Hagia sofia . View from the top was good . Highly reccomend .
Sublime Mosque!!. The most ostentatious Mosque of Istanbul in my opinion. The architecture is fantastic and breath taking. D

Beautiful with great Views. A beautiful mosque at the center of a large complex of gardens. Don't miss the excellent views across the Golden Horn in the northeast corner of the grounds. Tie into a trip to the Grand Bazaar or the nearby Hammam of the same name.

amazing. As almost all mosques in Istanbul, are amazing! Very clean and beautiful. What I didnt like was the unrespectfull way of other travelers speaking loud and taking pictures with flash of the locals praying.

The most beautiful mosk in Istanbul. This mosk is much more beautiful than well-known Blue mosk in the center of Istanbul, here you will enjoy everything - the architecture of the mosk itself as well as view, peaceful atmosphere and the way to mosk through cosy streets with native atmosphere.

Must visit. Avoid religious holidays like Eid. And you may consider cooler weather. We went there in October and it was nice except it was during Eid. You have to take off your shoes and not everyone wear clean socks :)

Rare to see something like this.. What a combination of art , convulgance of religions. Sculpture, frescos, paintings, stained glass, calligraphy, and more.
It has a serene atmosphere except for noisy guides.
You will have a longish wait but worth every minute.
The surrounding areas and tombs are also interesting .
Better than Blue Mosque???. Having visited both, I really preferred Suleymaniye. It's a little quieter, more serene and has more interesting features ...

Architecture is breathtaking at least from THE outside. Love THE detail both in and outside. Beautiful ceilings. On THE grounds outside quote a few cats and dogs, which I liked. They did not beg ,just liaid in THE shade and watched THE tourists
Amazing. Lovely place to visit, Must see at night. Queues might be long some days but well worth it. Very pretty inside.

Amazing Mosque. The interior is a lot simpler than other great mosques in Istanbul, which allows the proportions and the harmony of the building to really shine.If you have time and are in the area it's worth a visit, especially since it's free. Like most of the big historic mosques in Istanbul, the outside is impressive and the inside in beautiful. Quieter and calmer than some of the more famous attractions also!
Beautiful. Beautiful Mosque and its free to enter but long queues and a long wait to get in, so best to go earlier in the day.

Majestic. A visit to this mosque should be a must in any trip to Istambul. It is not onle the largest and most splendid, but also has the tumbs of Suleyman and Roxelana in the cementery adjacent to the mosque in a hill overlooking the city.
Mosque visitor. I was in Istanbul 25 years ago when it was an interesting and "mysterious" city. Now it is packed with tourists and everything is crowded.
We like this mosque best!. Everyone goes to the Blue Mosque and almost always their are lines. This mosque is a great one to visit with less crowds but intersting interiors and exteriors.

Now close to the top attractions. The Suleymaniye Mosque is worth the time and effort to get to in Istanbul. It has a coherence of style both internally and externally - and a sense of the spiritual now missing from other places in the city. It also, to its credit, has excellent voluntary guides who are prepared to talk with you about aspects of the Mosque.

Stunningly beautiful. Such a grand sight to behold. What's great is that it's free and you can either take your time and enjoy the site itself or you can keep it short and feel fine about not having to pay anything to have a wonderful experience. As per previous posts, be mindful and sensitive to the culture by dressing appropriately and expect it to smell like feet. Enjoy :)

Suleymanye mosque is in the top of hill. Suleymanye Mosque is in the top of hill and inside very atmospheric, very nice energy inside. Highly recomend. There are tombs of Suleyman and his family by the Mosque.

Glorious. A shining monument to the hight of the Muslim empire. It can be seen from several vantage points around the city and it looks incredible from every one of them. Take your camera or smart phone and go crazy is my advice.
lovely grounds. Interesting cemetery and a building containing tombs, are on the grounds . The mosque was beautiful.
Scenic mosque. This is one of my personal favorites among mosques in Istanbul. A true beauty with a scenic view of Istanbul. Worth the hill and the climbing.
Gorgeous. Don't just go to the Blue Mosque. This one is so much more special. Make sure you shoulders and knees are covered. Women must also cover their heads. Wear easy to slip on and off shoes.

Magnificent. It is the largest mosque in the city (Hagia Sophia is a museum!). It was built on the order of Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent by the royal architect Mimar Sinan in the middle of the 16th century. Sinan tried to rival with Hagia Sophia. To achieve the same effect of unsupported dome, he hid the massive pillars, which support the dome, inside the walls. Although not as large as Hagia Sophia, the Süleymaniye is brighter, thanks to light coming from the huge amount stained-glass windows. The interior decoration is minimal, with white marble, ivory and very restrained use of Iznik tiles. And probably because the light and discreet decorations, it`s more serene and majestic than the Blue Mosque. It`s also much less touristy, although lately tourists are beginning to discover this place, primarily due to the popularity of the show “Magnificent Century”. In the garden behind the mosque are mausoleums of Sultan Suleiman de Magnificent and his favorite wife Hürrem Sultana (Roxelana). So if you are fan of the “Magnificent Century”, it`s the absolute must! Sadly the tombs are not open to the public.
amazing. its big and beautifull like to go and visit again. inside decoration is amazing. dome are very tall.
Impressive. Get to see inside a working mosque. Be prepared to line up for the privilege. Once inside it's worth it.

Gigantic Mosque. This mosque is so huge that you can see it from afar. The courtyard is great and nice to click photos. Upon entering note that you need to take off your shoes/footwear although you can pick a plastic bag at the entrance for packing and putting inside your bag. It is advised that visitors wear long pants (below knees) and shirt/tops with sleeves. This applies to both men and women. The inner part of the mosque is divided into 2 -the common area which visitors can stay and observe and the prayer area. The prayer area is only for Muslim faithful who would like to pray. The sides of the mosque is for ladies. Look above and see the nice, artistic and colorful presentation of some verses from Quran. Notice the huge columns that support the mosque. be amazed by the lights hanging above. Take time to sit for a few minutes (15 mins minimum) and observe the faithfuls pray.Of course, dont leave the mosque with out taking pics. Bring your wide angle and low light lens to capture the beauty of the place.Note: some part of the mosque is undergoing repair.If this review has given you insight, please click "helpful" below.
still in use. this mosque looks amazing from the outside but is a big dissapointment from the inside. the mosque is still in use and therefore you dont have access to many places in the mosque.
Beautiful. This mosque is Definitely worth seeing and worth the trek. Very large with excellent an courtyard. Do yourself a favor and see it.
Amazing!. Beautiful building, great history, nothing like I've seen before. if you haven't been to Istanbul...its time :)

Blue Mosque. Across square from Hagia Sophia. Also worth the trip. Incredible interior. Very long lines when cruise ships in so better to wait latePM after 4:45. Line moves fast so don't be discouraged. Close around 5:30 or so so time your visit accordingly. Don't get suckered by some guy wanting $40 to get you ahead of the line. You'll be in in less than 10 minutes.

Worth seeing. Although the mosque is not famous as blue mosque or Hagia Sophia and it is not crowded as other famous sightseeing. But believe me the glory and the architecture of the place is amazing. One big advantage I saw you can find opposite the mosque souvenirs shops and it is much cheaper than sultanahmed area and grand bazaar ever before negotiating the price, also some good local restaurants opposite the mosque with good prices.You will see some beggars mainly women and children but you can ignore them and continue enjoying your visit. You can go there by tram (T1 Line) and you can walk for about 15 Min to reach the mosque I do not remember the tram stop but you can ask there some advice. Avoid taking Taxi; I had a bad experience with Taxi drivers, deliberately they take a longer path and sometimes they do tricks in the fare calculator that you might pay 5 times the actual fare. I strongly recommend using Tram or Metro while moving between your favorite places and your hotel.
amazing. the one of the most wonderful mosque in the world. especially at the night time.. soo amazing
It was Monday so this mosque was closed.. Wonderful structure and interesting story. Beautiful grounds, parks and nice restuarants to grab a bite. Beware of the taxi drivers.
In love with that mosque. We prayed at Suleymaniye Mosque after shopping at the Grand Bazar (Around 8 mintues walk). Very lovely and nicely decorated. I loved it.

Worth a trip!. Thanks to tripadvisor...I did squeeze in a time to see this mosque despite visiting the Blue Mosque & the Hagia Sophia already in Istanbul especially since it was only 0.4 miles away from the hotel I was staying...It was definitely a big one...I believe this is the biggest one in Istanbul but it does offer something different especially when you can visit the tomb of Suleyman the Magnificent within the mosque grounds...I would definitely recommend anyone to visit this place

A must see. This was my favorite mosque - it is surrounded by a very busy, noisy neighborhood - and then you walk into this quiet, green oasis. The building was beautiful and provided great information on Islam.
the mosque and the view of istanbul. suleymaniye mosque is very beautiful as much as blue mosque, fully recommended to see and take photos of the mosque and the view of istanbul ( golden horn part)

good location but room was noisy. stayed there 6 days.location if hotel is wonderful near to istiklal caddesi(street) and near bus station and metro.the room was small but very clean and the bathroom was very good.the break fast was good and delicious except orange juice(artificial). we had great time in Istanbul and thanks to grand halic hotel .
The most attractive mosque in Istanbul. This mosque has a beautiful tranquillity about it. It was built for Suleyman the Magnificent whose tomb is in the grounds. Not to be missed in my view.

Listen to the prayer chanting. Also a nice place to visit. You can wander round inside, maybe i didn't see it all but there were so many people in there it's hard to stand still at times. There is a prayer vocal battle between the two mosques around 1-2pm, each person takes a turn to chant a verse of prayer over loudspeakers, interesting turn of events.

Worth the Hike. This mosque is up on a hill, so be prepared for the hike. But! it is totally worth it. I walked up the hill just before a storm blew in, and it was terribly windy and gray. But once I got inside the mosque it felt like a peaceful (warm) sanctuary.

Best best plac for visiting. When I saw the mosque sultan Ahmed I believe how the ottoman architect was advance at that time.When I enter the mosque you will see the arch bulid by marble and what shook me was the time they bulid the mosque in 7 years
A place for the soul. The Suleymaniye Mosque is a truly a place for the soul. I was so awed my the majesty of the building, I had to return one more time on my last day to experience it again.

Long way. Beautiful mosque following the style of Blue Mosque.Be aware if you want to climb the hill from Galata bridge to Suleymaniye mosque you need to have stamina.Probably is better to come from the side of grand bazar.
Nice building,pity about the people. Interesting mosque, worse than a football crowd. A circus. Suffering from too many cruise ships with few places to go.

Süleymaniye Mosque - Big and Impressive. The Süleymaniye Mosque is the second largest mosque in Istanbul. Built between 1550-57 it is an impressive reminder of the Ottoman Empire's military might and power. You can walk around the entire complex, There is a breathtaking view from the walls down to the Bosphorus. The interior is simple and beautiful. The huge central dome is similar to that found in Hagia Sophia, and the stained-glass windows were lovely. From the Süleymaniye Mosque you can head down to see the New Mosque and the Rustem Pasa Mosque. And from there you can catch the tram up to the Sultanahmet area.
Turkey 2014. Smaller and quite lovely..the frescos are gorgeous..and the noon prayer service was beautiful! No lines the day that we went.

Worth the walk. This Mosque is considered to be the most important of the many Mosques in Istanbul. It was stunning and well worth the walk away from the other key sites in Sultanahmet. Also appeared less busy than other key sites.
Smaller crowds. I found this mosque more beautiful than the Blue Mosque and there was no crowd. Well worth the effort to go see this one!

The mosque from Heaven, Suleymaniye. My husband and I entered this mosque through the prayer entrance, a much easier way to get into any mosque. The silence which greeted us seemed from another world. The carpeting, the most exquisite I've seen, silences not only footsteps but distractions in one's own mind; something that heals and eases the soul. Praying in such a place, regardless of religion becomes natural and I prayed for all inside and outside the mosque. The scuplture, window designs, lighting, carpeting and the very size creates a unique and monumentally beautiful place in the world.
Fantastic. If you don't go to see this when in Istanbul don't call yourself a traveller - its on most people's bucket list...
The beautiful Mosque. One of the beautiful mosques that I ever seen its pink color really stunt me. Constructed by my Arnaut co patriot Architect Sinani Love it

Beautiful mosque, staff could be friendlier. You can't miss the mosque, it's huge and sits on top of the hill not so far from the Blue Mosque etc. Women must drape a scarf on their heads and be dressed modestly to enter. They will provide you with a cloak and scarf if you need one. The grounds are beautifully kept. We were a little disappointed when we went to see Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent's tomb because it was locked up and not easy to see from windows. I had to zoom in with my camera to see which tomb was his. They could at least let people have a better view from the window. His wife's tomb had worse visibility. Not worth opening up the area if we can't see anything. It's located in the cemetery that had lists of people's name. It would have been nice to have brief on who generally was buried in the cemetery and how far back they're dated. Staff were quite protective and aggressive at the entrance of the mosque. I understand it's their job to make sure we're respectful when entering but a smile and explanation is far better than a scowl and an order. All that being said, it's a beautiful mosque on beautiful grounds. You should definitely see it.

I am not religious but I feel very tranquile and ease here. So much history behind this famous mosque, one of my favourites and always look forward to going there each time I visit Istanbul. The decor is amazing and I feel at peace whenever I visit there.
Stunning. It is a beautiful sight. A must to visit. Ladies must cover their legs, shoulders and heads. Don't go there at prayer time though as you aren't permitted to enter!

More enjoyable than the Blue Mosque. If you find the crowds at the Blue Mosque overbearing then we actually found the Suleymaniye Mosque to be a more awesome place once inside. Its architecture and history are equally fascinating but its much less crowded and so you can asbsorb the atmosphere and history that much better

suleymaniye mosque is the best mosque in istanbul. I am so surprised that all the web sites talking about the blue mosque and not about suleymaniye mosque.this is must see for me . its garden and gate are fantastic . also the hugeness of the inside of the mosque is wonderful .also it seems as if it is new because it is very well maintained.it is very easy to go to the mosque which is located within walking distance from the old city of sultanahmet and especially laleli and aksaray.

Majestic Mosque. A very moving experience where the magnificence both inside and outside the mosque can be assessed in your own time. Perhaps we were lucky with timing (Sunday morning during Eid), but there were no queues so no pressure to move along at a prescribed pace, therefore time to take in the workmanship. A nice touch was the attempt to explain the beliefs (and myths) of Islamism inside the mosque, very topical in this part of the world.
Serene. architecture was amazing with bautiful peaceful atmosphere and clean cool marble everywhere including the washrooms!
Beautiful!. Nice and spacious. Gorgeous from the inside out, just a little far away from where we were staying.Had to walk a lot, weren't guided properly.

Beautiful, clean, simple, inspiring. This mosque is a great place for a peaceful experience, whether you visit for actual worship or just to get a quiet moment. It is simple and yet very beautiful. It is not far from the grand bazaar, and worth a trip. The grounds are very nice as well.

Beautiful mosque. The architecture was stunning, a nice mosque located on one of the 7 hills of Istanbul, entry was free, we were allowed to walk around freely, an absolutley magical soul cleansing place.
At first time it is very impresive. I like the historical mosques and Topkapi palace.What I did not liked it is that are a very crowded visits specially on Hollydays.
What a mosque!!. Go first thing in the morning, ahead of the crowds. Walk around the garden. Inside the mosque, you will be rewarded with the Suleymaniye's majestic beauty.

Pretty Impressive. For something that was built hundreds of years ago, this place is pretty impressive, but it could be better. You can see the structure from the outside and it is impressive with all the domes. You can also go in the courtyard and get a better look at the building, but to get into the actual mosque, you either have to be a muslim going for a prayer, or you queue up to go in the side entrance. We queued as we were tourists and it was 40 minutes and tourists were being whisked through the fast lane as they were on a promise of seeing the tour guides brother's carpet shops afterwards (good luck with that). We did get inside, and as I said earlier for something so old, it is pretty impressive. The tiles are fantastic all over the walls and ceilings, but there is disrepair and not much repair work being carried out. For the amount of money that is paid into the coffers next door at the museum of the Hagya Sofia , money should be spent here repairing the beautiful ceiling work,

Incredible architecture. Loved the history and traditions of the Turkish people. Prayer was just begining when we arrived and all visitors were respectful of the patrons and left them to quietly worship.
The Blue Mosque. A definite must see in Istanbul, it is so beautiful, the stained glass windows, the tiles and the carpet in red with beautiful flowers and it's huge...

Quiet sanctuary away from the tours. This impressive mosque is a short walk from the Old Town Center, and was almost empty of tourists, unlike the Blue Mosque. It's interior is bright and much less colorful than the Blue Mosque, and more conducive to introspective viewing. We found its simplicity very attractive. There was also a very detailed English language explanation of Islam, which provides an educational perspective on the tenets of the religion. I strongly recommend a visit.
Beautiful. Very interesting. We had a private guide so learnt a lot and were able to see everything in better prospective.
very nice!!!. It is so beautiful same as blue mosque. I love this place! It takes about 20 minutes walk from eminonu.

THE mosque to visit.. More dignified, more subtle, architecturally and historically more significant, and not to mention much, much, much less crowded then the Blue Mosque. We visited both and this would be the one we would have chosen if we only have time for one.

Awesome. Busy but didnt have to queue for long.Passed the abulotions area on the way in. I was prepared and had a large scarf with me as is customary, but females could borrow/hire one on the way in. Beautifully decorated building and with a calm atmosphere despite the number of visitors.
Worth the walk. A little walk from most places but it was quieter than other popular spots and the Mosque was beautiful
Beautiful Mosque. Much less crowded than Blue Mosque and historically significant with beautiful interior and surrounding areas

Lovely mosque by Sinan the builder. It is far less crowded than the Blue mosque but it is also not quite as stunning as the Blue mosque. Fewer tiles inside, but the sarcophagus of Sinan is inside the mosque. This is also close to the Grand Bazarre so you could combine visits to the two.
Beautiful. This is another beautifully ornamented mosque with depth of history. I loved it. It is a loverly experience to walk through the mosque and see all the history.
Stunning. The simplicity of the Mosques are inspirational. Unlike other religions, it appears to be simply a place of worship without all the frills
A must see. Slightly off the beaten path, but well worth the slight detour. The area around the mosque is great and there is a lovely Hammam near by too. really Impressive mosque!
Exquisite. It was a such a beautiful place. The inside is a bit smelly as people going on with their smelly feet!

Beautiful. The vast size of the entire complex around the Suleymaniye Mosque is very impressive. Also it's state is excellent although there is some reconstruction work is going on in the surrounding building outside the main walls. The entire interior including the lighting is beautiful. Go the Sultan roof terrace Cafe just in the front of (south side) the Mosque for a cup of Turkish coffee or tea and a great view across the entire city.

Spirituality. Sure the architecture is unique and the whole area with its medrese, tumbs an gardens worths the visit. But, Suleymaniye is part of the little group of religious buildings where someone feels the elevation of his soul. Rare. Highly recommended
what a place. this mosque is just fantastic, the whole area is mind blowing and there is so much to take in, best to go early morning if you can to avoid large waiting times to get in

Wonderful place to relax and enjoy the beauty. I went to 6 mosques in Istanbul during my visit and this and Rusta Pashem were my favorites. I'll admit that Blue Mosque is much more visually impressive, but there is an expansive and peaceful feeling to Suleymaniye that I didn't find at the others. Further, the grounds are also beautiful and less crowded than the more touristy areas near the Blue Mosque. I also thought the materials on Islam were interesting and helpful to a visitor who knows little about the religion.

Beautiful mosque. The newly renovated Mosque is quite stunning. They also had some wonderful murals describing the Muslim history and it was very fascinating. This is surely a sight worth seeing when visiting Istanbul

Excellent exterior, but.... The view of this mosque is magnificent. It can be seen from many places in Istanbul. But, I don't necessarily think its worth a visit for itself, as the interiors aren't that much to brag about, especially if you've been to the Blue Mosque and others first. The outside is much more impressive.

Worth the hike. We actually climbed through the spice bazaar and through the grand bazaar so it took about 30 min to get there from eminou station (new mosque). The deco is not as much as the blue mosque but it has great acoustics and the mausoleums of Suleiman (expanded the empire 7X from when he got it) and Roxelana. They are not open to the public but fun to take picture in front of them. The cemetery is also very interesting.
Massive and must see. You cannot miss it. It's huge and beautiful. You just need to check out the pictures posted by travelers here.
The Blue Mosque. Absolutely breathtaking and, in spite of all the people, a wonderful sense of peace. Beautiful tiles in lovely colours.
Massive. You need to be found of the architecture and man made structures. It is most impressive from a distance.And when it is dark, the lights speaks by itself. Worth a Visit.
Fascinating. A calm and beautifully decorated mosque, most attractive. Not to be missed. Still a working mosque, but tourists did not seem to intrude on the faithful who were worshipping there.

Beautiful Mosque well worth the visit. This is a beautiful site to visit in Istanbul. Be warned women must be covered from their heads to past their knees and men must also have covered knees. If you do not have coverings they will supply cloths to you. Ladies if you have a light scarf take it with you because it can be very hot in the mosque.Despite this and the crowds it is well worth a visit. On Fridays parts of the day the mosque is closed for prayer so if possible go another day.

My favorite Mosque of all Istanbul!. We finally arrive to this beautiful mosque, which is my favorite mosque. It blended Islamic and Byzantine architectural elements. Mimar Sinan the great architect is buried behind the mosque. The views to the Golden horn and the Bosphorus are unique. Here you can find more photos and information about my last visit to this Mosque:http://phototrekistanbul.blogspot.com.tr/2013/10/photo-trek-vefa-and-sulemaniye-mosque.html
Peace. a place of peace and beauty...magical. Close to Grand Bazaar. Rich history well explained in a pamphlet at the entrance. Visited for evening Maghrib prayer; spiritually uplifting atmosphere.
Stunning interior. Off the beaten track and reasonably quiet compared to other attractions so no queues but beautiful building and fabulous views from outside across the city

Huge Mosque. You have to hike a bit to get to this mosque which towers above other buildings nearby. Parts of the grounds were under renovation so we didn't see everything. Didn't think the interior could hold a candle to the Blue Mosque. It is most impressive from a distance.

The most beautifull one!. This mosque is for me the most beautifull one of them all in Istanbul. Both inside and outside its really well maintaned and looks fantastic. It also gives you from the outer courtyard some excellent views of the Golden Horn, Bospurus and surrounding areas.
Beautiful and historical. One of the most beautiful mosques we have seen so far. During our visit there was a explanation about Islam which was very enlightning.
cover up!. beautiful and serene place to visits if mosques are your thing. big line so get in early. make sure shoulders and thighs are covered, and women need to wear a headscarf.

Lovely site to see - Definitely recommend. Went to the Suleymaniye Mosque twice on my recent trip to Istanbul. Looks absolutely amazing from the outside and inside. We waited in the queue (around 20 minutes - queue did get bigger, we went very early in the morning) and it was great that they let you borrow an outfit if needed for free. We put them on and walked inside. Sure does look so beautiful and nice. A shame it was so busy inside and lots of tour groups, however still was an amazing experience. Nice to walk around as well and take pictures from all angles. Would definitely recommend and go again when in Istanbul. No charge to go in either. To use the loo there is a fee and toilets were dirty.

Stunning !. There is an absorbing sense of space, culture, art and architecture that can only be experienced.Photos may tempt but being there is a must to truly appreciate its beauty and magnificence.

I should not tell you.... When everyone is lining up to go into the blue mosque you should better visit the Suleymaniye Mosque. The dimension is impressing and the interior as well. In addition to the mosque you have the environment around with caravanserais and bazars. Well, as I should not tell you since this is a little visited mosque and it can soon become crowded. 

Much better than Blue Mosque, and quiet and empty. We discovered this gem while looking for the grand bazaar - direct entrance, and a much nicer experience than the blue mosque where the overwhelming impression is foot odour.
Mosque loved, great place. Mosque loved, great place. Very bright, lots of stained glass. Will be in Istanbul. be sure to visit

Beautiful mosque exquisitely restored in lovely grounds. A large mosque with 4 minarets featuring superb 10 detailed serefes.The exterior is impressive; the interior is beautiful and immaculately restored.Not crowded and with a hushed atmosphere- a place of worship rather than a busy tourist attraction.The grounds and their structures are also in exceptional condition. Suleyman and Roxelana's tombs are here.Additionally the view from here is superb- one of Istanbul's most famed.
Amamzing!. It was a such a beautiful place. The inside is a bit smelly as people going on with their smelly feet!
An Island of Peace and Tranquility. This is a must-see in Istanbul. The beauty of the building, both the interior and exterior are overwhelming. Not as crowded as the Blue Mosque

Amazing on the inside than outside. The exterior of the mosque looks simple but the interior was exquisite. A huge mosque that attracts many visitors as well as local praying public. Long queue may put off tourists but it is well worth seeing from the inside.

Exquisite. A most beautiful mosque.
It is a much used place of worship and you will need to be properly attired, remove your shoes, and keep the chatter to a murmur, and rightly so.

Undoubtably a must see. The mosque is closed to visitors during prayer times so check up on those before you visit. Also you are likely to stand in a line for at least 30 minutes so work that into your plan.

A relaxed and uplifting visit. After our crowded and noise-ridden visit to The Blue Mosque we really appreciated the peace, quiet and beauty of the Suleymaniye Mosque....which is beyond the reach of large tour coaches and groups. It is surrounded by lovely gardens/lawns and there is a good restaurant within the precinct.

It's located up on high hill!. I just decided to visit this place on first day in Istanbul and had no idea before that this place is located on mountain. The mosque seemed not far so I headed to this place. The way to climb up hill amazed me and made me exhausted than expectation.

Favorite Mosque!. I visited this mosque on my last day in Istanbul. It was so much more peaceful than the Blue Mosque. Many less tourists and souvenirs were less expensive near by. Definitely see it if you have a chance!

Well worth a visit. This is quite an ornate mosque, and perhaps better than the Blue Mosque/Sultanahmet. You can walk there from the Blue Mosque/Hagia Sophia etc. in about half an hour, and the Grand Bazaar is about halfway between them.
Fantastic!. You can visit the mosque out of prayer´s time, it´s a very beautiful place! The vitrals are unique and the calm inside is worth living it.
Visit to Süleymaniye. Beautiful building, impressive architecture peaceful and not as swamped by tourists as the Blue Mosque is.

amazing. Very beautiful mosque.Better if you take something with you to cover your heat and for men it is enought if you cover your knees. It was so busy when we were there but believe me you have to see it.
One of the best mosque in turkey. This mosque till use how turkish they wear amazing in building and design , I advice all visitors to visit this mosque.
Place of peace. This gives you a great insight into the peaceful side of Islam. It's such a nice break to see something that has a true love by the cities people

mosqus. This mosque is beautiful inside - amazing stained glass windows and an air of calm which sweeps over you on entering. I loved it - perhaps even more than the Blue Mosque. We were lucky to go on a.

Amazing. I actually had the time to visit here while on a business trip. Such a beautiful and sacred place to visit. The pictures do not do it justice. The craftsmanship and architecture is one that is extremely detailed. Definitely enjoyed this place.

Beautiful!. Visited on a wet and cold day, but once inside the mosque, the dullness of the day dissapeared! The amazing workmanship inside is unbelievable! This is a definite 'must see' for anyone visiting Istanbul. A word of warning-there are only one set of toilets in the mosque grounds. If you visit the cafes just outside, they do not have wc's, so don't get caught out! A very peaceful place to sit and relax. As this is a 'working mosque, time your visit between prayer times.
Blue masjid. Very nice masjid . Magnificent monument that show the strongest of Muslims once upon a day . U should visit it .
Amazing building and well maintained. take the walk uphill from Eminonu port towards the mosque. You will pass by narrow streets, old buildings, full of history.
Beautiful mosque. The inside of this mosque is far more beautiful than Sultanahmet mosque it's definitely worth a visit
Peaceful. Best late in the day when it is quiet.Has a lovely simplicity and singularity of purpose, unlike the Aka Sofya

The Biggest Mosque in Istanbul. This one is special. It is the biggest mosque in Istanbul. Although it may not seem like it because the Blue mosque is pretty big. I think this one is the biggest because of the complex that belongs to it- the spa, graveyard, gardens, market place...It is beautiful on the inside just as much as on the outside. Garden is simple and neat.
Worth the visit. Although parts of the mosque were not open it was worth the visit. We enjoyed the immense size and the quiet feeling in such a busy city.
Beautiful and peaceful Camii!!. Amazing Mosque! It also contains the tube of Suleyman!!It is also located in Fatih area, na area in the old town of Costantinoupolis!

Sinan, The Great Architect. The great architect Sinan designed a mosque that has huge prayer hall under a vast dome with great structure yet with appropriate decoration. The lighting and acustic are superbly design. If you make a sound anywhere in the mosque, it can be heard with the same intensity all over the mosque. Can't believe it was constructed in 1550 and still so beautiful than most modern mosque nowadays

Historical mosque. I'm glad to have had the opportunity to visit the "Blue Mosque". It is one of the most popular sites in Istanbul. We had to wait in a long line to enter the working mosque. Ladies if you're going to visit the mosque, please make sure you cover your legs, head, and shoulders. On the outside of the mosque they will provide sheets to cover up. The mosque was extremely busy that day we went so just feel like I had a quick look around before heading out of the crowded mosque.

Beautiful interior. Firstly, the review below titled "if you must" relates to the Aya Sofia, not to this place so ignore that review.This mosque is beautiful inside - amazing stained glass windows and an air of calm which sweeps over you on entering. I loved it - perhaps even more than the Blue Mosque. We were lucky to go on a quiet Sunday afternoon so the lack of the massive crowd probably added to our experience.A definite must see in Istanbul. As usual, cover up and ladies take a headscarf.
Imperial Blue Mosque. The visit was a quick one as there are some restoration to the mosque. There was a long queue and waiting time was 20mins. Very famous mosque and not to be missed.

Mind Blowing. We visited this mosque after visiting many other to us this was the best not the most elaborate but the one you will always remember.After we left this mosque we stopped for coffee just outside the gates and the call to prayer started it was the most eerie fantastic sound we had ever heard, over two and half thousand Imams all calling prayer together I can only like it to or imagine it like standing in the centre of a giant beehive, something I will never forget.

Beautiful place of worship. My visit to Istanbul has given me a greater understanding of Islam and the Suleymaniye Mosque captures this perfectly. Much calmer and more peaceful than the Blue Mosque, it is a magnificent place of worship and a credit to those that care for it... make sure you visit when in Sultanahmet.

Mosque. This mosque is not so beautiful from the outside but once you go inside it is breathtaking! We were very fortunate that our guide told us to visit this mosque which we did on our own and were we ever glad we did

Beautiful Mosque. This is a beautiful mosque that is definitely worth a visit! Unfortunately, due to the fact that it works as a place of cult it is not possible to look at it in all its splendour and detail, but it is a good experience.

If you must. Luckily our private tour guide fast passed us in past the super long lines. THE PLACE:It used to be a church in the beginning, then a mosque, and now it's a museum, so we were told. The huge wooden doors inside leading into the museum are from Noah's Ark which was the coolest fact. There was construction going on, of course, so part of the inside was blocked with ceiling high scaffolding. There's no artifacts, just decor and some artwork. We ventured up the circular medium-easy ramps (no stairs) to the top. There's good views of the space below, and you get up close views of the mosaic tiles and other art work. OVERALL:Personally I'm not interested in places like this. It was cool to see but there's a lot more interesting places to experience here.

Serene Mosque. This mosque seems more serene than others. There is a courtyard on the left and a grave yard on the right. The mosque was designed by the 16th century architect Sinan. The graveyard is interesting and contains the tombs of Suleyman and his wife. Note that the gravestones have "hats" denoting the occupation of the deceased.

Beautiful and full of laight. this mosque is one of my favourites in the city. It is often less crowded than the Blue Mosque and it is definitely more beautiful. The windows let in so much light and are stained glass. I enjoy walking around the grounds and visiting the cemetery and tombs. There are plenty of places to eat while you are up on the hill.

Need to see this but that's it. Long queue so arrive early. Mosaics are pretty, however after seeing a lot other more exquisite religious sites this one is not as exciting and it didn't have a 'wow' effect on me.

Great beauty achieved through relative restraint. This mosque lies near some of the best authentic old wooden houses in the city but, being with a high intensity tour party, there was no time to see them. If you have time, do visit them.This mosque stood out from others for the following reasons; there are a whole host of ancillary buildings (some not presently open) such as a library, hospital, soup kitchen, madrassa and so on so very much a community centre and not just a mosque. The fact these buildings survive marks out this mosque from others where they have disappeared over the ages. It has an extensive and interesting graveyard, also the tomb (not open when we were there) of Suleyman the Magnificent who had the mosque built and his wife Roxelana; also the tomb of the architect Sinan – many consider this building his finest work though he did not agree nevertheless he chose to be buried here.The decoration inside is restrained compared to other major mosques in the city and refreshing for that. Stained glass, as a result, makes more impact than in other mosques. The carpet is different in that it has individual ‘cells’ marked out for worshippers rather than just ‘get down where you fancy’. The chandeliers make just the right degree of impact given the restraint of the background decoration. All in all, a very pleasing and not over-elaborate interior.The graveyard is worth lingering over with its fine range of quite different stones. Exterior decoration and stone features again differentiate this mosque from the others in their relative simplicity. Don’t miss this place – it has a lot to offer than Agia Sofia and The Blue Mosque do not and it is substantially less visited even though it is a few minutes’ walk from the Grand Bazaar.

Best Mosque in Town. Nobody tells you about this one but its clean facade and minimalist (by ottoman standards) decoration is refreshing after the complexity and busyness of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya.
A must-see Mosque. This is a wonderfully peaceful place to visit. Although most people visit the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, this is important one to visit.

The Blue Mosque. Exquisite tile work! We were able to go inside and take pictures and observe the local people and customs. Our guide explained the history of this beautiful edifice and gave us a booklet to keep. We saw hundreds of residents some dressed in western style clothing and many in more traditional garb. Visitors must wear appropriate clothing if going inside the mosque. Help is available.
Breathtaking Mosque. Magnificent mosque located on top of a hill. Bit of a climb/ walk to reach it but totally worth it. It has the floating dome that inspired Sinan in the Aya Sofya!

Spectacular and Serene. Much less of a show than the Blue Mosque, this spectacular space is so serene and contemplative that one cannot but help feel at peace here. Beautiful grounds. A bit of a hike from the bridge area, but worth it. Absolutely wonderful.
Gorgeous!. Worth the time to visit! Can be crowded, but you will love it! Loved the photo opportunities and rich history

one of the most superb mosques I have ever seen!. That's one of the most fascinating mosques I have ever visited. I visited also the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia...but trust me Suleymaniye Camii is better without any doubt. Located next to the university area it consists not only of the mosque itself but also of a garden in the back and tombs (turbe) on the right. It is worth visiting the whole mosque complex. Fascinating details inside from the colourful oriental rug to the huge chandelier. So cute! Higly recommended.There is also toilet on the back next to the garden (one Turkish Lira). Don't miss the fantastic view on the Bosphorus from the garden on the back.
Sinan's best. Suleymaniye Mosque is supposed to be the most beautiful and it was great... but we preferred the blue mosque over this one.

Beautiful. Beautiful mosque and entrance is free - immediately after the prayers (happen 5 times a day), there is a very nice recitation of verses from the Quran - if you are interested in the lyrical/musical qualities of Arabic, you will enjoy this too

Locals Say this is the Best Mosque in Istanbul. After seeing the attractions in the old city, we visited the Suleymanie Mosque and the gracious grounds and tombs surrounding it. Enter from the front gate for an impressive view of one of Sinan Mimar's masterful monuments. (Mimar's modest tomb is just outside the walls surrounding the mosque.) In contrast to many other buildings, this mosque is elegantly simple with some stenciling around the moldings, emphasizing the beauty of the structure. There are also some interesting design features (that one has to really look for), such as a small room above the front entrance where the soot from all the burning candles is collected to be reused for writing. When we visited there were only a few other people, so we could enjoy the serenity and appreciate the massiveness of the space. The grounds are also beautiful and are the site of Suleman the Magnificent and his wife, Roxelana's, tombs which were not open when we were there. There is a surrounding cemetery where many cats reside. This is a "must see" sight that many seem to miss.

worth the visit. We end up at Suleymaniye almost every time we're in Istanbul. It's a beautiful place with a commanding view of the city. We usually take a cab there (cabs are pretty affordable, especially if you're in that part of the city), which puts us at the top of the hill and then slowly make our way back down.
not worth the climb up. unless you staying long in Istanbul you can safely remove this from your list. and those who say this is better than blue mosque i completely disagree

Best Mosque in Istanbul. Another Mimar Sinan masterpiece... Not easy to find, but worth it to take the effort. Plus, you can walk to the Vefa Boza shop after or have some kuru fasulye (famous Turkish bean dish) near the Mosque.

Outstanding. So much less crowded than Blue Mosque. Much better internal architecture (unless you are besotted with Iznik tiles) than Blue Mosque. Designed by a master! The surrounding complex is also first class. If you only have the time to visit one mosque - this is the one.

Stunning architecture. Amazing place to visit. The achitecture and beauty of the place is breathtaking.
Just don't go on Friday because it's crowded due to the prayers day.
Magic!!. The wait in the line is totally worth it.... One of the most amazing buildings we've visited ever! The outside views at night are also a must see!

A Mosque thats it. Visited here for second time as we were with another couple on their first visit to Istanbul. Long queues in the hot sun [bring water ] Very nice building and our friends liked it .Tip wear shorts below knee for men and ladies have to cover up
Favourite Mosque. Peaceful, airy, beautiful and perfectly formed. Also lovely grassy courtyard surrounding it, away from the hustle and bustle of the streets.
Loved the mosque and its art. The mosque is a very nice site to visit and is recommended to anyone interested in historical arts and culture.

A peace of Magnificence. A little bit far from Sultanahmet District, however it does worth every step to visit this place. Almost the same design as the blue mosque yet less crowded and surrounded by a beautiful landscape. No entrance fee.
Amazing!!. Beautiful! Don't forgot to bring your scarf and cover up. Please take your shoes off before going in

An important site in the Bazaar district.. Another Beautiful Sinan mosque with an extensive park and garden, beware getting lost trying to find the entrance as you weave through the open air sellers and around Istanbul University. This visit an be combined with a trip to the Grand Bazaar.
Must see. This Mosque is huge. Its supported by UNESCO. I think its a really great example of High Turkish mosques.

nice. suleymaniye mosque is very beautiful.
sultan suleyman and his family graves are there so you can see khorram and mehrimah and ... graves.

Very nice mosque, way less crowded than the Blue Mosque... This wonderful mosque reveals a lot of hisory about the Ottoman Empire and the Ottoman rituals and habits. Its architecture is very special. It is far less crowded than the Blue Mosque. Unfortunately its location is quite strange.. it is in the middle of a chain a narrow streets. There is no fee of course. A must-go in Istanbul in my opinion. It is not very far from Sultanahmet, just about 1 mile(1,5-2 kilometres).

The best museum in Istanbul. Somehow this museum is less popular than the Blue Mosque. However, it has more history. The view is nice. There is also a spot for sight seeing outside the museum. A 1 hour visit would give you enough time to enjoy the beauty as well as the history of this mosque.

One of the Top 10 things to do in Istanbul for me. We encountered the largest queues of all for this attraction and queued for over an hour. We arrived in Istanbul on a cruise and given the grand scale of the city decided to do an organised tour. I found the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and this one similar but nevertheless interesting. I personally got far more out of my visit by understanding the history and how the buildings use has changed through the various stages of Turkey’s occupation right through to the current day. Well worth a visit. Remember to check the times you can enter so you aren’t disappointed.
World of best place istanbul. Just one time visit and see this kind of build and you never forget.you will fall in love for this place.we love all with all our heart.
Beautiful!. One of the most beautiful ottoman mosques - very clean, beautiful garden and the panoramic view of Galata and Golden horn.

Magnificent mosk from Suleyman the Magnificent. Absolutely most remarkable mosk I have seen in Istanbul.Blue mosk is more famous but this is beautiful artwork which fits to its benefactor Suleyman the Magnificent

Awe inspiring. This was one of the most profoundly spiritual buildings I have ever visited. It cannot be missed. DO dress appropriately - men and women need to cover shoulders and knees. Women need to cover their head. The provide robes or wraps for both men and women who don't comply.

The great Mosque Sulemaniye. We visited it very nice the graveyard have the very prominent personality like Sultan Suleman his family ,Pashes and etc,very clam place .garden is also good the bazaar outside the mosque. Was not visited,I want to visit that but unable to do it our guide looking to his watch so I feel bad to go to bazaar just for window shopping.now I regret it why not I visit it.

A Beautiful Less Crowded Mosque. If you are going to be in Istanbul I recommend visiting Suleymaniya Mosque. It is much less crowded than the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and just as beautiful. There are lovely grounds to stroll around and the inside is just as nice as the other mosques. As with all religious sites, you should be conscious of what you are wearing. Woman, you will be fine wandering around the grounds but if you plan to go inside the mosque make sure you have your legs and shoulders covered. They provide robes to put on if you do not have the right clothing but it is easier to just be prepared on your own. Throw a scarf in your purse to cover your head and you can throw it back in when you are done. You will have to remove your shoes when you are inside but they provide bags to carry them around. From the mosque is a short downhill walk to the Grand Bizarre so it is not as out of the way as it looks from afar.
Suleymaniye Mosque istanbul. beautifool mosque, and the whole surraunding, Very impressive, any visit to istanbul must include a visit too this mosque.

Astonished. I vested the above pictured Mosque and preyed in it i was really astonished of what I seen If you have time for only one mosque in your visit then it should be this one, the blue mosque is truly stunning it's true but this was a better experience. Maybe because there were fewer people and you can relax and take it in better. Take the time to visit and be impressed.The mosque is very impressive by its size and decorations. It is much more impressive than Ayasofya mosque, more recent style.I could not understand when planning my trip why this mosque rated higher on TA than the Blue Mosque. Having visited both I now understand and agree. The mosque is beautiful, less tourists, calm/peaceful, beautiful views from the terrace and fantastic courtyard. Great views of the mosque from were I stayed .
Amazing Mosque. I enjoyed it even more than Sultan Ahmet (Blue) Mosque, as it was less crowded, beautiful and peaceful. There are also great views of the Golden Horn area in the back.

great mosque, my favourite with the grounds as well. this is well worth a visit, best way to reach it is from the metro stop venecelier, as you come out station walk up the hill to your right in same direction you are facing.we visited many mosques and just look in awe a the engineering of these massive buildings,this one in my mind the best one as it has lovely grounds outside and not too crowded.and of course free to visit.

Any visit to Istanbul must include a visit to the Mosque. If you have time for only one mosque in your visit then it should be this one, the blue mosque is truly stunning it's true but this was a better experience. Maybe because there were fewer people and you can relax and take it in better. Take the time to visit and be impressed.

Just Beautiful. I could not understand when planning my trip why this mosque rated higher on TA than the Blue Mosque. Having visited both I now understand and agree. The mosque is beautiful, less tourists, calm/peaceful, beautiful views from the terrace and fantastic courtyard. Great views of the mosque from the university.
Impressive. The mosque is very impressive by its size and decorations. It is much more impressive than Ayasofya mosque, more recent style.
A Must-See in Istanbul. Exquisite tile work, incredible history. Visitors not allowed during active worship service. Be respectful and dress modestly.
Beautiful mosque. Large and beautiful, great structure worth a look. A bit of a hike from other areas, but easy to find.
Don't miss this!. A magnificent building, steeped in history and very well presented. We really enjoyed our all to brief visit whilst in Istanbul.

Splendid Building. Again not enough time so did not go close but the views from the various angles were spectacular. The shape of the domes, peculiar to Turkey i believe are really attractive. Next time I shall allot more time to do these things.

Magnifincient. We visited this mosque 2 times and it never seizes to amaze as and capture our senses .
The tranquility and spiritual is something we love .
Overcrowded in August. Visited Istanbul in the 80's (August). Disappointed to find that it had changed so drastically. Tourism has caused it to lose it's authenticity and serenity.

Fascinating History. As part of only one day in Istanbul we did not have much time to spend at the Suleymaniye Mosque, but we did enjoy the time we had. There are several very interesting historical parts to the mosque. We enjoyed this more than the Blue Mosque where unfortunately our tour spent more time.

So beautiful. I was really happy that they let you go in without shoes. I feel that taking off your shoes and walking on your socks, your experience with the place gets a bit more personal and slow. I like that. The place is beautiful. I learned a complete new color scheme and a whole new way to make a color composition. I saw people praying in their regular ways.
