I am grateful that they share their praying place even with non-believers of their religion.
Istanbul sights. Magnificent Mosque, totally stunning, visit also Suleyman's tomb with his coffin surrounded by his small sons. Ladies do not forget to take a head covering and cover bare arms.

An exquisite jewel of Islam. If you happen to be wandering the streets of Sultanahment neighborhood in Istambul, it's impossible not to see and be attracted by the Blue Mosque. What you will see is well worth the walk. It's not just and experience of the beauty of Islamic architecture, it's a learning opportunity to better understand a huge part of the world's societies.
Best-designed Mosque in Istanbul. Beautiful airy design and gorgeous setting with sea breeze plus gardens and cemetery. Sinan was an amazing architect!
Special. Wonderful atmosphere, cool and quiet interior. The view from the terrace over to the Golden Horn and Gallata Bridge is not to be missed.

A beautiful mosque on the top of Istanbul. Just take a 15 minute walk from Beyazit tram station and you will be there. the decorations of the mosque and the dome are breathtaking. If you are around the Grand Bazaar just go there and you will be rewarded

A must see!. It's completely different from the Blue Mosque, and that was a surprise. Elegantly artistic, moderately adorned with almost no tiles, it tells you why Sinan was the greatest architect of the Ottoman Empire. Lovers of romance should also visit the tombs of Suleyman the Magnificent and his beloved wife, Hurem Sultan, situated next to each other in the mosque's graveyard.

Stunning. Forget the blue mosque, visit here instead. There are probably 10% as many tourists as the blue mosque, and the architecture is unique, solemn, and beautiful. It is also neat to visit the tomb of one of the greatest leaders of one of the greatest empires, suleyman the great
Best mosque in Istanbul. Forget the busy blue mosque. Head up to this one and feel the tranquility captivate you. Beautiful history and architecture.
Second largest mosque in Instanbul. Constructed in the 1550s by the Ottoman Empire's greatest architect, Sina, it is awe-inspiring and on a hilltop.

Take a look. With each mosque you stop to take a look at, the next is only older and more amazing, this place is huge, its location is central and it is tourist friendly, def worth in taking a look, having a sit down and soaking in some history.
Tiles. The tiles alone are worth the trip. The time of day is very important as the light makes it look different at different times.

Beautiful mosque, great information about its history. Another beautiful and impressive mosque to visit. Make a point of picking up the great brochure they have at the entrance. It explains not only its history but also the common elements present in all mosques which was great to understand the symbols and inscriptions around the building,

Awesome. Suleymaniye Mosque defines awesome. It looks amazing, and its simply just incredible. walk around the whole mosque and you will be rewarded with the photo of a lifetime. There are also some of the best food places I found in Istanbul right in front of the mosque.
Hidden Gem. A must visit, totally understated in tourist terms but a true gem. The most spectular of all the mosques in Istanbul.

Quiet and peacful mosque. One of the oldest mosques in Istanbul. On a top hill so it is viewed from far of the city.
You can go there by taxi, or take the tram to he grand bazaar then walk by Beyazit mosque to Istanbul university and the mosque will be at your right. It is 15 minutes walking in interesting area.

Central Landmark - Worth A Visit. It was quite a hike up to the hill to the Suleymaniye Mosque but well worth the climb. The Mosque is a major landmark that can be seen from many locations across istanbul. It's an impressive building but not as decorative as other mosques. Tourists are reminded to cover up bare legs and women are required to wear a headscarf.

Beautiful. Was so happy that I got to pray in such a beautiful mosque! The close down the mosque at prayer times to tourist , so just open for people praying which was nice. Super clean carpets when praying !

Largest and magnificent!. Istanbul's largest and most magnificent mosque! It was built by Mimar Sinan (architect). Super b garden overlooking the Bosphorus & Istanbul panorama. I recommend you to take plenty of pictures!
Must see. Great place to visit particularly if you are interested in Photography. Females need to be wearing scarf and leg covers to be allowed in the Mosque.
nice views from the outside. inside not so interesting, but nice views form bars nearby, specially at sunset. Relaxing gardens. Not so crowded.
Must visit. It is one of the best mosques in Istanbul and Ottoman Architect Sinan. Do not forget to visit its garden and have haricot bean where you can find just across the entrance of the mosque.
Extremely beatifull mosque. Blue Mosque is one of the most beatifull mosques I have visited. Come early (no queu) and spend time enjoying the insights of the mosque.
Suleymaniyah Mosque. It is a beautiful piece of historical architecture and portrays the greatness of the Ottoman Empire and Islamic culture.
Historical place. Advising to get a good package with tour company, as the only language used in Turkey is turkish. They will help you to avoid staying in long queues in front of any gate.

Beautifully maintained. Its a beautiful mosque, probably the largest among the main mosques in the city. At least when we went, there was not as many people as in the blue mosque or aya sofya. Perhaps because of its location too, or people go later at sunset.

Nice historical mosque. But not the best mosque I've seen, but maybe I've seen too many in different countries. Still, worth checking out and probably more so than the blue mosque based on its history and architect
Clean and nice. The mosque was clean and organised and staff were friendly and helpful and cafés outside the mosque were good and reasonable

not during the summer season. I visited the Blue Mosque in April for the first time; there was no queue and we stayed inside as long as we wanted. The second time I came there was in August and it was impossible to get inside without at least 2 hours of queueing even at 9 in the morning!

Impressive. Much more impressive and enjoyable to visit compared to the Blue Mosque.
We walked around the city which made it easier to get around and from here all the good places like the spice bizarre and grand bizarre are within easy reach
Very impressive. The size, scale and history of this mosque make it a must see. The campus is lovely too. It's a hike uphill to get there, but worth it.

Surprising!!!. After a long walk, we were there!!! More than mosque (superb) the views. Stunning and gorgeous!!! Just on the right side of the mosque. Sit there and see Bosforus. If you have a camera, you won´t be able to stop... shooting everywhere.

A must place to visit. A beautiful mosque in Istanbul. The wonderful architecture of the mosque speaks for itself. The mastery of the builders is evident in every part of the mosque. It is amazing to see the craftsmanship of the builders, the accuracy of cutting stones and pillars are amazing in that era when no such facilities available as we have today. A must see mosque!!!

Not to be missed. It was a hot day. There was a very long queue but we were approached by a man who (for a fee) helped us bypass the queue. He explained the history of the Mosque (also known as the Blue Mosque) and pointed out some of its features. There are (quite reasonably) strict dress codes but scarves and "skirts" are provided for those who are not appropriately dressed.
Fantastic mosque. don't waste your time with the guides. The line is long but moves very fast. Read up about the mosque before you go.

The supreme mosque & complex. This is a sublime collection of buildings, showcasing the best of Islamic art, architecture and social benevolence.There is so much to see here, without the crowds that throng around Sultanahmet square's buildings: the mosque; the tombs of Sultan, Roxelana & Sinan; the caravanserai; the medreses; addicts alley; sunken gardens. There are NO QUEUES and NO ADMISSION CHARGE!The garden around the tombs is a picture of irises in April & May.Take time to savour the tranquillity of the different spaces and then take a well-earned drink at a café (sorry, can not remember its name), close to Sinan's tomb, with rooftop views back to the Suleymaniye and out across the Golden Horn and Bosphorus (we met a lady here who had been sitting, reading a book and savouring the atmosphere for two hours over s ingle cup of coffee! So civilised!).

Beautiful and Calm. The Blue Mosque may be more famous, but this is the one to visit. It is beautiful, calm, restorative. We visited just after the 5:00 prayers and there were very few people there. Knees and heads (women) need to be covered. Bring your own scarf or use one of theirs.

Great views from the corner of the back courtyard. Wish there was a guide or more information to help us understand its significance. Very peaceful and nice, you can really see a few things on this visit. Just be careful to book transport back as we suffered to get a taxi back once finished.

Mosque of Suleyman the Magnificent. Those who have watched the tv series magnificently Centuries, here they can feel the charm of old times.
Suleymaniye Mosque, built to survive for centuries, proudly raises his "rocket" in the sky.
necessarily be seen
Dominates Istanbul's skyline. Needs a taxi, but well worth it both for the mosque itself and for the royal tombs just outside There is also a pleasant open-air café across the road
Beautiful. Beautiful place, great architecture. It is a masque which was built for Suleiman the Magnificent, and building also magnificent.
Worth Visiting. it looks so beautiful in the evenings. That is as good as Blue Mosque though it may not carry that history.

Exquisite. Unlike among the hoards at the Blue Mosque, a visit to the Suleymaniye Mosque is an opportunity to appreciate the value of breathtaking architecture in amplifying the faithful's sense of sanctity and awe.

peaceful and spiritually.. I've visited BlueMosque before i came to Suleymaniye Mosque, unlike BM, Suleymaniye Mosque is very peaceful, and less attention from the tourist... not as grand as BM, but Suleymaniye Mosque has it's own charm which no words can describe... i got emotional here for some reason, and i truly charmed by it's peacefulness and calmness when i'm sitting at one corner and admire it's beauty. The courtyard is a great place to unwind, and chill... I love the fact that you can visit the mosque even when they are praying... as long as you don't take photos during the praying period. Don't miss to go around the mosque, in the garden behind the main mosque there are two mausoleums including the tombs of Sultan Suleiman I, his wife Hürrem Sultan (Roxelana) and his daughter Mihrimah Sultan. The sultans Suleiman II, Ahmed II and also Saliha Dilaşub Sultan and Safiye Sultan (died in 1777), the daughter of Mustafa II, are buried here.How to get there: Take tram from ferry port towards Grand bazaar, and alight at Grand Bazzar station. Walk towards the north east direction. Quite a bit of walk but is worth your time.

Largest Mosque in Istanbul. The Blue Mosque has gotten so much publicity over the years that most people don't know that this is actually the largest mosque in Istanbul. We decided to attend Friday prayer there and it was absolutely amazing..
great. I love it. go and see the great masterpiece of memar sina. The atmosphere is so quite and delirious.I feel every body thst comes to istanbul must see it .
I love it. The mosque were beautiful and the design is old .You will always think that you are in othmani timeDon't miss this mosque

Best mosque in Istanbul!!. In my opinion this is the best and most beautiful mosque in Istanbul. The interior decoration and artwork is brighter and much more pleasing to the eye than that of Sultan Ahmet Mosque (Blue Mosque). The surrounding courtyard is also a good place to relax and unwind. Also from the courtyard you can get great views of the Golden Horn!
feel great. It's a very big and nice mosque. not as crowded as blue mosque ( happily) and you can enjoy seeing sea, and town from above.
Avoid the crowds!. This is off the beaten path but truly a hidden gem! No crowds and truly a personal experience. The beauty of this place is awe inspiring!
Awesome. One of the most spectacular structure in Istanbul. You can witness the spirit in the mosque if you go there around 9:00 am. And take a stroll around the complex.

Beautiful architecture. Although this Mosque is not nearby the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, it is definitely a must see attraction. It is situated on top of a hill, so a little bit of a walk, but worthwhile your effort. The surrounding area is quiet with beautiful lush green shady trees and lawns. There is much less tourists here because its off the beaten track, but therefore you will be blessed with silence around you and a peaceful atmosphere when visiting this mosque. To enter, you must be aware of the dress code. You will be given some robes to cover yourself if you are not properly dressed. The interior and exterior architecture are really awesome. The court yard infront of the main entrance is huge. Be advised not to visit during prayer times (also closed for tourists 30 minutes before and after prayer times). On the one side of the mosque you will see a row of water taps next to the wall. The men who are coming to pray, will wash their hands and feet here before entering the mosque. When you leave, use the exit of the complex at this side, cross the street and walk a short way (50 m) uphill into the grounds of the university. Be on the look-out for some stairs on your left ascending to an open rooftop-area. From here you will be able to take the most magnificent photos of the Suleymaniye's beautiful domes and miniarettes as well as panoramic views of the Bosphorus. This is not only the biggest mosque in Istanbul, but also one of our favourites. Make some time in your itinerary to visit this awesome place.
Incredible. It is really unbelievable that this survived earthquakes and invasions. It is remarkable that the paint over of the Frescos actually preserved them. A very unique monument indeed
Nice to visit. The mosque is ice to see and is much less crowded than the Blue Mosque. You can also see the tomb of Suleyman the Magnificent near the mosque.

Suleymaniye Mosque-A hidden treasure. I visited the Suleymaniye Mosque in Istanbul in July 2014 after visiting the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The Suleymaniye Mosque was unquestionably my favorite. Not only are there less tour groups and people, but the interior and exterior are more beautiful than the other two. It is in a much quieter part of the city and has a beautiful court yard to walk around in. It is the largest mosque in the city and the colors are amazing.I highly recommend visiting the most on a sunday morning. When I went there were about 15 other people on the entire property.

Architectural Wonder. The Sultanahment Mosque comprises of the Mosques and surrounding complex. The plan of the Sultanahmet complex, the most irregular and in coherent of the great imperial complexes, evidences the great site for the complexes in the vicinity of the hippodrome.

If you have to make a choice, pick this over Blue Mosque. If you have limited time and want to experience a great mosque, go here first. It is true that it can be a little bit of a walk compared with other sights that are more closely packed together. But that is part of what makes this place special--it is quiet, and you will have some opportunities for stunning views of the city and personal reflection. This is an architectural and artistic masterpiece, and you will be able to enjoy it without the hoards and hucksters that you'll find outside of the Blue Mosque. A true cultural gem! Many mosques will provide modesty items if needed, including this one, but you'll move around with greater ease if you have your own.

Must visit. One of the must visit places in Istanbul. Very close to spice/grand bazaar. You can spend some nice time inside the prayer hall or outside on the grass. The mosque is on top op the hill, so you will be able to enjoy some nice Istanbul views from the top as well.

Nice large mosque- architecture. Passionately designed mosque with lots of detail and hard work put in it makes it a must see place to visit. And if you're a bit modestly dressed (shoulders to shins), the housekeepers will allow you to have a moment of discussion with Creator inside the prayer area of mosque.
The best of them all. Is a little farther than the others, but worth the walk. The blue mosque is nos as beautiful as this one

impressive architecture. It is one of most photographed landmarks in Istanbul, especially at sunsets. But most importantly is impressive for the architecture and what it stands as a symbol for Istanbul and Turkey.
Must see. what a beautiful piece of islamic art ...time well spend the inside is beautiful make sure you are wearing long pants and long sleeves to enter the mosque for ladies bring a head scarf

Historic Mosque. Within a 15 minute walk from Laleli tram station lies one of the most significant historic mosques in Istanbul. Well the uphill walk might be a little strenuous but the mosque won't let you down. Built by Mimar Sinan on the order of Kanuni Sultan Süleiman Han around 1550 AD it's the largest mosque in the city. One can also visit the tombs of Kanuni Sultan Süleiman Han and his wife Roxelana (aka Hürrem Sultan).

A wonderful worship space. Regardless of your beliefs, this is a very special place. Simply exquisite and in my opinion, commands reverence. Covering garments are supplied as needed. They only ask for a donation on leaving, to maintain the facility, when you see the prices charged by the other sights, this would be a worthy beneficiary of your generous thank you gift
You should see it, even if you've seen it 20 times before:). Its a must to see! Absolutely breathtaking! And don't forget to pay respect to the great Sultan that is buried right behind his mosque.

Favourite place in Istanbul. So peaceful and beautiful, so much history to explore. As a Muslim it was especially wonderful to pray Friday prayer here, the congregation was amazing. And I loved the zero touristy atmosphere here.
Süleymanıye Mosque. We really enjoyed our time in Istanbul, and were sorry not being able to visit all the existing beautiful places in the city. Süleymanıye mosque was our favourite.
Worth it. What an amazing architect done by sinan. It is a must seen great from the inside and surrounded by gardens with beautiful views.
Wonderful. Suleymaniye mosque is really beautiful and there is Sultan Suleyman's grave in the garden. And there is prince and princes graves too.
Peaceful place. This mosque at a place behind Istanbul University and very quiet, not like Blue Mosque. It was very holy and beautiful.
Must see. Could be the best site in Istanbul. Nicely located, the construction itself and the surroundings are just breathtaking.

Major Mosque and associated buildings. Huge mosque and associated buildings. Bit of a hard work trek to get there at 32 C (85 F) and 83% humidity! but worth it. Beautifully tiled and presented. Views from the graveyard and outside are amazing.

the real deal. Suleymaniye Mosque is a little off the beaten path but well worth the visit because, compared to the Blue Mosque, it was not at all filled with tourists. Near the university and lunch places. We saw more locals here - a funeral service, men washing their feet. The inside is exquisite. A highlight of our trip.

A piece of Art. The mosque is one the most beautiful works of art you will ever see :)
IT was a bit crowded but alhamdulillah the security and the management of travellers being nicely escorted into the masjid was very nice.
beautiful. lovely place to go in, place full of history very peaceful and serine, architeculy well ahead of its time

not to be missed. this is one of the main historical attractions in Istanbul that usually is missed as its away from SulatanAhmed district, the mosque is fascinating with its grandiosity and amazing architecture. it is comparable / better than the famous Blue mosque, its renovated and very well taken care of.

a quite and big Mosque. There are no queues nor crowds in this Mosque. Of course you enter with your head covered if you are a woman and take of your shoes.There is a very informative brochure for free in the entrance, so you can sit in the carpet and read it, and get all the information you need.It is very simply decorated compared to the other Mosques of the city (Blue Mosque and Yeni Cami for example) but some architectural facts make you admire the intelligence of the architect.The area around is quite as well.Don't visit it if you are not close and you have few days in the city, there are more impressive thing to see.

tolerance. Unfortunately my good experience is not about the building which i found very big and dominating upon the old city but quite the opposite:a very kind turkish man encouraged and helped me entered the mosque during the prayer which i thought was forbidden for no believers.I stayed only few minutes enough to realize that faith has a lot of fases and that tolerance is the most important off all
Lovely place. Lovely place to visitThe ottoman emperors reflection and true cultural representation of Muslim history Nice calligraphy and art

magnificent. sultanahmet area..if u ignore salesman, tourists and the noisy people u will feel the tranquility cause of the historic texture.and then this huge but elegant mosque will welcomes u.stained glasses and tiles are amazing

Peaceful and Pretty. Loved the atmosphere here. Much quieter than Sultanahmed (Blue) Mosque but just as beautiful inside in every sense. The gardens outside were so tranquil and relaxing and building itself was as splendid with its domes and minarets on the outside and the decor and design inside. I enjoyed this experience more so than at the illustrious Blue Mosque, especially the tranquility. Definitely my fav mosque that I visited on this trip - haven't been to every mosque in the city, so can't say if it's the best, but a must see site.;

Fantastic from outside but average inside. A must seen place. One of the main attraction in Istanbul. It is very impressive from outside by not so inside. The courtyard is very nice. Take a lot of photo if you can. There are plenty of shops and restaurants in the area
Breat architecture. Located nearv the grand bazaar this mosque is a huge mosque with an amazing architecture and an important historical value.
incredible building. Great colors, tiles and architecture - must visit and take the time to enjoy the space and colors. One of our favorites in Istanbul.

Great and sobre.. The Suleyman Mosque is a very big mosque, and more sobre than for instance the Blue Mosque, which makes it (to me) even more impressive!Check prayer times, as the mosque closes for quite a while during prayer.

Near Grand Bazaar, Beautiful Mosque. As mentioned, this site can be combined with the Grand Bazaar in proximity. The interior can only be matched by the Blue Mosque minus the large crowds. A must-visit!
If only we all had the same hygiene. A must see when in Istanbul. However the foot odour smell is so intense it crawls in to your skin and spoils the entire experience.

Sublime and beautiful. Could have spent all day inside, what a beautiful place. The young Turkish guides (employed by the City) who mingled around outside were outstanding in being approachable, friendly and willing to help.
Stunningly Beautiful. Amazing architecture, beautiful setting especially at the fall of dusk, peaceful. Requires a bit of a walk but well worth the energy and time.
great. Third visit to this building over 24 years.just love it.cannot be beaten for beauty of form and imposing granduer.has a serenity (if you can miss the tourists) that is sublime.

Just go and be a tourist already!. There are trips were you simply want to avoid crowd and not go to the "toouristy" spots, and though this one really isnt in the truest sense of the word, but definitely a landmark and be you a muslim or christian or whatnot, the design and architectural splendour of the place alone is worse going

Fascinating. Another fascinating mosque to visit in Istanbul. One of the largest in the world. A must see. I walked there from the Spice Bazaar but please be advised, it's not an easy walk! You literally have to hike up long uphills and go through many turns.

A peaceful place. This is a working mosque. It was amazing to see as a non-Muslim. It is not a touristy place and is further away from a lot of the other attractions than the Blue Mosque but it was worth the trip through the University to get to it. The cemetery beside it is a nice place to walk through too.

Stunning work of Mimar Sinan. An absolutely beautiful mosque, so minimal, by Mimar Sinan, the famous architect of Sultan Suleyman.The compound also had the buldings with the tombs of Suleyman, Hurrem Sultan, Mihrimah Sultan and others, however, they were closed to the public, one could only take photos by sticking the camera on the windows. Also don't miss Sinan's tomb out of the mosque compound.

beautiful and less crowded. This mosque built to compete with the blue mosque is almost as beautiful as the other one but, as this one is not in sultanhamet is almost empty, so you can spend more time and really feel the spiritual atmosphere, it's worth the walking

Beautiful mosque well worth seeing. A little out of the way from the main sites, its well worth visiting, a huge space and beautiful architecture. There are a couple of great places to eat nearby so worth a visit

Worth a visit.. I personally prefer this mosque to the Blue Mosque. Much more serene and peaceful. The inside is also beautiful, light and airy. A true masterpiece by Sinan. You have a lovely view over the Bosphorus from up there. We found the streets,walking there from the Egyptian market, very interesting and also, going back, you can turn the other way and walk towards the Grand Bazaar. Again, very interesting streets and little shops. Really enjoyed our visit to the Suleymaniye Mosque.
Well worth a visit. Prepare to wait and queue. We arrived a the worn time of day and it was closed for prayed but the outside was truly impressive. If you go take plenty of pictures.
Beautiful. I enjoyed this beautiful mosque, take your time to go up and view from above. You can probably enjoy the mosque and see what there is to see in an hour or less.

Sultan Suleyman Mosque, a Most Appropriate name for a Great Mosque in Istanbul. One of the great mosques in Istanbul, is the Sultan Suleymaniye Mosque located in the Fatih District of Old Istanbul, about 10 minutes wlaking distance from another great mosque in the same district (Sultan Mehmed II Mosque). When taking a Bhosporus cruise, The Suleymaniye Mosque presents a very impressive view. It dominates the skyline on the Bhosporus strait. Timing the visit to this most is critical since it was closed to tourists at 2:30 PM and 5:30 PM wjen we were there to visit. Once inside the mosque, one can't help but be amazed at the amazing muslim decorations. Intricately drawn symmetrical patterns dominate the "nave" of the mosque. Circle of lights for the muslim devotees create an impressive but simple environment to pray facing Mecca.We did not know that muslim women are not allowed in the main prayer area. A relatively small area hidden from the main prayer area are reserved for women to pray from. Turkish women do not wear the usual muslim apparels that are worn by other muslim women. In fact, we learned that it was illegal to use the hijab, nikab, or burka by Turkish women. The women wearing the usual muslim attires are mostly women tourists coming from other Arab nations who come to Istanbul, we were told.The Sultan Suleyamniye Mosque is comparable to the Sultan Ahmet Mosque (The Blue Mosque), but only have 4 minarets compared to the 6 minarets in the Blue Mosque. Women tourists are required to have a head covering, and shoes must be removed (handy plastic bags are given to everyone who enters the mosque). We saw muslim men washing their feet, hands, arms, and face is a cleansing station outside the mosque, which we did not know before. The building architecture of this mosque is quite impressive, and rivals that of the Blue Mosque. Certainly, a must place to see and visit when in Istanbut. It is free, i.e. no charge to visit, just like the other mosques in Istanbul, so we're told.

The biggest art work of Sinan. It always makes me laugh, every tourist talks about the "Blue Mosque"! Suleymaniye which few people visit is though different architecturally and historically much more imposing and significant than the Blue Mosque.It is huge, airy, full of light and beautiful Islamic inscriptions.It was commissioned by Suleyman the Magnificent to his architect Sinan and told him: "I want the most magnificent mosque". And Sinan delivered. Also there is the tomb of Suleyman, his legitimate wife (do read her Life story!) Hurrem and their daughter Mihrimah.One of the best Ottoman Restaurant is just across from the back door, I strongly recommend it: DARRUZIYAFE.
Good!. Very Nice! The architecture and the way it is maintained was great! The lines were were very organised and moved very fast.

An architectural masterpiece. Most visitors to Istanbul tend to visit Hagia Sophia or the Blue Mosque however it would be a mistake to miss visiting Suleymaniye Mosque which is considered by many to be the greatest work of the master architect Sinan. When approaching Istanbul from the area of Galatta Bridge it is the Suleymaniye Mosque that dominates the skyline and once you get nearby you realize how big it actually is. Visitors are requested to dress modestly and to put shoes in a plastic bag and it was quite amusing to see some young men who arrived in shorts and vests being told to put on a loose skirt and shawl before entering. Once inside you can marvel at the structure and ornate decor and reflect on the skills that were required to produce such a magnificent building. In addition to the mosque the surrounding area was built as a social complex and within the grounds also stands the building housing the tomb of Suleyman the Magnificent.

Beautifull and impressive at the same time. It's not in sultanahmet as the rest of important things to see but was a very good surprise. Very impressive the inside of mosque and well conserved both the gardens and the cemetery in the backyard. We couldn't visit the tomb of the sultan it was closed but really worth visiting specially the insided of the mosque. Nothing to envy the Blue Mosque or the Hagia Sophia.
Lovely mosque but don't spend too much time here. It is a nice mosque. Great architecture both inside and out. But you will probably spend not more than 45 minutes here.
Not much. I didn't understand what the fuss is all about. It was a typical mosque and the carpets smelled so bad. Don't plan on staying inside for long.

Beautiful warm feeling in interior and exterior. In the late afternoon, sitting on the big outside space of this mosque enjoying breeze from Bosphorus was my favorite. Architecture wise, it was gorgeous. Overall wonderful feeling.

great place. actually i found it more intersting then the blue mosque it was great..u can take great pix inside or outside and there is some friendly faces which are rare in istanbul they helped me with picture's and showed me the place..
impressive. really recommend to go all the way up and visit it , offers great view and it`s not so full of tourists.

wonderful complex. Beautiful, it is more simple but that is its beauty, and has still a large complex of buildings around it. Go to a rooftop bar nearby so you get the view over the mosque complex and the Bosphorus close by. Worth it!

Good visit if you have time. If you have time after seeing the major sights in Istanbul a visit to the Suleymaniye Mosque is worthwhile. It is a bit of a walk from the major sights in Sultanahmet but worth it if you enjoyed visiting the Blue Mosque. It is huge and quite a spectacular both inside and out. And, it is a bit quieter tourist-wise.

An amazing architecture. Architecture is all what can attract in this mosque. The configuration of the doms in all the mosque symbolizes the link between earth...and heaven and we can see it very clear on this one..
Even more interesting. If anything we found this more interesting than the Blue mosque. Do look at the unusual grave stones in the grounds

True working mosque. Commanding position on top of one of Istanbul's 7 hills; lovely breezes and views after a long climb. Very grand exterior courtyard with marble paving stones and columns and large, open and serene interior. We went during prayers and sat quietly. Note to women: no worries if you do not have head or knee coverings, as these will be efficiently supplied at the entrance at no cost. You must also remove footware.Also, signs show no photos are allowed, but all tourists openly took them in the presence of guards, so... your decision to photo or not seems entirely up to you.Recommend this lovely, spacious mosque, for a glimpse into a working Islamic institution.
Nice Mosque. This is a nice mosque, but perhaps not as beautiful as the Blue Mosque. Still it is worth a visit, especially if you are near the Grand Bazar

Beautiful. I liked its simple design. Compare to the Blue mosque, this one is more peacefull. Do not miss the other buildings of the complex, such as Daruzziyafe restaurant, Suleymaniye library, hospital and the tomb of Suleymen.

Beautiful, historic mosque. Definitely worth while stopping to see this mosque while wandering around the old city. Gorgeous architecture, and well-maintained. Remember to bring a scarf to cover your head.

Historic Mosque Without the Fuss. The Suleymaniye Mosque does not match the Hagia Sofia or Blue Mosque as a historical landmarks go, and is a bit off the beaten path. But it is an architectural marvel, providing stunning views of the city that are not provided by its rivals. Its location makes it less of a tourist destination, providing a more serene experience as one would expect from a functioning mosque. Go early and you can take pictures in the courtyard without any interference, and possibly without seeing another soul.

Istanbul's architectural masterpiece. The fact that it was not as crowded - perhaps we were lucky - as the more traditional convenient sites meant that one could soak up the atmosphere, and appreciate the superb proportions and elegant simplicity of this gorgeous building and its surroundings. A sense of tranquility abounds.
As impressive as you'd imagine. The grandeur of the mosque, both outside and inside is truly impressive. As with all attractions in the Old City - arrive early before the crowds!

A truly grand mosque. This absolutely lovely mosque sits on top of a hill overlooking the Golden Horn and the Bosporus. Subtler and less crowded than the Blue Mosque, the Mosque of Suleyman the Magnificent has a deeply spiritual feel and excellent architecture and decorative features. It is but a short walk from the Grand Bizarre to the Spice Market through the back streets of old Istanbul (a delight in itself) and not to be missed. Be sure not to miss the tombs of Sulleyman and his sultana Roxelana

beautiful area!. after walking away from our boat cruise, another story! we had lunch near here and then walked up the steep, very busy streets to visit this mosque. it is perched on a hilltop opposite the Istanbul university. fodor's describes it as " perhaps the most magnificent mosque in Istanbul". the dome is the highest of any ottoman mosque and a 3 year multimillion dollar restoration has left it in all it's glory. wonderful soaring spaces. large lawn areas. not crowded. delightful. do find it and go!

Informative. Unlike the Blue Mosque (very crowded) this gave visitors a much calmer experience. They were also leaflets with printed information which included great info about the various features inside the building & significance to the faith. We could therefore appreciate it better. The courtyard is lovely and from the terrace you can see over the golden horn water - but currently only from one corner as there are renovations obscuring most of the terrace view.
Incredible Monument . Its soo beautiful inside here.you are living the history when you walk alonge here.they explain you whats happened here and the stories were soo exciting.
Spiritual. The mosque is a beautiful site. We were able to go inside and learn more about the history and traditions. The architecture was amazing.
magnificent building and impressive interior.. liked the history behind the mosque especially the tomb of the sultan which is located just next to the mosque!

Wow!. this place is breathtaking so much so I need say no more. But since I have to write 50 characters or more let me say it's a steep walk up hill and pass through the spice bazaar for even more of an adventure. The volunteers there are quite informative even it you are not religious. It's a must see and don't forget your camera :)
built by Sinan, the great Ottoman architect.. exquisite inside and out. Much less crowded than some of the other sites. In a very interesting location.
The biggest Mosque in Istanbul. Very beautiful architecture, pleasant inside. This is the place where the tombs of Sultan Suleyman and Hurrem Sultan are located.

The one mosque to visit. If your travel is limited and you can only see one mosque, see this one. Mimar Sinan's masterpiece, it beats the Blue Mosque hands-down -- and it does not have the Blue Mosque queues. There is a bit of uphill walking to get there (nothing too serious, prefer to start at Laleli T1 station) but it will reward you. Be sure to get the free literature at the mosque entrance.

Definitely worth a visit. It is on the standard "tour" but the tile work inside was definitely not to be missed. There is a reason this is a destination. The requirements, removing shoes and wearing a veil, were very reasonable.

Outstanding... Absolutely hands down lovely place to spend an afternoon. On a quiet afternoon, I spent hours wandering in and out of the mosque. Unforgettable air of peacefulness, a truly sacred experience.

Breathtaking. Queues are a fact of life here if you don't do what we were advised to do and get in early! We did and were rewarded with peace and tranquillity.Tranquil space and we were not asked to leave for dawn prayers. We were sat quietly (suitably dressed) at the back in the non muslim area...
Beautiful site. Couldn't believe my eyes. Even from a distance it's beautiful.the area itself is a great place to just meditate

Truly peaceful, a real gem!. This place is worth the short walk across the city. When entering the mosque scarfs are available if you need to cover up, you will also be given a bag to put your shoes in. The inside the mosque is stunning and is less touristy than the blue mosque, tourists should sit at the back of the mosque and will not be allowed into the main prayers area. Tip: remember that this is a working mosque therefore tourists should follow certain rules e.g. don't point your feet towards the front of the mosque, instead sit cross legged or sit on your feet and try not to disturb people that are praying by standing in front of them, talking or taking photos of them

Outstanding design and architecture. So beautiful! Probably the most beautiful building we saw in all of Turkey. Men have to cover their legs if they're wearing shorts, and same for women plus cover their heads. Totally worth it, more beautiful than Hagia Sofia but less historic.

Mosque of Suleiman the Magnificent. Inner dome is beautiful. Outside but within the grounds had great views of the Borphorus. Close to the Grand Bazaar. I always carried a head scarf with me so I could enter any mosque that we came across as we walked around this beautiful city.
Amazing architecture. Now restored and beautiful by one of the great Ottoman architects Sinan. Must be seen with the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia.

Breath-taking busy mosque. ignore the hawkers on the way in. push your way into the mosque. walk past the smell of sweaty feet and walk into an absolutely stunning mosque. Im amazed that it is a fully functional mosque that is in use while you walk around. A free landmark is always a bonus. A must see.

A beautiful building. So pleased that we visited this mosque which is just beautiful. A few minutes walk from behind the Grand Bazaar with a nice walk past the university, or up the hill from Eminonu. Also so quiet after the crowds at the Blue Mosque
Real atmosphere - great place to visit!. A very interesting Mosque - more atmosphere due to less tourists. Make sure you include this on your Istanbul trip for definite!
Worth the climb. this mosque is the highest on the landscape , but worth the climb and is a true must se when in Istanbul

amaaazing. I'm in love with this place
I like to visit it more once especialy it has a view on Busphur
a large area and clean
Blue Mosque is magical. Get a tour guide if you want, but to be in it is magical. Some tour guys tend to rush through it, to get another person to take the tour, so pick a good one if you do.

Interesting and beautiful.... We were fortunate enough to be brought to this Mosque by our private guide we hired for the day through our hotel; she also happened to be an art Historian and a young Professor at a local University. I wanted to pass on her insight to everyone about this Mosque. The famed Ottoman architect Sinan built this Mosque and deemed it his second favorite next to Selimiye Mosque he built in Edime. It is a fact that Sinan is buried here at this Mosque, but what Historians believe, based on his own modest design of his crypt and the placement at the which he located it for burial... very bottom right corner, it is like an artist signature on a painting. I found that fascinating, and the Mosque and gardens are peaceful and beautiful in their own right, even without the back story, which made it more special to me.

Beautiful architecture!. Mosques in Istanbul have a unique Ottoman architecture, and all of these building are beautiful! Sulemaniye Mosque being the main one among all of these is a must visit place in Istanbul. Keep your cameras handy, it makes for some great photography!
So much history. Worth it! The grounds were lovely and the building were beautiful. It was less crowded than the other popular spots, and felt special in its own way.
Nice. There are many mosques in city, this is a great one to see if you are in the area, combine it with a trip to the grand bazaar.

It worth the visit if you have the time. If you have the time, visit the Suleymaniye Mosque. It is close to the Grand Bazaar, up on a hill. It less crowded than the other Mosque and it has a nice view.

The magnificent mosque. I have been to many places in the world with amazing buildings. However, Suleymaniye Mosque has been my favourite building since early 90'es. It is a must to see if you are visiting Istanbul! I would suggest visiting the mosque during the evening prayer -if possible- to experience the real ambiance.

great tiles. Loved the walls and roof with the beautiful isnik tiles, beautiful craftsmanship. The imam's singing was hypnotic. People dressed in shorts are given a wrap around skirt, those with bare shoulders get a scarf/wrap. Prayers are at 6"30pm and being an active mosque it will close for prayers 5 times a day so time your visit well.

An absolute must in Istanbul. This is not my first trip to the Mosque, and every time while in Istanbul I visit it because of the beautiful architecture and relief from the summer heat. Make sure to wear respectful clothing (no bare shoulders and knees, although the Mosque staff will provide fabric to cover up). I also recommend bringing a spare pair of socks if you don't want to walk barefoot for hygiene reasons.

Architectural marvel of Sinan. there as soooooo many mosques in Istanbul and they are all worth visiting . but if one has to choose two or three samples , this mosque is one of the top selection . ladies make sure you carry large scarf and preferably pants or something to cover up...this is a functioning praying facility.

Historical. You must have time at hand to visit this mosque. Rushing it will not allow you to take in the historic arte facts. The queues is exceptionally long and you have to arrive very early. Take time - it is worth it.

Beautiful!. This beautiful mosque is a must see. Although it does not attract the same number of tourists as the Blue Mosque, the history and the Quranic recitations during the day make it a magical place to visit.
An impressive mosque!. The architecture of this building is wonderful to behold. Our guide gave us an informative lecture on the mosque and the practices within the mosque.

Incredible. my boyfriend and i went to Istambul in November.We tought it could be cold... we were wrong, it was a nice weather and we decided to walk.Among the city we went to Suleiman Mosque, beautiful as you could imaginate.Definitely is a highly recommended place!
must see. I loved this one in particular. I don't know why, but I liked it even more than Blue Mosque. It wasn't as crowded, but just as beautiful.

Worth the long way up from Galata. This mosque is part of a complex, that unfortunately is under renovation, but it was really worth the walk from Galata bridge that was up and up and seemed endless under the sun. But getting there was worth the effort. Outside it is impressive for the size and details and amazing view of Bosphoro, but inside it is also beautiful, much more interesting, and calm than the Blue mosque.

Beautiful!. Much more colour than the Blue Mosque, personally i liked it better. the walk to the mosque is very steep and tiring. take the tram to Beyazat Station and walk your way toward it. Do try the Kuru Fasulye at the market next to the mosque. :-)

Quieter than the Blue Mosque. Make sure yuo go with a guide/tour as they can give you the background. Absolutely stunning both inside and out and far fewer people to contend with so a much better experience inside. Take your pictures from several vantage points as you can see how the Mosque blends in with the local neighborhood.

Blue mosque. So inspiring and beautiful inside and out. Make certain to cover your shoulders, head and knees. If not they will provide you with a covering. We preferred to bring our own and show respect.

Family holiday. Truly amazing to see. I found it hard to grasp the dates and the age of such a large structure and the fact that it is still standing. Great if you have a guide. Pre order as queues are long. Well worth seeing.

Great architecture without the busy crowd. Beautiful mosque, excellent architecture, but best of all, without the hordes of people that swarmed the Blue Mosque. Great and quiet place for a contemplative respite.

Beautiful!. This mosque is beautiful. Built by the great architect Sinan on one of the seven hills of Istanbul for Suleymaniye the Magnificent, this is a must see. It is the largest complex built in Istanbul during the Ottoman era. The scale of the mosque is amazing. The interior is lovely - the light quality is very special. The the courtyard and the tombs behind the mosque also should be seen. The complex includes other buildings including a school and the tomb of Sinan. Directly behind the mosque you will find the botanical gardens which were virtually empty and offered amazing panoramas of Istanbul.Men and women - please cover your knees and shoulders. Women must cover your heads.I do not like crowds and was pleasantly surprised by how few people were here.

coooooollll. after seeing the famous ones(blue camii and aya sophia) of course u can't be impressed that much, but i enjoyed it because i'm a viewer of the series suleyman the magnificent( turkish serie who plays on romanian chanel-kanal D)-so for me was cool to see the tomb of one of his wifes( hurem)-the famouse one :) and the huge mosque that he build...try it!!!

Nice and calm place. I can't decide which is more beautiful. The Blue Mosque or the Suleyman Mosque.Nice and calm place with a beautiful garden and a cemetery on the right side.Stay for a while outside and listen the prayer call!Free of charge entrance!

This mosque is more beautiful inside than the Blue Mosque. I stumbled on it and I am not an expert on architecture. I thought it was even more beautiful than the Blue Mosque (at least inside). It also felt different, because there were not a lot of tourists, it was peaceful and truly like a place of worship.
nice architecture. The mosque is very nicely looking. architecture is super and the design is great..............................
the biggest working mosque. We were visiting at Ramadan, and it was wonderful to see the people at worship. Very much worth a viisit

It's just OK. This destination is definitely worth seeing, but there's really not much to see. Women will be required to cover up with provided scarves and gowns. Because everyone must take their shoes off, there is a general smell of stinky feet on warm, crowded days. Our recent experience this past June was quite smelly. When you do go inside, you might only spend 5-10 minutes. There's really not too much to see inside. Since there is no cost, that doesn't really matter. The outside architecture is much more interesting.

Beautiful Architecture. Wouldn't have gone looking for this mosque if not for the Rick Steves guide book, but so very glad we did. The Suleyman Mosque is one of the most beautiful mosques I have ever seen (from an architecture standpoint I thought it was more beautiful than the famous Blue Mosque).It is out of the way from the other standout attractions of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque but although it was a bit of a walk we didn't have trouble finding it. Again, totally worth the effort. It was designed by Mimar Sinan (Sinan the architect) for the Sultan Suleyman the Magnificent and Sinan's story just adds to the greatness of his structure.

Stunning atmospheric mosque. So much better than the blue Mosque. do not approach from the Spice Museum - it is like climbing Everest! Approach it from the Grand Bazaar to avoid the hike. The mosque is the biggest in Istanbul and is atmospheric inside. We were lucky enough to still be on the hill at the call to prayer and it was an awesome experience as you could hear all of the other mosques within the city and the combined sound was phenonomal
Sight seeing. Hard not to be impressed They get better and better as you progress.Crowded but having guide makes all the difference and you learn about each building
Beautiful. Fewer people than the Blue Mosque or New Mosque, it's huge and beautiful. It's definitely worth the long walk up the hill.

My favourite!. An absolute must in Istanbul! Very pleasant to visit because it is very quiet and one gets enough room to walk around, unlike in Blue Mosque for example. Lovely especially after the buzz of the nearby noisy bazaars.

Pretty. It is quite pretty and quick, just an in and out kinda place.They give you robes/scarves if you are inappropriately dressed, so don't worry if you are in shorts and a singlet.Even if there is a queue it won't take long as it's very quick moving

Much quieter, but about as grand as the Blue Mosque. The Suleymaniye Mosque is harder to get to, and you have to walk through a bit of a maze to get to this mosque, but this results in a much more intimate visit, when compared with the Blue Mosque.

Beautiful. Amazing architecture, go during the week when the crowds are not so busy - be sure to wear a long sleeve top and pants that cover your knees and take a scarf, this way you don't need to borrow one of their robes.
Another mosque, nothing different. If you never been in a mosque might be interesting but in fact there are nothing different or nicer than other.

Spectacular mosque. majestic scale, not too crowded, spectacular views a functioning community mosque. There are adjacent buildings worth a view such as the madrassa and an alms house which has been converted to a restaurant.
The area below the mosque is very seedy and should only be visited during the day.
Unbelievable. Really beautiful. Quite interesting and wonderful history. Nothing to dislike- lot of people but what are ya gonna do?

Very peaceful . The blue mosque is very beautiful but also very busy. This mosque is a peaceful place set in a tranquil garden. A much more reflective place to visit. You must go to the blue mosque you also need to visit here to get another experience. Do take lunch at the Dârüzziyafe restaurant just next outside the garden wall. The most restful place we found in Istanbul with very good food. Go there even if only for a quiet drink of Turkish tea.
unbelievable. you can spend all your day to try to understand history in this country so complexed beetween Europe and Asia the beauty of what was done and hopefully will last forever

Stunning Architecture. From a distance, the Suleymaniye Mosque is visible and its exterior is magnificent. It is absolutely huge and as you walk towards it, it towers over you. Inside, there is a seperate area for the women and men to pray and the Main Hall is so vast and stunning. The ceiling is so high and is decorated in such a beautiful way. The architecture and sheer beauty of the place really hits you.
Fantastic. First time visitor to the mosque, impressed with the way they accommodated all tourist by providing clothing to cover while in certain areas of the mosque. Most amazing experience

another visit to living history. what an inspiring place, wander through the mosque and be amazed at the history in front of your eyes. The gardens were an escape from the multitudes, spend time watching the passing parade.

My favorite mosque in Istanbul. Well worth the uphill trek to get there, to my eyes the most beautiful of all the mosques in Istanbul. Also loved the peaceful gardens around the mosque, a nice respite from busy Istanbul. Get some pics of Suleymaniye from close up, then more pics from Galata Tower across the Golden Horn.

A Beautiful, Peaceful Place to Pray or Contemplate. Many tourists visiting Istanbul are brought to the Blue Mosque which is right in the heart of the city. As a result it can be very busy and crowded, and not at all what a mosque should be - somewhere peaceful where you can commune with whatever deity you care to believe in.The Suleymaniye Mosque is bigger than the Blue Mosque and it is far more peaceful, if not quite as beautiful. Everyone is welcome although you are best keeping away on Fridays and during the five times of prayer every day.Remember to take your shoes off as you go in, to protect the carpets, and carry them with you in one of the plastic bags provided. Ladies, please cover your heads - headscarves are provided if you don't have anything suitable. Leave them at the exit as you leave.Take the time to sit on the floor or kneel and just breathe in the peace. Look at the beautiful painted calligraphy which adorns the walls. And marvel at the huge space, modelled on Hagia Sophia by the greatest Ottoman architect, Mimar Sinan.

Suleymaniye (hard to find) Mosque. A visit to this mosque was recommend by our guide. Looking at the map it seemed easy to find. Do not be fooled either go with a guide or take a taxi. The roads up to the mosque are quite frankly awful (as this is the end of the spice market and residential area). The mosque itself is well worth a view wonderful inside. I understand that the locals consider this better than the Blue Mosque

The magnificent. If you are in Eminönü and Fatih area,you must pay a visit to this fantastic Mosque in order to see how beautiful it is with its amazing main dome and inner architecture.Strongly recommended to visit this magnificent mosque

Sultan Suleman's Mosque. It is one of the mosques built by Sultan suleyman and Maymaar Sinnan was its architect. The small tomb of sinnan is also adjacent to it. The mosque is beautiful having 4 minarates. It was infect whole complex developed by sultan including mosque, madrissah, dispensary, etc! The tombs of Sultan Suleyman, his wife and daughter are also near one of the entrance of mosque. There is no fee but donations are welcomed!

the best architecture in istanbul. it has a unique relaxing atmosphere. visit "ağakapısı" cafe just very close to it. learn the history of the mosque before you visit. there are very nice streets next to the building where you can buy local souvenours .

Mosque on a hill. You can see this mosque at the top of the old city. Looks very impressive in the evening sunset and lit up at night.Quite a walk up hill to get to it but fairly quiet and no queue to get in as a visitor.Impressive inside and good photo opportunities inside and out.

Beautiful mosaics.... Suleymaniye Mosque is smaller but just as beautiful as the Blue Mosque. It is lower profile and a bit harder to find, but worth the effort. It doesn't have the crowds that the Blue Mosque has. I advise women to wear long pants, and have their own light head scarf. If you have shorts on, even long shorts, they will give you a 'skirt' (sack) to wear over your clothes, which on reflection I would just wear long pants. A tshirt is fine (shoulders and hair must be covered), and you take your shoes off on entry, they give you a plastic bag to carry your shoes.Hope the practical information helps.

great mosque in a very quite area. The mosque is located in a very quit area. The building was constructed by the architect Mimar Sinan and for my opinion is the most beautiful in istanbul. Also the cemetery is very interesting, and also the Royal Family's memorial graves
So classy and understated!. We loved this masjid. The architecture, the minarets, the beautiful domes were all so breathtaking. We visited twice during our visit. Don't miss it!

Peace Descends. I have never been in a building which affected me quite like this amazing mosque. Upon entering, I felt calmer, more at peace - as if I'd entered a very special place. I am not a religious person and do not ascribe that sense of peace to being in a holy place - but there is something indescribable about this building that at least four me, was profound. If you go, take some time to sit - to absorb and feel the place. You have little to lose but a few minutes, and much to gain.

Large but not the first choice for a visit. Because we were there three days this time we visited Suleymaniye. Not particularly easy to get to, difficult to get a cab when leaving, and not an impressive view on arrival (except from the Bosphorus)

Better than Sultanahmed. My spouse and stopped at this mosque after taking the subway from Taksim. It was a beautiful mosque and a more tranquil and enjoyable visit than to Sultanahmed. Hearing a young boy singing Qur'anic verses was a beautiful and special addition on the first day of Ramadan.

Spectacular Architecture. Had the chance to pray the Friday prayers here. The mosque is as beautiful from the inside as it is from the inside. For non-Muslims they arrange for scarfs and cloth to cover the head and legs as a sign of respect when visiting the mosque
Suleymaniye Mosque. Hugh mosque, with far fewer visitors than the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia. Vast open space, easy to walk about.

Hilltop Haven. Traipsing around Sulemaniye you'll see this place sat high-up on one of Istanbul's hills. It's perhaps best seen that way, a pretty and vast silhouette, but it is worth the trek up the hill to see the Sinan's carefully orchestrated complex of buildings and to appreciate the mosque's interior from its pretty gardens. Sadly the interior of the Hagia Sophia makes the city's other grand spaces seem somewhat muted, but it is worth inspecting the interior of the mosque, although the large prayer area somewhat limits exploration. The cemetery behind the mosque is beautiful and not to be missed, as is the view over the city.

Fantastic Building. This was well worth the visit - scale and size is amazing and free to enter at that. Need to avoid prayer time but outside that the people were friendly and really enjoyed the visit

Amazing mosque with many small domes.... The last time i visited the blue mosque was in 2008. This was my second visit and i enjoyed very much. The blue mosque is the iconic figure of the beautiful city.

Beautiful. Very impressive. More interesting to visit than the Blue Mosque, and far less crowded. Part of a whole complex including a hospital, school, and the still working Turkish baths (worth a visit too).

Beautiful mosque. There was a lot of renovation work in the area so it took us a while to find the entrance to the grounds, which could have done with some clear signage but once inside it was beautiful. Different from the Blue Mosque in the tiles usage but still stunning visually.

Grand. Not nearly as crowed as the Blue Mosque. More serene and more impressive. Interesting neighborhood too. I recommend eating some of the traditional beans and rice in one of the little places just outside the mosque.

Sulemaniye Mosque visit Friday 20 June evening. Beautiful and serene, loved the visit in the early evening light. It's close by to the Grand Bazaar and to a University, and a metro to take you right into Taksim Square.

Possibly the best. While most of the tours cover the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia, both of which absolutely should not be missed, most tours do not seem to include the Suleymaniye Mosque. That may be because its location makes driving to it a bit of a challenge. Whatever the reason for its not being included many tours, you should not miss it. It is spectacularly beautiful and the mausoleums beside the mosque are also fantastic. Be sure you do not miss seeing this complex while in Istanbul.
Classic Mosque. Far less crowded than the Blue Mosque and just as attractive with its classical lines. The associated tombs are well worth a visit.
Stunning. Go here. Stunning architecture and decoration. Be respectful in your dress and wear a head scarf if you are female.

Great view of the city in a prefect location!. I love this mosque! It is just as fantastic as the blue mosque, but not as crowded. It is a little bit of a walk from the spice market, but they also have shaded areas to sit and relax. The inside is a sight to see. Make sure that you walk around the whole complex because there are a couple of great shops such as one where the owner makes all his own glass jewelry. Again, not on everyone's list to see, but well worth it!

Amazing. The place is lesser known attractions either that or the fact this is a an active worship area makes he place less crowded and touristy. The mosque offers a great view of the city. This is one of the grandest mosques yet done in simplicity but that does not mean it is any less beautiful. You need to be covered and dressed accordingly to visit the place. After the visit you could visit any of the restaurants close to the mosque.

Complete mosque complex. The whole complex is preserved. The tombs of Suleiman and Roxelana. The outer courtyard has a fountain that adds the sound of falling water to the peace of the space. Sinan was indeed a great architect and if you have only this Mosque of his to see, don't miss it.

Worth the walk.. While approximately the same size as the Blue Mosque, it's style is somewhat more muted but the artwork in the domes is no less spectacular. It's also much less visited by tourists than the Blue Mosque. A short walk from the Grand Bazaar, you can then descend toward the Golden Horn and end up at the Spice Market.
My favorite one. Out of all the mosques I visited, this was my favorite. This one I liked because the finishing of the mosque is pretty nice, much better than Hagia Sofia or Blue Mosque.

grat mosque watchour for fasulye restaurant rip offs. wonderful mosque, but beware of the fasulye (bean and rice) restaurants just outside. great food, but they (especially the one on the corner touted in guide books, ali baba) "add" onto your bill, which they don to itemize for foreign tourists. but here is how you beat that scam.... go to one of the ones down the line with a "menu" (presently 8 YTL). order it, and be sure to have exact change ready and when it is time to pay, give them the exact amount they advertised.....that way you donot get ripped off. otherwise, you will be.... so now you know how to do it, enjoy!!

enjoy. The tombs were fascinting and really calm decorative mosque with no people. The rest of the food is pedestrianThe restaurants outside the mosque are famous for beans. I thought the cemetery was also very interesting.
Size is unbelievable. Architecture and size.Excellent handling of large tour groups. Great phot opportunities. Must see part of Istanbul

Suleymaniye Mosque. The Süleymaniye Mosque was built on the order of Sultan Süleyman (Süleyman the Magnificent) “was fortunate to be able to draw on the talents of the architectural genius of Sinan Pasha” (481 Traditions and Encounters: Brief Global History). The construction work began in 1550 and the mosque was finished in 1558.This “vast religious complex called the Süleymaniye…blended Islamic and Byzantine architectural elements. It combines tall, slender minarets with large domed buildings supported by half domes in the style of the Byzantine church Hagia Sophia (which the Ottomans converted into the mosque of Aya Sofya)” (481 Traditions and Encounters: Brief Global History).The design of the Süleymaniye also plays on Suleyman’s self-conscious representation of himself as a ‘second Solomon.’ It references the Dome of the Rock, which was built on the site of the Temple of Solomon, as well as Justinian’s boast upon the completion of the Hagia Sophia: “Solomon, I have surpassed thee!” The Süleymaniye, similar in magnificence to the preceding structures, asserts Suleyman’s historical importance. The structure is nevertheless smaller in size than its older archetype, the Hagia Sophia.
one of the best and its free. We loved this mosque and its grounds. The tombs were fascinting and really calm decorative mosque with no people. Not far from grand bazaar.

large mosque but not as ornate as the Blue Mosque. Worth a visit but in our opinion not in the same league as the Blue Mosque - relatively close to the grand bazaar so can be combined with a trip here. Shawls must be worn by ladies and shoes must be removed (plastic bags provided) as is the case in the other mosques.

A Masterpiece. This is a beautiful mosque! The grounds are well maintained and landscaped. Do some reading first to really enjoy it as the story of Suleyman and Roxelana is fascinating. I thought the cemetery was also very interesting. The restaurants outside the mosque are famous for beans. The rest of the food is pedestrian.

Less crowded than the Blue Mosque. This is a very grand mosque and far less crowded than the more famous Blue Mosque. The outbuildings are very interesting. Be sure to check the hours when visitors are allowed, however, as they are not open as much as the Blue Mosque is.

A little far away.....but great once you get there. This Mosque is a little further away.......but once you get to the top of where its at..........its like a whole little town up there, you can buya refreshment or eat lunch......its by the University....very easy to get to
Very Interesting. The grounds are expansive and beautiful; however, the mosque itself is a sight inside. Try to arrange to be there at a time when you can view the inside of the mosque.

Beautiful. This is a really lovely mosque.. I loved the surrounding gardens..and inside it was so peaceful and spectacular .must visit.on the way out I wondered around and wound up in an extremely odd and poor area of Istanbul so make sure u know where to get the taxi

Worth the walk up the hill. Probably more impressive than the Blue Mosque, another example of brilliant Ottoman architecture which blends Eastern Christian and Arabic design to make these uniquely impressive mosques. Glad I made the effort to see it.

Less crowded and just as majestic. This mosque was just as wonderful yet less crowded than the Blue Mosque. It's a slight climb up the hill from Rustem Pasha. The courtyard and inside were magnificent. You may observe Muslims washing their hands and feet before prayer at the outdoor faucets as well. Be sure to pay attention to prayer times. There is also a graveyard outside. As a non-Muslim, the entire visit only took me about 20 minutes.

Amazingly beautiful, Almost No Tourists. There was only 20-50 people there midday and it was wonderful. Extremely pretty inside. Be careful leaving -- the neighborhoods will remind you of the movie Taken 2 or some war torn Syrian village in spots. Go back the way you came.

Excellent. I found the lightness and vastness of this mosque to be very impressive. Much less crowded and not a far walk from the others so definitely worth a visit. Felt that the light colouring helped to give you the impression of a newer mosque. Lots of history, must visit.

Impressive. It is just as impressive and beautiful as the Hagia Sophia and rightfully so because both were the brain child of one person. There is a climb involved in reaching the place since it is placed over the hill and because of which there is also an amazing view available as well. The mosque truly reflects the architecture and skill levels of the Ottoman Empire. The mosque is beautiful and quiet. The decorations that goes inside the place is really amazing and one of its kind making the place a nice place to visit

Incorrect Architect Attribution. Not a review but a comment on your description. This mosque cannot possibly share the same architect as Hagia Sophia as the latter was built nearly 1000 years previously. The Suleymaniye Mosque shares the same architect as the Rustem Pasa Mosque.

True Beauty. This is the biggest Mosque of Istanbul and the most traditional. It has an interesting cemetery right next to it and has a very particular underground area that you must see. Its very close to the Grand Bazaar and its just passing the entrance of the Istanbul University so you can't miss it.Its one of the many mosque of the city but this one its special. The design and architecture its extremely well maintain and it has a special aura around it. Most of the time its quite peaceful, although you can easily spot tourist coming and going from the Mosque. People around are used to tourist but still you have to respect the tradition of a religious place so "no shorts no skirts" policy apply.For me this place its a must. You should go.
An oasis of quiet. This mosque is sligtly off the beaten track, but worth a visit. It is quiet and light, with beautiful windows and a great view over the river.
Nice and beautiful . It is a nice place to visit and need to have little time to stay inside nice carpet and decoration and you can have a nice photo shot

Worth the effort. A long up-hill walk to this peaceful mosque.A fascinating insight into the less touristy streets
Unfortunately the tombs were closed when we visited.
Special. This Mosque is actually in some ways prettier than the Blue Mosque as it is truly grand and beautiful inside. It position is also special as it is close to the river overlooking the city.
beautiful. Not too crowded and well worth a visit! beautiful mosque. The courtyard is lovely and peaceful to walk around. Make time for this one

Magnificent. A magnificent mosque to visit and not crowded by tourists taking pictures.
Very peaceful to make a prayer inside.
Close to the grand bazaar
Worth a visit. This mosque is not frequented by tourist groups so it is not crowded. It is well worth a visit for the lovely courtyard and the stunning interior as well as the tombs outside
Impressive, looks like it was build recently. Do not miss this old complex which is consisting of mosque and surrounding buildings including Sinans (architect) grave (Turbe).
A must see. This mosque is a must see in Istanbul and cannot be missed. The pictures don't do it justice and it is definitely worth while!

Most impressive mosque in Istanbul that we visited. This is a new, larger and more modern mosque than the Blue Mosque. Closer to the university and above the bazaar, it is quieter, brighter inside- more windows, and feels more revered with less tourist crowding. We may have been fortunate at the time we went, but this is still within easy walking distance of the hotels in the old town.
historical wisdom. if you really want to know about the history of Istanbul, you have to visit this amazing place. one of the most beautiful mosques i've ever seen.

Very Nice. It is an amazing mosque. Apart from the the feeling of reverence during prayers, you can feel the beauty of the architecture.It is located in a very nice historical area where you can find some coffee shops that have fantastic view over the city of Istanbul.

Best mosquee in Istanbul. For us this was the nicest mosquee of Istanbul. Way less crowded than the Blue Mosquee and stunning. The area is very nice, after the visit of the Mosquee we walked down the ancient streets to reach the spices bazar and we met a lot of quirky shops and very nice people, a very genuine experience outside the crowds of the gran bazar.

Less Crowded, But Not Less Impressive. It won't take long to vist Suleymaniye mosque, so did miss it. Of course there is no cost to visit, the stained glass is beautiful, and the crowds will be small compared to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia. Don't miss the cultural, religious and historic landmark while in Istanbul.
It is biggest mosque of Istanbul. This one of the place you should see. It is not be so easy to go there with public transportation but you can walf from Spaice Market.

Suleymaniye Mosque. One of the more exquisite mosques in Istanbul. Gorgeous just for its decorative walls. Be sure to carry a scarf with you ladies- all women must cover their hair before entering most of all the mosques.

Outstanding. Must see if visiting Istanbul. The Magnificent Sultan Suleyman is there and available for visit. Also great Food and attractions around the mosque. Mimar Sinan terrace Cafe has Views that will blow you away.

A top site. Very large, truly magnificent and lacking the crowds of the Blue Mosque, it is truly awesome and grand, its peace on a grand scale.Outside con one side of the Mosque is a row of food places all serving 'Beans and Rice' A plate of this with salad, bread and a drink is around 8TL, a good end to your visit.

Worth the visit!. This mosque is less visited than Blue Mosque, so it's less people and crowded and also free entrance. It's close to Grand Bazar (in walking distance). It's worth to go there. If you don;t have proper clothes (for men, long pants and for women, knees covered, had & arms covered, they give you at the entrance things to cover your body, so it;s ok.
Beautiful. This mosque is on a high hill and visible from far. Beautiful from inside and definitely worth a visit. A short walk from the Grand Bazaar so you can do the two on the same day.

Well worth your trip to see it!. My son Kyle thought that this Mosque was the most beautiful one in Istanbul.  The clean simplicity of the interior decorations are what we loved most versus the ostentatiousness of the other Mosques and the great architect Sinan built it. Go in the afternoon and you'll get great sunlight shining through the windows and light up the domes. We took the tram and walked up the hill to the Faith Mosque and then walked by the aqueducts to get here.

Very grand. Enjoyed the walk from the grand bazaar to the mosque. Was definitely worth the visit very peaceful inside. Excellent courtyard and a really good view of the city and the sea from the corner of the courtyard.

Better than the Blue Mosque. My husband and I enjoyed this so much more than the Blue Mosque. Fewer people, much more serene, and while you still must follow the protocol, the people that were enforcing the dress etc. were not as militant. We also really loved the interior much more than the Blue Mosque. Also, this is where Sulieman and Roxelana are buried and it was an added interest to view their mausoleums. If you pick one mosque in Istanbul, go to this one! Really lovely.
A Grandest Place. It's breathtaking both inside the main building and outside in the garden behind the mosque. Must see.

Beautiful holy place, no matter what your religion is, don't miss!. We visited 4 mosques in Istanbul, every one was unique and provided a different perspective on history, religion, and the Turkish people. Not as crowded as the Blue Mosque, this is truly beautiful and quiet. We went to the tombs, serene with mostly Turkish people visiting and meditating briefly. Inside the mosque, behind the women's screen, we could see women sitting with each other quietly talking and praying. One of the best things about travel, is seeing how other people live, eat, and worship. We had a private guide who provided much insight into Suleymaniye and why he is truly magnificent. It's a bit off the beaten path but worth the effort.

Masterpiece Sinan complex. High on a hill but not difficult of walking access, this is a serene and beautiful mosque, set off by a large surrounding complex of subsidiary buildings and tombs. Do not miss it.

Don't miss. This is a huge part of Ottoman history. Be prepared to cover your legs (pants or very long skirts ladies) and cover your heads, and take off your shoes. They will not let you in without doing so.It's quite an impressive place. Don't miss it.

well worth a look. This Mosque is a little further away from the central attractions around and near the Blue Mosque and Sultanahmet, but the short walk is worth it, as the crowds are much smaller, there is a great café and restaurant precinct adjacent to this Mosque, and the roof top terrace cafes on the northern side give one of the best and highest views of Istanbul, over the Bosphorous and the Golden Horn.

Amazing. If your going to see 1 mosque in Istanbul, make it this one. The size is very big. The gardens are huge and is sooo much quieter than blue mosque. Great on the evening you have some great views

Beautiful Mosque. One of Istanbuls better kept secrets.. oops, the cat's outta the bag! In some ways it might be a better visit than the Blue mosque. The tile work is just as beautiful, the grounds are spacious and serene. There are even some good views of the Bosphorus to take in from here. It is not as crowded as the tourist spots in the heart of the old city.

Recent Suleymaiye visit. This mosque is not quite as impressive as the Blue Mosque, but then it can't be compared directly either. This mosque had the same architect, and the construction is somewhat the same, but the colors are totally different. This is absolutely worth the visit, but be sure to go on a sunny day as the interior is a bit dark.

Impressive. The vast size of this thing is breath taking, with its enormous dome and courtyard and gardens outside. Up a bit of a steep hill to get there, but well worth it. Inside not as many tourists as at the Blue Mosque, so gives you more chance to take in the peaceful atmosphere and the intricate details of the walls and ceiling, and the hanging lights complete the look.
